description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 31The Vietnamese are a remarkable and stoical people.

title: Theater: Play's the Thing by Molnar
description: Would you believe Molnar? When I was young the Hungarian playwright FerencMolnar had a slightly fading reputation. I remember a French company  GrenierHussenotcoming to London after World War II and giving Liliom. I also remember later seeing The Play's the Thing in Oxford. It seemed funny but contrived. It still is mostly delicately contrived but also, and I had nearly forgotten this, elegantly funny.

title: 2 AIRLINES CANCEL CONCORDE ORDERS
description: The Concorde supersonic airliner program suffered a grive setback yesterday when Pan American World Airways decided to drop its options on seven planes and Trans World Airlines' management said it intended to cancel its six options.

title: Mets Sign McGraw for $75,000, Record Contract for Relief Pitcher
description: In an age of sports specialists, Tug McGraw became the highestpaid relief pitcher in baseball history yesterday when the New York Mets raised his pay 50 per cent to $75,000.

title: FuelOil Crisis Feared
description: Government energy planners, in a new appraisal, have warned that the fueloil shortage could become a crisis before spring if there is a sustained cold wave. Details on Page 70.

title: Westinghouse Profit Up
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday gains in sales and net income for the fourth quarter and for 1972. Donald C. Burnham, chairman, placed fourthquarter sales at $1.42billion against $1.29billion a year earlier.

title: Refiners Set Marks
description: Two of the country's large oil companiesStandard Oil of California and Continental Oil Companyreported substantial rises in income in the last quarter of last year and records for the entire year 1972.

title: NEWS TALK IS HELD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31President Nixon announced today that he would send Henry A. Kissinger to Hanoi on Feb. 10 for three days in an effort to make the peace in Vietnam more secure and lay the groundwork for reconstruction of Southeast Asia.

title: Arabs Fail to Reconcile Hussein and Commandos
description: CAIRO, Jan. 31Foreign and defense ministers from 18 Arab countries flew back to their capitals today without having succeeded in a fourday effort here to make peace between King Hussein of Jordan and the Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Mimi Vignos Bride Of D. B. Gillies Jr.
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 31Miss Miriam Claire Vignos, of Canton, Ohio, and New York was married here this afternoon to Donald B. Gillies Jr. of Richmond. The Rev. Dr. James H. Slatton performed the ceremony in the River Road Baptist Church.

title: 2 Fliers, Captured by Foe Last Fall, Become Fathers
description: GOLDSBORO, N. C., Jan. 31 (AP)  When Capt. John H. Alpers Jr. and Capt. Brian M. Ratzlaff of the Air Force are released from North Vietnamese prisonerofwar camps, they will learn they became fathers four days after a ceasefire went into effect.

title: Old Friends Enjoy Caviar, Champagne and Buckley
description: William F. Buckley Jr. had a party last night. It was for Frank Shakespeare, who was the head of the United States Information Agency, and it was not just any old party; it was Mr. Buckley's party:

title: HEROIN ROLE LAID TO A NEWARK AIDE
description: NEWARK, Jan. 31  A Federal grand jury today indicted a program director in Newark's Model Cities program on two counts of possessing and conspiring to distribute heroin.

title: HOUSE APPROVES A REFORM STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31The House took the first step today toward what could become the most sweeping Congressional reform in decades.

title: 3 PATROLMEN HERE ACCUSED IN ASSAULT
description: Three young patrolmen were arrested yesterday and suspended without pay on charges of beating two men in a corridor of the Manhattan Criminal Courts building on Dec. 14.

title: President Contends He Has a Constitutional Right to Hold Back Funds Appropriated by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 President Nixon declared today that the Constitution gave him an absolutely clear right to withhold funds appropriated by Congress and that he was determined to use the right to prevent higher taxes or prices.

title: Housewife Pleads Guilty To Slaying Adopted Child
description: A 34yearold Queens housewife pleaded guilty to seconddegree manslaughter yesterday in the death of her adopted daughter, a 2yearold Korean orphan.

title: LAOS P.O.W. LIST SNOWS 9 FROM U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 North Vietnam turned over to the United States in Paris today the names of nine American prisoners  seven servicemen and two civiliansheld by Communist forces in Laos. The list also included the name of a Canadian civilian.

title: The Heir Apparent Charles H. Winner
description: Just after Weeb Ewbarik's oldest daughter, Luanne, was married in 1947, the coach issued a warningjokingly to his football team at Washington University in St. Louis. I just lost my oldest daughter to a halfback at Brown, Ewbank said, so I don't want any of you messing around with my other two daughters, especially you halfbacks. One of Ewbank's halfbacks, Charley Winner, was sitting in the back of the room and he immediately thought to himself, What the heck would I want with one of his daughters anyway?

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Knowlton Acquitted Of U.S. Tax Charge
description: NEWARK, Feb. 1Former State Senator Willard B. Knowlton was acquitted tonight by a jury in Federal Court of a charge of willfully failing to file an income tax return for 1968.

title: Arkansas Senate Defeats Equal Rights Amendment
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Feb. 1 (UPI)The Arkansas Senate defeated tonight the proposed women's equal rights amendment to the Constitution.

title: Theater: Frisch's Public Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1With every playwright every major playwright that isyou are either, an ally or an adversary. This is not exactly to do with the value of the playwright but much more with your personal attitude to his mind. You, can dislike a very good businessman. You can be distrustful of a very good playwright. Max Frisch is a very good playwright  especially for other people.

title: BRUINS TOP LEAFS; ESPOSITO EXCELS
description: BOSTON, Feb. 1 (AP)Phil Esposito and Bobby Orr went on scoring sprees and figured in Boston goals tonight, leading the Bruins to a 52 National Hockey League victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: People and Business
description: Gerald K. Bouey takes over today as governor of the Bank of Canada, succeeding one of the world's bestknown central bankers, Louis Rasminsky. Mr. Bouey, the No. 2 man at the bank since Jan. 1, will move into the governor'w post as Mr. Rasminsky  a prominent figure in international banking orcies since World War IIretires at the age of 65.

title: The President's Tough Line
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 A lot of people around here have been wondering about President Nixon's mood as he goes into his second term, and now we have a few hints from the President himself. The man is fighting mad. He has his second term and his settlement in Vietnam, and he has come out of his struggles with all his grievances intact. If anything, he is more combative and energetic than ever before, and he seems determined to reform everything and everybody but himself.

title: Rev. Dr. J. Manning Potts Of Methodist Upper Room
description: TAMPA, Fla., Feb. 1 (UPI)The Rev. Dr. J. Manning Potts, who developed the Methodist Church publication The Upper Room into a devotional guide read by 10 million people in 120 nations, died yesterday of a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: RATIONING PLANS FOR FUEL SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 Senator Henry M. Jackson, chairman of the Interior Committee, said today that he would introduce a bill to require the Government to draw up standby rationing plans to deal with domestic fuel shortages.

title: Cuba Returns to Mexico Hijack Arms and Ransom
description: MEXICO CITY. Feb. 1 (UPI)  Cuba returned the $320,000 ransom and an arsenal of weapons that landed in Havana in November, along with nine guerrillas in a hijacked Mexicana Airlines jet, the Mexican Government said yesterday.

title: JOHNSON DISPOSED OF MOST OF LAND
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 1The major portion of the ranch properties of former President Lyndon B. Johnson has been sold to a land subdivider from Tulsa, Okla., the Johnson family disclosed today.

title: Watching the Press
description: The press, by tradition the allseeing eye for the public, is afflicted with myopia. It is so occupied with discovering the defects in the optics of others that it failsor refusesto see the mote in its own. New evidence of this malady is found in the current debate over a press council. Even though the public displays little interest, it is a discussion of large public concern.

title: Patrick Flood, Latin Teacher And Columnist, Dies at 75
description: Patrick Flood, a retired high school Latin teacher who wrote an advice column for immigrants in the Irish Echo, died Wednesday in Miami. He was 75 years old and lived at 524 East 20th Street.

title: CUP SKI RACE WON BY MISS PROELL
description: SCHRUNS, Austria, Feb. 1 (UPI)  Annemarie Proell sped to her seventh straight downhill victory of the season today, led Austria to a 12345 sweep and seized an almost unbeatable lead in her quest for a third consecutive World Cup ski title.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Lumber Dealer Testifies On Graft in Atlantic City
description: CAMDEN, Feb. 1 (AP)An Atlantic City lumber dealer testified in Federal Court here today that he made payoffs totaling $10,500 to an official in that city's Parks Department between 1964 and 1970.

title: REALTY VALUATION IN RECORD DECLINE
description: The city's Finance Administrator reported yesterday a record number of decreases in property assessments, a reflection of the extent to which housing is deteriorating in Brooklyn, Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: ISRAEL HOLDING 14 AS SPIES FOR SYRIA
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 1 (Reuters)  Fourteen persons have now been arrested as members of Syrianoperated espionage ring in the Israeli  occupied Golan heights, military sources said here today.

title: AGNEW, ON A VISIT, ASSURES LON NOL
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 1Vice President Agnew, paying a fivehour visit, assured Cambodia today of continued U. S. support.

title: Cabral Buried in Guinea Amid Cry of Revolution
description: CONAKRY, Guinea, Feb. Amilcar Cabral, leader of Africa's most successful anticolonialist guerrilla movement, Was buried here this morning after an hourlong military parade. There were few tears.

title: Books of The Times
description: PREGNANCY, BIRTH & FAMILY PLANNING. By Alan F. Guttmacher, M.D. Viking. 365 Pages. $10. IS MY BABY ALL RIGHT? By Virginia Apgar, M.D., and Joan Beck. 492 Pages. Trident. $9.95.

title: The Child Has Leukemia, but here's Little Time for Tears
description: Before 4yearold Karen Czemiaivski goes to sleep, she often puts a lock of hair beneath her pillow. By the time she awakens, a fairy godmother has replaced the ringlet with a silver coin.

title: Insanity Defense Planned In Killing of Teacher Here
description: Lawyers for John Wayne Wilson, who is accused of the murder of a teacher of deaf children, Roseann Quinn, in her West Side apartment last Jan. 2, will rely on the defense that their client was insane, according to court papers filed yesterday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Jets Name a Coach
description: Charley Winner, former coach of the St. Louis Cardinals, was named yesterday to coach the New York Jets, beginning with the 1974 season. He is a soninlaw of Weeb Ewbank, the Jets' coachgeneral manager, who has said he will give up coaching after the 1973 season. Details on Page 23.

title: Defense Aide Denies A CoverUp Memo On Ellsberg Studies
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 1In direct contradiction to another witness, a Defense Department official denied today in the Pentagon papers trial that he had ever written a memorandum passing on orders that studies of the papers be removed from the files

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy disclosed yesterday that the city's auxiliary police would resume their street patrols tomorrow nightbut that for the time being they would operate in civilian, clothes.

title: STOCKS PLUMMET ON AMEX AND OTC
3 BROTHERS' BODIES FOUND IN L.I. HOME
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., Feb. 1The bodies of three brothers in their 70's who lived together in a twostory wooden frame house in a middleclass section of this village were found today by a mailman.

title: Grenade Kills Man in Ulster Bus; British Soldier Is Shot to Death
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 1A hand grenade was tossed into a bus carrying Roman Catholic workmen today, killing one man and injuring nine, two of them critically.

title: FEDERAL SPENDING FOR POOR TO SLOW
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 After a decade of steady increases, proposed Federal spending for the poor will level off next year, new budget documents disclosed today.

title: Congress: BudgetMaker
description: By his politically skillful management of budget and tax issues, President Nixon has placed Congress on the defensive. Congress in the modern era has become accustomed to dealing with Chief Executives from Franklin Mi.Roosevelt to Lyndon B. Johnson, who had ambitious programs to cope with various social problems. The conservativeminded appropriations committees fought these Presidents by cutting their budget requests.

title: State Asks Proof of Need Before Welfare Is Given
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Governor Rockefeller ordered today that, starting July 1, all welfare recipients be required to undergo facetoface interviews at specified intervals to reestablish continued eligibility. Assistance will be cut off for anyone unable to document his eligibility.

title: Saigon Bars Newsmen From Tan Son Rat Base
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 1 South Vietnamese military officials informed journalists today that their press credentials were no longer valid for entry to Tan Son Nhat air base.

title: Gulf & Western Bids for A. & P. Stock
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., yesterday announced a bid to obtain up to 19 per cent of the outstanding shares of the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company, the nation's oldest and largest retail food chain.

title: Promise of Access
description: In an Administration that makes a fetish of secrecy, any hint of greater openness is welcome. Thus, when President Nixon held his first news conference in sixteen weeks on Wednesday, the event was notable not only for itself but for the intimation it brought that the executive branch might be more communicative in answering future requests for information from Congressional committees.

title: 2 Artists Join in Rachmaninoff Songs
description: NICOLAI GEDDA, tenor, and ALEXIS WEISSENBERG, piano. At Philharmonic Hail.

title: Santa Fe Orders Hopper Cars
description: The Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway announced yesterday that it is ordering an additional 1,000 new hundredton covered hopper cars at a cost of $18million. Deliveries of this latest order, which will be built by ACF Industries, Inc., are expected to commence early in June.

title: Nature and Machines Pile Snow on Belleayre
description: PINE HILL, N. Y., Feb. 1It was snowing again today in the Catskills and Nelson Sears, the superintendent of the stateowned Belleayre Mountain, seemed certain his business would be at least normal from now until the end of the winter. This has been an almost unbelievable year, said Sears News as he watched the flakes falling of from his office Skiing window. So far, we've been open only 27 days. And remember, we were in business earlier than usual this season because of that Ike November snowstorm.

title: Milwaukee Man Accused In Slaying of 2 Policemen
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 1 (Reuters)One suspect was charged with two counts of firstdegree murder and three other men were still being questioned tonight in connection with the shooting deaths last night of two police officers.

title: One Name on 5 Slips In Police Drug Theft
description: The name of Joseph N. Nunziata, the narcotics detective who reportedly committed suicide last March, appears on at least five of the nine vouchers for the 398 pounds of narcotics that were stolen from the Police Department property clerk's offices, informants said yesterday.

title: Screen: Last Tango in Paris at Last
description: Vincent Canby saw Last Tango in Paris for the first time at the New York Film Festival last October. His review of it appeared Oct. 16, 1972. He saw it a second time, as is his custom with important films, before its commercial opening yesterday at the TransLux East at Third Avenue and 58th Street. In a second evaluation, written for the Sunday Arts and Leisure section Jan. 28, he developed a number of points touched on in the original review. Following are excerpts from both reviews, the earlier first.

title: Pessimism About The Colony
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Charley Winner to Coach Jets in '74, Replacing Ewbank, FatherinLaw
description: In a decision suggestive of nepotism, the New York Jets named Charley Winner, the former coach of the St. Louis Cardinals and Weeb Ewbank's soninlaw, the successor yesterday to Ewbank as their head coach, beginning with the 1974 season.

title: Eastern Hockey League
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Editors Comment on Arrest of Columnist's Aide
description: Newspaper editors around the country voiced their reactions yesterday concerning the arrest of Leslie H. Whitten, an investigative reporter and associate of Jack Anderson, the columnist.

title: Dangers in Nuclear Plants Cited at A.E.C. Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 A hearing board of the Atomic Energy Commission tried today to begin clearing some obstacles to speedy licensing of nuclear electric power plants by resolving some problems involving their environmental impact.

title: Czech Orchestra Has Mellow Sound
description: Prague has been the source of Czechoslovak orchestras touring the United States, but the Czech State Orchestra that played in the International Festival of Visiting Orchestras in Carnegie Hall on Wednesday night was from Brno, capital of the province of Moravia. Still, it had the characteristics of the ensembles from the national capital and at its best was a lovely group to hear.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: NEW YORK

title: Chrysler Flaunts Sails at Show
description: For many persons visiting the National Boat Show for the first time, One of the best surprises comes with the first boat they see. Immediately inside the firstfloor door stands a Chrysler sailboat.

title: WARDEN CONCEDES JAIL HARASSMENT
description: The suspended warden of the Queens House of Detention for Men pleaded guilty yesterday to charges by the Correction Department that he allowed correction officers to harass, demean and use excessive force against inmates in quelling a riot at the Kew Gardens, facility in October, 1970.

title: Cosmos 547 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1 (UPI)The Soviet Union today launched Cosmos 547, another in its series of unmanned earth satellites, the Government news agency, Tass, said.

title: Judge Held Up
description: An acting justice of the State Supreme Court was robbed of about $125 on a midtown street Wednesday night by two armed men he believed might have gotten away because the police took nearly an hour to respond to his report of the incident.

title: Vietcong General Joins Military Team in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Feb. 2The chief of the Vietcong delegation to the joint military commission, who is the second highestranking member of the Communist apparatus in South Vietnam, arrived In Saigon yesterday aboard a United States Army helicopter after being picked up in a Communistheld town near the Cambodian border.

title: Despite Reforms in Prisons, Problem Persists in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Feb. 1In two of the loweaved, campuslike buildings of Leesburg, the newest of New Jersey's prisons, are housed programs that graphically illustrate the paradoxes of the state's penal system.

title: Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: Failure of the Concorde
description: Pan American Airways and Trans World Airlines have dealt a perhaps mortal blow to the supersonic transport plane by canceling plans to buy thirteen Concordesa move other airlines may take as a signal to do likewise. Too much British and French money has already been sunk in the building of these carriers for the airlines' decision to be a cause for rejoicing, but it is at the very least a cause for genuine relief.

title: Knicks Bring Up Wingo, Star of Eastern League
description: DETROIT, Feb. 1  The New York Knicks, who asked waivers yesterday on Tom Riker, their top pick in last year's college draft, filled his spot on the 12man roster today by purchasing the contract of Harthane Wingo from Allentown of the Eastern League.

title: Justice's Widow Robbed
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va. Feb. 1 (AP)Mrs. Elizabeth Black, the widow of Supreme Court Justice Hugo L. Black was robbed of $12 at knifepoint Tuesday by a young man who forced his way into her home here, the police said today.

title: Congressman Finds Instant Pressure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 Representative E. G. (Bud) Shuster was sitting in the midst of a vast array of packing boxes, without even a Congressional office suite to call his own, when angry constituents began pelting him with letters of protest.

title: ROSEWALL VICTOR IN MILAN TOURNEY
description: MILAN, Italy, Feb. 1 (AP)Topseeded Ken Rosewall reached the quarterfinals of the $50,000 Milan indoor tennis tournament by beating Adriano Panetta of Italy in straight sets, 63, 63, today.

title: Connally Says He Has No Plans To Hold an Office or to Seek One
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1John B. Connally expressed his gratitude today to President Nixon for the President's public declaration that Mr. Connally could handle any job I can think of, including the Presidency.

title: Harlem Meals on Wheels Handicapped by Auto Theft
description: A car used by the Central Harlem Meals on Wheels program to distribute hot meals to 50 disabled and elderly persons a day has been stolen, according to Rev. Paul Thurston, chairman of the volunteer prograin.

title: Gypsy Cab Driver Is Shot In Brooklyn Holdup Attempt
description: A driver of a gypsy cab was shot and wounded early yesterday when he resisted a robbery attempt by two passengers at their destination in the Bushwick section of Brooklyn.

title: Specter of Rising Rates Sends Dow Off by 13.24
description: The specter of higher interest rates turned a moderately weak stock market into a nearrout late yesterday.

title: Auxiliary Police to Resume Patrols, but in Civilian Garb
description: The city's 5,000 unarmed auxiliary policemen  withdrawn from street patrols last Monday after attacks on regular uniformed policemen left one man dead and eight wounded  will resume their patrols tomorrow might, but in civilian clothes.

title: KISSINGER TO SEEK NORMALIZATION IN VISIT TO HANOI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 Henry A. Kissinger said tonight that during his mission to Hanoi next week he would explore ways of moving relations between the United States and North Vietnam from hostility toward normalization.

title: 2 MACKELL AIDES BALK AT WAIVERS IN STATE'S INQUIRY
description: Two of Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell's highest aides have refused to sign waivers of immunity in an investigation of the prosecutor's office by Maurice H. Nadjari, State Deputy Attorney General.

title: Deep Sleep Film Director Arraigned on 9 Charges
description: PATERSON, Feb, 1The producer of the Xrated film Deep Sleep surrendered to the police here today for booking on nine criminal charges, all of a sexual nature, in connection with the making of the movie.

title: Islanders Win 3d Period But Lose to Hawks, 53
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Feb. 1Earl Ingarfield, who was named coach of the New York Islanders last Monday, made his home debut in the Nassau Coliseum tonight. It was not much different than most of the games coached by his predecessor, Phil Goyette.

title: Libya Said to Have Lent Black Muslims $3Million
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The North African nation of Libya lent American Black Muslims $3million last year but has refused a request for a second loan, according to persons close to both parties.

title: Red Smith
description: Jerry Quarry was saying that he was ready, willing and able to do my job, and he looked it. He has a sunny, tough, Irish face, somewhat rearranged in 54 fist fights over seven years, but not unattractively. In his 28th year, the 200pound body is hard and healthy. He has always had presence, has always spoken with cheerful assurance. I've been here before, he said, meaning New York and Madison Square Garden and the main event of a major heavyweight card. He has indeed. He was here with Joe Frazier and George Chuvalo, Buster Mathis and Randy Neumann and Tony Alone and Mac Foster, and although he didn't always win, he always fought. He'll be back In the Garden a week from tonight with Ron Lyle, a new kid on the block, who doesn't compare with him in professional experience but is bigger and older and in some respects tougher. Lyle is a rookie at 30 because he loitered for 7 years in the Colorado State Penitentiary.

title: Wampfler Quits as Coach Of Football at Colo. State
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo. Feb. 1 (UPI)The Colorado State Univerisity football coach, Jerry Wampfler, who weathered an attempt last December to dismiss him, announced his resignation today.

title: Fed Announces a Review Of Banking Structure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Federal Reserve Board disclosed today that it was making an intensive review of the entire structure of international banking  United States Pranks abroad and foreign banks in the United States.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Senator James L. Buckley announced yesterday that he would seek an amendment to the Federal Constitution to overturn the Supreme Court decisions last week severely restricting the rights of states to legislate on abortion. The ConservativeRepublican said he was consulting men of science and law on the form of the amendment and would introduce it as soon as possible to undo the damage inflicted by these pernicious decisions.

title: Rap Brown Lectures His Jury on Peers
description: H. Rap Brown, allowed the unusual opportunity to address the jury that is trying him on charges of armed robbery and attempted murder, opened yesterday with a prayer from the Koran, then presented a rambling discourse on law, philosophy and religion.

title: Marked Decrease Noted In South Vietnam Fighting
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Feb. 2With the Vietnam ceasefire in its sixth day, American analysts today reported a marked decrease in fighting and said that the situation was approaching a fairly manageable level.

title: Chou Urges U.S. to Halt Action in All Indochina
description: PEKING, Feb. 1  Premier Chou Enlai last night hailed the Vietnam ceasefire agreement as a great victory for China's Vietnamese allies, and called upon Washington and Saigon to refrain from any acts of procrastination, expansion and sabotage that could undermine it.

title: Auxiliaries Told to Adopt a Low Profile
description: Sgt. Peter Bartoszek and Patrolman George Thomson stood before some 25 civilians seated in the grimy, greenwalled muster room of the 44th Precinct station in the Bronx last night.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Countrymen flung into the Intense activity of New York City for the first time are prone to remark disparagingly on what they feel is the overly aggressive behavior of most of the people they meet.

title: Vietcong General Joins Military Team in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Feb. 2The chief of the Vietcong delegation to the joint military commission, Lieut. Gen. Tran Van Tra, arrived in Saigon yesterday aboard a United States Army helicopter after being picked up in a Communistheld town near the Cambodian border.

title: Bridge:
description: Some of the hardest problems for a defender are those that require him to survey a range of hands his partner might hold to find one that allows the defense to succeed. Those who like to solve such problems should cover the East and South hands shown in the diagram.

title: Records
description: Eric Clapton shows how much the rock business has moved since those dear dead days when it was called the pop music biz. Mr. Clapton is a guitarist and also one of the first rock musicians to acquire the superstar tag.

title: A FAMILY EFFORT AIDS THE NEEDIEST
description: Contributions recorded yesterday by the 61st annual New York Times Neediest Cases Fund brought the total raised to date to $1,014,824.11.

title: Store Sales Increase 20%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $676million, up 20 per cent from the yearearlier $563million. Total retail store sales were about $8.1billion, up 13 per cent from the yearearlier $7.17billion.

title: Bertolucci Talks About Sex
description: Bernardo Bertolucci thumbed through an Italian newspaper searching for an article about the obscenity trial in Bologna of his film. Last Tango In Paris. Suddenly he saw a photograph of himself. I look like a criminal, he said ominously, the moment he goes before the judge.

title: HORSES & EQUIPMENT
description: Horses & Equipment 3995

title: ROBERT D. BROWN OF RAWLINGS DIES
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Feb. 1Robert D. Brown, chairman and chief executive officer of Butler Industries of Newark, a manufacturer of display fixtures, died, apparently of a heart attack, at his home here last evening. He was 54 years old.

title: Concorde Output Cutback and Layoffs Seen
Marked Decrease Noted In South Vietnam Fighting
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Feb. 2With the Vietnam ceasefire in its sixth day, American analysts today reported a marked decrease in fighting and said that the situation was approaching a fairly manageable level.

title: Baseball Hammers Out a New Stalemate
description: Negotiators for the baseball players and club owners will meet again today with no agreement on a new contract in sight and uncertainty about whether spring training will begin as scheduled later this month.

title: TV: Ragtime Much Ado on Tonight
description: After an extraordinary lineup of news specials last nightinterviews with Henry A. Kissinger, the late Lyndon B. Johnson and South Vietnam's President Thieuthe Columbia Broadcasting System is tonight turning over its three hours of prime time, from 8 to 11, to Shakespeare's Much Ado About Nothing.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon is reportedly preparing to appoint Stanley S. Scott as a special assistant to replace Robert J. Brown on his White House staff. Both men are black. Mr. Brown, the most prominent black member of Mr. Nixon's staff for four years. completed his last day of White House work yesterday, before returning to his consulting firm in North Carolina. Mr. Scott has been an assistant in the White House Communications office for two years. Before that, Mr. Scott, who is 39 years old, was a reporter with The United Press International and with radio station WINS York.

title: LONDON PAPER SAYS CHINA HELD P.O.W.'S
description: LONDON, Feb. 1  Victor Louis, the Soviet citizen who is Moscow's correspondent of The London Evening News, said in a dispatch today that American prisoners of war captured in Vietnam have been held in secret maximum security camps in China.

title: End of a Siege
description: After seven months of stalemate at the bargaining table, striking elevator constructors in this city have voted to go back to work under a contract only slightly different from the threeyear pacts a dozen other construction crafts accepted many months ago.

title: Chrysler Flaunts Sails at Show
description: For many persons visiting the National Boat Show for the first time, one of the best surprises comes with the first. boat they see. Immediately inside the firstfloor door stands a Chrysler sailboat.

title: Colts Trade Logan
description: Joe Thomas, the general manager of the Baltimore Colts, continued his housecleaning operation yesterday by trading Jerry Logan, the club's seasoned safetyman. Logan, a player of Pro Bowl quality, went to the Los Angeles Rams for an undisclosed future draft choice. This was the eighth trade for Thomas since Jan. 22. The list of the departed includes John Unitas, Tom Matte, Norm Bulaich, Bill Newsome and now Logan, who is 31.

title: GAMBLING RAIDS IN FOUR COUNTIES
description: CRESSKILL, Feb. 1  An elegant home in this fashionable suburb was the main target of a fourcounty gambling raid that the Bergen County Prosecutor's office described today as a multimilliondollar operation.

title: LAOS P.O.W. LIST SHOWS 9 FROM U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 North Vietnam turned over to the United States in Paris today the names of nine American prisoners  seven servicemen and two civiliansheld by Communist forces in Laos. The list also included the name of a Canadian civilian.

title: Defense Aide Denies Ordering Cover Up Of Ellsberg Studies
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 1In direct contradiction to another witness, a Defense Department official denied today in the Pentagon papers trial that he had ever written a memorandum passing on orders that studies of the papers be, removed from the files.

title: Ground Is Broken Here For the Clinton Towers
description: In a ceremony that was barely marred when the frozen earth would not yield to the blows of a shovel, Mayor Lindsay presided at a groundbreaking yesterday for a $17.6million, middleincome apartment development on 11th Avenue between 54th and 55th Streets.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Feb. 1Despite injuries and illnesses, the Rutgers basketball team has won its last three games and it goes for another victory against Navy in Annapolis, Md., on Saturday.

title: Nixon Hears War Called a Sin
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1President Nixon, the Rev. Billy Graham and three Russian atheists were among the more than 3,000 people who attended the 21st National Prayer Breakfast here today and heard a longtime foe of the Vietnam war call it a sin that has scarred the national soul.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Feb. 2, 1973 SECURITY COUNCIL

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Timothy Grossi, a city building inspector, was indicted by a Hudson County grand jury on charges of bribery, conspiracy, extortion and obtaining money under false pretenses. He is accused of demanding and receiving a $1,200 bribe to issue a building permit for a warehouse on the Port Jersey Development Corporation property in the Point Breeze section.

title: JOSEPH D. WEISS, AN ARCHITECT, 77
description: Joseph Douglas Weiss, an architect who specialized in geriatric nursing homes and hospitals, died yesterday at the Yale New Haven Hospital, after having been injured in an automobile accident Jan. 12 near New Haven. He was 77 years old and lived in Chappaqua, N.Y.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Pearson Estate, Comprising Securities, Put at $597,915
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 1Lester B. Pearson, former Prime Minister of Canada, left an estate of $597,915 according to a will probated in Ottawa's Surrogate Court today. Mr. Pearson died of cancer last Dec. 27.

title: Adelphi, Led by Galloway, Crushes Yeshiva, 7838
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Feb. 1 Don Galloway hit 12 of 13 shots, including the first 11, to lead Adelphi University to a 78.38 rout of Yeshiva University tonight at Woodruff Hall.

title: Martin A. Ansbro, 50, Dies; Headed Hudson Engineering
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Feb. 1Martin A. Ansbro, president since 1962 of the Hudson Engineering Company of Hoboken, died today at his home, 429 Orenda Circle. He was 50 years old.

title: Examiner Recommends Con Ed GasRate Rise
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1A Public Service Commission examiner recommended today that Consolidated Edison be authorized to increase its gas rates on a permanent basis to obtain $4.6million a year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am sorry that there was such little public notice of Secretary John A. Volpe's glorious exit from the Department of Transportationhis rejection of a major interstate highway route through an urban park.

title: 2 MACKELL AIDES BALK AT WAIVERS IN STATE'S INQUIRY
description: Two of Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell's highest aides have refused to sign waivers of immunity in an investigation of the prosecutor's office by Maurice H. Nadjari, State Deputy Attorney General.

title: Jets Name a Coach
description: Charley Winner, former coach of the St. Louis Cardinals; was named yesterday to coach the New York Jets, beginning with the 1974 season. He is a soninlaw of Weeb Ewbank, the. Jets' coachgeneral manager, who has said he will give up coaching after the 1973 season. Details on Page 23.

title: Irate Senators Question Butz on Appropriated Funds Held Back by White House
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz, after refusing to testify before one Senate panel on the President's impounding of appropriated money, ran into barrage from irate Senators on the sane, heated constitutional question at an Agriculture Committee hearing today.

title: Pentagon Tightens Rules for Retiring With Disability Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) The Defense Department announced today a tightening of military disability retirement standards to avoid what some members of Congress contend are unwarranted tax breaks for generals and admirals.

title: City to Press Safety Program for Taxis
description: A safety program for the city's taxi industry  including seat belts for passengers, retraining for drivers with poor safety, records and a betterdesigned car  was outlined yesterday by Michael J. Lazar, the Taxi and Limousine Commission chairman.

title: Nixon Retracts His Statement He Ordered Fitzgerald Ouster
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1President Nixon retracted today statement he made at his news, conference yesterday that he had ordered the dismissal of A. Ernest Fitzgerald, the Air Force analyst who had disclosed soaring costs and alleged waste in production of the C5A transport plane.

title: SILVIO L. MASSOLO
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Feb. 1Silvio L. Massolo, advertising production manager and purchasing agent for The New York Post, died today at the Long Island Jewish Medical Center at Lake Success, N.Y. He was 62 years old and lived here at 6 Annette Drive.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: JAZZ So you'd like to dance along with Dixieland and all that oldtime jazz? Not too many places to do that, but there's one that comes up the first Friday of every month, October through May, such as tonight at 9, at the Columbia University Club, 4 West 43d Street. The main ballroom is taken over by a group of ardent nonpro jazzmen (doctors, lawyers, engineers, businessmen, ad men, all such types) who play with an eye to dancers, continuing a 25yearold tradition started by Lawrence S. Pratt, lawyer (onetime partner in Wendell Willkie's law firm) and jazz buff.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Libya Said to Have Lent Black Muslims $3Million
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The North African nation of Libya lent American Black Muslims $3million last year but has refused a request for a second loan, according to per sons close to both parties.

title: LATIN COUNTRIES GET NIXON PLEDGE
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 1President Nixon promised today to give priority attention to interAmerican cooperation in his second term.

title: OURS CONQUER RAIDERS, 8 TO 5
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Feb. 1 (UPI)Jim Harrison and Ross Perkins scored two goals each tonight to lead the Alberta Oilers to an 85 victory over the New York Raiders in a World Hockey Association contest.

title: Unionization in Academe
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.  The chamber of horrors we are sometimes told will come when unionization arrives in the academic community turns out to be alarmist. My conclusions are based on six years as president of Bennington College, With 600 students and no faculty bargaining unit, and one and a half years as president of Rutgers, with 39,000 students and a faculty bargaining unit, the local chapter of the American Association of University Professors. The roles the faculty play in these two dissimilar institutions are remarkably similar.

title: City and Horn and Hardart Start a FoodandFun Plan for the Elderly
description: Mayor Lindsay stepped behind a steam table yesterday, picked up a ladle and dished out a meal of fried chicken and rice to Joseph Bishop, who accepted the platter with a wizened smile.

title: F.D.I.C. Gives Approval To Jefferson Bank Merger
description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation confirmed yesterday that it had approved the merger of the troubled Jefferson Savings Bank, Watertown, N. Y. with the much larger and stronger Community Savings Bank of Rochester.

title: Bench Plays Golf in Return to Action
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Feb. 1Johnny Bench, the Cincinnati Reds catcher who underwent lung surgery last Dec. 11, returned to his first competition today since the operation and was his usual robust, exuberant self.

title: 13 CITY UNIONS SCORE PLAN ON RETIREMENT
description: A coalition of publicemploye unions came out strongly yesterday against the statewide publicemploye retirement plan submitted Tuesday by the state's Permanent Commission on Public Employe Pension and Retirement Systems.

title: NAVY COACH QUITS, JOINS LION STAFF
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Feb. 1 (AP)  Rick Forzano resigned as head football coach at the United States Naval Academy today to become an assistant coach under Don McCafferty with the Detroit Lions.

title: Pennsy Estimates Needs For Aid by Government
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company yesterday put an approximate price tag on the Government assistance they say will be necessary to restore the sick railroad to health. In a report to Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court in Philadelphia, who is overseeing the road's reorganization, the trustees said at least $600million of subsidy assistance and possibly $800million would be required between now and 1976.

title: Presidential Board Urges Raise Of 14.5% for PATH's Carmen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)  A Presidential emergency board recommended today that the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen was entitled to a 14.5 per cent wage increase over a twoyear period from the Port Authority TransHudson Corporation, the rapidrailtransit system between New York and New Jersey.

title: BIG BOARD IN SHIFT ON INSURANCE SALES
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its board of directors had given approval to a change in the rules that will permit member firms to sell health and accident insurance. Firms already were permitted to sell life insurance.

title: SPATE UNIT FIRM. ON FUELOIL RULE
description: TRENTON, Feb. 1The State Environmental Protection Commissioner, Richard J. Sullivan, has refused to relax New Jersey's lowsulphur requirements for fuel oil despite claims by a major supplier that these grades of fuel oil are in short supply.

title: State Asks Proof of Need Before Welfare Is Given
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Governor Rockefeller ordered today that, starting July 1, all welfare recipients be required to undergo facetoface interviews at specified intervals to reestablish continued eligibility. Assistance will be cut off for anyone unable to document his eligibility.

title: A Driver for Gambino Is Cited for a Violation
description: James Faille, the driver of an automobile carrying Carlo Gambino, reputed Mafia leader, was given a summons by the police yesterday for operating a car while carrying a revoked license.

title: Yugoslays Hotly Deny A Drift Toward Soviet
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 1  Nearly 20 years after the death of Stalin and 25 years since Yugoslavia's break with the Soviet bloc, memories of Stalinism and alliance with the bloc still haunt this independentminded country.

title: Gain Is for Quarter
Commodity Price Index Up 0.4 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 136 from 135.6 last week.

title: Charges Are Reflected
description: Operating results of the Amerada Hess Corporation in the quarter and year ended Dec. 31 plunged from the year before, reflecting charges for expected losses against longterm fixedprice residual oil contracts, unamortized costs of certain nonproductive oil and gas leases and a change in accounting.

title: ROSEWALL VICTOR IN MILAN TOURNEY
description: MILAN, Italy, Feb. 1 (AP)Top  seeded Ken Rosewal reached the quarterfinals of tilt $50,000 Milan indoor tennis tournament by beating Adriano Panatta of Italy in straight sets 63, 63, today.

title: CHILD DETENTIONS ATTACKED IN SUIT
description: A suit was filed In Federal Court here yesterday to prevent the confinement of children considered incorrigible, ungovernable or habitually disobedient.

description: AMERICAN ASSOCIATION

description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

description: The Amstrong Cork Company said directors have approved the purchase of up to 175,000 of its common shares. The company's stock was down  at 26 on the New York Stock Exchange.

description: The chairman of the, boards returns to the indoor track and field circuit tonight at the Toronto Star Maple Leaf Indoor Games.

title: BURTON W. KELLOGG
description: Burton W. Kellogg, president of Emory Sexton & Co., Inc., shipbrokers at 19 Rector Street, died yesterday in the Elizabeth (N.J.) General Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived in Westfield, N.J.

title: ETHELWYN BRADISH
description: Ethelwyn C. Bradish, an artist and art teacher, died Tuesday in St. Luke's Hospital. She was 90 years old and lived at 155 East 93d Street.

title: A 3D MARKET SALEUPSETS BIG BOARD
description: The New York Stock Exchange has conducted an intense investigation into the circumstances under which a block of 18,900 shares of Wells Fargo & Co., was sold in the third market by a member firm and has revised some of its procedures as a result.

description: The City's five Republican county leaders discussed with Governor Rockefeller yesterday possible Republican endorsement of three Democratic mayoral hopefulsCity Controller Abraham D. Beame, City Council President Sanford D. Garelik and Representative Mario Biaggi.

title: 2 Turkish Students Sentenced to Death In Subversion Case
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 1A military tribunal in Ankara sentenced two university students to death today on charges of attempting to overthrow the constitutional Government and abolish Parliament by force.

title: BREWER, ARCHER, WATSON POST 68'S
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 1Gay Brewer, George Archer and Tom Watson shared the firstround lead in the $200,000 Hawaiian open golf tournament over the windswept Waialae Country Club course today with fourunderpar 68's.

title: CLIMB CONTINUES IN LOAN DEMAND
description: Demand for business loans soared at major New York City banks during the week ended Wednesday, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Stennis Condition Is Reported Better; He Talks With Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI) Senator John C. Stennis, showing definite improvement but still in very serious condition, conferred with an aide from his hospital bed today, less than 48 hours after he was shot in a holdup.

title: COURT BARS DELAY IN CLEANING UP MR
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit has ordered the Environmental Protection Agency to rescind its decision allowing 17 states, including New York, two additional years to come into compliance with air pollution limits.

title: CUP SKI RACE WON BY MISS PROM
description: SCHRUNS, Austria, Feb. 1 (UPI)  Annemarie Proell sped to her seventh straight downhill victory of the season today, led Austria to a 12345 sweep and seized an almost unbeatable lead in her quest for third consecutive World Cup ski title.

title: Pubco Petroleum Accepts New Offer On Mesa Merger
description: The Pubco Petroleum Corporation announced yesterday that its board of directors had accepted the Mesa Petroleum Corporation's revised offer to merge Pubco into Mesa.

title: PUBLICITY POSTS GROW IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1The annual opening of the Legislature's payroll today showed a strong disposition by the Republican leaders for publicrelations men, particularly in the Senate, where the new majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, has created a small communications empire.

description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 1 (UPI)  Col. Pramual Vanigbandhu of the Thai police, once regarded as a top investigator of Thailand's narcotics traffic, was himself charged today with illegal narcotic dealings.

title: West 11th St. Neighbors Honor Their Fire Hero
description: Mrs. Alice W. Mathews, 74yearold resident of West 11th Street who keeps up with things on her block, was walking her dog the other day when her friend Joseph M. Mazzitelli came up to her with big news.

description: The International Business Machines Corporation yesterday had some good and some bad news.

Kennedy Panel Says Government Inquiry on Bugging Was Limited

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 1Four Americans were killed during the week that ended with the start of the Vietnam ceasefire last Sunday, the United States military command said today.

title: Scientists Study Pa use That, Uh, Expresses
description: In the beginning was the word, says the Bible, but a growing number of researchers are, suggesting that the pause precedes the word, often interrupts it, and defines its end.

description: An adman and a lyricist, inspired by Broadway's constant need for funds and the trend toward corporate involvement in things cultural, have decided to marry the two into what they have called Sponsored Theatre.

title: Dollars and Sense
description: The biggest problem facing the United States and Europe is a matter of dollars and sense. There are too many of the former and there is too little of the latter on one or another side of the Atlantic, depending on the observer's geographical stance. But adjustments on both trade and monetary matters must be made if NATO is to hold together in this newly flexible multipolar world.

title: Business Briefs
description: WARSAW, Feb. 1The Chase Manhattan Bank has offered substantial credits to Poland to facilitate the purchase of American technology, David Rockefeller, chairman of the bank, said today. Mr. Rockefeller, ending a nineday visit to Eastern Europe, would not say how much money was involved, but the loan is believed to around $40million.

title: Cost Controls on Nursing

Health facilities in general remain subject to strict economic controls along with the food and construction industries under Phase, 3. The balance of the ecpnorny is expected to obey voluntary wageprice guidelines.

title: McGovern's Drive Got $22.8Million, Democrats' Record

title: The Changing Scene in London

The only good news is that February will be warmer than usual. Despite the long  range forecasts, the British have become accustomed to changes in the weather.

title: Indians Kill 3 in Raid on Brazilian Amazon Post

title: Australia Takes the First Steps Toward Recognition of Hanoi
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 1Australia, whose troops helped to fight Communist insurgency in South Vietnam for more than 10 years, has instituted steps toward diplomatic relations with Hanoi.

Tom Catlin will continue working with the linebackers and Dick Vermeil with offensive backs and special teams, Knox said.

title: Journeys for Healing
description: President Nixon's decision to dispatch Henry Kissinger to Hanoi late next week is a beneficial omen for an uncertain peace.

title: Court Denies Plea to Hear Kawaida Builder's Appeal
description: NEWARK, Feb. 1The Appellate Division of Superior Court has refused to take up the Kawaida Towers housing controversy, leaving the pickets free to demonstrate in front of the site of the proposed highrise project.

title: G.M. LIFTS SALES AND NET TO PEAKS
description: DETROIT, Feb. 1The General Motors Corporation announced today that its sales and earnings for 1972 reached record levels despite Phase 2 controls on prices and a series of strikes that caused the company to lose the production of 200,000 vehicles.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Federal Judge Milton Pollock reserved decision yesterday in the Women's International Tennis Federation antitrust suit against the United States Lawn Tennis Association. Mrs. Gladys Heldman of Houston, director of the W.LT.F., sought in the Southern District Court suit a preliminary injunction to prevent the U.S.L.T.A. from banning Mrs. Billie, Jean King and 64 other contract professionals from U.S.L.T.A.sanctioned tournaments such as the United States Open and Wimbledon in England.

title: Rail TonMileage. Up 13.7%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads last week totaled an estimated 16 billion tonmiles, 13.7 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago, Carloadings in the same week totaled 513,279 cars, 9.6 per cent above last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 12.1 per cent above last year.

title: 'Private Parts,' Film by Bartel, Arrives:The Cast
description: Innocent but eager, young runaway Cheryl Stratton means to explore her aunt's seedy Los Angeles hotel no matter what stands in her way. Neither the creaking doors, nor the footsteps in the hall that scare her half to death each night, nor Aunt Martha's prudent warnings, nor even the 110-volt charge of electric current intended to keep idle fingers from Aunt Martha's master key ring, will deter her.And so she roams the corridors of the dim old place, little dreaming that her girlfriend's boyfriend (who came to find her) has been fed in pieces to the hotel furnace, or that her girlfriend (who came to find the boyfriend) is already decomposing between trays of developer and wash in the basement darkroom of a strange, intense photographer named George.Indeed, it is George who draws Cheryl on, with his soft, disturbing eyes and his half anonymous gifts of black leather and silky nothings for her to wear. And it is George who spies on Cheryl  to her knowledge and rather to her pleasure  from behind the secret peephole in the bathroom wall.Cheryl, George, Aunt Martha, the girlfriend, the boyfriend, the crazy Mrs. Quigley and the wicked Reverend Moon  all of them live, and some of them die, in "Private Parts," a movie by Paul Bartel, which opened yesterday at the First Avenue Screening Room. Bartel is a young director whose previous short films have shown a genius of title ("Secret Cinema," "Naughty Nurse") not entirely matched by their content. "Private Parts" is no triumph, but it does mark a giant step forward toward the successful blending of precocious perversity and satiric good sense that seems the fated direction of his career.Bartel really has a theme  the willful annexing of one personality by anothera scary and potentially serious theme that at the movies tends to make its way more profitably into the horror film than any other genre. The hapless heroine of "Secret Cinema" finds herself unconsciously starring in somebody else's movie, shown to selected audiences in weekly installments. The not-so-hapless heroine of "Private Parts" dresses or undresses for a part (the film's title, of course, contains a pun) that she does not begin to comprehend until she is literally trapped in the Feudian intricacies of its motivation.Attempting to make all this funny as well as frightening, Bartel succeeds in some details and fails in others. But the attempt, even when it isn't quite working, is a good deal more interesting than most. With Ayn Ruymen as the beautiful Cheryl and Lucille Benson as her protective aunt (also a photographer, a specialist in attending funerals and snapping the moment when the spirit escapes the body) he has been fortunate in getting good performances from perfect types. Not all the film's nonsense is under imaginative control, but most of it is."Private Parts" is at least a hopeful occasion for those of us who love intellectual cinema and at the same time care for the menacing staircase, for the ominous shadow, for empty rooms shuttered against the light of the afternoon.The Cast

title: SOME AGNEW AIDES SAID TO BE LEAVING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) While Vice President Agnew is touring Southeast Asia, several top aides are reportedly preparing to leave his Washington staff.

title: Holding of Infant Aided
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2A New York stockbroker has invented a support for an infant's head that he calls the Helping Hand. Steven A. Seiden, a partner in Herzfeld & Stern, a New York Stock Exchange member firm, is to receive Patent 3,715,140 next week. He became interested in the subject when friends and relatives handed him their newborn children. He found that it was almost impossible to hold the babies' wobbly heads up properly.

title: 30 Cardinals Named; Three Are American
description: ROME, Feb. 2Pope Paul VI today nominated 30 new cardinals from all continents, including three Americans.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Events Today
description: Operas

title: Brooklyn Banjoist Accused of Bilking Insurers With Staged Falls
description: A 32yearold Brooklyn banjoist plucked, thousands of dollars, in liability claims and struck chords of dismay among casualty insurance companies by faking slipandfall accidents in food and department stores, a Federal indictment charged yesterday.

title: CITY FINDS 3 AIDES BROKE ETHICS CODE
description: The city's Board of Ethics ruled yesterday that three city housing officials were in a conflict of interest in connection with the use of $144,000 in municipal funds to repair a Bronx tenement owned by a church of which they were officials.

title: Elis Bow, 76 to 56
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 2 (AP) Penn held Yale to one field goal in the first 15 minutes and went on to defeat the Bulldogs, 7656, in basketball tonight at the Palestra.

title: Montana Senate Rejects Equal Rights Amendment
description: HELENA, Mont., Feb. 2 (UPI)  The State Senate, after a series of tie votes and two hours of emotional debate, has apparently killed chances for the state to ratify the equal rights amendment to the Constitution.

title: Peking Leader ship Greets Hanoi Aides At CeaseFire Rally
description: PEKING, Feb. 2 (Reuters)Almost the entire Chinese leadership led 10,000 people in a mass rally in Peking today to celebrate the Vietnam ceasefire.

title: STERN IS STUDYING LOSS OF EVIDENCE
description: NEWARK, Feb. 2  Herbert J. Stern, the United States Attorney for New Jersey, said today, that he had begun an inquiry to determine how a vital piece of Government evidence at the Federal tax trial of former State Senator Willard B. Knowlton disappeared from the courtroom yesterday.

title: Detective Ruled Suicide Victim Tied to All of Missing Narcotics
description: Sources close to the investigation of the theft of nearly 400 pounds of narcotics from the office of the Police Department property clerk said last night that the entire amount had been signed out in the name of Detective. Joseph N. Nunziata, whose death last March was ruled a suicide.

title: MAURICE N. LIDZ
description: Maurice. N. Lidz, president of Lidz Brothers, Inc., button distributors at 250 West 36th Stret, died Thursday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 1339 Boxwood Drive, Hewlett Harbor, L. I.

title: Knicks Toppled By Bullets, 8977
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 2After dominating play in the first two quarters and holding a 12point lead at the half, the New York Knicks were stopped cold in the final 24 minutes by the Baltimore Bullets and lost an 8977 decision tonight at Civic Center.

title: People and Business
description: William McChesney Martin Jr., a former chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said he feared that inflation would surge ahead by about 4 to 4.5 per cent in the 1974 fiscal year, which begins July 1, instead of the 2.5 per cent hoped for earlier.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: General Motors added  to 76, the only auto maker to show a gain. After the market close on Thursday, G.M. reported record profits for 1972.

title: Postmark Collectors Fight for Names, Not Numbers
description: UNITED STATES POSTAL SERVICE OH 445, PM 31 JAN 1973It used to be whenever anyone got a letter from his eastern Ohio city, all they had to do was look at the, postmark next to the stamp on the front of the envelope and they would mow immediately that the letter was from Youngstown.

title: Dutch Sternaman, 77, Dies; Chicago Bears CoFounder
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 2 (UPI)Edward (Dutch) Sternaman, cofounder and a former coach of the Chicago Bears football team, died today at his home. He was 77 years old.

title: Three in Ulster Killed ExecutionStyle
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 2  Guerrilla gun squads killed three more persons in Belfast today.

title: Bell ell and Hailwood Pace Daytona Race Qualifiers
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2The, British team of Derek Bell and Mike Hailwood decisively beat a threeman French team today to qualify for the pole position in tomorrow's running of the TwentyFour Hours of Daytona.

title: Pennzoil's Net Up
STENNIS'S DOCTORS FEAR AN INFECTION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) Surgeons said today that Senator John C. Stennis, wounded in a holdup last Tuesday night, was still in very serious condition and they were concerned about the possibility of infection.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Prisoners at Camden Set Jail on Fire; Threat of Tear Gas Helps End Protest
description: CAMDEN, Feb. 2Twentythree. Camden County jail inmates barricaded themselves Inside a jail dormitory on the sixtli floor of City Hall today, then surrendered three hours later when the police told them teargas and, dogs awaited them.

title: Bishops' ExSecretary Is Ordained to Episcopacy
description: Msgr. John J. Snyder, secretary to the last two Roman Catholic bishops of Brooklyn, was ordained to the episcopacy yesterday at a twohour ceremony in Our Lady of Perpetual Help Basilica, Fifth Avenue and 59th Street, Brooklyn.

title: A Battling Judge Retires To Aid Minority Children
description: Chainsmoking and reminiscing in her Family Court chambers the other day, Judge Justine Wise Polier recalled some of the battles she has fought in her 38 years on the bench  battles to get better care for children who come before the court.

title: Records: Eubie Blake
description: Eubie Blake, the pianist, singer and composer, who has had a remarkable twilight career during the last two or three years, will be 90 years old Wednesday. And, just in time for that birthday celebration, four records have been released that document his earliest recorded performances and his most recent, spanning 55 years. The early work actually comes from piano rolls rather than records. But this may be just as well since his 1917 pianoroll version of his own Charleston Rag, cleanly transferred to a recording in 1972, now has more vitality and presence than comes through the relatively thin, scratchy reproduction of his 1921 78r. p. m. record of the same tune.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The Giants acknowledged yesterday that their faint hopes for a reasonably solid home stand at Yankee Stadium in 1973 had gone aglimmering. The City has advised the National Football League club that its renovation of the stadium is expected to begin in early October, as planned, Ieaving the Giants only three playing dates there.

title: 58 Makes Big Snow a Heavy Rain
description: Unseasonable temperatures once again rescued the Northeast from winter's worst, as the temperature rose to 55 degrees yesterday and what could have been a massive snowstorm into a rainfall of more than two and a half inches.

title: CELTICS DEFEATED BY HA1KS, 10099
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2 (AP)Pete Maravich scored 37 points and the Atlanta Hawks capitalized at the freethrow line tonight its hanging on fora 10099 National Basketball Association victory over the Boston Celtics.

title: NETS TURN BACK CHAPS BY 10693
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Feb. 2The New York Nets, who often five dangerously in the home stretch, headed into the final eight weeks of the basketball season tonight with a 10693 victory over the Dallas Chaparrats.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Walt Michaels considered be to be his credo. Be a man, he often said. Always be a man.

title: A Diplomat's Hail to His Chief
description: WASHINGTONPeace that heals. The phrase Seemed only a distant dream when President Nixon first uttered it in his Inaugural Address four years ago. But now, three days into his second term, the President has repeated the appealing words and delivered the results to back them up.

title: LOANSHARKING RAID YIELDS $50,000 CASH
description: Six detectives raided a suspected loansharking operation yesterday and scooped up records, an adding machine and 10 shopping bags containing, they said, $50,000 in cash and $2million in checks.

title: Rise $800Million Orders Down
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 2 Manufacturers' inventories rose by a strong $800million in December, tending to confirm an irregular improvement in this longsluggish sector of the economy, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Arms Aid for Cambodia and Laos Debated in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2A disagreement has reportedly broken out within the Nixon Administration over whether the recently concluded agreement for a ceasefire in Vietnam allows the United States to continue military aid to Laos and Cambodia.

title: Hanoi Is Saki to Move Troops Out of Cambodia Combat Zones
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 2Some movement of Vietnamese Communist troops out of battle areas was reported here today, but there was difference of opinion as to its significance.

title: IKE GILBERT
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Feb. 2 (AP)Harold Raymon (Ike) Gilbert, retired assistant athletic director at the Pennsylvania State University, died today in Centre Community Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: CAMDEN INMATES SET JAIL ON FIRE
description: CAMDEN, N. 3., Feb. 2 Twentythree Camden County jail inmates barricaded themselves inside a jail dormitory on the sixth floor of City Hall today, then surrendered three hours later when the police told them tear gas and dogs awaited them.

title: 17 Die in Brazil Rail Crash
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 2 (Reuters)  An official announcement said that 17 people were killed and more than 1001 injured, 35 critically, when an express train derailed today 97 miles north of here.

title: Mrs. Norma Hearn Dead; Welfare and Civic Leader.
description: Mrs. Norma Burke Hearn, a welfare leader whose first husband was Justice Murray Hearn of the State Supreme Court, died yesterday at the Suffolk County Hospital in Riverhead, L.L She was 69 years old and lived at 24 Monroe Place in Brooklyn and in Remsenburg,

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and index, Page 31

title: Uruguay Devalues Peso
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 2 (AP)Uruguay's central bank ordered a 5.97 per cent devaluation of the peso todaythe second this year and the 12th since last March 1. It set the new rates at 792 pesos per dollar to buy and 800 to sell.

title: ExAddict Dramatizes Living Death for Bronx Pupils
description: To show Bronx elementary school children that dope is death, a former addict climbed stiffly from a coffin yesterday and told the youngsters about his own living death as a slave to drugs. The act was part of an antidrug fair that had been attended earlier in the week by more than 5,000 pupils from schools in District 9 in the Morrisania section. It was repeated yesterday for the benefit of newsmen, following complaints from two mothers who said their children had been frightened by it. Neither mother had seen the show.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Feb. 2Tokyo stock prices plunged today for the fourth consecutive day. The local DowJones average closed at 4,810.52, down 245.65 from yesterday, with a turnover of 300 million shares. The cumulative fourday decline in the Dow amounted to 529.99 points, exceeding the sharp drop in Tokyo stock prices in June, 1972, when Britain began floating the pound.

title: NIXON'S MESSAGE ON STATE OF UNION IS FIRM ON CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2President Nixon, whose budget cuts and pledges to dismantle social programs have stirred angry debate on Capitol Hill, sent to Congress today a State of, the Union Message that was unyielding in his intention to hold down spending.

title: Liberty, New and Old
description: LONDON, Feb. 2At the start of his opinion for the Supreme Court in the abortion case, Justice Blackmun acknowledged the sensitive sand emotional nature of the issue, the seemingly absolute convictions it inspired.

title: Miss Lorentzen Wed to J. N. Kowalchyk
description: MONTGOMERY, Ohio, Feb. 2In the Montgomery Presbyterian Church this evening Miss Elizabeth Turner Lorentzen, who teaches music at the Montgomery Elementary School, was married to John Nicholas Kowalchyk, a widower and district representative for the Gaylord Container Division of the Crown Zellerbach Corporation in Cincinnati. The interfaith ceremony was performed by the Rev. William Graler and the Rev. Martin Iott, a Dominican priest.

title: Bridge
description: Spotwatching is a profitable exercise for declarers who like to make their contracts. The opening lead, for example, will usually give some clue to the distribution of the suit led, and the declarer who bears this in mind is more likely to find the best line of play.

title: City's Cold Squirrels Have a Farm Friend
description: Every morning, with fidelity and great care, an elderly man feeds, the squirrels in Madison Square Park. He does it with a beer can, which he has fastened atop a pole and filled with acorns and walnuts.

title: Agency Says Prediction by Companies Would Not Be Required
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it planned to relax its traditional ban on corporate earnings forecasts in statements by companies under the Federal securities laws.

title: A Battling Judge Retires To Aid Minority Children
description: Chainsmoking and reminiscing in her Family Court chambers the other day, Judge Justine Wise Polier recalled some of the battles she has, fought in her 38 years on the bench  battles to get better care for children who come before the court.

title: English Town Is Shaken by Concorde Cancellations
description: FILTON, England, Feb. 2Stanley Taylor looked back this afternoon over his 35 years of ups and downs as an assembler in the aircraft industrythey were mostly ups, he saidand decided that there is still a future, but a future that will be long delayed, for him and the 7,019 other men who are building Concorde supersonic airliners here. Our problem is that we are three years ahead of our time, he said. In 1975, when Concorde begins hopping the Atlantic in half the time other planes take, the whole world is going to want to fly her. She is a great aircraft and the airlines that don't want her now are going to beg for her later. But what to we do until then?

title: U.N. URGES BRITAIN TO CURB RHODESIANS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 2The Security Council adopted a resolution today calling on Britain to take measures to bring about an end to Rhodesia's economic blockade, blackmail and military threats against neighboring Zambia.

title: U.S. SAID TO URGE LAOS TO CONCLUDE EARLY CEASEFIRI
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 2 A high Laotian Government source says that the United States is strongly urging the Government of Premier Souvanna Phouma to conclude speedy ceasefire with the Pathet Lao and that the Premier has accepted the American view despite misgivings that no accord with adequate guarantees can be reached.

title: Men in the News: Some Among the 30 Prelates Designated for the Cardinalate by Pope Paul VI
description: A Portuguese immigrant from Azores whose first job was sweeping floors of textile mill, he was installed as Roman Catholic Archbishop of Boston on Oct. 7, 1970, succeeding Cardinal Cushing, and became first nonIrishman in post in 124 years. . . . Born to poverty on Oct. 6, 1915, on Slo Miguel Island, largest of Azores . . . Emigrated to United States in 1931 . . . learned English at night and in spare time, attended high school in Fall River, Mass., studied for priesthood at Catholic University in Washington . . . First pastorate St. Michael's Church, Fall River . . . Served four years as Bishop of Brownsville, Texas, one of smallest and poorest American dioceses . . . Regarded as social activist, fought vigorously for rights of MexicanAmerican farm workers and spent every Christmas and Easter in jails ministering to the prisoners . . . Named Bishop of Brownsville in 1966 during farm strike, quickly supported workers' demands for $1.25anhour minimum . . . Sold episcopal limousine and settled for room in palace.

title: FLORIDA QUINTETS ARE PICKS TODAY
description: Rhode Island will meet Jacksonville today in the second game of a college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden with a lame duck coach. Tom,Carmody resigned the post two weeks ago, effective April 30.

title: Watergate Judge Wants U.S. to Revive Its Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The judge in the Watergate trial charged in blunt language today that the recently concluded criminal proceeding had failed to get to, the bottom of the case and urged the Government to resume its investigation.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and index, Page 31

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The wining New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: EXPLOSION LEVELS IOWA STORE AREA
description: EAGLE GROVE, Iowa, Feb. 2 (AP)An explosion all but destroyed two buildings and heavily damaged several others tonight, rescue officials said.

title: Islip Asks Total Ban on Autos to Preserve Fire Island
description: ISLIP, LI., Feb 2A comprehensive plan to preserve the character of Fire Island and the Great South Bay, including a total ban on motorized traffic, was disclosed today by Islip Town Supervisor Peter Fox Cohalan.

title: NEW DRUG LAWS SCORED IN HARLEM
description: Some 75 Harlem residents last night told two legislators of their opposition to Governor Rockefeller's package of new laws on narcotics addiction.

title: Liquori Wins Mile; Women Runners Star
description: TORONTO, Feb. 2 (AP)Iris Davis of Tennessee State broke the world indoor mark for the 50yard dash and. Glenda Reiser, a 17yearold from Ottawa, shattered the world standard for the 1,000yard run tonight at the Toronto Star Maple Leaf indoor track games.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Speaking for the majority in the, Supreme Court's abortion decision, Justice Blackmun spoke of a viable baby as only a potential life. Also, concerning the remnant of legislative authority graciously left to the people and their representatives, he wrote in only a hypothetical vein: If the state is interested in protecting fetal life after viability. . . . If? Furthermore, he described the grounds for compelling state interest in the unborn as their capability of meaningful life outside the mother's womb. Meaningful? Thus the Court opened the door to weighing human lives according to comparative worthiness, or something called meaningfulness.

title: 225 Press Photos Shown at Museum
description: The exhibition called From the Picture Press, which opened this week at the Museum of Modern Art, 11 West 53d Street, is an attempt to encompass, presumably for esthetic purposes, the vast, highly variable and sometimes anonymous work of photographers whose work has appeared in newspapers over the last halfcentury. The exhibition is, in effect, an act of esthetic reclamation  an effort to salvage something significant and permanent from the ephemera of pictorial journalism.

title: Sports Today
description: Seton Hall vs. Florida State and Rhode Island vs.. Jacksonville, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street. First game, 1:30 P.M.

title: ES. SAID TO URGE LAOS TO CONCLUDE EARLY CEASEFIRE
description: VIETIANE, Laos, Feb. 2A high Laotian Government source says that the United States is strongly urging the Government of Premier Souvanna. Phouma to conclude speedy ceasefire with the Pathet Lao and that the Premier has accepted the American view despite misgivings that no accord with adequate guarantees can be reached.

title: Postmark Collectors Fight for Names, Not Numbers
description: UNITED STATES POSTAL SERVICE OH 445, PM 31 JAN 1973It used to be whenever anyone got a letter from this eastern Ohio city, all they had to do was look at the postmark next to the stamp on the front of the envelope and they would know immediately that the letter was from Youngstown.

title: Gains in Earnings Are Overshadowed Dow Is Off 4.97
description: Stock prices tumbled yesterday as money worries on two fronts  domestic and internationalovershadowed strong 1972 earnings reports.

title: WINE TALK
description: Sooner or later, most wine articles and wine books advise readers that nothing is so important to the wine buyer as a good wine merchant. Find one, they say, and stick with him.

title: Brewster Gets 2to6Year Term
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Former Senator Daniel B. Brewster of Maryland, convicted on three counts of accepting illegal gratuities, was sentenced in Federal Court today to a minimum of eight months and a maximum of two years in prison on each of the three counts.

title: Joint Bearing Venture Set
description: The Hoover Ball and Bearing Company and Nippon Seiko, K.K., of Tokyo, announced yesterday that they had agreed in principle to establish an equally owned company in the United States to manufacture and market antifriction bearings. The proposed joint venture would have a value in excess of $10million.

title: West Germans Take Step To Stem Inflow of Dollars
description: ZURICH, Saturday, Feb. 3The West German Cabinet, meeting in emergency session, ordered the tightening of foreignexchange controls early today to stem an influx of dollars that had reached crisis proportions.
