description: Evacuated residents returned to their homes, and many, homeowners pumped out their flooded basements yesterday as Friday's drenching storm moved from the Northeast into Canada.

title: S. J. Stein to Marry Donna Ellen Duskin
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Feb. 3 Mr. and Mrs. Victor Dorman have made known the engagement of Mrs. Dorman's daughter, Miss Donna Ellen. Duskin, to Steven Jay Stein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Stein of Philadelphia. A wedding in May is planned.

title: U. S. Olympic Movement Stalled
description: With detours hovering at almost every turn, the United States Olympic Committee will convene its splintered membership this week in Colorado Springs to install new officers and chart the administrative and financial road to the 1976 Montreal Olympics.

title: Military Budget
description: WASHINGTONIn his second day In officebarely three days after the Administration had solemnly presented Congress with a $79billion defense budget which it insisted was the minimum required for national, sectirityDefense Secretary. Elliot L. Richardson told reporters he had ordered a sweeping review of that budget to see where cuts might be made.

title: Nixon's Fresh Approach
description: In the first of what will be a series of State of the Union reports to Congress, President Nixon has repeated the dominant theme of his inaugural address, his budget and his economic report: Social programs must now be cut backand military programs expanded. To be sure, Mr. Nixon does not use that kind of simple language to describe what he is proposing to do. Rather, in postOrwellian flights of rhetoric and statistics, he has sought to show that more is less and less is more.

title: Smallpox Hits Bangladesh
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Feb. 3 (Reuters)More than 1,000 people have died in a smallpox outbreak in Bangladesh, according to reports reaching here. Some 400. people reportedly died in Dacca last month alone.

title: Numismatics
description: JUST four weeks ago, this column voiced strong criticism of some elements in the hobby that are either marginally numismatic or that this writer felt were not adequately dedicated to the good of the average collector. Included in the last category were publishers of annual price guides and albums, for they seemed to be playing into the hands of opportunistic dealers and other speculators by giving official, regular  issue status to such mint errors as the 1955 and 1972 doubled  die centsthus almost guaranteeing inflated prices for these oddities.

title: Yonkers Drivers
Western Capital Keeps Socialist Guinea Alive
description: PARIS  Guinea professes a socialist ideology, but foreign  largely Western capital is keeping the West African republic's economy alive and offering President Skou Tour's Government hope for an end to the present economic morass.

title: RHODESIA TOOPEN ZAMBIAN BORDER
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 3 (Reuters)Rhodesia will reopen her border with Zambia at dawn tomorrow after an announcement suggesting that Zambia had backed off from her policy of aiding African nationalist guerrillas.

title: Insko Gets Consecutive Triple On Seton Hanover's Triumph
description: YONKERS, Feb. 3Back in the hands of his favorite driver and facing softer company, 5yearold Seton Hanover captured the A2 pacing feature tonight at Yonkers Raceway. He returned $9.20 for $2 in the straight wageing.

title: Ad Aide Creates Fabric Sculpture
description: SOMERVILLEA twostory frame house at 166 West Cliff Street contains a host of elflike creatures who, in the words of their creator, are fabric sculptures.

title: TransCameroonian, a New Backbone
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon Thrusting northward through sparsely populated savannah land, the second extension of the TransCameroonian Railway is giving the country a new economic backbone.

title: Bay State Governor Criticizes U.S. and Texaco for Fuel Crisis
description: BOSTON, Feb. 3  Warm weather and President Nixon's lifting of oil import quotas, which has encouraged the Soviet Union and other Communist countries to enter the United States fuel market for the first time, have temporarily eased New England's fuel supply problem.

title: Seminaries
description: Until recent years, theological seminaries tended to appear more like fortresses than colleges. Students for the ministry were segregated from their lay counterparts and put through a specialized clerical education. Some denominations and even different religious orders within denominations maintained their own seminaries as exponents of their own particular approaches to theology and ministerial training.

title: Photography
description: LONDON IN New York there are three ... five ... eleven ... twenty photography galleries, depending on who is doing the counting and how he defines his terms. In London, however, there is really only one place where new photography is regularly exhibited throughout the year. It is called, appropriately, The Photographers' Gallery, and it is beginning its third year of operation this month.

title: All this and a view of the park
description: The planning behind the transformation of this apartment was almost as thorough as that involved in designing a house. Richard and Marlene Lloyd bought the coop for its location and Central Park view. Then they started thinking hard about the kind of apartment they really wanted. A formal dining room wasn't important, but a familystyle kitchen was. We wanted a large living room and a den for privacy. This they knew, but they were not quite so certain how it should look. It came out supermodernand the family loves it. Architects Alan Buchsbaum and Howard Korenstein of Design Coalition reorganized everything. They designed a walltowall sofa in the living room's bay window, raised on a platform to give sitters an eyelevel view of the park. Revolving cabinets close off an adjoining study. A maid's room became part of the kitchen; the children gained a suite of their own. We've lost rooms, say the Lloyds, but we've gained space and privacy.

title: What Did My Parents Ever See in Jack Paar?
description: I WATCHED Jack Paar Tonite for its entire premiere week, and I don't know why I kept coming back again each night. I guess I could put it down to that better part of my nature which makes me root for the underdog, but I suspect it goes beyond that. I think it has something to do with the peculiar quality, of generosity or loyalty which makes me stick around to see if a bad performance gets better. At today's prices, a theatergoer feels dutybound to remain in his seat until the end of a play or movie. But a television viewer who sits through all 90 minutes of an often embarrassingly bad show must have a soft spot in his heart someplace.

title: Architect Gives Houses By Sea a Nautical Flair
description: PORT JEFFERSON  It was what would be called a drop dead view in decoratop circles. Except for those grand Mediterranean bluffs holding the most prestigious GrecoRoman temples, few sights came to mind that could rival for sheer magnifivence the cliffside location of the latest contemporary house of the architect, Geysa Sarkany Jr.

title: At the other end of the tunnel
description: When the war has ended and the road is open again, the same stars will course through the heavens. Then will I weep for the white bones heaped together in desolate graves of those who sought military honors for their leaders. From a diary of an unknown North Vietnamese soldier, 1965.

title: Red Cross Elects a New Chairman
description: The executive board of the American Red Cross has elected as its chairman Cornelius W. Owens, executive vice president of the American Telephone & Telegraph Company.

title: Two Victories Forfeited
description: CANTON, Ohio, Feb. 3 (AP) Walsh College has forfeited basketball victories scored over Ohio Dominican and Rio Grande for using an ineligible player against those schools this season. Walsh officials discovered Ron Kushner, a 6foot4inch freshman from Amboy, N.J., had attended Texas Southern one day last fall before enrolling at Walsh.

title: Soviet Hails Arctic Convoy for Icebreaking
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 3  The Soviet Union has honored an Arctic convoy of four ships, escorted by five icebreakers, that smashed its way through the ice of the north Siberian seaway as late as the month of January. It was the longest extension of the shipping season in the history of the Arctic sea route.

title: Kenya Tries to Expand Beef Exports
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The aristocratic English pioneers in Kenya were tormented by repeated frustrations in trying to set up modern ranches.

title: CAMBODIA HIGHWAY TO SEA REPORTED CUT
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 3 (Reuters)The Cambodian command announced today that Communist forces had cut one of Phnom Penh's main supply routes for the first time since Government forces announced an end to their offensive operations.

title: Scotch Plains Is Reliving Past
description: SCOTCH PLAINS  When the stagecoach rumbled up the dusty main street to the Stage House Inn here in the 1700's, the innkeeper would fire a cannon. The boom was a signal to townspeople that they could collect their mail, embark for New York or perhaps hear news of Washington's troops, who were camped in the nearby hills.

title: 3 Children of One Family Killed in Fire in L. I. Home
description: WILLISTON PARK, L.I., Feb. 3  Two sisters and one of their younger brothers died early today in a fire that had started in the kitchen of their home here and then spread to other rooms.

title: PUZZLES
description: BRAVING THE ELEMENTSBy Keith Blake

title: UpperBracket Blues
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The millionaires who financed President Nixon's reelection campaign have been trooping to the White House lately in depression and alarm.

title: Carter, Cage, Reich . . . Speak, to Me
description: ON the one hand, a quest for greater complexity, denser sonorities, improved data processing, That was Elliott Carter's new String Quartet No. 3. On the other hand a quest for simplicity, direct communication, clarity. That was Vesalii Icones by Peter Maxwell Davies, and It also was Cheap Imitation by John Cage and Four Organs by Steve Reich. All of these were receiving local premieres within the past two weeks, and they represent opposing views of the musical avantgarde.

title: Antoinette E. Carter Planning Marriage to Gerrit Vreeland
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., Feb. 3Miss Antoinette Esterbrook Carter, a grandniece of the late Charles Evans Hughes, Chief Justice of the United States, has made plans to be married here to Gerrit Vreeland on April 28.

title: PROBLEMS CLOUD WHITLAM'S IMAGE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 3The new Labor Government of Prime Minister Gough Whitlam has run into severa image problems as it enters its third month in office, following a sweeping electoral victory Dec. 2 over the conservative coalition that had ruled for 23 years.

title: Arizona State Five Wins
description: TEMPE, Ariz., Feb. 3 (AP)Aritona State, with five players scoring in double figures, crushed Wyoming, 9162, in Western Athletic Conference basketball game today and assured itself of at least a share of the W.A.C. lead with a 5.2 wonlost record.

title: Cairo's Political Party Purges 64 Journalists and Intellectuals
description: CAIRO, Feb. 3  Sixtyfour journalists, writers and other intellectuals and professionals were dismissed today from the Arab Socialist Union, Egypt's only political party, in what is believed to be the beginning of a major purge conducted by the government of President Anwar elSadat.

title: Court vs. Congress
description: WASHINGTONCan the Supreme Court make fundamental changes in the rights of accused criminals by administrative fiat? That was the question posed last November by the Court's promulgation of a new set of rules of criminal evidence for the Federal court system.

title: 2 SHARE HONORS AT POODLE TRIAL
description: Two white standard poodles, Kaeley Kiss Me Kate, U.D., and Creme Puff of Ancient Oaks, U.D., divided the major honors yesterday at the 21st trial of the Poodle Obedience Training Club of Greater New York at the Statler Hilton.

title: L. L. Stanton Jr. Weds Mrs. Brattnas
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, Feb. 3Mrs. Berit Rask Brattnas, sports attach at the Swedish Consulate General in New York, was married here this afternoon to Louis L. Stanton Jr., a partner in the New York law firm of Carter, Ledyard & Milburn. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Everett E. Berrey, a Baptist minister, at Mr. and Mrs. Everett Taylor's home. Those present included the bridegroom's daughter, Miss Susan Stanton, a student at Vassar College, and his sons, L. Lee Stanton 3d, who attends Yale University, and Gordon R. Stanton, student at the Buckley School in New York.

title: In Quest of the Baroque
description: IT is seductively easy to be patronizing about the performances of baroque music that preceded our own sovereignly enlightened era. Imagine: It was a time of almost universal disdain for the harpsichord, let alone the clavichorda time when ignorant, arrogant armies of romantic pianists smeared the clean lines of the baroque with soupy rubatos and bathetic overpedallings. The dark ages, in other words.

title: RUSSI SKI VICTOR; COLLOMBIN HURT
description: ST. ANTON, Austria, Feb. 3 Bernhard Russi, world and Olympic champion in the downhill, raced to a record victory today in the ArlbergKandahar event, marred by an injury to the Word Cup point leader, Roland Collombin of Switzerland.

title: Point of View
description: AS West Africa moves into a second decade of independence, there is a groping for greater selfreliance. Government attitudes are changing with respect to the conditions under which a country's nonrenewable resources are exploited.

title: RAIDERS BEATEN BY COUGARS, 42
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 3 (AP) Thirdperiod goals by Rosaire Paiement and Bob Sicinski gave the Chicago Cougars a 42 victory over the New York Raiders tonight in a World Hockey Association game.

title: JUDGE A. D. MALANDRA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 3 (AP) Judge Angelo D. Malandra of Camden, N. J., died of a heart attack here yesterday. He was 65 years old.

title: The Tangle In Laos
description: VIENTIANENo one here doubts that a ceasefire and political settlemeat will be patched together fairly quickly in Laos. The question whether it will last.

title: Pro Arte Chorale Plans a Weekend Workshop
description: OAKLAND  When New Jersey's Pro Arte Chorale performs the world premiere of Antiphonies in Venice's St. Marks Cathedral next year, it not only will be celebrating its 10th birthday but also will be going home.

title: Miss Jan Sherwood Is Affianced
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Feb. 3  Miss Jan Sherwood and Michael Garvan Cavanagh plan to be married here June 2. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. John Sherwood, parents of the future bride whose fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Dunbar Cavanagh of East Norwalk.

title: Mayor's a Busy Mother, Too
description: EAST BRUNSWICKOne day last week, East Brunswick's new Mayor, Mrs. Jean, Walling, went home and cried. It marked the first time that she had allowed herself that luxury since she began to campaign for her party's nomination more than eight months ago.

title: City Wants College At Renewal Site
description: Intensive efforts are being made by the Lindsay administration and a number of public and private agencies to persuade Baruch College to build a new campus at the site of the Atlantic Terminal Urban Renewal Project in Brooklyn.

title: Mount Saint Vincent College Appoints a New President
description: Sister Doris Smith was elected the next president of the College of Mount Saint Vincent in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, the college's board of trustees has announced.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Van Lingle Mungo always had a low boiling point when he was throwing fireballs for the Brooklyn Dodgers during the era of the Daffinerss Boys at Ebbets Field. He was steaming one day after Tom Winsett, a sturdy hitter but a notoriously bad fielder, mangled a couple of plays to let runners get on base and then lost the game for Mungo by dropping a fly ball in the ninth. The big pitcher went from the ball park to a telegraph office and sent a message to his wife. It read:

title: Teddi King Opens Jazz Song Season At Reno Sweeney
description: Teddi King is a singer of respectshe has respect for a song's lyric and also for the mood of the piece. Perched, waiflike on a high stool at the Reno Sweeney supper club on West 13th Street, where she has opened a threeweek season, she took the audience through some carefully selected items by Irving Berlin, Cole Porter and Duke Ellington among others. They were carefully selected for correct tempo atid, more important, for correct mood.

title: Brooklyn Brownstone Revival
description: At least one brownstone resident in Boerum Hill is not getting much sleep these weekend mornings. Each Saturday and Sunday he is awakened by a different young couple, children in tow, who ask: Is your building for sale? Know of any others?

title: Busy Biafra Lacks Investment Funds
description: ONITSHA, NIGERIAJohn Aleba's business is something less than a $20 inventory of soaps, cigarettes and cans of evaporated milk sitting on rough boards shaded by straw mats near the rubble of the central market that thrived in this city before the Nigerian civil war.

title: The ultimate blackmail
description: Not long ago, in a debate at the U.N. on terrorism, Dmitri N. Kolesnik, a spokesman for the Soviet Union, said: Robin Hood was armed with bows and arrows, but modern terrorists prefer to have rifles and bombs, and tomorrow it's quite possible they will have deathcarrying germs or maybe stolen atomic bombs. And with the help of these bombs, they can blackmail any government.

title: Confucius Says 1973 Could Be Year of the Giants in Baseball
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 3Manager Charlie Fox quoted from Confucius in the flat dialect of the Bronx Irish today to explain haw his San Francisco Giants would win it all next season and save Candlestick Park from the clutches of the mortgagor.

title: Sincerity and Authenticity
description: For more than 30 years, starting with a book on Matthew Arnold (1939), and a brief work on E. M. Forster (1943), and via several wellknown collections of essays, The Liberal Imagination (1950), The Opposing Self (1955), A Gathering of Fugitives (1956) and Beyond Culture (1965), Lionel Trilling has seen literature as a criticism of life. The phrase comes from Matthew Arnold, and Trilling rightly interprets it to mean That literature is moral rather than moralistic in character, that it always makes its comment on the individual caught up in society or culture. Every person's freedom is affected by the habits and presuppositions of his time, which often sustain him unconsciously; and our culture could not exist for long without the antagonism of what Trilling calls, drawing among others self.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: MADISON AVE.
description: The National Advertising Review Board, the advertising industry's first serious attempt to regulate the advertising industry, has weathered its first formative year.

title: Floridian Charged With Setting Blaze That Injured 139
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 3 (Reuters)A 49yearold man was arrested today and accused of setting a flash fire in a crowded cafeteria that injured 139 persons, most of them in their 60's and 70's.

title: Mauritius Adding New Export Items
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar Travelers stopping here before going on to Mauritius, often ask, But how can that little island out in the Indian Ocean be a part of Africa?

title: Florida State, Jacksonville Win at Garden
description: Seton Hall lost its 13th game yesterday, something that figured to happen, but not in the manner it did.

title: Nassau Planning to Build Center for Horse Riding
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso recently announced plans for an equestrian center to be established on the 423acre Muttowntown Park and Preserve.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
Dance Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I WOULD like to correct some of the statements made by Clive Barnes in his column of Sunday, Jan. 28.

title: Abstract PaintingThe Crisis of Success
description: THE international hegemony of American painting has been so obvious for so long that hardly anyone mentions, it anymore. Abstract painting, in particular, has burgeoned so phenomenally on these shores since World War II that it has come to seem by adoption, as it werepractically a native art form, like jazz. Fine abstractions crowd the walls of our museums, homes and public buildings; they are part of the way our country looks.

title: Newton Applies to College
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., Feb 3 (UPI)Huey Newton, defense minister of the Black Panther party, has decided to finish his education. A spokesman for the University of California, Santa Cruz, said yesterday that Mr. Newton had applied for admission. Disposition of the application was kept private in accordance with university policy.

title: Dahomey's Trade Deficit Persists
description: COTONOU, Dahomey Plus ca change ... The French saying that the more things change, the more they remain the same, might have been inspired by events in this West African country.

title: Paper Recycling Urged
description: What will happen to this newspaper after you're through reading it? If you stack it with others and take them to a recycling collection point, you remove clutter from the streets, you save the city sanitation men some work and you even help to give the newspaper a new usefulness in some other form.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: NOW, George, remember: The fundamentals are very important, and you lay that right down on the line. That was the message, according to the Secretary of the Treasury, George P. Shultz, that President Nixon repeatedly gave him before the former University of Chicago economics dean met the press last Jan. 11 to announce and explain the Administration's new ball game  Phase 3 of the economicstabilization effort.

title: Values Clarification Clarified
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I. A willing group of followers came out last week to hear the Pied Piper of values clarificationa new educational method. His program had been diverted from nearby Great Neck where many fear he will turn the youngsters away from their parents' beliefs.

title: Togo, Once German, Brews Beer Fit for a Kaiser
description: LOME, Togo  The best beer and the biggest shopping bargains in West Africa are just some of the attractions that are beginning to spur a flow of winter touristsmainly West Germans to this small country on the Gulf of Guinea.

title: SYRIA IS LIMITING ROLE OF RUSSIANS
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 1While Syria is heavily dependent on the Soviet Union for military supplies and economic development, there are indications that the Syrians want to maintain a real measure of economic and political independence.

title: Miss Susan Carey Plans April Bridal
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey and Mrs. Carey of Brooklyn and Shelter Island, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Carey, to Martin J. Dempsey Jr., son of Mrs. Dempsey of Philadelphia and the late Mr. Dempsey.

title: Class Gets Taste Of Drunk Driving
description: FAIRFIELDAfter a mock trial here last week, two Montclair State College seniors were convicted of driving while under the influence of alcohol and lost their licenses for six months.

title: Headliners
description: A Lady's Will

title: The London of Sherlock Holmes
description: Michael Harrison is one of those amiable British eccentrics without whom the world would be a duller place. He has written many books, but his main field of expertise is in Sherlock Holmes research, which he pursues with the kind of fixated passion that in other fields would have already found a cure for cancer or given us an overdrive that would surpass the speed of light.

title: Nolan of Shore A. C. Takes 5.2Mile Jersey Road Run
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 3Harry Nolan of the Shore Athletic Club won a 5,2mile road run today in 25 minutes 37 seconds. Arthur Hall of Staten Island finished second in the field of 101.

title: Dance: In the Repertory
description: Among the ballets created by George Balanchine for the June Stravinsky Festival last year the Symphony In Three Movements stood out for its finely tuned buzzsaw energy. Appearing in the repertory of the New York City Ballet for the first time since then on Tuesday evening at the State Theater, the piece, with with its refined tensions, can claim artistic affinity with his greatest works.

title: VERMONT SKIER SETS RECORD, TEAM WINS
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., Feb. 3Petter Kongsli, a Vermont sophomore, smashed all jumping records at the Norwich area ski jump and led the Catamounts to their first Ski Carnival victory held at Bolton Valley and Norwich.

title: STORMY LEADING FLEET IN RIO RACE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 3 (Reuters)With a weighted burial bag in the aft cabin and a nurse and a cardiaccare unit aboard, a 72yearold Dutch millionaire was sailing his ketch Stormy through Brazilian waters today in an effort to clinch the glamorous 3,500mile CapetowntoRio ocean race.

title: HIGH COURT ASKED TO AID NEWSMAN
description: The United States Supreme Court has been asked to exempt a Maryland newsman from testifying before a grand jury on the ground that local law enforcement officials, embarrassed by his article about the open sale of marijuana, are engaged in official harassment of the press.

title: Late Gifts to Nixon Effort
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The top contributors to President Nixon's campaign in the final days before the Nov. election and afterward, based on 65 yearend committee filings, with estimated levels for eventual donor totals when. all reports are complete, are as follows:

title: Son to the Schwartzes
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Feb. 3A son was born Jan. 19 to Dr. and Mrs. John L. Schwartz in Hoag Memorial Hospital here. The child is a grandson of George Stromberg of New York and of Harry Schwartz, a member of the editorial board of The New York Times, and Mrs. Schwartz, of Scarsdale, N. Y. The child's father is a fellow in child psychiatry at the University of California Medical Center in Orange. The child has been named Mark Daniel.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 3 (UPI) Lowell MacDonald's goal at 5:20 of the third period today gave the Pittsburgh Penguins 21 victory over the Minnesota North Stars.

title: Autopsy of Mummy Finds Him or Her Well Kept
description: DETROIT, Feb. 3. (UPI) Medical researchers this week performed an autopsy on a 2,000yearold mummy, digging through 10 layers of linen, resin and balm wrappings to find most of its organs remarkably well preserved.

title: The Civil Servants
description: A Washington wit once remarked, Politicians in this town treat bureaucrats the way the rest of the country would like to treat politicians. To which someone replied: Or the way bureaucrats treat people.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article When a House Changes Hands, There Are a Few Little Extras [Jan. 14], by Grace Lichtenstein, gives the impression that the poor homebuyer is suddenly confronted on the day of closing with unexpected and excessive bills.

title: Queens' FourGame Streak Snapped by Lehman, 9180
description: Queens College (87) had its fourgame winning streak snapped as Lehman College (124) beat Queens, 9180, at the losers' court last night in a Knickerbocker Conference game.

title: UnderUtilized Uptown Bus Station Eases Load on Downtown Terminal
description: Four men were savoring a latemorning interlude at the Cobbs Corner Bar in the George Washington Bridge bus station the other day. A, visitor wandered in and asked: Say, does anything ever happen around here?

title: Bishop Stephen T. Nagbe Dies; Leader of Methodists in Liberia
description: Bishop Stephen Trowen Nagbe, head of United Methodism in Liberia and, at the age of 39, one of the youngest bishops of the United Methodist Church, died Friday in Liberia.

title: Watergate
description: WASHINGTONThere were a lot of important questions in the Watergate trial, Judge John J. Sirica observed last week, and I was hoping that we would get answers to all of them. I don't know if we did or not. Maybe one or two.

title: SYRACUSE DEFEATS LA SALLE, 91 TO 84
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 3 (AP)With Jim and Mike Lee leading the way, Syracuse University broke away from La Salle with four minutes left to take a 91.84 victory today, the 27th straight at home for the Orange.

title: Yugoslav Acts to Indict a Key Film Maker for Derision
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavla, Feb. 3  Yielding to demands by World War II Partisan veterans indignant over allegedly having been called Stalinists, the Belgrade prosecutor has moved to indict a leading film director on a criminal charge of derision of the state, its agencies and representatives.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Grumman Asks Deal With Navy
description: BETHPAGE, L. I.The Grumman Corporation has proposed to the Navy broad series of compromises to resolve the impasse over construction of the controversial F14 fighter, including possible elimination of some of the Phoenix missiles with which the plane is armed and which top Pentagon officials see as the raison d'etre of the entire plane.

title: Middle East Hussein Back to The Fold
description: CAIROKing Hussein last week took a long step toward ending his isolation in the Arab world. The King's Foreign Minister, Salah Abu Zeid, agreed at a conference of Arab League Foreign and Defense Ministers here to reactivate the eastern front against Israel and to put it under the overall direction of Gen. Ahmed Ismail, the Egyptian Defense Minister and CommanderinChief who already has similar powers, at least formally, on the Syrian as well as the Egyptian front line.

title: Wife's fob Appealed to Him, Now He's a Flight Attendant
description: WASHINGTON  A year ago, while Theresa Williams was flying from coast to coast as a stewardess for United Air Lines, her exMarine husband was teaching in a ghetto school in Miami.

title: Reopening the Ersatz West
description: OLD TUCSON, Ariz., isn't a town, although it used to be, almost Columbia Pictures built it in 1939 as a replica of Tucson during the frontier era and used it as a set in a bigbudget film fittingly called: Arizona, starring William Holden and Jean Arthur Columbia sank $500,000 into Old Tucsor and then, when the picture was finished went off and left it.

title: A terrible reality
description: In a General Audience last Nov. 15, Pope Paul VI delivered an address about evil and the Devil. The following excerpts are from a text that appeared in L'Osservatore Romano, the Vatican newspaper.

title: Judith Richter Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank C. Richter Jr., of the Bronx, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Ann Richter, to Kenneth Robert Bukofser, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Bukofser of Pelham Manor, N. Y.

title: A New World Of Black Music
description: CELLIST, composer, a founder and administrator of the Symphony of the New World, Kermit Moore said the other day that he didn't know exactly when Black History Week takes place, but that his orchestra is going to observe it anyway with two concerts tcday and one next Sunday in Philharmonic Hall. In doing so, the programs will try to encompass as many aspects as possible of black music, with side trips into black literature.

title: CHUCKS DEFEAT MAPLE LEAFS, 21
description: TORONTO, Feb. 3 (UPI) Bobby Lalonde scored his 10th goal of the year at 15 minutes 41 seconds of the final period to lift the Vancouver Canucks to a 21 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight.

title: Qaddafi, Libya's Shy Powerbroker
description: TRIPOLI, LibyaMuammar elQaddafi, a moody, shy and frugal Bedouin who lived in a tent until he entered a military academy as a youth, has placed his stamp on the economy of Libya and influenced the world's multibillion dollar oil industry.

title: MRS. BOGGS WINS RACE IN LOUISIANA
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 3 (AP) Mrs. Lindy Boggs easily won tonight the Democratic nomination for the Congressional seat held by her missing husband, Representative Hale Boggs, for 28 years.

title: A Pig Confesses
description: So vast and wondrous is the variety of human tastes and interests that somewhere, somehow, there will surely be people who genuinely enjoy Artie Kaplan. Those of us who experience a deep involvement with the banal, who find comfort and solace in the familiarity of beloved and timeworn clichs, will surely be attracted by Kaplan's wholehearted, headlong plunge into the superficial.

title: Another Such Peace
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.At his news conference, President Nixon suggested that some of his critics were gagging at his phrase peace with honor. Pointing out that it takes two to heal wounds, he further suggested that his critics seem to be those getting the least pleasure out of the peace agreement.

title: It's Junk in January
description: JANUARY is the month for wallflower movies, for things that couldn't obtain bookings during the usually profitable ChristmasNew Year's week. They often are films that have been hanging around for a while, sometimes for years. It may not be true, but I have the feeling that no film ever really opens in January. It suddenly shows uplike a bill. The following is a consumer's guide to last month's films, some of which may still be playing. These are not all of January's films by any means, but those that I remember for one reason or another, in no special order of importance or pique:

title: Ghana Backs LargeScale Farming
description: ACCRA, Ghana  Samuel Adjei Nkansah, a former electrical engineer, is one of a new type of commercial farmer who is taking a leading role in Ghana's Operation FeedYourself.

title: Balacic, Snowmobile Victor
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., Feb. 3 (AP)Steve Balacic, 18 years old, won $6,000 today by taking the Traverse City 250 snowmobile race. Balacic, driving a Polaris, made 365 laps around the threequarter mile course in an unofficial time of 5 hours 10 minutes.

title: An Amiable Doodle, Written in Cigar Smoke
India Leads in Test Cricket
description: The fifth and final test cricket series between England and India begins Tuesday in Bombay, with India leading, 21. The fourth test ended last week in a draw.

title: CHARLES S. BURDELL, WARCRIMES LAWYER
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 3 (AP)Charles S. Burdell, a deputy prosecutor at the Nuremberg warcrimes trial of Hermann Goering, Rudolf Hess and other Nazi leaders died of a heart ailment Thursday. He was 60 years old.

title: Legislators In Queens Forming A Caucus
description: ALBANYIn an unusual move to create political unity, Queens Democratic and Republican lawmakers have joined together to seek a bipartisan approach to issues vital to the borough.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Cashmere is again becoming a status symbol in the world of fashion. The fiber, which suffered from declining demand in the late nineteensixties, is coming back strong with the opening of exports from China.

title: 2 Vietnamese Daughters Of African President Wed
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic, Feb. 3 (Agence FrancePresse)The two halfVietnamese daughters of President Jean Mel Bokassa, both called Martine and both 18 years old, have married Central African husbands.

title: JURORS RETURNING IN ELLSBERG CASE
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 3The jury in the Pentagon papers trial returns to work on Monday after having a week off while a legal battle was under way that many lawyers predict will come to be considered one of the most unusual courtroom fights ever in America.

title: Mali Moves to Step Up Agricultural Production
description: PARIS  Mali is pushing ahead with internationally aided projects to improve agricultural production in line with her military leaders' program to strengthen Mali's economy and financial status.

title: African Oil: More Hope Than Fact
description: ALTHOUGH both oil men and politicians in the West would welcome alternatives to Middle Eastern oil, a major African role as an oil supplier continues to be more promise than fact.

title: Timber Cutting Halted
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Feb. 3 (AP) A Superior Court judge issued a temporary restraining order against the Great, Northern Paper Company and the Baxter Park Authority this week to halt timber cutting in a remote northwestern section of Baxter Park. The order was sought by Attorney General Jon A. Lund.

title: EMERSON, LAVER REACH NET FINAL
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 3 (UPI)Roy Emerson defeated Dick Stockton and top seeded Rod Laver downed John Alexander today and advanced to the final of the eight annual Fidelity World Championship Tennis tournament.

title: Dr. Isadore S. Edelstein, Ophthalmologist, 70, Dies
description: SYRACUSE, Fab. 3Dr. Isadore S. Edelstein, an ophthalmologist who had practiced in Brooklyn Heights until his retirement a year and a half ago, died today in St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets for the following events may be Obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: LEWIS STEIGER
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Feb. 3  Lewis Steiger, who had operated Lewis Steiger & Co., a men's clothing manufacturer in New York, died today in a nursing home. He was 78 years old.

title: Art
description: THE Whitney Museum's current biennial of American art arrived in three weekly stages and will depart likewise beginning March 4, but until then, in its complete form, it occupies the entire museum. It is not nearly as good a show as it should be and not quite as bad as it might have been, not so much a selection as a grabbag. The installation, promising on the second floor, loses its bearings on the third. On the fourth it is not an installation but a compromise enforced by the inexcusable dimensions of paintings that seem to have been conceived at the scale of a print and blown up to billboard size.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Hartford policeman and two men he sought to question were admitted to Hartford Hospital yesterday morning after a fracas and a wild chase through three towns. Patrolman Neil Hunt of Colebrook stopped the men at 5:30. A.M. on a Hartford street where, with two unidentified women and an unidentified man, they were said to be driving erratically and creating a disturbance.

title: Indonesia to Reduce Navy
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Feb. (AP)Limited funds will force Indonesia to reduce her navy to 30,000 mentwothirds of present strength  by 1980, Adm. Sudormo, the navy chief of staff, has announced.

title: Royals Sign Aussie Hurler
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 3 (AP)Barry Stace, a 21yearold lefthanded pitcher from Sydney, Australia, has been signed by the Kansas City Royals and will be assigned to the team's farm system, the club announced today. Stace is scheduled to report to the Royals' minor league complex at Sarasota, Fla., next month.

title: Bayern Munich Adds to Lead
description: BONN, Feb. 3 (UPI)Bayern Munich whipped Eintracht Braunschweig, 3.0, in soccer today and stretched its lead in the West. German First Division to 3 points.

title: Television
description: GETTING the nod as a midseason replacement has to be rather like arriving at a party after the ice has melted and the onion dip is full of brokenoff potato chips. It's a bleak scene; because all the steady viewers have long since found their steadies, and the secret of how to break into Established Viewing Habits is known only to God and Norman Lear. What can a new show do but stick around, look pleasant and hope someone notices the stranger in the room?

title: Yale Outwrestles Columbia
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 3 Yale's wrestling team defeated Columbia, 2911, in an Ivy League match today. The Elis raised their league wonlost mark to 31. Columbia is 32.

title: Pop
description: WHEN anyone mentions West Indian music, steel bands and calypso instantly echo in the mind, but Jamaica's most popular music is reggae (rhymes with old) which has a rhythm as pronounced as a Jamaican accent. If you heard Paul Simon's Mother and Child Reunion which he recorded in Kingston's chief studio, Dynamic Sounds, two years ago, you were hearing reggae by the first white American musician to plunge into Jamaica's number one beat. More recently radio stations have been throbbing with Johnny Nash's huge hit I Can Sea Clearly Now. That Nash single and album of the same name (Epic KE 31607) plus two brand new releases by Jamaicans  The Wailers Catch a Fire (Island SW 9329) and Jimmy Cliff The Harder They Come (Mango MAN 1)just could make reggae as vital a trend as hard rock or folk rock.

title: Calendar, of Horse Show Events
description: TodayCoach. House Stables,. Kenilworth Road, Rye, N. Y. Regular, green and children's working hunters; equitation 8:30 A.M.

title: A Nostalgia For the Fifties?
description: THE new Whitney Biennial is a very large and Interesting exhibition. If it is not also a very exciting exnibitionand it isn'tI do not count that as an unendurable loss. It may even be a gain. The price of excitement in art comes high nowadays, and apparently fewer and fewer artists are willing to pay it. Much of what passed for esthetic excitement in recent art was, in any case, a false excitementexcitement without substance or achievement, excitement as a substitute for achievement. The sixties proved to be the watershed of that particular phenomenon, and its spokesmen now inspire as little confidence as their counterparts in the political movements of the period. Indeed, there is a parallel to be traced in the vogue of Pop art, which dominated the scene just a decade ago, and the concurrent excitements of the Kennedy Administration. Both in for drastic revaluation.

title: A Ship Lover Stows Relics
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I.The modest house on the quiet street here is by no means a graveyard of ships, although it is stocked with nameboards, bits of ship railing, slivers of engines, old banners and other last relics of such ships as the Morro Castle, the Olympic and, overshadowing them all, the Leviathan.

title: Eastern Hockey League
description: FRIDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: KISSINGER TO VISIT PEKING FOR 5 DAYS AFTER HANOI TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 Henry A. Kissinger will travel to Peking for five days of concrete consultations with Chinese leaders after his trip to Hanoi next week, the White House announced today.

title: Miss Warner, R. W. Parsons Plan to Marry
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Feb. 3  Mr. and Mrs. Rawleigh Warner Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Suzanne de Clairmont Warner, to Robert White Parsons, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harris B. Parsons of Barrington, R.I., and Fishers Island, N.Y.

title: BOMB SCARE DIVERTS AIRLINER TO OMAHA
description: OMAHA, Feb. 3 (Reuters) A United Air Lines pilot landed his Boeing 747 with 99 passengers and a crew of 14 here tonight despite a threat that the plane carried a bomb set to explode when the plane descended below 3,500 feet.

title: Booming Botswana Widens Economy
description: GABORONE, Botswana Long one of Africa's poorest nations, Botswana, is looking forward to a change of fortune as a result of diamond, copper and nickel mining.

title: Police
description: I don't walk up to cars like used to, admitted a patrolman from lower Manhattan's Sixth Precinct: I might get a civilian complaint, but at least I won't get my head blown off.

title: Linda Goheen Affianced
description: ALLIANCE, Ohio, Feb. 3The engagement of Miss Linda Goheen, to Elliot Drisko Jr., has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Arthur J. Goheen. Mr. Drisko is a son of Dr. Drisko, executive director of the Family Service Society of Yonkers, and Mrs. Drisko of Yonkers.

title: Gardens
description: THE most popular salad green is lettuce. In the Northeast, it can be picked for six or seven months, often more. But it lakes planning and the right variety.

title: The Neglected Problems
description: WASHINGTONThe big nations now have a chance to concentrate on the big problems in the worldthe control of military arms, population, trade, pollution and moneyand there are some encouraging signs that they are beginning to do just that. Prime Minister Heath of Britain has been here talking with President Nixon about the reorganization of the world monetary system, the changing economic relationships between the expanded European Community and the U. S. and Japan, the continuing ArabIsraeli crisis in the Middle East and the forthcoming conferences with the Soviet Union on the balanced control of weapons and forces in Europe.

title: Britain Names Chief of Staff To Be Defense Commander
description: LONDON, Feb. 3 (Reuters)Gen. Sir Michael Carver, Chief of the British General Staff, will become the new Chief of the Defense Staff next October with the rank of field marshal, the Defense Ministry has announced.

title: World's Great Men of Color
description: Alexander Dumas pare once remarked, When I discovered that I was black I determined to so act that men should see beneath my skin. The late anthropologist and historian Joel A. Rogers set out not so much to probe beneath men's skin, but to uncover the touch of Africanity hidden in every genealogical woodpile. One result of his research was World's Great Men of Color (published by the author in 1947), which is a classic of its genre. For over half a century, in nearly every continent, he remained in relentless pursuit of the Negro and the Negroid  that perennial pigment of the white man's imagination and creation of his own convenience. As to who is a Negro in the United States, said Rogers, only those who are able to throw all logic, all reasoning to the winds, can ever hope to be authorities on that matter. One such authority was the Bureau of the Census, which in its famous dictum declared that a Negro was someone with one blood.

title: Dance
description: FOR the past three weeks we have had the New York City Ballet and American Ballet Theater in town together. There is something unusual about this. For, as I pointed out last week, New York is unique in being the city in which two of the great major world companies coexist, to say nothing of the smallerscaled but extremely important City Center Joffrey Ballet and New York's various modemdance troupes.

title: the traveler's world
description: WASHINGTON, D.C.It happens so frequently that we ought not to be surprised when the Federal Government stumbles over its big, clumsy feet and makes a tangled mess of an otherwise relatively simple situation. Even by Government standards however, the current crisis over customs preclearance of nearly three million airline passengers bound for the United States from Canada, Bermuda and the Bahamas before they take off rather than when they land is both surprising and perversely amusing. The contretemps has the surface appearance of being legally and technically insoluble, being full of contradictions, with Federal officials demanding new powers that they must know they cannot possibly obtain.

title: Skepticism Pervades a California Suburb After Decade of Conflict in Vietnam
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 3A decade of conflict in Vietnam has left a mark in this suburban community, as it has across America. Many people think and feel differently from what they ?? did. They ask questions, they reject assumptions, they doubt what they are told.

title: Turkey Mass Trials For Rebels
description: Since the days of Kemal Ataturk, the founder of the modern Turkish nation, the Turkish Army has seen itself as the guardian of national stability. In March 1971, feeling that the elected Government was unable to deal with the country's economic and political problems, the generals took over effective rule of the country. One major factor that influenced their decision was the growth of radical leftist forces which, the generals claimed, aimed at destroying law and order through terrorist activities and setting up a Communist regime.

title: Old China Hands
description: WASHINGTON  Dinner we had as guests of . . . Chou Enlai at the Reception House. . . . Chou was host at our table. . . . The dinner waxed merry with toasts. . . . After pears and grapes . . . the party broke up part to go to the movies . . . Jack, J.K.E. and I to confer with Chou and Mao Tsetung.

description: The signs of the season are unmistakable.

title: Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained from more than 125 bookstores in 64 communities of the United States. The figures in the righthand column do not necessarily represent consecutive appearances.

title: New Albany Faces Face Lobbyists
description: ALBANY, Feb. 3Their new desks strewn with invitations, calling cards, gift calendars, diaries, race  track passes and honorary membership cards to various organizations, the new State Senators and Assemblymen are experiencing their first brush with the capital's ubiquitous lobbyists.

title: Dr. Sandra Kammerman Engaged
description: CENTRAL VALLEY, N.Y., Feb. 3The engagement of Dr. Sandra Kammerman to Sy Hyman has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Irving Kammerman. Mr. Hyman is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Morris Hyman.

title: VETERANS PENSIONS ADJUSTED THIS YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (UPI) The Government has sent millions of veterans pension checks that were reduced to adjust for Social Security increases that they got last year.

title: Cardinals
description: Membership in the Sacred College of Cardinals is a position of considerable poiver as well as honor in the Roman Catholic Church. The cardinals act as the principal advisers to the Pope in the government of the church, and they govern collectively as an interim administration after a Pope dies, and elect a new Pontiff. Throughout the history of the church, the creation of cardinals has been an exclusive prerogative of the Pope; he may confer or withhold the designation at his pleasure.

title: Gabon Broadens Basis of Exports
description: LIBREVILLE, GabonThis West African republic is making steady progress, and will start a major project this year that should enable it to tap fresh sources of wealth.

title: GERIATRICS AIDES OFFERED TRAINING
description: The Frederic D. Zeman Center for Instruction, which has one of the largest geriatrics training programs in the country, is preparing for its spring semester, with a record enrollment of more than 200 people.

title: Somalia on Long Road Toward Industrialization
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia The military Government of Somalia, in power since 1969, is taking its first step toward industrialization under a policy of scientific socialism.

title: ADELPHI IS VICTOR IN 3 RELAY RACES
description: Dennis Walker, Adelphi University's outstanding quarter miler, switched to the halfmile at Queens College's Fitzgerald Memorial Gymnasium yesterday and led the Panthers to an easy victory in the distance medley in the 17th annual Collegiate Track Conference relay carnival:

title: PENN FIVE ROUTS BROWN BY 8860
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 3 (AP) Penn held Brown without a field goal in the final 7 minutes 39 seconds of the first half tonight and coasted to an 8860 victory in an ivy League bas ketball game at the Palestra.

title: Policeman Termed a Suicide
description: A 28yearold city policeman, John Walters, who was found dead yesterday in a Times Square hotel room, apparently committed suicide with his service revolver, the police reported. He was found at the Strand Hotel, 206 West 43d Street, where he had registered Friday under the name of Jack Peterson. He is survived by his widow and three children.

title: Dance. Bolender Duet
description: Last summer's Stravinsky Festival included, among all the major works, a few jokes and jeux d'esprit. Among these was Todd Bolender's little duet PianoRagMusic, which made its first appearance in New York City Ballet's regular repertory yesterday afternoon at the New York State Theater.

description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Labor Unit Says Lawyers Seek to Bar NoFault Law
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations urged its branches around the nation today to work to defeat what it said is an attempt by the American Trial Lawyers Association to undercut efforts in Congress for a national nofault auto insurance law.

description: For the second night in a row, the Knicks played a strong first half, then went into a swoon. But the New Yorkers were lucky enough to hang on for a 9590 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers last night before another capacity crowd of 19,694 at Madison Square Garden.

title: American Motors Recalls Late Autos For a Brake Check
description: DETROIT, Feb. 3The American Motors Corporation confirmed today that it was recalling 270,815 of its 1972 and 1973 model cars because the brakes could suddenly fail on some of them.

title: Link Between Dead Detective And All Missing Drugs Denied
description: Sources close to the investigation of the 398, pounds Alf narcotics missing from the Police Department property clerk's office denied yesterday that the entire amount had been signed out in the name of Detective Joseph N. Nunziata.

title: Snow Farmers Make Hay on the Ski Slopes
description: BRIDGEVILLE, N.Y., Feb. 3  In this modern era, it should come as no surprise that ski area operators have learned how to cope with uncooperative weather.

title: C. J. Parsons to Wed Christina Johnson
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Feb. 3 Mr. and Mrs. Evan A. Johnson have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Christina Anne Johnson, to Charles J. Parsons of New York, son of Mrs. Amrine M. Parsons of Hiltons, Va., and the late Mrs. Parsons.

title: Music Mailbag
Elane Reicher Affianced
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Feb. 3Miss Elane Robin Reicher and Lee Michael Friedel plan to be married Aug. 26. Announcement of their engagement has been made by Miss Reicher's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Irwin. Reicher, to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ronald Friedel of North Miami Beach, Fla. His father is a vice president of the Miami Beach investment firm of Thomson and McKinnon, Auchinloss. Mr. Reicher is a member of the New York law firm of Dreyer & Traub. Miss Reicher and her fianc are juniors at Emory University.

title: Deep Throat Replaces Matinee for Children
description: Deep Throat, the controversial sex film whose fate currently awaits a pending Criminal Court ruling, replaced the Saturday children's matinee at the TransLux Theater, 85th Street and Madison Avenue, yesterday bringing out four angered adults and eight children who urged passersby to sign a petition calling for the film's removal.

title: Old Barn Raising With a New Twist
description: HUNTINGTON, L I.Barnraising in Colonial days used to be freedone by neighbors in one day of work and partying. Today it costs more than $17,000 and that is not the only difference.

title: Smaller Soldiers for Japan
description: TOKYO, Feb. 3 (Reuters)The Japanese Defense Agency has reduced the minimum weight requirement for recruits for the Women's Army Corps from 103 to 94 pounds.

title: Mrs. Frances B. Anderson, Former Editor, Dies at 51
description: Mrs. Frances Brooke Anderson, a former assistant editor of the Engineering and Mining Journal, a McGrawHill publication, and later a managing editor with the Haire Publishing Company, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. She was 51 years old and lived at 124 East 84th Street.

description: The belief that a large family is the ideal is declining, according to the Gallup poll.

description: WASHINGTONIcehard statements made during election campaigns have a way of melting in the glow of victory. But President Nixon made it clear last week that there would be no melting of his statements on the issue of amnesty for men who refused to serve during the Vietnam war.

description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 3 (UPI)One sailor has been acquitted and another convicted on charges arising from the Oct. 1213 racial disturbance aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk. Both men are black.

title: For Some Deserters Canada Is Home; Other Exiles Hope to Return to U.S.
description: TORONTO, Jan. 30  Alan Kazmer, a 31yearold advertising copywriter with the McCannErickson agency here, stared into a glass of beer as he pondered the news from the United States.

title: Yes
description: IT would be a Pyrrhic gesture to summarily put down Anton Chekhov because he comes from a distant time and place and a race different from mine. This 19thcentury Russian playwright's masterpiece, The Cherry Orchard, is being offered in an intriguing production of a nearBlack cast at that totally American institution, the Public Theater. Upon hearing of the production concept before attending a performance, I thought the idea abominable, but the man's work has survived revolutions, wars and evolution, so one must remember that Chekhov was read and studied even before one matured enough to read and study himself.

title: Harvard Six Wins, 101
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 3Harvard's center, Randy Roth, scored four goals and assisted on three others to lead the Crimson hockey team to a 101 victory over St. Nicholas of New York tonight.

title: LATE SHOT BEATS FORDHAM, 7574
description: NEWTON, Mass., Feb. 3Boston College rebounded from a 15point secondhalf deficit today to defeat Fordham, 7574, today on a shot by Tom Amstett with 47 seconds remaining in the game.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 (AP) Lieut. (J.G.) David Eisenhower, President Nixon's soninlaw, is on emergency leave from assignment in the Mediterranean, the White House said today. He was granted the leave to be with his family after the death of his maternal grandmother, Mrs. Percy Thompson, in Gainesville, Fla.

description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 3 (AP) The Rev. Dr. Paul P. Fryhling, vice president of the Evangelical Covenant Church of America, died today after suffering a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast It's called PACProgramme d'Action Commerciale  a Government  sponsored chain of retail stores that will eventually be owned and opperated by Ivorians.

title: City Has Agreed to $22Million Loan to Refurbish Housing in South Bronx
description: The City Housing and Development Administration has given a $22million commitment to a builder to rehabilitate 1,000 apartments in the rundown South Bronx, the largest project yet for the oftencontroversial Municipal Loan Program.

title: Vindication on China
description: It was a poignant occasion when several hundred officers of the United States Foreign Service gave a luncheon at the State Department last week in honor of a small band of their former colleagues who had been persecuted for being right. Here, in effect, was the last step in the vindication of the old China hands, whose careers had been ruined or tarnished because they correctly predicted the victory of the Chinese Communists over the ineffective Kuomintang Government of Chiang Kaishek.

title: Ellen Gerry Is Remarried
description: Mrs. Ellen Bowen Gerry and Dr. Charles Augustus Bauer were married here yesterday afternoon in the Brick Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. James Seth Stewart.

title: Marcy Bait Fiancee
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 3  Mr. and Mrs. Harold Bowen Barg have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marcy Judith Barg, to Lewis Andrew Lefko, son of Mrs. Harold Lefko, of Sioux City, Iowa and the late Mr. Lefko. Miss Barg and her fianc are students at Northwestern University.
