Prague apparently holding out as bait the conclusion of a consular convention, of a cultural and scientific exchange agreement, and of a final settlement of all the financial claims arising from postWorld War II nationalization.

title: Viscount Weir to Wed Mrs. Dorothy D. Hutton
description: Mrs. Dorothy Dear Hutton, widow of Edward F. Hutton, the financier, and Viscount Weir of Kilwinning, Ayrshire, Scotland, and London, plan to be married this spring. The wedding is tentatively planned for Scotland.

title: ... The Tax Battle
description: President Nixon has sought to convince Congress and the nation that the only alternative to acceptance of his drastic cutback on domestic programs is higher taxes. That definition distorts through oversimplification the range of fiscal choices open to the country.

title: A Woman Named Solitude
description: Reading is believing. This book must be read to be believed. Surely it shouldn't be possible to tell the tortures of slavery in the manner of a fairy tale and still convey the extent of the atrocity. Or if that torture of human flesh and spirit can be so conveyed, then surely it can't be possible to distill esthetic pleasure from this bestiality, page by page, and an awesome serenity from revulsion itself. Once upon a time, Andre SchwarzBart begins, on a strange planet, there was a little black girl named Bayangumay.

title: PUZSZLES
description: PLAYING GAMESBy John C. Lapin

title: At BONN ECOLOGIST QUITS IN PROTEST
description: BONN, Feb. 10False Veronica, the head rush and stiff Meirich have gone, as have the fish otter and the tree frog, and now the man who was supposed to protect them, Dr. Bernard Grzimek, has gone, too.

title: Author Produces His Own Library
description: EAST BRUNSWICKEvery morning, Michael Avallone leaves his house on Hilltop Road and walks two blocks to Ryders Pizza and Sub Shop.

title: BUCK MAYORS ASK FOR NIXON PARLEY
description: FAYETTE, Miss., Feb. 10Twentyfive black Southern Mayors, meeting for the first time as a group, called today for a White House audience with President Nixon to discuss the impact of Administration budget cuts that sharply curtail antipoverty spending.

title: 76ers Lose Record 18th in Row Amidst. Comedy of Misfortunes
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 10 (AP)  The Philadelphia 76ers should hive stayed in  bed yesterday, but they didn't and they're sorry.

title: Movies
description: ONCE again film buffs and philosophers can view a marriage of movies and metaphysics: the new Ingmar Bergman film has arrived.

title: JOHN M. COLGAN SR.
description: NYACK, N. Y., Feb. 10 John M. Colgan Sr., an architect, died today in Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 65 years old and lived on North Broadway, in Upper Nyack.

title: ROYAL OWL FIRST IN $127,800 STRUB
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 10 (UPI)Royal Owl, the West's outstanding juvenile two years ago, caught a track to his liking today and raced to a 3length victory in the $127,800 Charles H. Strub Stakes for 4yearolds at Santa Anita.

title: Travel Notes: An Ad That Came All Too True
description: SINCE Jan. 23, when the Helgafell volcano on the Icelandic island of Heimaey erupted, there has been an increase in the number of visitors from the United States stopping off in Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland.

title: Influenza
description: Trying to produce vaccines against influenza presents the kind of problem the Red Queen posed to Alice. Scientists, much as Alice, have to keep running to stay in the same place.

title: VIETCONG CHARGE ABUSE IN SAIGON
description: PARIS, Feb. 10The Vietcong charged today that the Communist military delegates who are in Saigon to help oversee the ceasefire were being treated shamefully.

title: King Hassan Is Keeping His Potential Opponents in Morocco on Defensive With Strong Dose of Fear
description: RABAT, Morocco, Feb. 8A strong dose of fear is helping to keep Morocco, a land of sudden and unpredictable political eruptions, relatively quiet.

title: U.S. Announces Names of 142 Prisoners to Be Freed Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) The Pentagon announced today the names of the American military prisoners of war who are in the first group, scheduled to be released Sunday night, Eastern standard time, from Communist camps in North and South Vietnam.

title: Dry Victories
description: I could dig knowing Kenny and Jerome. They're a couple of black teenagers having a rap about a show they want to put on at the Center. It's called Dry Victories, and that means, as Jerome explains, nothinglikevictory be taking place, ever, during Reconstruction days or in them other days, the days of Civil Rights.

title: StudentLoan Plan Gets an Overhaul
description: TRENTONA studentloan program that allowed 45,000 New Jenseyans to get a college education last year is being given a complete overhaul, and some educators feel that middleclass students will face difficulties because of it.

title: Davis, A Saddle Seat Trainer, Is Winner of Devereux Award
Melissa J. Witty Is Bride of D. C. Verdier
description: NORTH TARRYTOWN, N.Y., Feb. 10Miss Melissa Jane Witty of Mount Kisco, and Daniel C. Verdier of Crotonon Hudson, were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Marshall Smith in the Union Church of Pocantico Hills.

title: Doctors
description: You wake up one morning with high fever. You telephone your physician and get the following recorded message: Dr. Jones regrets to inform you he will not be availablehe has gone out on strike.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 11, 1973

title: SAID TO SEEK. TAIWAN JET PACT
Penn Trackmen Triumph Over Princeton, Columbia
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 10By capturing nine of 14 events, Penn's track and field team amassed 85 points today and defeated Princeton and Columbia in the 35th annual Polar Bear meet in Jadwin Gymnasium. Princeton scored 52 points and Columbia 10.

title: Historic Site Thwarts Plan for Renewal
description: MONTCLAIR  The listing of the ErieLackawanna Railroad Station as a historic site not only by New Jersey, but also by the National Register of Historic Placeshas thrown town planners here into a quandary.

title: Conductor Awaits Bow at Carnegie
description: BERNARDSVILLE  A diminutive, whitehaired woman will conduct a concert version of Monteverdi's opera, L'Orfeo, at Carnegie Hall next Saturday afternoon. What makes this annual presentation even more unusual is that the conducttor, Miss Charlotte Bergen, not only is, underwriting the cost of the entire proceeding, which begins at 2:30 o'clock, but also that the price od all seats, except those in the loges, is free.

title: Who Ordered Watergate?
description: WASHINGTONThere were more revelations in the Watergate case last week, at least four of them ... more investigations promised, at least two of them ... and still no sign of answers to the questions left begging since last June 17, when Washington police caught five members of a Republican intelligence team hard at work inside Democratic National Headquarters.

title: Making of Jets on Taiwan Reported Sought by U.S
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The Nixon Administration is reportedly preparing to withdraw 5,000 to 6,000 troops from Taiwan but, at the same time, is moving to enable the Nationalist Chinese Government there to become selfsufficient in modern jet fighters.

title: Ugh!
description: Biology may not be destiny, as some women allege, but it certainly causes a lot of trouble. As a nation, we are obsessed with the need to control our bodies. The glut of popular books on diet, exercise and food is mournful proof of this.

title: Winterthing
description: Being an unabashed admirer of Joan Aiken, I approached this play cautiously, wondering if her Gothic talents could adapt themselves to the dramatic medium: a form (it has always seemed to me) in which you are either good or awful. Miss Aiken, it turns out, is not only a good playwright but a classical one. She constructs her work as though it were a mosaic and lets each glittering fragment merge into the whole.

title: Alysia Gets Top Honors For Breed
description: Exactly two years ago ch. Museland's Alysia was named best smooth dachshund and best of opposite sex to the best of breed at the Knickerbocker Dachshund Club'sfirst specialty here.

title: REINSTATEMENT WON BY TEACHER
description: Officials of Community School District 16 in Brooklyn have decided to reinstate junior high school teacher who gave an interview to a newsman on school premises without obtaining permission from the district.

title: If Winter Comes
description: Distrust of a mild winter is ingrained in the countryman, a part of his rural inheritance. It isn't that he really enjoys cold weather and deep snow any more than his urban cousin. His feet get cold too and he gets tired of shoveling snow and plowing it out of his lane and barnyard. For his own comfort he would welcome April the year around. But he knows that what happens in January and February inevitably affects what will happen in June and July.

title: Why Did CIA Train Police?
description: More than 25 years ago, fearful of the designs of the Soviet Union, Congress authorized the creation of the Central Intelligence Agency. But Congress was also concerned about the designs of the agency, itself, and the National Security Act of 1947 specifically provided that the C.I.A. shall have no police, subpoena, law enforcement or internal security functions.

title: Girl, 3, Dies at L.I. Home
description: LEVTITOWN, L.I., Feb. 10A 3yearold girl died at her home last night from what the police believe they have been an overdose of sleeping pills Mrs. Barbara Furino of 235 Elm Lane, the child's mother, works as a night clerk in a supermarket. She told the police that when she woke at 2 P.M. her 4yearold son said his sister, Deborah, had taken the pills.

title: Luncheon to Give Insights
description: More than 200 persons are expected to attend the Dog Fanciers Club luncheon Wednesday at the McAlpin Hotel. Mrs. Augustus Riggs 4th, who will have named the Westminster best in show Tuesday night, is listed to speak. Three of the group judges will tell why they made their decisions.

title: Test for Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Congress began moving forcefully last week to grapple with the central issue in its bitter struggle with President Nixon over national spending priorities. At stake was the United States Constitution.

title: New Jersey
description: Not for the first time, the Garden State last week was abloom with a rare collection of exotic political plants, including some weeds and a potentially hot potato:

title: John Charles Brickley Is Fiance of Katherine Ann Tillinghast
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Feb. 10Mr. and Mrs. John A. Tillinghast have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Katherine Ann Tillinghast, to John Charles Brickley, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Taylor Brickley of Pocantico Hills.

title: Swiss Civil Servants Cool To Plea for Bonus Freeze
description: GENEVA, Feb. 10Just 10 per cent of Switzerland's 130,000 civil servants have answered a Government appeal that they set an example for their countrymen in the fight against inflation.

title: ArmySeton Hall Game Off
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 10 (UPI)  The ArmySeton Hall basketball game scheduled for tonight at the Army Fieldhouse was postponed because of a power failure at the facility.

title: Next Horse You Ride in the Park May Be From Racing's 5 and 10
description: TIMONIUM, Md.I've got three . . . four hundred . . five hundred, the auctioneer chanted without enthusiasm. Will'ya go six, will'ya go six?

title: Gain in Enrollments By Private Schools Reverses a Trend
description: The country's private schools have started to regain some of the student enrollment that declined over the last three years, according to a recent survey, but barely half of them are managing to operate without a deficit each year.

title: Bucks Reel Off 72 Points in First Half to Inflict 135108 Loss on Warriors
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 10 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks scored 72 points in the first half, 22 by Bob Dandridge, and rolled to a 135108 National Basketball Association victory over the Golden State Warriors today.

title: State Police Run Up A Bill for Narcotics
description: WEST TRENTON  The New Jersey State Police spent $100,000 in 1972 to buy narcotics on the street. In the same 12month period, they made 5,730 drugrelated arrests.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: Cheers for Katharine Fessenden's Guest Word article, Pouring Over Grammar!

title: 43 Workers Buried in Huge Gas Tank In Explosion and Fire on Staten Island
description: At least 43 workmen were buried under tons of concrete and flaming debris yesterday afternoon on the western edge of Staten Island in an explosion that ripped through the world's largest liquefiedgas storage tank.

title: Mayoralty
description: From Rosedale to Riverdale, eight Democratic mayoral candidates  at last count were campaigning as if there were no incumbent at City Hall.

title: Hussein
description: WASHINGTON  This is sort of Mideast month, said President Nixon last Tuesday to King Hussein of Jordan, who was seated stiffly in a lemonyellow chair in the White House Oval Office. You today, Mrs. Meir in March. The 37yearold monarch smiled with regal tolerance at such Presidential chitchat, which placed him in the company of his principal adversary, Israeli Premier Golda Meir.

title: The Exile of James Joyce
description: Born in Oran, Algeria, in 1937, Helene Cixous is professor of English at the new French University of Vincennes and has managed to pick up a major literary prize for her novel, Dedans (1969), while holding the editorship of Poetique and winning her doctorate through submission, I assume, of the French version of this astonishing, eloquent, dauntingly intelligent and philosophically learned work on Joyce to the University of Paris. And, as if to certify doubly that we are in a period of extraordinary emerging feminine talent in the arts and learned professions, her book has received a superb translation from Sally A. J. Purcell, an Oxford graduate in French and author of a recently published volume of poetry.

title: To Try to Dream Again
description: WALTHAM, Mass.Whatever else all the dreary and demeaning events of the past decade, more especially of the past four years, mean and may come to mean, they surely mean an end to the American dream as it was given to us. That which we inherited we shall not be able to bequeath, and that bespeaks a break in the continuity of our land.

title: At 29, an Opera Impresario
description: EARLY last summer the Houston Grand Opera issued the somewhat startling news that it was presenting 10 free, fully staged performances in an outdoor parklocated theater. The repertory was not exactly standard, either, with four performances of Carlisle Floyd's Susannah, four of Donizetti's The Elixir of Love and two of Dominick Argento's Postcard from Morocco (the Minnesota Opera production). The average attendance per night turned out to be 7,800. So when David Gockley, the company's general director for the past two years, was in town a few weeks it seemed worth while to find out from him what was going on in Houston.

title: Collapse of Penn Central Reflects Ills of Railroads
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 A massive report issued today by the staff of the Senate ComMerce Committee confirms that the Penn Central Railroad, the nation's largest, is in desperate straits.

title: ChienChung Pei And Dawn Tisen Are Married Here
description: Miss Dawn MeiChing Then, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. KiaKwei Tsien of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married here yesterday afternoon to ChienChung Pei, son of IeohMing Pei, the architect, and Mrs. Pei of New York. The Rev. James E. Thomas performed the ceremony in Christ Church United Methodist.

title: Sigh!
description: It's worth almost every cent of the $1.50 one has to pay for Rose in paperback to learn that the Queen Mother of Camelot doesn't care for dogs, that she says her rosary under the hairdryer and that she saves the banana from her airline dinner to eat in her 130 bargain of a room at the back of the Hotel Ritz in Paris. Or that Truman Capote considers Mrs. Joseph P. Kennedy to be somewhat of a social climber and not the sort of person with whom he would want to spend a long ocean voyage. With friends like that you don't need an enemy and it's heartening to find out that the rich and powerful have friends like that, too.

title: Coming Home Election
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.One of the major upsets of last fall's elections took place here in Puerto Rico, when against all expectations and predictions more than a million voters turned Governor Luis Ferr out of office, despite his extraordinarily wellfinanced reelection campaign and despite all the usual advantages of incumbency in a rather paternal society.

title: English Chances Fade Against India in Cricket
description: BOMBAY, Feb. 10 (Reuters) England's last hope of winning the fifth cricket test against India disappeared today when India batted through a tense final two hours without losing a wicket.

title: A Classic Case: The Kickapoo Dam Dispute
description: David Beckwith of Milwaukee, counsel for proponents of the Kickapoo River dam, summarizes their case:

title: Shop Class Builds a House in School
description: NEWARK  A 14footsquare house is being built inside the Montgomery Street School as part of a course called World of Construction?.

title: Sheriff Walcott's New Battle: Lending Little People a Hand
description: CAMDEN  Jersey Joe Walcott, the former heavyweight boxing champion of the world, is engaged in a fight to bring hope and selfrespect to the little people from whose ranks he emerged. His arena is Camden County, where he serves as sheriff and played a major role early this month in quelling a disturbance at the county jail.

title: FARM TAX RETURNS ARE MADE AVAILABLE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) President Nixon issued without publicity last month an Executive order giving the Department of Agriculture authority to examine income tax returns filed by farmers over the last five years.

title: Coalition Will Seek $300Million For Sewer
description: Mayor Lindsay and Thomas J. Cuite, City Council majority leader, announced last week the formation of a coalition that will lobby for Federal funds for a $300million sewageinterceptor system in the Gowanus and Red Hook sections of Brooklyn.

title: They Are Different Men Now
description: LOS ANGELESSome have suffered captivity for only a few months, others for eight years . . some were injured, others escaped without a scratch ... some will slip back easily into their prewar lives, others will never fully recover.

title: Penn Central
description: WASHINGTONLike the agonized thrashing of some huge, mortally wounded animal, the nation's largest railroad struggled out of a crippling strike last weekbut only with the help of Government intervention.

title: Dance
description: LAST week I was comparing American Ballet Theater, which earlier in the year gave a season at the City Center 55th Street Theater, with New York City Ballet, which is still at the New York State Theater, Lincoln Center. The contrast between the two is indeed fascinating.

title: Removing the sentimentalism from the nationalism
description: The strange career of the Irish nationalist movement in its diverse and often conflicting manifestations presents a daunting challenge for the historian. In its constitutionalist phases it employed the electoral machinery of the execrated British, with notable effects under Daniel O'Connell (17751847), the most successful mass popular leader the world had seen up to his day, and Charles Stewart Parnell (184691), the father of, among others things, modern British parliamentary political organization.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: About 10 years ago Prof. Richard Neustadt told the Senate Subcommittee on National Security Staffing and Operations that when it comes to action risking war, technology has modified the Constitution: the President, perforce, becomes the only such man in the system capable of exercising judgment under the extraordinary limits now imposed by secrecy, complexity and time [italics added] This statement by a distinguished political scientist and onetime adviser to President Kennedy followed by a few months the Cuban missile confrontation crisis with Nikita Khrushchev.

title: So Far, So Good
description: The success of the Vietnam ceasefire agreement, Henry Kissinger said, depends not only on its provisions, but also on the spirit in which it is implemented. Now, after two weeks of truce, there is real progress, though more is needed.

title: Agnew Briefs Nixon on His Asian Tour
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Feb. 10Vice President Agnew reported to President Nixon today on his justconcluded trip to Southeast Asia, saying that Asian leaders were interested hi the attitude of South Vietnam's President Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: Juniors Celebrate 40 Years at Westminster
description: Junior showmanship will celebrate its 40th anniversary at Westmintter, as 60 boys and girls from 23 states compete for the national championship and the Leonard Brumby Sr. Memorial Trophy. In 1933, Westminster staged its first event for youngsters, then called children's handling.

title: Salads for All Seasons
description: At this time of year salads are often a pallid routine, dependent on the dressing for all their flavor. The ultimate salad is still months away for Long Island food and garden buffs, but good salads can be made now with careful shopping.

title: Prison Guards Often Feel as Confined as Inmates
description: TRENTONFor the men who are in New Jersey's prisonsthe inmates who must live behind walls 24 hours a day for the duration of their sentences, and the guards who work behind the walls for a third of their days conditions of life and work, and of social attitudes, are a constant source of debate.

title: Fair Lawn Offers New Look at Stars
description: FAIR LAWN  The big dome in Lincoln School is a major attraction not only for this borough's youngsters but also for those in some neighboring communities.

title: Mrs. Rubin Has Child
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Feb. 10A daughter was born Jan. 21 to Dr, and Mrs. Mark M. Rubin at Lenox Hill Hospital in New York. The child has been named. Emily Rene. Mrs. Rubin, the former Miss Gail Tanney, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. O. Morley Tanney of Englewood. Dr. Rubin, a dentist, practices in Rutherford.

title: Lexington Park Wins $31,000 Vertex at Bowie for First Stakes Triumph
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 10Lexington Park, who was claimed for $14,000 at Laurel last Dec. 13, gained his first Stakes triumph today in taking the $31,000 Vertex Handicap at Bowie.

title: gee!
description: Fantasy and Science Fiction, reads the bookstore sign. The purist suppresses a retch. In his judgment it's a confusion of genres tantamount to Alchemy and Chemistry. I met a purist there just the other day, my colleague Frogmarch.

title: Headliners
description: It was a classic case of buckpassing, with emphasis on the buck. The emergency Presidential order had required that the state and local agencies operating the nation's airports postand pay forthe stationing of armed law enforcement officers at airline boarding gates. The agencies insisted that skyjack safeguards were a Federal responsibility, and that the Government should pay the piper. On Monday, just before the order would have taken effect, a Federal judge issued a temporary restraining order, and called a hearing for this Tuesday. The airport operators charge that the White House had bypassed normal Federal Aviation Administration procedures in its emergency actionand had moreover, made an end run around Congress, which is currently considering legislation to continue Federal financial support for airport police.

title: Architecture
description: WE are late with this yearly assessment, courtesy of flu, but the questions facing architects and society in 1973 are going to be around for a whilelonger than some of their buildings. These are years of loudly publicized doubts and confusion in the profession, which is faced with a world it has only made in part, and often made badly, and problems and changes never visualized by the gentlemen of the Beaux Arts.

title: Obituary of a River and the Life It Shared
description: THIS is an obituary of a river, an obituary written before the condemned becomes a memory. It's also an invitation to anyone who reads it to spend a few hours or a day in the valley of the Kickapoo to see and feel the life, the vitality that is being snuffed out. Other wild, freerunning streams have died, the victims of progress, that frequent misnomer for greed, but the Kickapoo is something special. Meandering through the rockstrewn hills of southwestern Wisconsin, if has cut its way into the pages of history and down into a substrata older than man. And a quiet, gentle way of life that has flourished along its banks for more than a hundred years is also vanishing.

title: Avalanche Kills 15 in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, Feb. 10 (Reuters) At least 15 people died when an avalanche swept away most of the small town of Casabamba in the Andes 250 miles southeast of here, according to reports reaching,Lima today. The tragedy occurred last Tuesday night, but bad communications prevented the news reaching other populated areas until late last night. About 4,100 people were reported left omeless.

title: Republicans Gather To Fete Their Own At Lincoln Dinner
description: The New York County Republican Committee held its annual dinner last night to honor two prominent Republicans Abraham Lincoln and Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Ellis to Box Harris April 14
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Feb. 10 (AP)  Jimmy Ellis, former World Boxing Association champion, will meet Tiger Joe Harris of Cincinnati in a 10round heavyweight bout here April 14.

title: Stennis Better but Remains In Very Serious Condition
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (UPI) Doctors continued to list Senator John C. Stennis, Democrat of Mississippi, as in very serious condition today despite a slow, steady improvement following a second operation for bullet wounds suffered in a holdup Jan. 30.

title: MILBURN LOWERS HIS HURDLE MARK
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 10Rod Milburn of Southern University, even after a slow start, broke his world indoor record for the 120yard high hurdles tonight at the fifth United States Track and Field Federation national indoor championships.

title: FASHION TALK
description: James Galanos came, out of the West last week with one of those American wepders: readytowear clothes that can compare favorably with the best of Paris couture styles. They're clothes for women whose second car is a Continental, for women who care how the inside of a dress is made as much as how it looks. (Translation: a day dress costs $700 or $800, a suit, well, that goes into four figures.)

title: Vivaldi and I Musici a Splendid Team
description: I Musici and Vivaldi are probably as happily paired an ensemble and composer as can be found today. It is a notion that seems to be widely held, because Carnegie Hall was filled on Friday night for the Italian group's Vivaldi concert, and the audience expressed approval of what it heard in no uncertain terms.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: SMITH TOPS MAUD; LUTZ DOWNS PILIC
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 10Stan Smith and Bob Lutz, close friends and doubles partners who have not met in a singles match in almost two years. will play for the $10,000 top prize tomorrow in the United States professional indoor tennis championships.

title: Peace Corps Found In Survey to Lack Skilled Volunteers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10A report by the House Foreign Affairs Committee indicated today that the Peace Corps lacked qualified volunteers.

title: DeliusA HoHum Cult Figure?
description: FREDERICK DELIUS is a strange case. Of course, like so many composers who cultivated a circumscribed, specialized style to perfection, he has his passionate partisans. But Delius has never been able to inspire that one basic ingredient necessary to foster a really controversial cult figure: an equal amount of violent dislike, No one really hates Delius  those who find his misty, latesummer afternoon chromaticism and nostalgiadrenched, bittersweet romanticism unpalatable simply shrug their shoulders and walk away. Critic Bernard Jacobson once summed up the antiDelian attitude pretty accurately: It is like talking for hours on end to a beautiful woman who never disagrees with a word you say.

title: Miss Lesley Murphy Fiancee of James Lee
description: EAST HILLS, L. I., Feb. 10 Miss Lesley Louise Murphy, a senior at RandolphMacon Women's College, plans to be married in July to James Jay Lee, a graduate of the University of Virginia. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. William G. Murphy, parents of the bridetobe. Mr. Lee is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William O'Donnell Lee of Moberly, Mo.

title: ST. JOHN'S BEATS FORDHAM, 7873
description: Emotion took over at times yesterday as St. John's scored 6 points in the final 52 secfonds for a 7873 basketball victory over Fordham at Madison Square Garden. It was the 14th straight for the nationally ranked and tournamentbound Redmen and their 17th in 19 games.

title: Caso's State of the County Message Assailed by Democrats Fiscal Aide
description: MINEOLA, L.I.  ?? Z. Kramer, vice chairman of the Natsau County Board of Accessors and fiscal adviser to Marvin Cristenfeld, the county Democratic chairman, charged last week that County Executive Ralph G. Caso's state of the county message was political Itokum, with the sole purpose, of initiating his campaign for reelection this November.

title: Martha Simon Bride Of Thomas G. Durst
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Feb. 10Miss Martha Jill Simon was married here this evening to Thomas Gregory Durst by Rabbi Maurice Davis at the home of her parents, Dr. and Mrs. Norman Simon. Mr. Durst is a son of Seymour Durst of New York and the late Mrs. Durst.

title: U.S. COURTS NEAR BUSING DECISION
description: DETROIT, Feb. 10Step by step, the Federal courts are moving toward a decision, probably this year, on whether black city children must ride buses to the suburbs, and white suburban children must ride them to the inner city, to achieve racial balance in the schools.

title: Slaying of 2 White Policemen Causes Friction in Milwaukee
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 10Since the slaying of two white policemen 10 days ago, this city has grown increasingly tense, with charges of unwarranted police attacks on blacks and countercharges that the issue of, police brutality is being used for political purposes.

title: American Writes Soviet Archive Guide
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 10  Guidebooks of almost any kind are hard to come by in the Soviet Union, and it has been up to an American historian to publish one of the most unusual of alla detailed directory to the complex system of archives and manuscript collections.

title: Rita Silva Will Marry
description: WOODRIDGE, N. J., Feb. 10  Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Silva have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rita Joy Silva, to Robert P. DeMarco, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter DeMarco of Merrick, L. I. The wedding is planned for August.

title: Now and then, a true voice emerges
description: In some ways, this anthology is not without merit. As the dustjacket tells us, it can serve as a convenient, teaching aid because of its double format: It is intended as a broad, uptodate selection of 42 poets, including accurate and sometimes very good translations (Harry Mathews of Denis Roche), and it also contains an introduction and a full apparatus of biographical notes.

title: On the Trail to HighPriced Beef
description: FRASER, Colo.Jim Murphy slammed a hook into the bale of crisp hay and heaved it onto the huge sled, shoving it up on top of a dozen other bales.

title: Peron Arrives in Rome
description: ROME, Feb. 10  Former President Juan D. Pern of Argentina, accompanied by his wife, Isabel, and his secretary, arrived here this afternoon from Bucharest, where he had met with President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania.

title: What Opera Would I Like Revived?
description: I'D LIKE very much to, see a beautiful production of works like Les Huguenots, L'Africaine, or La Juive. Most of the Meyerbeer and Halvy operas need lots of big soloists, they're Tong, and they're on a grand scale that many houses can't afford. But there's no excuse for the Met's not doing them. It has both the vocal talent and a stage that can do everything but sing. Sometimes I feel I have to keep on singing or I'll be upstaged by the stage!

title: Debra Kesselman, Student, Plans Bridal
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Feb 10  The engagement of Miss Debra Kesselman, a junior at Washington University, to Barry Lee Jacobson has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Sanford E. Kesselman, parents of the future bride. Her fiance, a graduate of Washington University and a doctoral candidate in industrial Psychology there, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Jacobson of New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: Numismatics
description: SPECIALIZED coin shows  devoted exclusively to one area of collectinghave become one of the numismatic success stories' of the seventies. The most recent example was the New York International Numismatic Convention in the Americana Hotel last Deember only ancient and foreign material was permitted to be sold or exhibited. The Collectors, who paid $1 admission, echoed (and, of course, largely created) the enthusiasm expressed by the 50 dealers in the bourse (an unusually large proportion of them from overseas), the New York dealer (Lester Merkin) who conducted the auction, and the exhibitors in the display area.

title: TWO U.S. WRESTLERS AVERT SOVIET SWEEP
description: BAKU, U.S.R.R., Feb. 10 (AP) John Peterson of Comstock, Wis., scored a victory and his brother, Ben, got a draw for the only United States points in a dualmeet wrestling loss to a Russian team today, Tass, the Soviet news agency, reported.

title: A ski house as Vermont as maple syrup
description: In some ski communities, including Stratton Mountain in Vermont, design review boards encourage residents to build houses with a Swiss chalet flavor. But the Robert Haidingers deplored the coy cuckooclock architecture that bears no relation to the solid grace of the true Swiss mountain house. Architect Alfredo De Vido, who shared the Haidingers' views, designed a ski house for them with a simple strength that suited its Vermont skiscape and yet passed the Stratton Mountain review board. He also managed to stay within his clients' $50,000 budget even while meeting their requests for two fireplaces, room to sleep 14 and a sauna. He designed the armchairs and dining table of the same Vermont pine he used to panel the walls and built in most of the other furniture for under $1,000, which is figured into the total cost. What else did they get for their money? An enormous living room extending 25 feet up to the peak of one of the two shed roof projections. The flat sides of the steep roofs are pierced with clerestory windows (shown at top right) lighting the living room and the master bedroom (at top left, opposite page). These offset the light loss from the roof overhangs that protect the lower windows from ice building up. Once you're inside a ski house, you stay inside, the architect points out, so the two bunkrooms (at right), a recreation room and an unbundling room for skis and gear are at ground level; the kitchen, living room and two bedrooms are warmly airlocked one flight up.

title: Bridge
description: A sneak can generally be categorized as low and dirty, whether it be a person moving furtively, a tattletale, a ball delivered along the ground at cricket, or an abbreviation for the useful sneaker. It is therefore surprising that the same word was once used by cardplayersand is still used on the West Coastto describe a singleton lead. In the days of whist, apparently, such a lead was regarded as slightly improper and unsporting.

title: Hunter Wrestling Victor
description: Hunter College closed out its Most successful wrestling season yesterday with a 349 victory over Marist College at Hunter. Hunter, with a 123 wonlost record, will compete in the City University tournament at Lehman College next Saturday.

title: Reaching for the Big Sky
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 10 (UPI)Portland State University decided today to apply foramlly for admission to the Big Sky Athletic Conference. The decision was made after carefully weighing several reports, a school spokesman said.

title: Suit Challenges State Law Banning Display of Prophylactics
description: PISCATAWAY A littleknown New Jersey law is being challenged in the courts by a major manufacturer of prophylactics. The company, the Youngs Drug Products Corporation of Piscataway, contends that the law, which prohibits the advertising of birthcontrol devices, is unconstitutional and outdated in today's society. The measenacted in 1898.

title: AveryA Modern Master?
description: WHEN the late Milton Avery died in 1965 at the age of 72, he was still a young painter. Chronological age seems to have had little to do with the character of his art. Avery's vision had the directness of a child's; in his work, the world seemed to be created afresh each morning. His subjects, I suppose, were oldfashioned  landscapes, still lifes and figure paintings which usually de. pitted his wife and daughter and occasional friends in for a visit. An air of domesticity clung to his work.

title: NEW HEARINGS SET ON CAR EMISSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit ordered the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency today to hold further hearings on the automobile industry's request for a oneyear postponement of the 1975 standards for, two exhaust pollutants.

title: Legislative Notes: Odds on Gambling
description: TRENTONAlthough New Jersey is generally regarded as a state with a voracious appetite for gambling, the latest plan to broaden its legal scope is meeting strong resistance from wary legislators.

title: Foreman Repaying job Corps
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 10 (AP)It cost the Government about $10,000 to put George Foreman through the Job Corps, but the heavyweight boxing champion was worth every penny, says one of the first men to work with Foreman in the Federal program.

The natural thing is to go back into business, and. Miss Ivler (Mrs. Mark Rubin in private life) did just that.

Oswald, New York's Correction Commissioner and a central figure in the 1971 riot at Attica State Prison walked out on a Worcester State College conference today after shouting protesters blocked the start of his scheduled speech on prison reform.

description: It was a spectacular dome, pushing 100 feet above the flat western shore of Staten Island between Arthur Kill and Prall's River. It had been built to store gas in cold liquid form until the call came to answer the peak winter needs of homes and industries in the metropolitan area.

description: ACROSS

title: Boo!
description: All these are usual, says Eliot in The Dry Salvages, though there through the magic of verse, pastimes and drum, and features of the press: and always will be, some of them especially when there is distress of nations and perplexity, whether on the shores of Asia or in the Edgware Road (for the last, read Broadway and 93rd). Meaning scrying and haruspication, peering into life after death, gaining assurance that Evil exists as an ultimate reality, lapping up any paperback testimony, fictional or mockreal, to the continued potency of the inexplicable. Now, When science knows so much and seems to be of such small comfort, the subliterary pastimes and drugs are an underdog's snarl at empty and expensive learning. The only real knowledge worth having, so we seem to be told, descends on the ignorant, the stupid, the credulous. Or on Ruth Montgomery, author of Here and Hereafter (Fawcett, 75 cents) and now, to clinch the revelations of those postmortal disclosures, of A World Beyond (Fawcett, 95 cents).

title: Losing Money on Money
description: LONDON, Feb. 10 (UPI)The Royal Mint has reported that it went $72.8million in the red last year buying up old money. Since decimal coinage was introduced two years ago it has paid for shillings and pence at face value.

title: Lindsay Now Plots own Political Moves
description: For the first time in his career, Mayor Lindsay has become his own political boss in City Hall.

title: Quick Action Seen In Europe as Talks On Turmoil Widen
description: BONN, Feb. 10A highly placed West German source said this afternoon that decisions can be expected here and in other capitals tomorrow in a concerted effort of Western states to end the present international monetary crisis centered on the United States dollar.

title: Anshutz: A Line All But Lost
description: PHILADELPHIA THE name of Thomas Pollock Anshutz (18511912) is not one that dominates the pages of American art history. Yet recent events have conspired to bring this littleknown painter, who has generally been more celebrated as a teacher than as an artist, to Public attention. Last year Ruth Bowman of New York University turned up, in the course of her research on the Artist, a cache of Anshutz papers and photographs, hitherto unknown. Then, in October, Anshutz's most famous picture  indeed, his only famous picture  IronworkersNoontime, painted in the early eighteeneighties, brought the highest auction price ever paid for an American painting, $250,000. Prompted by these events, perhaps, the Pennsylvania Academy, where Anshutz worked first as a student and then for many years as a teacher, has now organized a small exhibition of his paintings, drawings and photographs.

title: YONKERS FEATURE TO ALLEY FIGHTER
description: YONKERS, Feb. 10  Alley Fighter, Canadian  owned trained and driven, got up in the final stride to beat the favored Buchen Hanover in to night's featured Greenburgh, pace before 19,609 fans at Yonkers Raceway.

description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Feb. 10Sometimes you have it and sometimes you don't, said 23yearold Thorbjorn (Toby) Ryen here today after capturing, the Telemark ski jumping tournament.

title: Renoir Reported Stolen
description: PARIS, Feb. 10 (Reuters)A landscape by Renoir valued at about $100,000 was in a car reported stolen last night in suburban Neuilly, the police said today. The police said they doubted that the thief new the painting was in the car when he stole it.

title: Real GrassRoot Racing Is Provided by ARCA
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla, Feb. 10They work hard in factories, gas stations and bodyrepair shops. Around 4:30 P.M: they load their trailers and drive to towns like Mount Clemens, Mich., and Springfield, Ohio, to spend the evening racing their stock cars on halfmile tracks. The show must be finished at 11 P.M. because everyone, drivers rind fans alike, must be at work the next morning.

title: Seeing India in Maharaja Style: By Private Railway Car..
description: BE a Maharaja. See India in style by hiring your own private railroad car and mapping out your own itinerary. It's not a thing you can just up and do. On the ether hand, it's certainly not impossible to arrange. Simply allow some lead time and expect changes. And have confidence: The Indian railway bureaucracy has a genius for the lastminute fix, the mendandmakedo, and a great desire to show off its 37,000mile rail system, one of ttie world's largest and certainly the best east of Suez. Be adventurous, and then think of every change in plans as the beginning of a bright, new adventure.

description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Feb. 10Controversy over proposed visit of an allwhite South African rugby team to New Zealand is growing into a national crisis. Already it had divided this country more bitterly than at the height of demonstrations over participation in the Vietnam war.

title: Rah!
description: Rummaging through a charity book sale not long ago, I came upon a copy of the 1954 edition of the Mutual Baseball Almanac, minus its dustjacket but otherwise a bargain at 52 cents. I bought it for a couple of reasons: it provided a pleasant bit of nostalgia, recalling the baseball heroes of my adolescence, and it served as a useful reminder of how books about sportlike our attitudes toward sport  have changed in the past two decades.

At the TransLux East.

title: the traveler's world
description: WASHINGTON This is the second part of the inquiry, begun last week, into the brouhaha that developed over the Customs Bureau's proposal to stop preclearance  Customs inspection before takeoff rather than after landing  of airplane passengers leaving Canada, Bermuda and the Bahamas for the United States. We reported Customs' arguments that loose preclearance procedures were permitting drugs to slip into this country, arguments that led to a Congressional act that will end preclearance on May 15 unless U.S. Customs inspectors stationed in Canada, Bermuda and the Bahamas are granted authority to search, seize and arrest suspects, and adequate facilities are built to separate precleared travelers from visitors Mid those not cleared.

title: Shane Gould Wins Butterfly For Commonwealth Mark

description: BEECH MOUNTAIN, N. C., Feb. 10 (UPI)  JeanClaude Killy of France, who joined the professional ski tour this season, won today's giant slalom by defeating Hugo Nindl of Austria in the final of the parallelcotirse meet. The 1968 Olyinpic triple champion earned $2,500 and adyanced into second place in the season point standings.
