title: Art
description: THE Ferdinand Hodler exhibition at the Guggenheim Museum is one of the most valuable contributions to American acquaintance with the recent past of modern art that any museum has given us since the early days of the Museum of Modern Art. Then Alfred, H Barr, Jr., its scholarly, imaginative, and proselytizing young director, was bringing, us up to date on such esoterica as fauvism, cubism, and surrealism. How Hodler has been passed over all these years, when there have been retrospectives of every smallfry School of Paris hangeron, would be a puzzle except that the work of this Swiss painter has been concentrated virtually in its entirety in his native country.

title: From the pillbox to the herd dress
description: Designer Roy Ralston Frowick, otherwise known as Ralston, was totally prepared for what happened during the Coty American Fashion Critics' Awards, and he loved every minute of it. On the night of Oct. 19, 1972, a blacktie audience of manufacturers and store owners from around the country sat in Lincoln Center's Alice Tully Hall and applauded as eight designers, including Halston, won Winflies. (The Winnie is the bronze statuette that signifies the same kind of success for a fashion designer that an Oscar does for a movie star.) Then came the Coty Show, which featured highlights from the winners' dress collections, both live and on film.

title: SQUIRES CONQUER COLONELS
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 10 (AP)Julius Erving scored 20 of his 48 points in the final period tonight as the Virginia Squires rallied for a 105400 American Basketball Association victory over the Kentucky Colonels.

title: $476Million inU.S.Arms Bought in '72, Israeli Says
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 10 (AP)Israel bought $476million worth of arms from the United States last year, Finance Minister Pinhas Sapir reports.

title: The Job Is To Agree Who Won
description: VIENTIANDHenry Kissinger was in town, briefly, to smooth the way to a Laotian peace accord. Talks toward that end in this capital were in their final phase. The smell of ceasefire was in the air. Yet at the weekend, the annex war, as the debadeold conflict in Leos has come to be known, was still going strong.

title: The Rough Road Back for P.OW's
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 10As the first American prisoners start their journey home tomorrow night, they will move from a world of silence to a world of noise, from slow motion to speed, from isolation to crowds, from idleness to activity and from the company of military men to the company of wives, children and friends.

title: One Missing Worker Was There on Day Off
description: Billy Scarangella, a 22yearold construction worker missing in the Staten Island gastank disaster, was supposed to have had yesterday off. Instead, his family reported last night, he decided to work and take off Monday, Lincoln's Birthday.

title: 3 Concerns Pay $463,000 In Price Control Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (UPI)  Three companies have paid the Government about $463,000 in penalities after being charged with violations of the wageprice control program, the Cost of Living Council has announced.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEM  For the once large and flourishing Jewish community in Iraq, the years since the. ArabIsraeli war of 1967 have brought uncertainty and dread. Their treatment by the Baghdad authorities has fluctuated from month to month, from relative tolerance to outright persecution. The darkest period was in January, 1969, when the militant Iraqi regime that had seized power six months earlier convicted 14 persons, including nine Jews of spying for Israel and hanged them in public squares.

title: Recycling of Waste Discounted Here
description: Attempts to solve New York City's growing garbage problem by recycling the waste face a bleak future, according to a 200page collection of studies released yesterday by the Council on the Environment of New York City.

title: Lincoln's Birthday
description: Tomorrow is Lincoln's Birthday. Public and parochial schools in New York Connecticut and most of New Jersey, banks, most city offices and all branches of the New York Public Library will be closed, and no refuse will be collected. Stock exchanges, most stores and Federal and New York state offices will be open, but Connecticut and New Jersey state offices will be closed. Regular postal services will be maintained. Threehour alternate  sideofthe  street parking regulations will be suspended; other rules remain.

title: Snowmobile Driver Killed
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 10 (AP)A snowmobile driver, Joel Overbaugh, was killed today when his Modified IV Chaparral jumped the concrete retaining wall after he had qualified for tomorrow's feature race in the International ProAm Snowmobile Championships. Overbaugh, 29, of. Pontiac, Mich died at Milwaukee Couaty General Hospital, a race spokesman said.

title: '56 Refugee Now Master Of Sculpture In Porcelain
description: HOPEWELLThe sign that reads Ispanky Porcelains, Ltd.it is posted in front of a Ushaped building on the outskirts of Trentonreflects the rising fortunes of Lazio Ispanky from a penniless Hungarian refugee to international recognition as a living master of procelain sculpture.

title: Richard Bevier, a Founder Of Pan American Airways
description: Richard B. Bevier, who was one of the founders in 1927 of Pan American Airways, a fore runner of Pan American World Airways, died of emphysema in Brooklyn Hospital on Monday. He was 80 years old and lived in Westhampton Beach, L.I.

title: Drive Opens to Save an Old Canal
description: TRENTONA legislative drive to prevent the historic Delaware and Raritan Canal from being destroyed by commercial development began last week in the State Senate. Senators Raymond H. Bateman of Somerset County and William E. Schleuter of Mercer, both Republicans, introduced a resolution that would authorize a legislative committee to study ways to preserve the 140yearold waterway.

title: Cab Calloway HiDeHos Here at the Rainbow Grill
description: Cab Calloway is back in town, hidehidehoing around the Rainbow Grill almost as though he were back in the Cotton Club in the vigorous enthusiasm of his youth. Actually, the 65yearold Mr. Callaway does not unleash any hidehos until he gets to his most celebrated encore number, Minnie the Moocher. But the urgent cry with which he sings such songs as St. James Infirmary and It Ain't Necessarily So earlier in his program is an essential part of the vocal techniques which eventually spills over into the hidehos.

title: Charlotte Rush Bacon Is Affianced
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 10  Mrs. Katharine lay Bacon of Cambridge and Robert Bacon of Woods Hole have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Charlotte Rush Bacon, to John Charles Phillips 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur H. Phillips of Ipswich. The wedding will take place here in June.

title: Miss Errath Captures European Skating Title
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Feb. 10 (UPI)Christine Errath of East Germany won the women's title tonight at the European figureskating championships. The 16yearold girl from East Berlin scored 9 ordinals and 341.14 points.

title: SHOP TALK
description: BLOOMFIELD  On the outside, Economy Self Service Shoes is unimpressive. The name, boldly painted in fire salestyle letters on an oversized sign, lacks elegance. It's the inside of the store that's impressive.

title: URUGUAY OFFICERS PRESSING DEMANDS
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb 10 (AP)Uruguay's generals pressed demands today for a national reconstruction program amid reports the President Juan Maria Bordaberry might resign.

title: Florence Gail Weitzner Engaged
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Feb. 10  Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Weitzner have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Florence Gail Weitzner, to Pvt. Brian Peter Gibbes, U. S. A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Gibbes of Elmsford, N. Y., and Fripp Island, S. C. The wedding is planned for June 24 at the Hampshire Country Club in Mamaroneck, N. Y.

title: SMACK
description: Dinky Hocker has a mother so dedicated to her precious dope addicts that she has no sympathy left over for persons with other problems.

title: TAX CHECKOFF BOX CRITICIZED BY LONG
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 (AP) Senator Russell B. Long, Democrat of Louisiana, says the Treasury Department may have thwarted the will of Congress in the way it is handling the Presidential campaign financing plan.

title: After the War
description: SAIGONIt was not happening precisely according to the timetable laid down by the Paris accord, and there was some apparent tampering by the Saigon Government with the spirit if not the letter of the ceasefire agree ment, but peace in South Vietnam seemed last week to be acquiring a momentum of its own. And the first batch of American prisoners of war was about to be released.

title: South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURGThe Zulus were once known as the greatest warriors of southern Africa. Before they were subdued by the white man's guns almost a century ago, they inflicted on the British Army one of the most humiliating defeats in its historythe Battle of Isandhlwana. Today, four and a half million Zulus under white rule have a designated homeland, Kwazulu, a territory economically incapable of accommodating the whole tribe. So most of the men work in the white man's economy, about 150,000 of them in Durban alone.

title: President Quits Brooklyn Poly
description: Dr. Arthur Grad has resigned as president of the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn after 18 menths on the job, most of it marked by faculty attacks on his administration of the linendally troubled school.

title: James. T. Kelsey, Princeton '73, Is Fiance of Karen C. Flanigan
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 10 Miss Karen Clark Flanigan, one of whose grandfathers is board chairman of AnheuserBusch, brewers, and the other is former board chairman of the Manufacturers Trust Company in New York plans to be married here Aug. 25 to James Talcott Kelsey, whose father is executive vice president of the Talcott National Corporation, the financial and factoring organization.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: Peter G. Peterson, when he was Secretary of Commerce, once remarked that in government, one gets tons of data and ounces of analysis. It's a common experience in business as well, as if the information explosion offered a feast of facts and a famine of understanding.

title: Asian Parley in India Ends In Consensus on SelfHelp
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 10  An international assembly of more than 200 intellectuals, meeting here to discuss Asian problems, ended this week with the consensus that Asian countries should solve their problems themselves without outside help.

title: Bang! Bang!
description: No, Charlotte, I'm the jury now, and the judge, and I have a promise to keep. Beautiful as you are, as almost loved you, I sentence you to death ... the roar of the .45 shook the room. Charlotte staggered...

title: 4 Years Old, Automated Transit Line To Philadelphia Suburbs Turns Profit
description: PHILADELPHIA  Four years after it opened, an autoated, 75mileanhour rapid transit system here has accomplished something that transportation experts thought was all but impossible in urban transportation: It made a profit.

title: Jets Play Houston Aug. 3
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 10 (UPI) The Houston Oilers announced today a sixgame preseason football schedule for 1973, starting Aug. 3 at home against the New York Jets.

title: Molnar Keeps The Door Open
description: HAVING been trapped in a traffic breakdown on the Bruckner Expressway for an hour, escaping, only by wrongway flight down an entrance ramp (what I won't do to get to the theater!), I arrived at the Roundabout's production of Molnar's The Play's The Thing a few minutes late, dropping into my seat just in time to hear Hugh Franklinwho plays the airy dramatist of the pieceremark On how difficult it is to get a play started to the accompaniment of slamming seats. Naturally, I jumped, no doubt slamming the seat once more.

title: NEWS BAN REPORTED WHEN 27 ARE FREED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 10 (UPI)A spokesman for the Canadian delegation to the International Commission for Control and Supervision said today that plans for news coverage of the first prisone release in South Vietnam Monday had apparently been dropped.

title: Tyro Wins Like a Pro In Specialty
description: Ch. Fernden's Bianca of Olduvai, a 2yearold bitch, made her first specialty show a complete success yesterday afternoon, winning best of breed in the Rhodesian Ridgeback specialty show in the Olympic Ballroom of the RoyalManhattan Hotel.

title: California's Venture in Regulation of Coastline Land Use Is Gearing UpAnd Confronting Problems
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 10One of the nation's boldest ventures in landuse planning, statelevel regulation of California's 1,000mile coastline, is gearing upand confronting problems.

title: Forgetful Reminded Of Dates
description: RIDGEWOODYou forgot your wife's birthday. Again. So did Louis Kurland, but did he apologize, promise it would never happen again and, in general, behave like a craven, guiltedged husband?

title: SPIRIT OF GANDHI STILL STIRS INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 10  Has the spirit of Gandhi slipped away from India?

title: Sir Ambrose Keevil, 79, World War II Food Official
description: LONDON, Feb. 10Sir Ambrose Keevil, one of the principal organizers of London's food supplies during the early days of World War II, died here today. He was 79 years old.

title: Swiss Bus Plunge Kills 2
description: THUN, Switzerland, Feb. 10 (Reuters)  Two 14yearold girls were killed and 29 people injured when a bus returning from a ski camp somersaulted 800 feet down an embankment near here today, police sources said. The occupants of the bus were Swiss.

title: TAKING OF BRIBE DENIED BY KERNER
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 10  Former Illinois Gov. Otto Kerner, taking the witness stand in his own defense this week, denied that he had ever received horse racing stock as a bribe or that he had ever tried to conceal his stock ownership from the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Pete Huley, Klondike Pete, Gold Prospector and Actor
description: VANCOUVER; B. C., Feb. 10 (AP)Pete Huley, known to thousands in the. Yukon as Klondike Pete, died here Tuesday at the age of 80.

title: Coming Attractions
description: MARCH

title: BAKER CAPTURES POLE AT DAYTONA
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 10  Buddy Baker, a 32yearold race driver who has already begun training for his next career, qualified today for the pole position in the 15th annual Daytona 500 stockcar race, which will be run Feb. 18.

title: State Moves to Complete DisasterAid Radio Link
description: SOMERVILLE  Hospitals, rescue squads and civildefense units in New Jersey may be linked soon by a modern radio network.

title: Interest Squeeze and Bank Stocks
description: The confrontation between the Nixon Administration and the nation's commercial banking industry over interest rates is threatening to produce a classic earnings for the banks.

title: In 990 Will We Still Go Out to the Movies?
description: RECENTLY at a party, a group of us were talking about the possibilities of video cassettes. Suppose you're feeling mellow late one night and suddenly get in the mood to see Casablanca or an old Bette Davis flick. You could slip a cassette of a movie into your TV with the ease we now put on stereo records. We are, after all, the generation of instant, or at least semiprompt, gratification and it's swell to think technology is doing its best to keep us happy.

title: MINNESOTA DOWNS OHIO STATE, 80=78
description: COLUMBUS, Feb, 10 (UPI)Ron Behagen scored 33 points today and led Minnesota to in 8078 victory over Ohio State in a Big Ten conference game.

title: Criminals At Large
description: George Harmon Coxe is back with his 60th novel, THE SILENT WITNESS (Knopf, $5.95). Coxe has one stylistic mannerism through which his books can immediately be recognized. He's the hunh man. I guess I blew it, hunh? Nancy told you, hunh? Just fix that drink, hunh? This novel is about Jack Fenner, the private eye. Fenner has to guard an heiress, and he has as much trouble guarding her as Coxe has guarding against clich6s.

title: Guide to Survival For 6th Graders
description: MADISON  The North Jersey Conservation Foundation has announced the publication of the fourth volume in a series that had its roots in this community.

title: Kerr on Endgame
description: REVIEWERS are often invited to previews these nights, with the last of these designated as the official opening so that all reviews can appear together the following morning. There was a slight exception this week in the case of the Andr GregoryManhattan Project production of Beckett's Endgame. After permitting reviewers to attend on a number of different occasions, Feb. 7 was named opening night. On opening night there was no performance.

title: Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained from more than 125 bookstores in 64 communities of the United States. The figures in the righthand column do not necessarily represent consecutive appearances.

title: Miss Myers Is Betrothed
description: BETHESDA, Md., Feb. 10Dr. and Mrs. Richard C. Myers have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Christine Gueydan Myers, to Chester L. Fisher 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fisher Jr., of Briarcliff Manor, N. Y. and Landing, N. J.

title: N.C. STATE SCORES 19TH IN ROW, 11894
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb, 10 (AP)David Thompson scored 36 points and Tommy Burleson 24 as undefeated North Carolina State trounced Georgia Tech, 11894, tonight to protect its No. 2. national ranking with its 19th victory.

title: Paper Recycling Urged
description: What will happen to this newspaper after you're through reading it? If you stack it with others and take them to a recycling collection point, you remove clutter from the streets, you save the city sanitationmen some work and you even help to give the newspaper a new usefulness in some other form.

title: Split kisses, split motives, split psyche
description: Step into threeway mirror, Leo in collarless yellow Woody Herman bandjacket and holding smooth powderblue trousers to his waist, Teddy in banker's charcoal pinstripe suitcoat and black homburg, draping pants from his waist. This is my favorite moment in the first novel about Siamese twins I've ever read. Another nice moment is when Leo asks a girl for a goodnight kiss and says he'll split the kiss with Teddy. The twins are a manic offstage vaudeville team, gaily sledding, going to dances, working in a drugstore, running for class vice president, playing trumpet and trombone, playing Rosencrantz and Guildenstern in an amateur Hamlet, hunting down and finding a good deal of sex. Their loud zeal for experience, their bravado, their cocky mockery of themselves and others, are appealing, their loving loyalty to each other likewise, and their subtle wishes for separation, for the severing of the fourinch band that binds them, poignant.

title: Ballet: Surprise Work
description: On Friday night the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater gave everyone a surprise. A small surprise, but a surprise. It was the first repertory performance of Jerome Robbins's ballet Dumbarton Oaks. When this was originally given last summer at the Stravinsky Festival, it had an anyonefortennis setting. Now the work has been transposed to the ballet studio. Tennis rackets are out, and toe shoes are in.

title: The Last Word
description: At the centennial ceremonies for The Harvard Crimson three weekends ago in Cambridge, Mass., much of the murmuring among old editors was about Mary McCarthy's savage attack on David Halberstam's The Best and the Brightest in The New York Review of Books (Jan. 25). The attack was murmurable because (1) most people, especially old Crimson editors, delight in rhetorical overkill; (2) Halberstam himself is an old Crimson editorpoor David, giggle; and (3) Halberstam's book, with 180,000 copies in print, is a genuine best seller, and Harvard feels the same way Yale does about best sellerssuccess compromises one's seriousness.

title: RALPH E. ROTNEM
description: PRIDE'S CROSSING, Mass., Feb. 10Ralph A. Rotnem, a retired partner who became a consultant to the Harris, Upham Company, members of the New York Stock Exchange, died Thursday in the Beverly Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived here.

title: Byrne Wins Playoffs For U.S. Chess Title
description: CHICAGO, Sunday, Feb. 11 (AP)Robert Byrne captured the United States Chess Championship playoffs last night after Saibuel Reshevsky agreed to a draw in the sixth and final game of the roundrobin event.

title: Man Found Dead at Depot
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Feb. 10 A longhaired man in his late 20's was found dead this morning in the Long Island Rail Road station here. The Nassau County police said the man, who has yet to be identified, had been found on a station bench at 7:05 A.M. by a porter, Alfred Wilson.

title: Danish Panel to Prepare Home Rule for Greenland
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Feb. 10 (Reuters)  The Danish Government has agreed to set up a commission to work out home rule for the province of Greenland.

title: Saunas Finding a Niche in Modem Housing
description: And now, from those wonderful people who gave us Marimekko fabrics and Arabia dinnerware, Americans are adopting yet another product for the wellequipped homethe sauna.

title: Down Among The Women
description: Fay Weldon has almost brought off the novel that Women's Lib could call its own. Down among the women is no place to be: downtrodden, downbeat, downcast, each of these Londoners measures out her life in honeymoons. Scarlet is the kernel of the story. Left pregnant by her first sexual fling, she tries to hammer out an existence between the furious independence of her mother and the clinging helplessness of her father's new wife Susan, her junior, whose submissiveness is the kind that enslaves the man, not the wife:

title: Why These Campaign Gifts?
description: WASHINGTON When President Nixon signed the new Federal Election Campaign Act into law a year ago this month, he spoke of the restoration of public confidence in the integrity of the electoral process that would flow from it. The private financing of campaigns for public office, he added, was an area which has been of great public concern. As of last week, there was evidence that the concern remained.

title: YIPPIES ARRESTED IN FIRE BOMB CASE
description: In prosecutions stemming from the 1972 Republican National Convention in Miami Beach, two members of the Youth International Party (Yippies) were arrested here yesterday on charges of violating Federal firearms restrictions.

title: Investigation Said to Clear Coach of Racism Charges
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Feb. 10 (AP)A State University faculty union said today an investigation had cleared the former Binghamton State basketball coach, Frank Pollard, of charges that he discriminated against black players. The accusations were lodged in December 1971 by four black players. They said Pollard restricted the number of blacks on the court at one time.

title: Club Reproduces 1877 Catalogue
description: The symbol for the Westminster Kennel Club is a pointer. Back in 1877, when the club held its first show at Gilmore's Garden, a drawing of a pointer, Sensation, was on the cover of the catalogue. The lemonandwhite dog has been seen on most Westminster catalogues since, the modern ones showing him on point.

title: Monetary Ills Grip Business
description: It's Blue February in the nation's business community once again. Consider these developments:

title: On a Quiet City Street, Assessments Are Cut
description: Bolton Street, between Pelham Parkway and Lydig Avenue in the Bronx, is a quiet block lined with sixstory apartment houses. Most of the 12 buildings were constructed in, the late nineteenthirties. Some laver fire escapes zigzagging down their brick fronts to entranceways on the sidewalk.

title: RAIDERS DEFEATED BY CRUSADERS, 84
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 10 (AP)The Cleveland Crusaders scored four times in the third period to down the New York Raiders, 84, tonight and raise their lead in the Eastern Division of the World Hockey Association to 5 points over the New England Whalers.

title: Brustein from Britain
description: LONDON. IN recent months, London has been in the grip of a virus whose symptoms are rheum and depression, and whose origin is traceable not only, to the damp and sunless skies but also to the gray and dismal theater season. The English, quick enough to spot the signs of winter flu, are somewhat less familiar with the symptoms of an ailing stage, and so the problem has not yet been fully diagnosed.

title: They shoot opium smugglers in Iran, but...
description: TEHERAN. From the air, the landscape looks forbidding as the face of the moon. On the ground it is worse: a burning summer sun against which the treeless mountain slopes offer no shelter, or winter storms that obliterate the winding trails with masses of snow and ice. Spring brings the 120day wind, swirling, hot gusts that fill the pores and blind the eyes with the fine brown sand that covers the barren mountainsides. But the caravans from Afghanistan inch their way along the ridges and through the gorges every day except at the depth of winter. They carry tea, and guns, and silks, and cigarettes, and opium. Above all, opium.

title: AFTER 2 WEEKS, PEACE IS ELUSIVE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 10Two weeks after a ceasefire officially went into effect, relatively smallscale fighting was continuing over much of Vietnam and the machinery to detect and possibly deter the violations had not even begun to work.

title: New Cardinal Reads Plays Well
description: Is hearing a prerequisite for playing football? Not for Bonnie Sloan, who is deaf Is hearing a prerequisite and speaks in murmurs. Sloan, from Austin Peay State University in Tennessee, was selected on the 10th round of the recent draft by the St. Louis Cardinals. He is a 260pound defensive tackle who has never been able to hear.

title: Intermarriage
description: The bride was Roman Catholic and the groom Jewish. They wanted religious wedding, so they hit on compromise that would show that religions can live in harmony with religions. A priest conducted the saying of vows; a rabbi led them in the giving of the rings. Both clergymen gave blessings, and, in a final gesture of bubbling interfaith good will, the entire wedding party gathered in circle with their hands together like the New York Knicks just before game time.

title: Metuchen Is Resisting Construction
description: METUCHEN  For the 16,000 residents of this Middlesex County community, the major problem is how to raise the money to live in the style to which they have become accustomed. They are opposed to the construction of highrise apartment houses or industrial buildings  both established sources for tax revenue but still want to maintain a ranking school system, private homes and a limited shopping area.

title: PLAYERS DISCUSS OFFER BY OWNERS
description: The next move in the contract dispute between the baseball owners and players is now up to the players.

title: High Treasury Aide Sent On Tour of Major Capitals
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10The Treasury disclosed today that Under Secretary for Monetary Affairs, Paul A. Volker, has been attending a secret round of consultations in major foreign capitals for the last four days under instructions from the President.

title: Elizabeth Weeks Wed to R. B. Stecker
description: Miss Elizabeth Weeks, executive secretary to Dana S. Creel, president of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund, was married here yesterday afternoon to Robert Bates Stecker, vice president and general manager of the New York City area of American Telephone & Telegraph Long Lines. The Rev. Dr. Eugene E. Laubach performed the ceremony at the Riverside Church.

title: REPRIEVE OF WOLF IS URGED IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 10Soviet zoologists have been rallying to the defense of the Russian wolf, a muchmaligned animal that has apparently been unable to shed a centuriesold reputation as a bloodthirsty chaser of troikas.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTON AND POETRY

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: McGrawHill, Inc., has recovered ownership of its green skyscraper on 42d Street, west of Eighth Avenue, froni C. Russell Feldmann, who bought it in 1970 for more than $15million.

title: Miss Thode Is Affianced
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 10Mr. and Mrs. Edward William Thode Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Louise Thode, to Alfred Easton Poor 2d, son of Mrs. John Tynan of Rome and Charles Lane Poor of Washington.

title: Camera World
description: Two new photographic howto books have recently been released by Amphoto, the photographic publishing house that is now located at 750 Zeckendorf Boulevard, Garden City, L. I.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: IOFTEN ask, and am asked, when should you respond to a critic? The answer is: virtually never. For several reasons. It makes you look like a poor sport, thinskinned, and one who can't take it. It also calls attention to something that people have either misused or forgotten. Besides, he is a professional critic and writer and you are not. These are all good reasons, as I am undoubtedly about to prove.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: An Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Paperback Books
description: Like a lot of people, I suppose, the first thing I discovered in a paperback book was sex. That was over 20 years ago, and the book was, of course, God's Little Acre, the classic work of erotica of the forties. Not that I hadn't heard about sex from my friendseven experienced it in a gentlemanly way with girls who wore invisible chastity beltsand read about it in sex manuals which diagramed the female anatomy in a way that made it resemble one of those old headache commercials. But in God's Little Acre, people did it  uninhibited, busty sharecropper girls in thin cotton dresses.

title: Estimate Board Approves Several Projects of Interest to Brooklyn and Queens
description: The Board of Estimate Which approved development of a modern containerport in the Red Hook area of Brooklyn last week, also approved several other items affecting Brooklyn and Queens residents.

title: Women in South African Navy
description: CAPETOWN, Feb. 10 (AP)The South African Navy has begun training 21 women, the first female personnel.

title: Tar in Cigarettes Is. Reported Down By 46% Since '56
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10Smokers concerned over health hazards may find some comfort in statistics, recently compiled for a Senate subcom. mittee, on the tar content of cigarettes.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: What would an executive take to leave Tokyo for Dayton, Ohio?

title: Test for the Dollar
description: The economic wellbeing of American consumers and workers ... the future of international trade ... the outlook for political and economic stability in the world. They were all on the line last week as a major dollar crisis roiled the money markets.

title: Budgets
description: The tristate governorsNelson A, Rockefeller of New York, William T. Cahill of New Jersey and Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticuthave more in common this year than their fealty to the Republican party.

title: US. BUSINESSROUNDUP
description: Pedestrians and motorists who daily fight their way along city streets need no reminders of the monumental traffic problems that exist in urban areas.

title: SENATOR MARSANICH, WAS MUSSOLINI AIDE
description: ROME, Feb. 10  Senator Augusto de Marsanich, the honorary chairman of Italy's resurgent neoFascist party and a former Fascist Cabinet member, died here last night. He was 81 years old.

title: NEWSMAN VISITS IN VIETCONG ZONE
description: IN A VIETCONG ZONE South Vietnam, Feb. 8 (Reuters In 24 hours with the Viet cong I drank tea, shared meal, chatted about the Westand ran for cover with then when a South Vietnamese heli copter gunship sprayed a vil lage in a raid lasting more that half an hour.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Stock prices wound up a trying and turbulent week with a flourish on Friday, when they posted the biggest advance of 1973.

title: Hope for Lincoln's Complaint
description: LONG BEACH, L. I.Abraham Lincoln's haunting omen of his own death is now believed by eye specialists to have been a symptom of a defect in his vision.

title: BEANIE ATTACKS MAYOR'S BUDGET
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday attacked Mayor Lindsay's plan to borrow $250million through a new Transit Construction Fund for projects in the proposed capital budget, asserting it would cost taxpayers $80million in extra interest due to double borrowing.

title: Giants as Bowl Tenants? Yale's Officials Reluctant
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 10  The New York Giants sought shelter from Yale this week, opening discussions on use of the Yale Powl, which lies 70 miles northeast of Times Square. The pro football team needs a place to play while its new stadium in New Jersey is being built and it faces eviction from Yankee Stadium next fall.

title: WRAPAROUND QUOTE
description: ACROSS

title: Louis Nizer finds the defendants guilty as convicted
description: Among the holy days to be celebrated by Communists, Fascists and Americanists in 1973 are the Bicentennial of the Boston Tea Party, the Sesquicentennial of the Monroe Doctrine, the Diamond Jubilee of the SpanishAmerican War and the Founding of the Social Democratic Parties of the World, the Golden Jubilee of Hitler's BeerHall Putsch and the Silver Jubilee of the Founding of the Republics of North and South Korea, the Berlin Airlift and the Hanging of the Japanese Warlords. It is also the 40th Anniversary of United States Recognition of the Soviet Regime in Russia and the Founding of the Third Reich, the 30th of the Battle of Stalingrad and the Fall of Mussolini, and the 20th of the Death of Stalin, the Korean Armistice and the Electrocution of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg by the United States of America.

title: Reporter Hurt in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 10 (AP)  An Associated Press reporter, Lee Rudakewych, fell into a Communist ambush 16 miles east of Phnom Penh today but put his car into reverse and escaped with only aslight injury to his left hand. Mr. Rudakewych, 32 years old, or Philadelphia, had mistakenly passed Governrftent lines and gone about a hilfmile into a Communist  controlled segment of Route 1.

title: PUBLIC SUPPORTS DRUGPUSHER LAW
description: Governor Rockefeller's proposal that all sellers of hard drugs be sentenced to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole is supported by a sizable majority of the American public, according to a recent nationwide Gallup poll.

title: Susan Parker Bride of Donald Brant Jr.
description: Miss Susan Leila Parker and Donald Birtley Brant Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Victor L. Baer in the chapel of the, Brick Presbyteriant Church.

title: Letters: Just Once
description: To the Editor: It seems that every year at this time We read about how transAtlantic air fares are in total confusion. Prices will drop sharply. The public will fly to Europe for the lowest prices ever. Pan Am and TWA claim they will lose money.

title: Use House Plants For Indoor Designs
description: THE foliage of house plants makes stunning longlasting arangements. It costs nothing and is a welcome change in home decoration.

title: Committed to adolescence as a permanent state of being
description: IN the course of a very long and productive lifehe died in 1962 at the age of 91Hermann Hesse received his fair share of recognition, including the Nobel Prize; but the real Hesse boom, still cresting, did not get under way until after his death. The apotheosis of the Swabian mystic and his posthumous emergence as a paperback prophet honorednow that he is safely deadin his own country as well as in ours, is not devoid of ironies that he himself would have been among the last to appreciate; whatever his gifts, a sense of humor and selfirony were conspicuously missing. But the craggy figure of the solitary dreamer refurbished as a pop idol tends to obscure his genuine achievements as well as the larger meaning of his unlikely transfiguration in our own time. One of the few indisputable merits of this book is the light it sheds on both these aspects of his work.

title: LAWYERS FORMING LEGAL AID DRIVE
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 10A campaign to keep Federal legal assistance for the poor alive after the poverty program dies is being organized by a coalition of bar leaders here.

title: EURATOM IS SAVED BY 4YEAR BUDGET
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 10  The science ministers of the Common Market, meeting in Brussels, have agreed on a fouryear budget for the small Euratom research program. Besides saving the stagnating organization from extinction, the decision made this week opened the way for a new Common Market approach to research policy in the years to come.

title: Black Youths Advised on Media Jobs
description: The Billie Holiday Community Theater, in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, was packed last Tuesday with more than 300 hopeful black students and young people who wanted to get, jobs in television and radio, in advertising and on magazines.

title: WIDE GOALS SET BY G.O.P. WOMEN
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 10Republican members of the National Women's Political Caucus have agreed that the caucus should work for broad social aimssuch as the creation of taxsupported day care centers, coverage  of domestic workers by the minimum wage of and welfare reformand not solely for the narrower objectivs of achieving equal legal status for, women.

title: 16 Morvens of the Future
description: TRENTON  What New Jersey's high school students might call the now look for the Governor's official residence will be on display at the State Museum until March 11.

title: U.S. Reports Air Strikes In Both Cambodia and Laos
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 10 (UPI)American warplanes struck Communist troops attacking Cambodian forces today and ket up heavy raids over Laos, the Pacific command announced today.

title: City Ballet In Concert By Robbins
description: Jerome Robbins's The Concert, a little ballet that produces big bellylaughs, returned to the State Theater Tuesday night with, Delia Peters dancing the role of the henpecking wife for the first time in the New York City Ballet's production.

title: A Few Wards on Disney World: Bad Adjectives, Good VerbEnjoy
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.Walt Disney World is filled with the songs of birds, but the songs come from little green speakers stuck in the ground. There are no pebbles on the custommade Disney beaches and the water has the tepidity of a drawntoorder bath. Disney boats never hit sandbars or founder on shoals; they run on wheels and rails. Disney animals are net endangered species because they are plastic and computerized andbest of all100 per cent replaceable.

title: SALVINO CAPTURES PELICAN BOWLING
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb 10 (AP) Carmen Salvino, who hadn't won to tournament since 1968, took first place in the $85;000 LincolnMercury open Bowling Tournament at Pelican Lanes here today.

title: Conspirator Lancaster
description: THE mystery surrounding the death of President John F. Kennedy may never be solved, but rumors and theories continue to proliferate. Was Lee Harvey Oswald alone? Was he merely the agent of a radical group that has been responsible for other political killings? Was he linked to an international conspiracy to sap the spirit from the American public?

title: CHAPOT'S MOUNT TAKES SHOW TITLE
description: READINGTON, N. J., Feb. 10 Frank Chapot of the United States Equestrian Team rode eight horses at the Four Seasons Farm horse show today, won one championship and was more impressed with one of his losers than any other mount in the event.

title: Rested Knicks Defeat Pistons; Rangers Rout Islanders, 6 to 0
description: A threeday rest and the heartwarming pleasures of playing in Madison Square Garden proved enough for the Knicks to untrack the improved Detroit Pistons, 10793, last night before the standard capacity crowd of 19,694.

title: SANDERSON IS BACK IN BOSTON LINEUP
description: BOSTON, Feb. 10 (AP)Mike Walton scored three goals in the first period today and the Boston Bruins went on to a 63 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in a brawling National Hockey League game.

title: Trumpeter Improvises In Classes In Wayne
description: WAYNE  Last Monday night, Thad Jones was exuberantly leading his big jazz band, the Thad JonesMel Lewis Band, in a program at the Village Vanguard in New York. It was the seventh anniversary of the band's appearances there every Monday night, a longevity record that is remarkable in the volatile world of jazz.

title: JOHNNY MILLER, WITH 63, CATCHES NICKLAUS AT 273
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 10  Johnny Miller and Jack Nicklaus were separated by five miles and no strokes today at the end of the fourth round of the Bob Hope Desert golf tournament. Miller shot a 63, nine under par, at the Tamarisk Country Club to tie Nicklaus for the lead with 273, 15 under par for 72 holes. Nicklaus shot a 68, four under par, at the Bermuda Dunes course.

title: Canadian Police Aide Asks Moratorium on Gun Sales
description: TORONTO, Feb. 10 (AP)The president of the Canadian Police Association has called for a moratorium on the sale of guns and has appealed to citizens who have guns that are of no use to them to turn them in to the police.

title: Nude Shot Costs $15,000
description: BOISE, Idaho, Feb. 10 (AP)A man whose nude body was shown on a television newscast for ninetenths of a second last March has been awarded $15,000 damages from the station that shot and broadcast the film. A jury of nine men and three women awarded the damages Wednesday to Oren Taylor, 52 years old, of nearby Emmett. Station KTVB had shown a siderear view of Mr. Taylor's body as the police pulled him from his house naked while making an arrest.

title: Bertolucci Is All Tangoed Out
description: I AM more than bored, says Bernardo Bertolucci. I've been taking all this as a game, and now I'm tired of playing the game.

title: Ahh!
description: When did you last have relations with a vacuum cleaner? (Technology may have outmoded Portnoy's slice of liver.) The anonymous authors of The Joy of Sex, edited by Alex Comfort, warn that numerous (male) accidents in the home have resulted from such intimacies, and that the damage can be devastating. Meanwhile, since it appears that more and more people are feeling like interchangeable spare parts, it's instructive to look back at the selfhelp manuals which preceded those that focus on the sensuous battery or lamp or chair, and all the other guides which are selling even more hotly in the seventies than they did in the late sixties.

title: RECORD SNOW HITS GEORGIA, ALABAMA
description: Georgia and Alabama began digging out from under record snowfalls yesterday as 60mileanhour winds Whipped the storm into the eastern Carolinas with blizzard force, The Associated Press reported.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: ANOTHER of the world's periodic and severe monetary crises erupted in recent days to add a new layer of uncertainty to pressing economic problems and intensify an old challenge for the Nixon Administration.

title: Springtime in Virginia: An Appreciation
description: SPRING arrives differently enough within the wide sweep of North America's climates to bring with it very unalike emotions. In northernmost Wisconsin, for example, all that hints of the, approaching equinox at first is the honking of geese overhead, traveling north again. They fly high above frozen Lake Superior, the faint flapping of their wings hardly even a sound, more like a memory, a flutter in the chill air, and mournful.

title: Diary, of a Schoolgirl En Route to Death
description: WHILE I was taking several days off recently, catching up With that nebulous employment entity called time due, the American Broadcasting Company presented a 90minute program, including commercials, called Go Ask Alice. Offered as the network's Wednesday Movie of the Week, the film was not great. It was good, better than most of the madeforTV movies clogging the primetime schedules.

title: N.B.A. Lineup
description: AT BOSTON

title: Home Improvement
description: A NEW type of easily installed suspended ceiling system recently introduced makes it easier than ever for even a comparatively inexperienced doityourselfer to put up himself. Unlike most previous suspended ceilings there is no complicated measuring or room layout required before starting, and when the job is done the finished ceiling forms a solid unbroken surface with barely visible butted seamsthe metal grid suspension members are completely hidden from view because the metal supporting members fit into slots in the edges of each ceiling panel or tile as illustrated above. Thus the finished ceiling is attractive enough to be used in any room of the houseincluding traditionally styled living rooms and dining rooms.

title: Miss Flicka von Stade Fiancee of Peter Elkus
description: Announcement has been made by Mrs. Charles Steele von Stade of Ballytore, County Kildare, Ireland, of the engagement of her daughter, Miss Frederica von Stade, to Peter K. Elkus of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard J. Elkus of Woodside, Calif.

title: Stamps
description: CANADA is putting out on Feb. 21 two 8cent stamps, devoted to the Algonkian Indians, as part of the continuing series begun last year portraying the cultures of the early Indian tribes of Canada.

title: Jersey Police Dispatcher Held As Strangler of Secretary, 25
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., Feb. 10A 33yearold civilian dispatcher in the ParsippanyTroy Hills Police Department was arrested early this morning and charged with the murder of Linda Sisko, a 25yearold secretary who was found strangled in her apartment here on Wednesday.

title: Miss Perloff to Wed
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Feb. 10The engagement of Miss Bonnie Lynne Perloff, to Sanders Fowler 3d of Washington, son of Dr. and Mrs. Sanders Fowler Jr. of Shreveport, La., has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Frank S. Perloff. Mr. Perloff is president of Friendly Frost, Inc.

title: Prefontaine Runs 3:59.2 Beating Liguori
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 10 (AP)  Steve Prefontaine, the University of Oregon senior, ran the fastest mile in the world this year, 3 minutes 59.2 seconds, in defeating a good field at last night's Los Angeles Times Indoor Games.

title: Pop
description: THE medium, even more than the message, may have made women's lib hard to swallow. Revolutionary literature has rarely been noted for its wit or style, and while Germaine Greer and Kate Millett made the bestseller lists, excessive pedantry and zeal does put people off. Just as in the past novelists and poets made dogma digestible, today it is the singersongwriter who affects the mass audience by presenting the message in a medium, music, that immediately hits both the heart and the mind.

title: GERMANS DEVELOP A NEW CARBURETOR
description: BONN, Feb. 10Researchers of the Siemens Company in Erlangen have developed a new carburetor that appears to be capable of reducing automobile exhaust emissions to a tolerable minimum, spokesmen for the electrical concern announced this week.

title: Rangers Lift Streak to 10 With 3d Straight Shutout
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Feb. 10Like a fighter conserving energy for an upcoming title bout, the Rangers tonight struck, early, then, coasted to a 60 decision over their new suburban relatives, the Islanders.

title: School In Queens Has Cone To the Dogs
description: If you take the scenic route to town  you know, Queens Boulevard and under the el in Long Island City, you have passed Lenny Ross's school.

title: Preview of Springtime
description: FORCING branches into bloom for indoor decoration is ridiculously easy. Of course, plan ahead for it takes from two to four weeks for most branches to leaf out or the blossoms to mature. Here are some simple steps which bring excellent results.

description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 10Princeton remained in a tie with Penn for the Ivy League basketball lead tonight by running away from Columbia, 8254, in Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: All Aboard Cry Is for a Caboose

title: Mailbox: Comparatively Speaking
description: To the Editor: The proposed rule change that the American League is planning for the use of pinchhitters is going to make ifmore difficult for the use of statistics to compare present and future ballplayers with the heroes of the past. But who really worries about comparing O. J. Simpson to Red Grange, or Johnny Unitas to Benny Freidinan? These heroes of the past will retain their tame without specific comparison being made.

title: Nancy Murphy, Student, Engaged
description: RIVERSIDE, Conn., Feb. 10 Dr. and Mrs. John P. Marphy have announced, the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Laurette Murphy, to Michael Raymond Gadue, son of Mr. and Mrs, Raymond Gadue of South Burlington, Vt.

Inside the conference the rhetoric seemed equally blandexcept for the spicy comments of a guest speaker, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi,

description: MONTCLAIR  Graduation is becoming a yearround event at Montclair High School.

title: Bang!

description: ELKTON, Md,, Feb. 10 (AP) Frank Frisch, the 74yearold baseball Hall of Famer who Managed the St. Louis Cardinals' Gas House Gang of the nineteenthirties, was described in fair condifion today at Union Hoipital, where he was recuperating from an auto accident.

description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I. Although few Nassau County residents have heard of Mrs. Jessie Middlemast, the services she heads as county extension administrator of the Nassau Cooperative Extension tench the lives of thousands of men, women and children throughout the county.

title: CENTRAL BANKERS MEET IN EUROPE ON MONEY CRISIS
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Feb. 10 Monetary authorities of the major nonCommunist industrial countries, meeting here today, are trying to find ways to settle a currency crisis that is causing new strains in Western relationships.

title: Scali to Present Credentials
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 10 (AP) John A. Scali will present his credentials to Secretary General Waldheim as the new head of the United States mission to the United Nations on Feb. 19, a member of the mission announced today. Mr. Waldheim will be back In his office that day after a twoandahalfweek foreign trip.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Roden Of Bayside, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Virginia Roden, to Robert Henri Fast, a vice president of the investment banking and brokerage firm of Smith, Barney & Co., and manager of its Paris office. The wedding is planned for next month in Paris.

title: Edward T. Clark Becomes Fiance Of Miss Sivage
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 10  Mr. and Mrs. Gerald A. Sivage of Chicago have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliiabeth Hopkins Sivage, to Edward Thaete Clark.. He is the son of Mrs. Regina Thaete Clark of Philadelphia and the late Charles J. Clark. A wedding is planned in April.

title: The press needs a slogan: Save the First Amendment!
description: A pressGovernment confrontation, a good, sound haveateachother, is hardly new in the United States. There must have been a President sometime, even a Borough President, who never denounced the press and felt brotherly toward it, but his name does not come to mind. But there is now a direct engagement between press and Governmentbut not just between press and Governmenttaking place in this country, day in and day out, with increasing intensity, that does involve something new and touches the meaning, nature and balance of our society. What is new is that the executive branch of Government for the first time has been using the courts, as an ally, a weapon and a lever against the press to try to prevent it from performing its duties.

title: Canada's Parliament and Nation Aroused Over. Ban on Executions
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 10  When Canada's fiveyear moratorium on capital punishment expired last Dec. 31, many people raised doubts about its renewal. After prolonged and emotionally charged debate, the issue is far from settled and the final vote in Parliament is uncertain.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Feb. 1748MG Car Club, North Jersey center 10th annual New Jersey Monte Carlo 300mile allnight rally; start at Holiday. Inn, Edison, N. J. (off Highway 1, south of junction with Route 287 and N. J. Turnpike). First car off 7:31 P.M. Information: phone Barb or Phil (201)6736977.

title: Republican Legislative Leaders Are Reassessing Their Choice of May 31 and June 28 Primary Dates
description: ALBANY, Feb. 10  Republican leaders, faced with mechanical and perhaps political difficulties in the May 31 and June 28 dates they selected for the New York City primary elections, were said today to be considering a change in those dates.

title: AN AMAZON TRIBE TAKES A STEP OUT
description: RIO DE JANIERO, Feb. 10A small group of the legendary Kranhacerore Indians emerged from the Amazon jungle a tweek ago and made what was believed to be their tribe's first contact with the outside world.

title: Storefront Zoo Thrives on Slum Street
description: In a narrow, windowless room on a dismal block in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, a hen had just laid an egg. Carlos Gutierrez, 13 years old, cradled the stillwarm egg and noted, It won't be a chicken because it wasn't fertilized.

description: The vast stone and concrete storage tank near Arthur Kill looks from a distance like an ancient pyramid set down in the industrial clutter and halfdeveloped marshland of western Staten Island.

title: Doctorates
description: Few students who earned their Ph.D. degrees in the expansionist era of the 1960's needed to be told by the early 1970's that control of the academic marketplace had passed from the seller to the buyer. Job openings were scarce on campus and in industry and government, and it was increasingly obvious that many people equipped with America's elite academic credential had no place to go.

title: Friday's Fights
description: New YorkJerry Quarry, 200 pounds; outpointed Ron Lyle, 219, 12 rounds.

title: Pulpfiction style, poppsychology jargon, and a genuinely sadistic imagination
description: When Jerzy Kosinski's The Painted Bird first appeared in 1965, one could not easily judge whether it was, in the language of the blurbs, a searing indictment of humanity, or whether the real horrors of Nazioccupied Europe had somehow served as the occasion for the excesses of a peculiarly sadistic imagination. The evidence of Kosinski's two subsequent novels was not reassuring. Steps is scarcely a novel at all but rather a series of discontinuous erotic jottings, sometimes brutal, generally deficient in feeling, and finally repetitious. Being There is the sketchy design of a fantasy that even with denser novelistic realization would strain credulity beyond limitthe fourday metamorphosis of an illiterate mental defective into one of the most powerful and admired men in America.

title: 3 Westminster Group Victors Return
description: On of the oldest continuous sporting events in American history, the Westminster Kennel Club, show, will take place for the 97th time tomorrow and Tuesday at Madison Square Garden, with 3,027 dogs entered. They represent 126 breeds or varieties.

title: OneParty Vote in Gabon
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, Feb. 10 (Agence FrancePresse)candidates for the 70 seats in the national assembly will be selected by the governing Democratic party, according to an ordinance this week by President Albert Bongo. Elections take place Feb. 25.

title: Indians Clash With NonIndians in South Dakota City Termed Neutral Ground
description: RAPID CITY, S.D., Feb. 10A clubswinging melee between Indians and nonIndians injured 20 persons early today, only hours after American Indian Movement (AIM) leaders had termed the city neutral ground because the people are willing to sit down and recognize the injustices.

title: School Books

The argument between liberals and conservatives has been brewing for at least three years, and last Monday the Board of Education tried to settle matters.

title: A Queen Who Wears Jeans Is Enlivening Jordan's Palace
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10  She's tall, she's blonde, she likes to wear jeans. And the way she has been popping up in unexpected places around the royal palace of Jordan's King Hussein, she's also been giving the household staff something to worry about.

description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 10 (AP)Dr. Delano Meriwether, despite what he called a lousy start, led all the way tonight to win the 70yard dash at the MasonDixon Games.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The tragedy of America's involvement in Vietnam is not that the U. S. chose to stand and fight against Communist, aggression, but that we chose to stand and fight so badly. Never have such selfdefeating restrictions been placed on the use of American military power.

title: P.O.W. Phone Calls Will End the Doubts For Area Families

title: Peron Arrives in Rome
description: ROME, Feb. 10  Former President Juan D. Pern of Argentina, accompanied by his wife, Isabel, and his secretary, arrived here this afternoon from Bucharest, where he had met with President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania.

title: Son to the Paleys
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 10 A son was born Jan. 23 to Dr. and Mrs. Winston B. Paley at the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset. Mrs. Paley is the former Miss Vicki Rae Kreutzer of Roslyn. Dr. Paley is an obstetrician and gynecologist. The child has been named Scott Kenneth.

title: Sir John  What Makes Him Spin
description: SIR JOHN HALL was in town the other week. He has achieved sudden fame in the little world of record collectors through a catalogue he issued last October. Usually catalogues of antique records are mimeographed on cheap yellow paper, stapled together and sent to the four winds. Not Sir John's. His is the Sistine Chapel of record catalogues, or maybe even the Taj Mahal. It is bound in soft covers; it has texts, discographies and essays; it contains illustrations.

title: Expert Told Council Storing Gas at Site On S.I. Was Unsafe
description: James A. Fay, professor of mechanical engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, yesterday termed it imperative that public officials undertake a thorough investigation of the safety hazards involved in the storage of liquefied gas.

title: New Tags to Thwart Thefts
description: FREEPORT, L. I.The Police Department of this South Shore village of 40,000 people last month added a new dimension to the campaign to reduce thefts and to facilitate the faster recovery of stolen items.

title: Top Dogs Are Given Trophies
description: The owners and handlers of the six top groupwinning dogs of 1972 were honored last night at an awards dinner in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Yale Medical Dean Resigns
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb.10KingIman Brewster Jr. president of Yale University, has announced that Dr. Lewis Thomas will resign as dean of the Yale School of Medicine. Dr. Thomas, who is 59 years old, was appointed dean last July 1. He came to Yale from the New York University School of Medicine in 1968 to become chairman of the department of pathology. He is to become president of MemorialSloan Kettering Cancer Institute in New York.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: COMMITTEE ON INTEREST and Dividends asked four banksFranklin National Bank, Bank of New York, First Pennsylvania Banking and Trust Company and Girard Trust Bankto justify the prime rate increases they had announced Feb. 2. . . . Three of the banks dropped their prime rates back to 6 per cent from 6 per cent cooperate with the Administration, but First Pennsylvania held out at 6.

title: Impoundment Issue . . .

title: JOHN C. TYLER
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 10 (UPI) John C. Tyler, cofounder of the Farmers Insurance Group, one of the country's biggest multipleline insurance companies, died Thursday at Good Samaritan Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: School Finds That Travel Is Broadening

But other students studying English, French, Spanish or Russian literature and language will be able to take their lessons in England, France, Quebec, Mexico and Russia.

title: Wesley Powell Gains
description: BOSTON, Feb. 10 (AP)Wesley Powell, former Governor of New Hampshire, was reported in fair condition today at Massachusetts General Hospital, and his name was removed from the critical list. He was stricken last night with a cerebral hemorrhage.

title: Three Die in a FiveHouse Fire in Poughkeepsie
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Feb 10Three persons were killed and one man was critically In jured in a threealarm fire that swept through five connected houses here early this morning.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Ron Lyle muscular and substantial to be the figment of anyone's imagination, but he fell slightly shor of what he had been pictured to be an all consuming ogre devouring his way through heavyweights in irrsistible crunch to the top. He arrived in Madison Square Garden the night before last with an unbeaten String of 19 victories. In spite of it though he was something of a mysterious stranger, No one knew the true extent of his capabilities any. Then Jerry Quarry removed the mystery. No longer is Lyle unbeaten or a astranger. In delayed fulfillment of his early promise, Quarry turned in perhaps the most significant showing of his checkered career to give Lyle a solid theashing. However, it was no strawman whom Jerry unmasked, as he once did with Mac Foster, another highly ballybooed and undefeated heavy weight. Foster was flattened and disappeered from sight. Lyle remained vertical and actually turned in a rather creditable performance.

title: Africa Unit Said to Meddle In Seychelles Island Affairs
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 10 (AP)The chief minister of the Seychelles island group in the Indian Ocean has accused the Organization of African Unity of interfering in his islands' internal affairs by giving funds to a minority opposition party.

title: 10th Body Found in Rubble Of Building Struck by Jet
description: ALAMEDA, Calif., Feb. 11 (UPI)The authorities reported today that the discovery of a 10th body had accounted for all the persons who lived in a threestory aparment house demolished when a Navy jet smashed into the building last Wednesday night.

title: Miss Gould Swims 1,500 In 16:56.9
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Feb. 11 (UPI)Shane Gould, the Olympic champion from Australia tonight set a world record of 16 minutes 56.9 seconds for the 1,500meter freestyle, lowering her previous mark by 3.7 seconds at the Australian Swiniming Championships.

description: Young & Rubicam International, which got to be the secondlargeit agency domestically without acquiring another agency, is about to change its ways after only 50 years.

title: Flying Laboratory Ready
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Feb. 11 (UPI)A flying laboratory is scheduled to leave for Alaska tomorrow to begin a joint AmericanSoviet project to electronically measure water and atmospheric conditions in the Bering sea. The United States and the Soviet Union will contribute one aircraft and one ship each to the program. The American craft are a Convair 990 airliner and a Coast Guard icebreaker.

title: Clean Air and Autos
description: A Federal court decision in January has given seventeen states, including New York, two additional months to file with the Environmental Protection Agency their plans for reducing air pollution from mobile sources conform to the Clean Air Act. But by the same decision they have lost two years in the time they have to put those plans into effect, the court having rescinded the EPA's extension of that deadline from 1975 to 1977.

title: Uruguayan Navy Joins they Other Rebels
description: MONTEVIDEO. Uruguay, Feb. 11 (Reuters)The Uruguayan Navy tonight joined the army and air force in rebelling against the civilian Government, according to an armed forces communiqu.

title: Rockefeller and Esposito: State's Odd but Tough Couple
description: One of the more intriguing reationships in New York politicsand one that could have considerable impact in the upcoming mayoral race is that of Governor Rockefeller and Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader. Their relations are very friendly and cordial, said a source close to Mr. Rockefeller. The Governot can talk to Meade and Meade's got access to him, said another high ranking Republican. What makes this relationship unusual is not only the party differences but also the differences in background. Mr. Rockefeller is the Governor and a member of one of the wealthiest families in the country. Mr. Esposito is a former bail bondsman and an upfromthestreets politician.

title: SCIENTISTS FEAR SUPERSONIC JETS

title: More Than an Armistice
description: WASHINGTONIn 1973, as in 1962 and 1954, warring parties in Indochina entered into military and political agreements to stop the fighting and move toward a stable peace. For the sake of the longsuffering Vietnamese and other Indochinese people to whose tragic plight we have undeniably contributed and also in our own selfinterest, the United States should take all reasonable steps to reduce the likelihood of a resumption of war.

Gay, 35, of, Sharon. Esther Y. Wong, 44, and William F. Clough, 63, both of Boston, and John L. Kantaros, 24, of Milton, were critically injured. Witnesses said that the plane was attempting an emergency landing in a field during a snow storm when a crosswind flipped it over.

Prices fell and interest rates rose. But Credit when the foreignMarkets exchange markets perceived revived inflation speculators and hedgers stepped up sales of dollars, which wound up in the hands of foreign central banks, which were invested in securities of the United States Treasury.

Among the major commodities exchanges, only the New York Cotton Exchange, the Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange will be open for trading.

The question is whether he will use his renewed mandate to negotiate realistically and flexibly for a new Constitution that will restore workable government for all Cypriotes, the restive Turkish minority as well as the Greek Cypriote majority.

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 11Two 9yearold girls were injured in Belfast tonight by shots from terrorists.

title: Screen: 'Lady Caroline":Sarah Miles Portrays Byron's Admirer The Cast
description: In 1812, in the midst of the extraordinary success of "Childe Harold," Lady Caroline, wife of William Lamb, Lord Melbourne, met and promptly fell in love with the poem's author, Lord Byron. At first excited and later embarassed by the indiscreet ardor of the flamboyant Caroline, Byron found his own passions waning. In 1813, there was a rupture, and in her first novel ("Glenarvon," 1816), she included a satiric portrait of Byron.But years later, when she encountered the poet's funeral procession, she was mentally affected. She died in 1828; never fully recovered according to some, from the passionate attachment that made her famous."England expected an affaire," reads the ad copy; "Caroline gave them history." But all the claims for Robert Bolt's new movie to the contrary, it would be fairer to say that England probably expected nothing much, and Caroline at least gave them (in my dictionary) an affair. Robert Bolt gives us a bit of historythat is, he gives us a corner of the National Portrait Gallery, including Canning (John Mills), George IV (Ralph Richardson) and the Duke of Wellington (Laurence Olivier, in one of his noses). And he also gives some of that intimate historical wisdom on which he has so auspiciously built a career:"I am not a fool of history," says Wellington."Napoleon was," answers Caroline (she has gone to spend the night with him, I mean Wellington, for reasons somewhat obscure)."I mastered him!""You will be remembered for it.""Thankee." (long pause)"Napoleon will be remembered for himself"!In characterizing a film like "Lady Caroline Lamb," I am tempted to go on quoting lines. Let me give in to the temptation:"He writes like a housewife on the verge of the vapors." (Hostilemalereaction to Lord Byron)."He does not mean to write like Alexander Pope!" (Lady Caroline to the defense, neatly mentioning the one poet Byron would in fact mean to write like.)Despite its intimations of authenticity, "Lady Caroline Lamb" is less fact than fiction, with a plot that reads somewhat more like "Ryan's Daughter" (original screenplay by Robert Bolt) than like the true history of Lady Caroline. This would be perfectly acceptable if it weren't that the story Bolt tells is so much less fascinating than the story he ignores, and if he were able to give his story some form beyond the rhetoric of theatrical phrase-making that reduces the text of the movie to an endless succession of curtain lines.As Lady Caroline, Sarah Miles (Mrs Robert Bolt) very much looks the partat least from the one portrait, of Caroline in page's costume, that I have seen. Her pallor is perhaps too waxen, her manner too distracted, but her performance seems to be reaching for a character not realized in the film. Richard Chamberlain is an absurd Byron, but John Finch is a very reticent and feeling William Lambforced to do and say many uninteresting things.Robert Bolt directs (here, for the first time) in the same style in which he writes with the result that every scene, every grouping, every decision behind the camera or at the editing table is immediately effective and ultimately gratuitous. The settings are sumptuous, the costumes lavish, and the productions glossy to a fault. "Lady Caroline Lamb" is to cinema what the coffee-table book is to literature: a heavy but insubstantial irrelevancy. It opened yesterday at the Fine Arts Theater.

title: Red Smith
description: When the baseball players and the men who own them were haggling over the funding of the players' benefit plan last year, the players sought a fouryear agreement because that was the length of the network television contract that produces the funds. The owners insisted on a oneyear deal. It makes no sense, the players said, but if that's how you want it, so be it. Now that capital and labor are at it again, the players have offered to set aside one of the thorniest issues, the reserve clause, for a oneyear study. The owners don't want a oneyear study of the feudal system that gives, them ownership of their employes. They need three years of peace, says their front man, Bowie Kuhn, The players need three years of peace and I need three years of peace. On the owners' terms, that it.

Linsky, a former Massachusetts state legislator and unsuccessful Congressional candidate last year, as Fellows of the Institute for the spring term.
