description: AMER. BASKETBALL ASSN.

title: POLICE SHIFT VIEW ON BACKUP TEAMS
description: The Police Department, which two weeks ago authorized 7,000 additional tours of duty at overtime pay in the wake of two ambush shootings of four policemen, has called off the overtime as an economy measure.

title: Consumers Union Urges Albany To Reject Governor's Drug Plan
description: ALBANY, Feb. 13Consumers Union urged the Legislature today to reject completely Governor Rockefeller's proposed punitive penalties for narcotics pushers and Instead recommended a narcotics maintenance program for addicts on a carefully planned experimental basis.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Court Rebuffs Meskill on BusBill Veto

title: Queens Students to Get A 10c Transit Discount
description: Queensborough Community College students will be able to commute to classes by subway or bus for 25 cents a ride beginning tomorrow afternoon.

title: Casual Legislators Urged
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 13 (UPI) A proposal that would allow members of the Texas House of Representatives to wear turtle neck sweaters and sports shirts without ties instead of coats and ties in the statehouse was sent to a subcommittee for fur. Cher study yesterday.

title: Word of Secret Australian Role In Singapore Causes Sensation
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 13 Prime Minister Gough Whitlam today disclosed that Australian military units in Singapore were engaged in a secret codebreaking operation involving the interception of radio messages throughout Southeast Asia.

title: Chief of Nixon's Guard Is Removed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13The White House disclosed today that the head of President Nixon's Secret Service detail had been removed from his post.

title: Court Halts Bid on A. & P.; G. &W. Plans to Appeal
description: Federal Judge Kevin Thomas Duffy issued a restraining or der yesterday against Gulf and Western Industries, Inc., to stop the company from proceeding with its tender offer for shares of the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company. Gulf and Western said it would appeal the ruling.

title: Foes of L.I. Sound Bridge Win Delay
description: Opponents of the proposed bridge across Long Island Sound won a court battle yesterday when state hearings on the project were blocked by Judge Lloyd F. MacMahon in Federal Court in Manhattan.

title: New Mexico Becomes 27th To Back Equal Rights Plan
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Feb. 13 (UPI)The New Mexico Legislature completed ratification of the equal rights amendment to the Constitution yesterday with a 33to8 vote in the Senate. New Mexico thus became the 27th state to approve the amendment guaranteeing equal rights for women.

title: Pentagon Asks $192Million More for Litton Ships
description: The Defense Department has asked Congress to appropriate $192million more for Litton Industries' costplagued $1billion program to build five LHA amphibious assault ships, Representative Les Aspin disclosed yesterday.

title: People in Sports: Bench Signs for $115,000
description: Johnny Bench got it all back, and more, yesterday. Bench won the National League's most valuable player award in 1970 and earned a reported $90,000 salary for the next year, but he was cut down to $85,000 in 1972 after a 1971 batting slump. Yesterday he signed a oneyear contract as the highest salaried player in the history of the Cincinnati Reds.

title: What Keeps Released Manin Saigon?
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Feb. 14Why did Richard G. Waldhaus stay in Vietnam Monday when the 142 other American prisoners freed by the Communists flew to Clark Air Base in the, Philippines?

title: Devalued Dollar Will Buy Less at Home
description: The devaluation of the dollar means that the American consumer will find his money not going so far as previously in buying both foreign products and domestic goods that either have foreign components or are now more attractive to foreigners.

title: David Lawrence
description: Throughout a career that spanned more than sixty years and ended only with his death, David Lawrence was one of the nation's most highly respected and warmly regarded newspapermen, and it is as such that he would want to be remembered.

title: Primary Dates Set
description: State legislative leaders reached agreement, on holding statewide primaries on June 4 and a runoff primary on June 26 in New York City if none of the candidates for the three citywide offices reach 40 per cent in the first running. Details on Page 45.

title: Foreign Exchange Rates
description: Following are foreign exchange rates and situations in different countries:

title: Standard Poodle Best At Westminster Show
description: A stunning white standard boddle, Ch. Acadia Command Performance, came through with a true command performance at Madison Square Garden last night, as the twoday Westminster Kennel Club event came to a close, when he was named best in show in a field of 3,029 dogs.

title: 1,000 Protesting Transfer at Vailsburg Call for Greater Community Control
description: NEWARK, Feb. 13Nearly 1,000 white parents and students peacefully picketed Vailsburg High School for three hours this morning specifically to protest the transfer of a black disciplinarian and generally to demonstrate for greater community control of neighborhood schools.

title: Colleges experiment With New Ways for Workers and Housewives to Pursue Studies
description: A major effort is under way at colleges and universities across the country to make it easier for working men and women and housewives to earn degrees and the education necessary to upgrade and change careers without disrupting their lifestyles.

title: From Plantation to Law School: She Thinks This Trip Is Necessary
description: SELDEN, L. I.  A high school dropout who picked cotton for 19 of her 34 years, has set a goal that for most people with her background would remain the flimsiest of fantasies: she wants to be a lawyer.

title: DOLLAR DECLINES ON TOKYO MARKET
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Feb. 14 The foreign exchange market, closed since Saturday, reopened today with a surge of dollar trading. The dollar's value dropped quickly, with the yen floating.

title: SAFETY HELD LAX IN 91 MINE DEATHS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13The United States Bureau of Mines said today that a combination of pedestrian company safety practices and obviously deficient Federal safety regulations was responsible for the death by asphyxiation of 91 men in the Sunshine mine at Kellogg, Idaho, last May.

title: KAWAIDA BUILDER WAITS FOR RULING
description: NEWARK, Feb. 13  The builder of the Kawaida Tower housing project, barred by demonstrators yesterday from moving a bulldozer and laborers onto the construction site, announced today that he would make no further effort to continue work while the dispute was before a court.

title: Greece Threatens To Draft Students In Campus Protests
description: ATHENS, Feb. 13The militarybacked Government has threatened what it called student agitators with the immediate loss of their draft deferments in a decree aimed at curbing unrest at universities.

title: Pressure on the Press
description: WASHINGTONIt is my belief that the First Amendment was adopted for two basic reasons. One was to insure that Americans would be politically, intellectually and spiritually free. The other was to make certain that our system of government, a system designed to be responsive to the will of an informed public, would function effectively.

title: Money Situation in Brief
description: THE DOLLAR dropped sharply in limited foreign exchange trading following Monday nights surprise announcement of a 10 per cent devaluation. The decline was about 15 per cent against the Japanese yen, which Tokyo agreed to let float upward to find its own value according to supply and demand. Against the floating Swiss francs, the dollar decline was about 11 per cent. But trading was tentative; and confused, with foreign exchange markets still unsettled and the outlook for currency values still unclear.

title: WARFICK TEACHERS APPROVE CONTRACT
description: Teachers at Warwick; R. I., ratified yesterday a contract agreement ending a nine day strike. St. Louis teachers shouted down a school board offer of an $800 annual pay increase and kept their strike going.

title: Knicks Plunge Into Real Race
description: The true pennant race in the National Basketball Association cuts across division lines, and the New York Knicks, who face the Chicago Bulls at Madison Square Garden tonight, are about to plunge into the thick of it. The race is for the best wonlost record during the regular season. The prize that goes with it is money (an extra $30,000 to split up) and the more important right to the odd home game in every playoff series.

title: JAMES R. BONNAR, 66; LED GAF PURCHASING
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., Feb. 13James R. Bonnar, retired corporate director of purchasing for the GAF Corporation, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital. He was 66 years old.

title: People and Business
description: After spending 21 years with CocaCola and PepsiCola in his native Canada, Robert C. Hollingsworth came to the United States in 1971 to join the Royal Crown Cola Company as international marketing manager. Royal Crown opened 34 new ironchised bottling plants outside of the United States in the last two years and yesterday Mr. Hollingsworth was rewarded with the title of president of the company's international operation. XU

title: Yugoslavia Frees American Jailed for Activities in U.S.I
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 13 (UPI)Yugoslavia has freed a United States citizen imprisoned for seven months for alleged antiYugoslav activities in the United States, officials of the United States Embassy said today.

title: CHURH UNIT SAYS PRESS IS ATTACKED
description: An arm of the National Council of Churches charged the Nixon Administration yesterday with having made an unprecedented attack on freedom of the press as guaranteed by the First Amendment.

title: Advertising: Interpublic Dream
description: Thanks to its acquisition in November of CampbellEwald, the Interpublic Group of Companies is fast becoming the $1billion communications company Marion Harper, its founder, dreamed of and promised.

title: General Telephone Reports New Highs In Earnings for '72
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday nevi high in revenues and sales, net income and share earnings for 1972. Leslie E. Warner, chairman and chief executive officer said that following the strong growth of 1971, the 1972 results were particularly gratifying.

title: LATE FUND REPORTS FILED BY 2 PARTIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP) The General Accounting Ofifce reported today that the campaign organizations of President Nixon, and Senator George McGovern failed to report within 48 hours a series of large contributions received in the last 12 days of the 1972 Presidential campaign.

title: Net and Revenue at First Boston Drop in 4th Quarter and Year
description: Net income of the First Boston Corporation for the three months ended Dec. 31 totaled $3.1million, or 98 cents per share of capital and Class A capital stock. This compared with a net of $4.7million, or $1.43, for the similar period of 1971, adjusted for a 2for1 stock split in April, 1972, Total revenues for the latest quarter were $20.3million compared with $24.9million in the corresponding 1971 period.

title: Steel Workers Vote
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 13 (UPI)Steel workers across the United States and Canada went to the polls today to vote for their union's top officers. I. W. Abel, president of the 1.4 millionmember United Steelworkers of America, and SecretaryTreasurer Walter J. Burke were unopposed in bids for their third fouryear terms.

title: GIANTS IN JERSEY
description: They will be called the Jersey Giants and, they plan to play 18 to 30 Airierican Basketball Association games next season in a refurbished Jersey City Armory, with others in New Haven and perhaps a couple in Madison Square Garden.

title: Work on S.I. Tank Could Have Ignited Plastic Liner
description: Normal repair techniques used on the plastic liner inside the empty Staten Island liquefiedgas storage tank that burned Saturday, killing 40 workers, could have caused the liner to burst into flames, a spokesman for the company that built it said yesterday.

title: Soviet Asserts U.S. Has Failed to Ease Crisis in Currency
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 13  The Soviet Union, which is expected to profit considerably from the devaluation of the American dollar, asserted today that the American move had neither relieved the currency crisis nor removed the danger of a meriless trade war involving the United States, Western Europe and Japan.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: CAMBODIANS HINT Al ROLE FOR REDS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 13 (Reuters)  Official sources said today that the Govcnment had decided in principle to offer the Communists role in countrywide elections as part of an overall settlement of the war in Cambodia.

title: North Korea Is Said to Ask Its Case Be Aired in Peking
description: PEKING, Feb. 13 (Reuters)Diplomats in the Chinese capital said today that they believed North Korea had, asked Chinese leaders to present its case this week to Henry A. Kissinger for a complete American troop withdrawal from South Korea.

title: Sports Today
description: St. John's at Syracuse, 8 P.M. (Radio  WRVR 8 P.M.); Hunter at Pace, 8 P.M.

title: News Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 14, 1973
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Devalued Dollar Will Buy Less at Home
description: The devaluation of the dollar means that the Americari con, sumer will find his money not going so far as previously in buying tuitli foreign products and domestic goods that either have foreign components or are now more attractive to foreigners.

title: Devaluation Unlikely to Balk Tourists
description: The dollar devaluation is not expected to deter Americans from going overseas this year, although their money will buy less than it did in the past.

title: Woman and Friend Held in 3 Slayings; Her Father Victim
description: JAMESTOWN, N. Y., Feb. 13 (AP)A Jamestown woman and a man said to be her boyfriend were arrested today in Detroit and charged with murder in the rifleslaying of her father, her stepmother and her stepsister.

title: The New Ali Sounds Moreand More Like the Old Clay
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Feb. 13Whatever the reason, Muhammad All has been acting like Cassius Clay in approaching tomorrow night's 12round bout with Joe Bugner of England.

title: Children Learn That Adding Flour to Water Equals Dough
description: CLOSTER, N. J.Humpty Dumpty, Jack Homer and Miss Muffet are more familiar names than James Beard and Julia Child to some unusual chefs here who, as a matter of fact, can cook and bake but can't read or write.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: ExPrisoners Rushing for Gifts, Ice Cream and Home
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Philippines, Wednesday, Feb. 14 The first two returned war prisoners departed for the United States last night and another planeload of about 20 were scheduled to leave for home today. Meanwhile the men who were released by the Vietnamese Communists on Monday were treated to beer, banana splits, a movie and a shopping trip to the base exchange.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: TARIFF LAW IS AIM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 President Nixon said today that ate United States must have power to raise trade barriers as well as lower them to gain a fairer shake for American business in world trade.

title: Bostonian Indicted In Death of Woman From Westchester
description: CAMBRIDGE, Feb. 13A 33yearold Boston man was indicted on murder and kidnapping charges today in the death of Damans Synge Gillispie, 22, a Boston University student.

title: FARMSTEAD HONEY WINNER BY A NOSE
description: YONKERS, Feb. 13  Farmstead Honey, splendidly driven by Carmine Abbatiello, won by a nose from Joanie's Romeo equally well handled by Norman Dauplaise, at Yonkers Raceway tonight in the second division of the YonkersRoosevelt Hopeful pacing series of 3and 4yearolds.

title: Bar Votes Against NoFault Automobile Insurance
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 13The American Bar Association voted decisively today against Federal or state enactment of system of nofault automobile insurance, a move that would abolish the thousands of negligence lawsuits that now result from highway accidents.

title: Friday Deadline Set for Airport Guards
description: The Federal agency asserted yesterday that virtually alt United States airports would be able to have guards in place by Friday morning. The airport association agreed in general but contended that police manpower would be strectched so thin at some communities that they would be unable to keep up adequate airport staffing for long.

title: Biltmore Night: Manager Slain; 3 Panicky Holdup Men Sought
description: Four employes of the Biltmore Hotel sorted through police identification files yesterday in an attempt to come up with suspects in the earlymorning slaying of the hotel's night manager.

title: Records: Black Music
description: Two films dealing with black music opened recently accompanied by the release of their soundtrack albums. The most unique, from the West Indies, The Harder They Come (Mango Records SMAS 7400, $5.98), which is from what is probably the first film made about reggae music (reggae is rock and soul music filtered through Jamaican eyes and ears). The other film soundtrack is Wattstaxthe Living Word (Stax Records STS 2 3010, $6.98) taken from a filmed concert last year at the Los Angeles Coliseum to commemorate the seventh anniversary of the Watts Riots.

title: BigBusiness Budget
description: WASHINGTONWith a deft political touch, the President has submitted a budget to Congress designed to capitalize on citizen discontent with government.

title: Notes on People
description: The White House Press Office is now able to speak fluently in six languages, all from the tongue of Andrew T. Falkiewicz, who was born 43 years ago in Poland and has been working for, the United States Information Agency for 17 years. Mr. Falkiewicz, a UnitedStates citizen since 1954, speaks English, Polish, Czech, German, French and Russian fluently. His White House duties, which he assumed last month, include dealing with the 1,000 foreign correspondents300 of them in Washingtonwho work in this country. His salary is about $30,000 a year. He was said to have been discovered by Ronald L. Zeigler, the White House Press Secretary, while working at the American Embassy in Moscow during President Nixon's visit there last year.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: SPACE OBSERVATORY ENDS 51MONTH LIFE
description: The first successful Orbiting Astronomical Observatory, until last August the heaviest and most sophisticated unmanned satellite launched by the United States, ended its 51month life late yesterday and continued orbiting the earth as, two tons of dead electronic gear.

title: Women Tennis Players Find Love at First Site
description: Feminist politics took center court at the Seventh Regiment Armory last night as Billie Jean King starred in a series of tennis exhibitions to raise funds for the National and Manhattan Women's Political Caucuses.

title: Money Rates Rise a Bit as Bond Levels Plummet
description: Devaluation of the dollar acted as a doubleedged sword on interest rates yesterday.

title: Intermarriages Up 63% In '60's, Census Reports
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13  A special Census Bureau report on marriage, released today, shows a 63 per cent increase during: the nineteensixties in marriage between whites and members of minority groups.

title: 6 TexasBased Companies Ordered to Reduce prices
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP) the Cost of Living Council announced today that six Texasbased companies, one of which owns several Las Vegas clubs, had agreed or been ordered to reduce prices because of violations of the Phase economic gidelines.

title: Who Buys Time For Whom?
description: WASHINGTONThis has become a kind of Middle East period for the White House. King Hussein of Jordan visited President Nixon last week to stress that, with the Vietnam war over and both Moscow and Peking playing up to Washington, it is time for a fresh United States initiative. And Israel's Goida Meir arrives in just over a fortnight.

title: Hanoi, in a Surprise Move, To Free 20 in a Few Days
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13North Vietnam, in what appears to be a goodwill gesture, has agreed to release 20 more American prisoners of war within the next few days, the Pentagon announced today. The decision to release the prisoners ahead of schedule was linked by a Pentagon spokesman to Henry A. Kissinger's visit to Hanoi over the weekend.

title: Procaccino Sues on Runoff
description: Former Controller Mario A. Procaccino sued yesterday to have the planned runoff primary in New York City declared unconstitutional on the ground, among others, that it discriminates against poor guys like me.

title: Books of The Times
description: SOVIET CRITICISM OF AMERICAN LITERATURE IN THE SIXTIES. An Anthology. Edited and translated by Carl R. Proffer. 213 pages. Ardis, Ann Arbor, Mich. $8.95.

title: Oklahoma Primary Barred
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 13 (UPI) The Oklahoma House, defeated a bill yesterday, 39 to 37, that, would have established a Presidential primary election in the state.

title: Gen. Alvan C. Gillem Jr., 85, Commander of 3d Army, Dies
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Feb. 13 (AP)Lieut. Gen. Alvan C. Gillem Jr., who served in the 1960's as executive director of the National Foundation of the March of Dimes, died in an Atlanta hospital today. He was 85 years old.

title: In Currency Comparison, Drop Is Seen as 5 to 7%
description: The United States dollar dedined in a nervous and uncertain foreign exchange market in New York. Because of the unsettled market conditions, bankers were unable to provide a precise estimate of the drop in the external value of the United States currency.

title: COURT HNES FORD $7MILLION IN SUIT ON POLLUTION TEST
description: DETROIT, Feb. 13The Ford Motor Company was fined $7million today by a judge of the United States District Court here on charges that some of its employes had tampered with engines to make thm pass Federal air pollution standards.

title: Convention Center Model
description: Depicted as a triumph of design, a source of needed revenue and a symbol of civic pride, the $200million New York City Convention and Exhibition Center was unveiled in architectural mockup yesterday.

title: Supreme Court Dismisses Last 2 Tombs Revolt Cases
description: Over the strenuous objection of the Manhattan District Attorney's office, Supreme Court Justice Xavier C. Riccobono dismissed the last two cases stemming from the 1970 rebellion in the Manhattan House of Detention, known as the Tombs.

title: FLAG AT FULL STAFF TODAY FOR CAPTIVES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP) President Nixon ordered today that all flags be raised to full staff tomorrow to honor returning prisoners of war and American casualties in Vietnam.

title: 39 ARRESTED HERE IN COLLEGE PROTEST
description: Thirtyeight students and a faculty member at Manhattan Community College, at 134 51st Street, were arrested yesterday on charges of criminal trespass when they took over the outer office of the institution's president, Dr. Edgar D. Draper.

title: Colts Raise Prices $1
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 13 (AP)The Baltimore Colts announced a $1 acrosstheboard increase in ticket prices today for home gamen in Memorial Stadium.

title: Frisch's Condition Critical; Vital Signs Called Unstable
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Feb. 13 (UPI)Frankie Frisch remained in critical condition tonight at Wilmington Medical Center with his vital signs unstable, according to a hospital spokesman. Frisch, 74 years old, was seriously injured in a car wreck near Elkton, Md., Thursday, and suffered broken back bones and internal injuries.

title: ExMayor of Atlantic City Admits Shakedown Guilt
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Feb. 13 (AP) Former Mayor Richard Jackson of Atlantic City admitted in United States District Court here today that he had been involved in a scheme to shake down contractors who did business with the city.

title: BOLD US. ACTION HAILED IN BRITAIN
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 13 Western Europe today considered the second devaluation of the dollar in 14 months good news.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 43

title: Brew Buying Franchises
description: Steak & Brew, which started with one store on 12th Street and has now grown to 45 units, 36 of which are companyowned and nine franchised, is beginning to buy back the franchises. The latest unit reacquired is that at Madison Avenue and 79th Street. In August, another franchised operation in Ft. Lauderdale, Fla., was bought back. A spokesman for the company said that it was hoped that eventually all the franchises would be bought back.

title: LIMITED IMPACT SEEN ON IMPORTS
description: Optimism vied with skepticism in comments of foreign traders yesterday on how effective the new currency values would be in reducing growing the United States trade deficit that last year exceeded $6billion.

title: DOLLAR'S PRICE OFF
description: LONDON, Feb. 13Amid confusion and uncertainty, and with most of the world's foreignexchange markets still closed, the newly devalued United States dollar began rnoving downward against most other currencies today.

title: Uruguay Pact Assures Military Control
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 13  Uruguay's armed forces have assumed virtual control of the Government but will remain in the background and preserve the constitutional system. This is the general tenor of the agreement reached yesterday between President Juan Maria Bordaberry and the military commanders after weeklong governmental crisis.

title: ARGUMENT DELAYED AT VESCO HEARING
description: Judge Charles E. Stewart Jr. adjourned argument in Federal District Court here yesterday until Friday on the appointment of a temporary equity receiver to control the assets of the International Controls Corporation, an electronics company formerly headed by Robert L. Vesco.

title: FAULKNER'S FURY ISSUED IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOWFor the first time, and after what was reportedly a considerable behindthescenes argument, William Faulkner's classic novel, The Sound and the Fury, has been published in the Soviet Union.

title: VIETNAMESE SIDES TRADE PRISONERS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Feb. 14The Saigon Government and the Communists exchanged 1,021 more prisoners of war yesterday on a battered metal airstrip in the little town of Loc Ninh, 77 miles north of here.

title: ARENTCURB BILL VOTED IN TRENTON
description: TRENTON, Feb. 13A controversial measure that would enable New Jersey communities to adopt local rent control laws received initial legislative approval in the Assembly this evening.

title: TARIFF LAW IS AIM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13President Nixon said today that the United States must have power to raise trade barriers as well as lower them to gain A fairer shake for American business in world trade.

title: Reading Loss $20.1Million
description: The bankrupt Reading Railroad reported yesterday a $20.1million net loss for 1972. In 1971, the road had a $11.5million net loss.

title: Cuba Emigres Hold Arts Festival Here
description: Domingo Pouble, a small man in a Chesterfield overcoat, was saying that the Problem was language. He had been a painter and a proFessor of art in Havana, he said, but now he has been reduced to giving only a few Private lessons now and then.

title: The Dollar Devalued
description: The dramatic action of President Nixon in devaluing the dollar for the second time in fourteen months has at least temporarily succeeded in extinguishing the fires of the international monetary crisis. Coupled with the agreement of Japan to float the yen and of major European countries not to offset the dollar devaluation, the American move, sets the staga for what could be a fundamental reorientation and liberalization of trade and financial policies among the nations of the free world.

title: Winning an Election Gets Man Back on the Track
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 13He was eating high on the hog in 196870, winning the biggest stockcar races and $100,000 to $137,000 a year. Then his world collapsed when the Ford factory withdrew from NASCAR competition at the end of 1970, stranding Cale Yarborough and other Ford contract drivers. In 197172 Yarborough took a crack at the United States Auto Club championship circuit, but that venture foundered on mediocre equipment and worse luck. Then, last fall, two good things happened to Cale Yarborough: He was elected to the County Council of Florence County, S. C., the first Republican to win there in a century, and Junior, Johnson offered him a good ride. There are few stockcar rides better than Johnson's.

title: 9 PENTAGON AIDES VISIT F14 PLANT
description: CALVERTON, L. I., Feb. 13 Nine senior Department of Defense officials, including the new Deputy Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of the Navy, flew to the Grumman test facilities here today to discuss the controversial F14 project with senior officials of the Grumman Aerospace Corporation.

title: Newspaper Devotes Issue to Censorship
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Feb. 13 (UPI)Bannered across the front page of The Pottstown Mercury today were the words Censorship  it's Here.

title: REACTIONS TO STEP ARE VARIED IN U.S.
description: Businessmen, economists add labor leaders yesterday viewed the devaluation of the dollar with mixed feelings.

title: ExPrisoners Rushing for Gifts Ice Cream and Home
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Philippines, Wednesday, Feb. 14 The first two returned war prisoners departed for the United States last night and another planeload of about 20 were scheduled to leave for home today. Meanwhile the men who were released by the Vietnamese Communists on Monday were treated to beer banana splits, a movie and a shopping trip to the base exchange.

title: Be Quiet or Be Fined, S.I. Ferry Riders Told
description: The city came out strongly yesterday for the right to. peace and quiet on Staten Island ferryboats.

title: Business Briefs
description: American Air Drops Concorde Options

title: School Fire Allegedly Set by a Pupil And Fatal to 21 Stirs a French Debate
description: PARIS, Feb. 13A controversy that has gripped all of France and made her examine her conscience is raging far beyond the central event that set it offa Paris school fire a week ago in which 21 persons, most of them children, perished.

title: With an Eye on Details, Fashion Turns Its Attention to Summer
description: Nobody's telling you to give all your clothes to Good: will Industries and start from scratch. Fashion isn't up to such shenanigans at the moment.

title: Losey to Film Remembrance
description: LONDON, Feb. 13Joseph Losey, sunk into the black sofa and looking as bulky and tired as a beached whale, pushed across the manuscript, a dipper designed to gather up a river of time.

title: DOLLAR'S PRICE OFF
description: LONDON, Feb. 13Amid confusion and uncertainty, and with most of the world's foreignexchange markets still closed, the newly devalued United States dollar began moving downward against most other currencies today.

title: Watanabe on Guitar Performs in Debut Almost Flawlessly
description: To the fastgrowing ranks of superior young classic guitar technicians, please add the name of Norihiko Watanabe. Mr. Watanabe, a 25yearold Japanese, made his New York debut Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall with a program of standard virtuoso pieces, and he played them almost flawlessly.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Hogan Concedes Gambling's Role

title: Miller's Role in Base Criticized
description: Commissioner Bowie Kuhn lashed out at Marvin Miller yesterday, accusing the players' representative in baseball's second annual playerowner confrontation of deliberately trying to create confusion in the minds of the clubs, players and public regarding the status of the negotiations.

title: The Crisis: A Week of Flying and Phoning
description: BONN, Feb. 13Four weeks ago Egon Bahr, chief aide of Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany, returned from a trip to Washington and told his colleagues that the Americans are thinking about devaluation.

title: SILVER PRICES UP, TRADING IS HEAVY
description: The devaluation of the dollar affected many commodity prices yesterday.

title: Convention Center Model Unveiled Here With Pride
description: Depicted as a triumph of design, a source of needed revenue and a symbol of civic pride, the $200million New York City Convention and Exhibition Center was unveiled in architectural mock up yesterday.

title: HANS GLOM DIES; AIDE TO ADENAUER
description: BONN, Feb. 13  Dr. Hans Globke, the controversial top aide and personal friend of former Chancellor Konrad Adenauer, died after a long illness at his home here today. He was 74 years old.

title: ROLE OF ELLSBERG IS CALLED SPECIAL
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 13 The defense in the Pentagon papers trial set out today to show that Daniel Elliberg was not only authorized to use the papers but that he also bad a special relationship to them that went well beyond Government authorization.

title: Late Celtic Foul Shots Subdue Bulls, 105 to 101
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 13 (UPI) Dave Cowens and John Havlicek dropped two free throws each in the final 58 second tonight to break A. tie and give the Boston, Celtics a 105101 victory over the Chicago Bulls in a National Basketball Association game.

title: ExAtlantic City Mayor Admits Shakedown Guilt
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Feb. 13 (AP) Former Mayor Richard Jackson of Atlantic City admitted in United States District Court here today that he had been involved in a scheme to shake down contractors who did business with the city.

title: Soviet Olympic Champion Five Is Set for U.S. Tour in Spring
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 13 (AP) The Soviet basketball team, which won the gold medal and handed the United States its first defeat ever in Olympic play last year, will tour the United States for a series of games, the Amateur Athletic Union said today. One game is scheduled for May 7 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Terms of Money Market Explained for Layman
description: With increasing frequency economic affairs of the modern industrial world are jolted by recurring monetary crises. Foreign exchange trading flares up and currency markets are closed down. Stock and bond prices go through wide jiggles. The man in the street gets worried and wonders what it all means. Here are some explanations:

title: Rights Commission Urges Fair Employment Unit to Act on Government Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has been urged to move promptly to enforce antidiscrimination laws in state and local government employment, a new responsibility of the commission.

title: North Carolina State Captures 20th
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Feb. 13 (UPI)David. Thompson reeled off 33 points tonight as unbeaten North Carolina State romped to its 20th victory of the season beating East Carolina, 10570.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Feb. 14, 1973 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pru Devon of WQXR Dies; Led Latin America Program
description: Mrs. Prunella Bodkin Godfrey, who as Pru Devon conducted a program of LatinAmerican folk and popular music on radio station WQXR from 1948 to her retirement in 1971, died yesterday in New York Hospital. She was the wife of Gilbert H. Godfrey, a news editor with United Press International, and lived at 43 Fifth Avenue.

title: SUPERMARKET COSTS EXPECTED TO CLIMB
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (UPI) Despite a flurry of recent White House moves to stem food inflation, 1973 supermarket prices will average 6 to 6.5 per cent above the 1972 level, in the sharpest oneyear increase in 22 years, the Agriculture Department predicted togy.

title: A.E.C. to Cut 2,110 Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP) Manpower reductions totaling 2,110 scientific and other employes at five major Atomic Energy Commission plants will be made between now and the end of June, the A.E.C. said today.

title: Kissinger Making Stop in Hong Kong Before Peking Talks
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 13Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser for national security, arrived here today, for two days of rest between visits to Hanoi and Peking.

title: PENN CENTRAL ASKS TO CURTAIL SERVICE
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad filed petitions yesterday with the Federal District Court in Philadelphia seeking authority to abandon service on 5,000 miles of the system's 20,000 miles of line and to discontinue operating passenger train service for which it was not fully compensated.

title: MRS. PAUL J. NEWLON
description: Mrs. Marjorie Smith Newlon, wife of Paul J. Newlon, a lawyer here, died of leukemia yesterday in New York Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived on Old Stone Hill Road in Pound Ridge, N.Y.

title: BROWN IS PLACED AT HOLDUP SCENE
description: Roger Jenkins, who was chefcook at the Red Carpet Lounge on Oct. 16, 1971, when that West Side bar was held up by four or five armed men, testified yesterday in State Supreme Court. He pointed at H. Rap Brown, the black militant, seated with three codefendants.

title: Red Smith
description: For a long time there have been doubts in this corner about the importance of playing the national anthem to dignify fixed fights, crooked horse races, dumped roundball games or thrown World Series. Not every American shares this view, however, as Jesse P. Abramson can testify. Mr. Abramson, director of the animal United States Olympic Invitational track meet, opened a can of worms recently when he remarked that it might be wise to omit The StarSpangled Banner from the program in Madison Square Garden next Friday night. Now Jesse Abramson is at least as patriotic as Nathan Hale and it was regard for his country and its institutions that motivated him. He felt it was inviting disrespect for both the anthem and the singer to open the show with the hymn while the customers were trooping into the hall, or to close it while they rushed for the Long Island Rail Road. And to use the anthem as windowdressing for the 1,500meter run struck him as downright bad taste.

title: U.S. Says Pact With Cuba To Curb Hijackingh Is Near
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 13The United States has virtually concluded an agreement with Cuba aimed at Curbing the hijacking of aircrafe and ships between the two countries, Administraton officials said today.

title: TAX REFORM DRIVE OPENED BY HARRIS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 Former Senator, Fred B. Harris of Oklahoma announced, today a mass organizational approach to Federal tax reform, hoping to revive Populist issue that failed to ignite his campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination last year.

title: Owners' Salary Arbitration Proposal
description: In presenting a new proposal to the Players' Association last week, the owners' negotiating committee included a provision for salary arbitration, an offer the owners termed historic.

title: VAN DILLEN GAINS 62 64 TRIUMPH
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Feb. 13 (AP)Erik Van. Dillen, the 21yearold Californian, advanced to the quarterfinals of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis circuit tournament today with a 62 64 triumph over Graham Stilwell of Britain.

title: Prisoner Flabbergasted By News From Home
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Phillipines, Feb. 13 (AP)There was general sympathy here today for one former prisoner of war who, after calling his wife in the United States, was said to have walked down a hospital corridor saying, My God, she did it, she did it, she did it.

title: PHILIP BADGER, 81, EXHEAD OF N.C.A.A.
description: DENVER, Feb. 13Philip O. Badger, professor emeritus of marketing at New York University and a former president of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, died on Saturday after a prolonged illness. He was 81 years old.

title: Chief of Nixon's Guard Is Removed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13The White House disclosed today that the head of President Nixon's Setret Service detail had been removed from his post.

title: Man Robs 4 Girls in Wel In Midtown and Rapeslne
description: A prowler who invaded the 11thfloor room occupied by four teenaged girls in a West Side hotel early yesterday, robbed them of $28 and then raped one of the girls in a nearby stairwell as the others cowered in fear in their room, the police reported.

title: PECHTL IS VICTOR IN GIANT SLALOM
description: ZWIESEL, West Germany, Feb. 13 (AP)Joseph Pechtl of Austria won the giant slalom today in 2 minutes 20.78 seconds, while Werner Mattle of Switzerland, an Olympic bronze medal winner, was second in the race that counts toward the European Cup.

title: U.S. Says Pact With Cuba To Curb Hijacking Is Near
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13The United States has virtually, concluded an agreement with Cuba aimed at curbing the hijacking of aircraft and ships between the two countries, Nixon Administration officials said today.

title: Tams Overcome Nets, 95 to 93, On Neumann's Shot at Buzzer
description: MEMPHIS, Feb. 13Johnny Neumann's 10foot bank shot at the buzzer gave the Memphis Tams a 9593 victory over the New York Nets tonight in the American Basketball Association.

title: Copper Range Lifts Its Domestic Prices By 3 Cents a Pound
description: The Coppper Range Company said yesterday it was increasing its basic domestic copper price by 3 cents a pound to 55 cents, effective today. This would follow a general industry increase of 2.5 cents a pound effected in early January by major domestic producers. Industry sources indicated that yesterday's action by Copper Range was expected to trigger a fresh round of price rise throughout the industry.

title: Indians Who Live in Rapid City Hope Violence Will Lead to Improvement
description: RAPID CITY, S. D., Feb. 13 Alberta Firethunder lives on Crazy Horse Street in the Sioux Addition, a collection of perhaps 100 shacks and improvised small houses about four miles from town. The city purchased the property 20 years ago to induce the Indians to move out of town.

title: Washington Hotels Offer Entire Floor To Nonsmokers Only
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13Nonsmokers have a new hero today. His name is J. Willard Marriott, and he is offering an entire floor of rooms in three of the hotels he owns here to nonsmokers only.

title: New News Hearings Set
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (UPI) More than three dozen witnesses are scheduled to testify before a Senate subcommittee as a new round of hearings on bills to shield newsmen from forced disclosure of confidential sources begins next week.

title: Nixons Take a Stroll And Then Have Feast
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP)President and Mrs. Nixon took a threeblock stroll tonight and ate Chinese dinner. They were accompanied by their soninlaw and younger daughter, Mr. and Mrs. David Eisenhower, and the President's longtime friend C. G. Rebozo.

title: Summaries at Westminster Show
description: Breed Winners

title: Albany Settles on Primary Dates: Pule 4, With Ruoff on the 26th
description: ALBANY, Feb. 13The Republican and Democratic legislative leaders, with Governor Rockefeller's approval, finally settled today on dates for the statewide primary in the spring and for a runoff primary in New York City if it is needed.

title: The Theater: El CocaCola Grande
description: Normally critics never respond publicly at the theater  after all we give at the office. At one time I laughed, snarled, giggled, sneered, but then found that people seemed to be watching mepresumably backers and the rest of the angelic hordesand this was discouraging. So now, like most of my fellow critics, my response is as placid as a dead fish on a cold slab. Normally.

title: Hanoi, in a Barprise Move, To Free 20 in a Few Days
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13North Vietnam, in what appears to be a goodwill gesture, has agreed to release 20 more American prisoners of war within the next few days, the Pentagon announced today. The decision to release the prisoners ahead of schedule was linked by a Pentagon spokesman to Henry A. Kissinger's visit to Hanoi over the weekend.

title: Subways Getting First Woman Motorman
description: A year or so from now, Marion McAllister of Hollis Park Gardens, Queens, may be the only woman in the city who is guaranteed a seat in a crowded subway train.

title: Times Picks Aide to Sunday Editor
description: The appointment of Jack Rosenthal as an assistant Sunday editor was announced yesterday by Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, president and publisher of The New York Times.

title: BOULEZ CONDUCTS THE PHILADELPHIANS
description: The good subscribers to the Philadelphia Orchestra concerts in Philharmonic Hall heard Pierre Boulez conduct the ensemble for the first time on Monday night. They were given program of five 20thcentury masterpieces that are standard in his repertory, but not in the Philadelphians'.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Confers With Separatists
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 13The elderly men sat on separate beds, puffing cigarettes and speaking softly. We have seen the Prime Minister, said P. Basi Reddy, a frail man who is a senior leader from Andhra Pradesh. She is aware of our situation.

title: Attack at Drew Is Third on Campus Since December
description: MADISON, Feb. 13The attack on a Drew University dean by three masked assailants yesterday was the third assault on the 150acre campus since December.

title: Town Hall Concert Is Opening Event In WNYC Festival
description: Radio station WYNC began its 34th annual American Music Festival with an orchestral concert Monday night at Town Halt. The selection of pieces was a rather odd one, and the performances sounded a bit spotty, but there was intermittent pleasure to be derived from the proceedings.

title: Newburgh Policeman Guilty
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 13 (UPI)  Anthony Paonessa, a 35  year  old suspected Newburgh police lieutenant, pleaded guilty today to a charge of petit larceny in State Supreme Court in White Plains. Paonessa was the 13th of the 16 persons indicted in the theft of money recovered in a gambling raid to plead guilty.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Pacific Gas and Electric Company yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed offering of 4,072,409 common shares for subscription by its shareholders on the bases of one new share for each 15 shares of record March 6. Subscription rights will expire March 27. Blyth Eastman Dillon and Dean: Witter, & Co. are joint managers of the underwriting group that will purchase common stock not subscribed through the rights offering. The company's stock closed unchanged at 29 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: MRS. RICHARD WYCKOFF
description: Mrs. Alma Weisse Wyckoff, widow of Richard D. Wyckoff, a writer on the stock market who founded The Magazine of Wall Street, died Monday in a Waterbury (Conn.) hospital. She was 81 years old and had lived at 220 Madison Avenue.

title: A. RAYMOND MILLER
description: A Raymond Miller, a retired executive with the International Business Machines Corporation and a vice president of the Westchester Kennel Club, died last night in St. Clare's Hospital after having suffered a heart attack. He was 78 years old and lived on High Point Terrace in Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Pathmark Freezes Some Food Prices
description: Pathmark Supermarkets, one of metropolitan New York's three largest food chains, will freeze prices of about 400 grocery and other products for the next 60 days.

title: Cordero Notches 3 Winners at Hialeah
description: MIAMI, Feb. 13To the many New Yorkers in the crowd of 14,123 at warm and sunny Hialeah today, the racing program was just like home three winners for Cordero, the smiling Puerto Rican reinsman who has a strong following in Gotham, or anywhere else he competes. He leads the riders at the current meeting, his accomplishments today raising his scores to 27, well ahead of the runnerup, Jorge Velasquez. For those who do not know Cordero's first name is Angel.

title: Jersey ExAide Guilty
description: Richard Jackson, a former Mayor of Atlantic City, pleaded guilty in Federal Court in Camden to charges that he was involved in a scheme to shake down contractors who did business with the city. Details on Page 45.

title: Weyerhaeuser Net Rises
Boit Replaces Wottle In Garden 1,500 Race
description: Mike Boit, 24year old Kenyan Olympian studying at Eastern New Mexico University, has been added to the 1,500meters run in the Olympic Invitation track meet Friday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Amex and OTC Stocks Soar On Devaluation and Then Fall
description: The United States dollar devaluation triggered a big advance in early trading on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday, but quotations had retreated to less spectacular levels by the end of the session.

title: Nixon on Radio Today To Talk on Resources
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP)President Nixon asked today for network radio time to make a midday broadcast tomorrow on natural resources and the environment, the subject of the next in his series of State of the Union Messages.

title: Saving the Railroads
description: A favorite fadeout scene in the serialized Perils of Pauline used to show the heroine bound to the railroad tracks while a speeding steam engine bore down on her, its overstrained brakes seemingly incapable of stopping the train in time. Now it is not Pauline but the railroads themselves that are constantly perched on the edge of doomfrom strikes or financial ruinwith the audience in perpetual suspense over whether rescue will come at all.

title: The Quality of JusticeI
description: One man's justice is another man's injustice, wrote Emerson a century ago. Today New York's courts and services have become inadequate, depersonalized and therefore unjust.

title: WRECK IS CLEARED FROM PENNSY LINE
description: YONKERS, Feb. 13  Penn Central crews worked through the night and cleared 23 de railed freight cars from two or the four Hudson Division track in time for this morning's rush hour.

title: Money Situation in Brief
description: THE DOLLAR dropped sharply in limited foreign exchange trading following Monday night's surprise announcement of a 10 per cent devaluation. The decline was about 15 per cent against the Japanese yen, which Tokyo agreed to let float upward to find its own value according to supply and demand. Against the floating Swiss francs, the dollar decline was about 11 per cent. But trading was tentative and confused, with foreign exchange markets still unsettled and the outlook for currency values still unclear.

title: FLYERS TROUNCE ISLANDERS BY 82
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 13 (AP)Rick MacLeish scored a club record of four goals to lead the Philadelphia Flyers to an 82 victory over the New York Islanders in an National Hockey League game tonight.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: John J. Kenny Loses Trial Delay Plea

title: School Board Is Pressing Hunt for New Chancellor
description: Even though the Board of Education has received no word on whether Dr. Harvey B. Scribner will, as directed, go on terminal vacation April 1, it is hoping to have a new Chancellor take over on that date.

title: COURT FINES FORD $7MILLIION IN SUIT ON POLLUTION TEST
description: DETROIT, Feb. 13The Ford Motor Company was fined $7million today by a judge of the United States District Court here on charges that some of its employes had tampered with engines to make them pass Federal air pollution standards.

title: KARMA BUILDER WAITS FOR RULING
description: NEWARK, Feb. 13  The builder of the Kawaida Towers housing project, barred by demonstrators yesterday from moving a bulldozer and laborers onto the construction site, announced today that he would make no further effort to continue work while the dispute was before a court.

title: NOFAULT SIGNED BY ROCKEFELLER
description: ALBANY, Feb. 13Squinting under television floodlights, Governor Rockefeller signed the modified nofault auto insurance bill today as an allRepublican phalanx of legislative leaders watched beamingly.

title: Sao Paulo Is Setting a Growth Record, and Its Problems Keep Pace
description: SAO PAULO, BrazilDawn breaks and finds Sao Paulo, still working/Sao Paulo, which doesn't know how to sleep/All through the night the Icily keeps thinking/About the things it will do in the day.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Profit Taking Sharp Stock
description: Stock prices rose sharply in tumultuous trading early yesterday in the market's initial reaction to the dollar devaluation, but profit taking pared gains markedly during the afternoon.

title: City Will Move Disturbed Prisoners to Queens Jail
description: Thirteen hours after a prisoner was killed by a fellow inmate in the psychiatric cellblock of the Manhattan House of Detention for Men, the Department of Correction announced plans yesterday for an immediate improvement in facilities for mentally disturbed inmates.

title: Waldheim Arrives in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Feb. 13 (AP)Secretary General Waldheim flew to Tokyo from Hong Kong tonight for a fiveday visit as a guest of the Japanese Government. He is on the final leg of his fivenation tour of the Far East.

title: A SemiFloating World
description: Paul A. Volcker, the gangling Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, flew in from Europe feeling very pleased with the solution he had negotiated to the world monetary crisis. With President Nixon and Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz doing the quarterbacking from Washington, Mr. Volcker had come home with a deal that he thought did three things:

title: 197172 Crisis in Broadcast Journalism, DuPontColumbia U. Survey Reports
description: Government assaults on television news and public affairs programing, combined with a nervousness on the part of network officials reacting to the attacks, placed broadcast journalism in 197172 in a state of crisis more profund than it has faced in its 50year history.

title: Accord on Truce Still Etudes Laotians
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 13The Laotian Government and the Communistled Pathet Lao remained locked in conflict both at the conference table here and on the battlefield today, although optimism was expressed by both sides that a ceasefire agreement could be reached soon.

title: Gibraltarians Endure, but Impatiently
description: GIBRALTAR, Feb. 10The British fleet is in, and because it is the Spanish Navy is not far behind. It is the latest chapter in the long controversy between Spain and Britain over one of the last disputed bits of territory in Europe.

title: Civilian Aide, Object of Big Hunt, Shuffles to Freedom
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Philippines, Feb. 13He came off the plane shyly like most of the 26 other Americans released by the Vietcong yesterday.

title: Dr. Hans Kmoch, Chess Analyst And Theoretician, Is Dead at 76
description: Dr, Hans Kmoch, a highly respected chess theoretician and analyst, died early yesterday at his home at 360 Central Park West. He was 76 years old and had been suffering for some years from a circulatory problem.

title: Opera: Cheers in Norma
description: A new combination for Bellini's Norma arrived at the Metropolitan Opera on Monday evening, and an enthusiastic audience roared its approval. Montserrat Caball in the title role, and Fiorenza Cossotto, as Adalgisa, put on a show that had some of the buffs talking about the great singers of the past.

title: First 2 P.O.W.'s 's Land in U.S. Grateful, Overwhelmed, Proud
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 13 (AP)The first two of the returning United States prisoners of war stepped onto their native soil with a salute tonight, after an hour's delay while their plane circled an airfield with wing flap trouble.

title: 3 CITIES ASK U.S. AID TO BUY 2DECK BUSES
description: New York, Los Angeles and San Francisco have applied for a $1.1million Federal grant to purchase 10 doubledecker buses.

title: Subways Getting First Woman Motorman
description: A year or so from now, Marion McAllister of Hollis Park Gardens, Queens, may be the Only woman in the city who is guaranteed a seat in a crowded subway train.

title: CAMPAIGN LIMITS EASED BY PANEL
description: TRENTON, Feb. 13  The Assembly Judiciary Committee today released a weaker substitute for a campaigndisclosure bill that has already passed the State Senate.

title: Winning an Election Gets Man Back on the Track
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 13He was eating high on the hog in 196870, winning the biggest stockcar races and $100,000 to $137,000 a year. Then his world collapsed when the Ford factory withdrew from NASCAR competition at the end of 1970, stranding Cale Yarborough and other Ford contract drivers. In 197172 Yarborough took a crack at the United States Auto Club championship circuit, but that venture foundered on mediocre equipment and worse luck. Then, last fall, two good things happened to Cale Yarborough: He was elected to the County Council of Florence County, S. C., the first Republican to win there in a century, and Junior Johnson offered him a good ride. There are few stockcar rides better than Johnson's.

title: Washington Hotels Offer Entire Floor To Nonsmokers Only
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13Nonsmokers have a new hero today. His name is J. Willard Marriott, and he is offering an entire floor of rooms in three of the hotels he owns here to nonsmokers only.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Feb. 13.Herbert Brown, a former Rutgers University, crew captain, no longer spins over the waters of the nearby Raritan. He is now 60 years old. But on Thursday Brown will be in a position to spin many a yarn when the Rutgers Rowing Alumni Association holds its crew dinner on campus.

title: 2 TeenAge Robbers Surrender in Dallas; Hostages Unharmed
description: DALLAS, Feb. 13 (UPI)Two teenage robbers, one a former mental patient, held 20 hostages at gunpoint inside a bar last night and today, but released them unharmed at daylight and gave up to the police an hour later.

title: Though February Still Is Winterlike, 'Tis the Season for Hybrid Anemones
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y., Feb. 13  Despite February's cold and snow, the anemone capital of the world is in full bloom here in the northwestern corner of Dutchess County.

title: Taft to Delay Amnesty Bill
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 13 (UPI)Senator Robert Taft Jr., Republican of Ohio, said in a speech here yesterday that he would wait until all American prisoners of war were returned and a complete accounting of others had been received before reintroducing his amnesty bill in Congress. The legislation would give draft evaders immunity from criminal prosecution in return for three years of duty in the armed service or designated civilian program.

title: Stony Brook Students Demand Safety Measures on Camptis
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Feb. 13Motivated by the death last week of an 18yearold freshman at the State University center here, 300 students met today with the president of the center and presented him with 40 demands dealing with safety on the 1,100acre campus.

title: Leading Israeli Suggests Withdrawal And Finds a Solid Wall of Rejection
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 13In the last 10 days, Itzhak BenAharon has learned the perils of challenging the conventional wisdom that prevails in Israel these days on the question of withdrawal from the occupied Arab territories.

title: People in Sports: Vanderbilt Picks Sloan
description: Vanderbilt University, a school that takes its time about changing football coaches, turned yesterday to 28yearold Steve Sloan. He replaces Big Pace, who resigned Jan. 15 as athletic director and football coach after a sixyear wonlosttied record of 22383.

title: YEN CLIMBS 14% IN HECTIC TRADING; TANAKA CRITICIZED
description: TOKYO, Feb. 14  Trading volume reached nearrecord levels on the foreign exchange market here today as the yen was floated and the dollar dropped in value.

title: Edmund Hawley, Lawyer And Counsel to A. T. & T.
description: Edmund S. Hawley, a lawyer who was counsel to the American Telephone and Telegraph Company from 1920 to 1956, died Saturday in Dostors Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 850 Park Avenue.

title: Article 1  No Title
A Trap That Electrocutes the Mouse
description: Like a latterday Leonardo da Vinci, Rhyder McClure sits in his rooftop loft in Greenwich Village and dreams up all sorts of wondrous ideas. A bed that would float above the floor on a magnetic field, for instance. A treadmill to exercise city dogs, A vacuum cleaner made of clear plastic that is a piece of working sculpture.

title: Wallace to stay in Hospital
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Feb. 14 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace will remain at University Hospital here for an indefinite period because of slight bleeding that resulted from surgery performed Jan. 26, officials said yesterday. A hospital spokesman said doctors attending the Alabama Governor emphasized the appearance of small amounts of blood in the urine was not unexpected following bladder surgery.

title: Voters Reject Tennis Plan
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 14 A proposal to build five tennis courts at Ridgewood High School for use by pupils and the public was defeated yesterday when 54 per, cent of the voters opposed the $65,000 tennis bond issue.

title: Wood Field and Stream: 6Pound Line Catches On
description: Judging from the size and variety of their catches, salt water anglers are apparently delighted with the new sixpound line test class established by the International. Game Fish Association.

title: Price of Gold Skyrockets to a Record of $72.30 an Ounce on, Speculative Buying
description: LONDON, Feb. 14 (UPI) Worldwide speculation pushed up the price of gold by more than $3 today to a record $72.30 an ounce on the open market.

title: Gauges of U.S. Payments Improved in the Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14Two of the four measures of the United States balance of international payments  generally regarded as less revealing than the two to be reported latershowed improvement in the fourth quarter and for 1972 as a whole, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: A Song of Salina
description: SALINA, Kan.Three wars back, when I was a soldier encamped in an Astoria, Queens, walkup flat, I told my landlady my wife and I were going to lunch at Rockefeller Center.

title: Tears Flow at Vietnam Reunion
description: BIEN HOA, South Vietnam, Feb. 14The young South Vietnamese soldier, fresh from a Communist prison camp, shuffled tentatively toward the old woman. For moment she hesitated. Then, crying and shrieking with joy, the woman recognized her son and clutched his arm.

title: Devaluation Said to Cost Pentagon $80Million
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 (AP)The Pentagon estimated today that the dollar devaluation would result in a $80million increase in its costs this year and $200million in the next fiscal year.

title: District Attorney Runs Again
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 14 (AP) District Attorney Arlen Specter announced today that he would run for a third term, saying that he had made the decision in hopes of electing a topnotch slate of judges.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 15, 1973

title: Company Plans for Currency Shifrts
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, NJ., Feb. 14When Gene A. Burns, the financial vice president of one of the nation's largest multinational corporations, stepped onto his front porch in Ridgewood at 6:30 Tuesday morning and picked up his morning newspaper, he was surprised to see that President Nixon had devalued the dollar.

title: ENGELHARD RAISES PRICES OF METALS
description: The Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation announced yesterday that it was raising its prices for its platinum group of metals due to the devaluation of the dollar as well as increased demand. The action followed, similar increases by the company's chief South African supplier, Rustenburg Platinum Mines, Ltd. The new prices are platinum, $150 to $155 per Troy ounce, up from $130 to $135; rhodium, $220 to $225, up from $195 to $200; iridium, $220 to $225, up from $150 to $155, and palladium, $75 to $77, up from $68 to $69. The price ranges reflect charges that vary depending on quantities purchased.

title: T.W.A. Seeks 46% Cuts In Limited Fare to Coast
description: Trans World Airlines sought approval from the Civil Aeronautics Board yesterday to slash the cost of a transcontinental airline ticket by as much as 46 per cent for passengers who sign up for flights 90 days in advance.

title: 20 Former P.O.W.'s Land At Air Base in California
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Feb. 14The first full planeload of returning prisoners, symbol and victims of decade of agonizing war in Southeast Asia, came home today.

title: Cahill Aide Cleared In CoverUp Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Feb. 14Attorney General George F. Kugler, Jr., was cleared today by the State Commission of Investigation of any inference that he or his staff had covered up information that ultimately led to the extortion conviction of former Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin.

title: Incendiary Device Found In 58th St. Alexander's
description: An incendiary device found on the mezzanine of Alexander's Department Store on Lexington Avenue at 58th Street shortly before closing time last night was dismantled by the police.

title: Soldier Dies After Ambush in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 14A 20yearold British soldier who was shot in the back last night in an ambush in the Lower Falls Road district of Belfast died here, today. He was the third soldier killed this year and the 150th since February, 1970, when the first soldier was shot dead.

title: The RagingOn
description: I am oppressed with the feeling that far too often the voice of the church is the voice of Catholic intellectual gunrunners who thread their invective with an oily, pious violence laced with quotations from the gospels, as if whatever they did and said had its origin, its justification, its sanctity from the very mouth of the Lord.

title: Nixon Aides Ask Support Of Meany on Trade Plans
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 14  Pokerfaced George Meany, cigar in mouth, gave no indication today whether he was buying what Secretary of State William. P. Rogers and Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz were selling.

title: BUCKLEY TO FIGHT BILIS ON AMNESTY
description: Senator James L. Buckley declared yesterday that granting general amnesty to draft evaders and deserters now that the war in Vietnam is over would be to reward those who chose to escape their duty at the expense of those who discharged it.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: An international architecture magazine, Architecture PLUS, to be published month ly in English, was introduced yesterday by Peter Blake, editor in chief.

title: Kugler's Exoneration Held Prelude To Cahill Announcement on a 2d Term
description: TRENTON, Feb. 14Authoritative Republican leaders reported tonight that today's exoneration of the Cahill administration by the State Commission of Investigation had cleared away the last obstacle to an announcement, perhaps before the end of the month, that Governor Cahill would run for a second term this year.

title: Walt Michaels Hired By Eagles as an Aide
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 14 (UPI)Walt Michaels, who has coached the linebackers for the New York Jets for the past 10 years, was signed today as an assistant coach of the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Americans in Lebanon See Their Dollars Shrink
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 14Americans living here on dollar incomes or traveling as tourists saw their money shrink today when they exchanged their devalued dollars for local currencies.

title: A Blaze Upstate Takes Five Lives As Rescue Fails
description: JORDAN, N. Y., Feb. 14 (AP) A fire took the lives of two women and their three children before dawn today despite a neighbor's rescue efforts.

title: MRS. NEVIN BALLIET
description: DOUGLASTON MANOR, L. I., Feb. 14Mrs. Corinne Balliet, the wife of Nevin Balliet, a retired executive of Uniroyal, Inc., died in Long Island Jewish Medical Center on Tuesday. She was 72 years old and lived here.

title: Pact With Cuba
description: The antihijacking agreement about to be concluded by the United States and Cuba represents a significant breakthrough in the fight against terrorism in the skies. With some additional goodwill on both sides it could also become a breakthrough for the gradual normalization of relations between the two countries and the lifting by the Organization of American States of an increasingly ineffective quarantine of Cuba.

title: Assembly Gets a Bill to Restore the Death Penalty
description: ALBANY, Feb. 14A bill to restore the death penalty for most persons convicted of firstdegree murder  a measure that fell only 11 votes short of adoption last yearwas introduced again in the Assembly today by Robert F. Kelly, a Republican Conservative of Brooklyn.

title: death Firm on Wage Curb As Union Challenges Him
description: LONDON, Feb. 14  Prime Minister Heath today faced the first major challenge to his program of wage and price controls and said he would not yield an inch.

title: Chilled Wine and Warm Hearts Awaiting a P.O.W. in Jersey
description: There is a bottle of champagne in the Abbott home on Rensterville Road in Alloway, N. J., that has been chilling there since October, 1968. It will bbe opened when Maj. Joseph S. Abbott Jr. of the Air Force returns home from North Vietnam some time soon.

title: Business Briefs
description: The United States Circuit Court of Appeals yesterday scheduled a hearing next Tuesday on the motion of Gulf and Western Industries, Inc., for an early consideration of its appeal against a Federal District Court's injunction that froze a public offer to buy stock of the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company.

title: Amer. Hockey League
description: TUESDAY NIGHTS GAMES

title: Surrender at Dearborn
description: The Ford Motor Company, which had been one of the most outspoken opponents of Congress and the Environmental Protection Agency's efforts to control automobile emissions, has now meekly accepted penalties amounting to $7 million for violating the agency's regulations. Presumably in order to avoid trials, the company this week paid the maximum $10,000 fine on each count of a 350count criminal information, settled a civil suit for an additional $3.5 million and signed a consent decree to shun such violations of the Clean Air Act in the future.

title: Insurance Industry Accord Gives Lift to NoFault Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The insurance industry has quietly compromised a threeway split over nofault automobile insurance and is organizing a united lobbying campaign for enactment of state nofault laws.

title: MRS. H. H. LEAVITT
description: MOUNT DESERT, Me., Feb. 14Mrs. Whiteman Leavitt, widow of the Rev. Dr. Horace H. Leavitt, who was pastor of the Union Presbyterian Church of Bay Bridge, Broklyn, from 1915 to 1931, died in Bar Harbor Hospital on Feb. 6. She was 90 years old.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: BLAZERS WIN, 65, FOR 4TH STRAIGHT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 14 (UPI)  Danny Lawson scored with 15 seconds to play tonight to give the Philadelphia Blazers a 65 victory over the Cleveland Crusaders in the World Hockey; Association, their fourth in a row.

title: Australia Open to Deported Girl As Racial Curbs on Entry End
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 141  New Australian immigration rules, eliminating racial bars and ending favoritism toward Britons, are being put into effect dramatically.

title: TV Review
description: On television, particularly color television, one of the more consistently good tfack. records has been established by programs in the broad naturesciencetravelogue category. With good, sometimes extraordinary photography, professional editing and a decent script, the viewer is taken to faraway places for brief encounters with exotic peoples, places and things. It isn't easy, to go too far wrong.

title: U.S. AND HANOI WILL SET UP A COMMISSION TO CHANNEL HELP FOR NORTH VIETNAM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The United States and North Vietnam announced today that they had agreed to establish a Joint Economic Commission to chaimer postwar American reconstruction aid to North Vietnam.The formation of the commissionscheduled to begin work in about a monthwas announced in a communiqu issued here and in Hanoi on the four days of talks held by Henry A. Kissinger with Premier Pham Van Dong and other North Vietnamese officials from Sunday to yesterday.

title: Nixon Aides Said to Draft Weaker StripMining Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 Advocates within the Nixon Administration of stiff regulation of strip mining have suffered nearly total defeat in their efforts to draft a strong control bill.

description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Feb. 14 (Reuters)Volkswagenwerk, A.G., has announced that it plans to raise its vehicle prices in Germany by an average of 4.4 per centMonday. It said the rise reflected increased costs.

description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Feb. 14The first full planeload of returning prisoners, symbol and victims of a decade of agonizing war in Southeast Asia, came home today.

title: A Newark Law Firm Sues To Halt State Investigation
description: NEWARK, Feb. 14A Newark law firm known for its representation of workmen's compensation claims by minorit roe clients sued in Feditygroup clients sued in Federal District Court here today to bar what it contends is unconstitutional harassment and intimidation by the State Coramission of Investigation.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 45

title: Soviet Moon Rover Pauses to Examine an Unusual Rock Slab
description: MOSCOW, Thursday, Feb. 15 The Soviet Union's Lunokhod 2 moon rover has started examining an unusual slab of lunar material that evidently was thrown out from the moon's interior during the birth of a large crater, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported today.

title: Who Lives to 142?
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14  In his news conference the other evening Secretary of the Treasury Shultz made devaluation of the dollar sound so good that you wondered why it took the Government so long to get around to it.

title: ELISABETH ACHELIS, CALENDAR REFORMER
description: Elisabeth Achelis, a crusader for calendar reform for many years, died in her sleep early Sunday morning. She was, 93 years old and lived at 1 East 66th Street.

title: SCHNELLENBERGER IS HIRED BY COLTS
description: Howard Schnellenberger, who had been on the Miami Dolphins' staff, was named head coach of the Baltimore Colts, yesterday, thus filling the last open head coaching job in the National Football League. The 38  year  old Schnellenberger, who once coached Joe Namath at the University of Alabama, was the sixth new head coach appointed since the end of last season as 23 per cent of the teams made changes.

title: Customer Debt Declines For Big Board Members
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that customer dept to member firms, reflecting margin accounts, dropped $200million in January, the first decline since November, 1971. The size of the drop was the largest in nearly three years.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 8.15 million shares of capital stock of the John Hancock Income Securities Corporation a new closedend, diversified investment company, was oversubscribed yesterday at $22 a share. An underwriting group run by Loeb, Rhoades & Co. handled the $179.3million financing for the income fund, which will put 80 per cent of its money into bonds and 20 per cent ito preferred and common stocks.

title: Ali Cuts Bugner and Outpoints Him in 12
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Feb. 14Muhammad All added 12 more rounds tonight to the 40 he had sparred with Joe Bugner in previous years.

title: An Aide Says Mrs. Nixon Really Cares About Mail
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 Statesmen want to visit the First Family in San Clemente, Calif.; charitable organizations want a memento from the White House to sell at a bazaar; children scribble crayon notes saying, We love you, Mrs. Nixon, and elderly people with feeble hands write to ask for the First Lady's help to get more Social Security.

title: Economic Aide to Nixon Scores Sentimentality and Prejudice on Major Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers said today that the misery component of unemployment is less than it used to be at any given level of unemployment, mainly because so many of the unemployed were now young persons rather than adults.

title: Bradley Paces Hunter Five To 5251 Victory Over Pace
description: John Bradley a senior forward, scored 19 points in the second half last night to overcome a 2316 halftime deficit and lead. Hunter College to a 5251 Knickerbocker College Basketball Conference victory over Pace College at the loser's Manhattan

title: Surge in 4th Quarter
description: R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., the nation's largest cigarette producer, which derives a third of its revenues from nontobacco operations, achieved a 12 per cent increase in earnings and 13 per cent in sales for the fourth quarter and 6 and 5 per cent, respectively, for all of 1972. Both periods set new records, the annual for the ninth consecutive time, according to a spokesman at Winston  Salem, N. C., head quarters yesterday.

The two Doris Centeno and her daughter, Carmen Rivera, pleaded guilty: to attempted promotionof prison contraband and they face, at their March 21 sentencing, a maximum, of seven years in prison.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The United States and North Vietnam announced today that they had agreed to establish a Joint Economic Commission to channel postwar American reconstruction aid to North Vietnam.

Perilman of Temple EmanuEl performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's apartment.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 President Nixon said today in a radio address that he would propose a plan to assure the nation adequate supplies of energy at acceptable economic and environmental costs.

title: R. A. GREEN
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Feb. 14 (UPI)Former Representative R. A. (Lex) Green of Florida died Friday evening. He would have been 81 years old on Saturday.
