title: Dollar DevaluationThe New American Reality
description: History sometimes has a way of telescoping events so that we suddenly sense an order or pattern, a philosophy or a watershed.

title: Keansburg, N.J.: Beach Resort, Ethnic Clich
description: KEANSBURG, N. J.  The beach stretthes away on each side like a ribbon of soiled cloth. On this day, shortly after a major storm, it seems to be littered by hundreds of spiked German helmets, as though some of the refuse of the First World War had surfaced here to demand attention. Actually, the helmets are the remains of horseshoe crabs that were driven ashore by wind and tide and could not make it back to the foul waters of Raritan Bay. Presumably they died an awful death, silently waving their sticks of tails in the air, rocking their shells in the hot sun, bellies up, slowly cooking. Shrieking gulls, those vultures of city ports, finished them off.

title: O.E.O. Strategy For an Execution
description: WASHINGTONA little too much strategy leaked from the White House last week in its fight to kill off the Office of Economic Opportunity. The result: an intensification of Congressional bitterness over the President's withholding of funds from programs already set into law.

title: Revisions in StripMining Bill Appear to Aid Industry
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17Unpublished revisions of the Nixon Administration's proposal to regulate strip mining, which was sent to the House and Senate Interior Committees late yesterday, indicate that the bill was altered in the drafting to accommodate surface mining interests.

title: Newsmen Bar Political Role
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 17 (UP1)The Capitol Correspondents Association has voted overwhelmingly to forbid its members to seek state elective office.

title: New Battle of Philippi Pits Greek Farmers Against Power Board That Seeks Their Land
description: PHILIPPI, Greece, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Philippi, where 2,000 years ago the armies of Mark Antony and Octavian defeated Brutus and Cassius, the slayers of Julius Caesar, is the site of A new kind of battle today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: OAK BLUFFS, Mass.Several new surf spinning rods, long, slender and gleaming, hung on a rack behind him and he was busy wrapping guides on another when I arrived.

title: Bergen Belsen Survivors to Mark Warsaw Ghetto Uprising
description: An association of Nazi deathcamp survivors has announced the allocation of $250,000 for literary works and the holding of international meetings that deal with the Nazi holocaust.

title: Ulster: Ray of Hope?
description: On the face of it nothing could seem more improbable than a calm discussion on the future of Northern Ireland between leaders of the Protestant Ulster Vanguard and of the largely Catholic Social Democratic and Labor party. It may not come off; but at least the S.D.L.P. has asked for such a meeting and William Craig, the Vanguard leader, has promised prompt consideration.

title: YOUTH SCREENING BY F.B.I. ALLEGED
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 17 A Wisconsin agency has treatened to drop its sponsorship of a National Young Americans award program unless it receives assurances that the Federal Bureau of Investigation does not screen its nominees.

title: CITIES WILL MEET ON PRODUCTIVITY
description: Major tribulations of American cities, and efforts to increase efficiency and productivity in municipal government under the present strains, will be detailed here next month at what is said to be the first conference ever held on productivity programs in cities.

title: Court Ruling Favors Swamp Deer Hunt
description: BASKING RIDGEA controlled deer hunt will probably be held next December in the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge, now that a Federal District Court has dismissed a suit by the Humane Society of the United States. The society had sought to ban public hunting in the preserve, according to George W. Gavutis, refuge manager.

title: Opera
description: BOSTON, Feb. 17The Opera Company of Boston's performance of TheDaughter of the Regiment had scarcely begun last night when a startled spectator exclaimed to the woman with him: You sure don't get this at the Met!

title: ... that conscience will become no more than a faded flower ...
description: COLOGNEThe hopeful process one calls worldwide easing of tension helps least those who, under constant risk of denunciation or imprisonment, most enthusiastically support it: writers, academics and intellectuals.

title: Madison Museum Features Tools of Colonial Artisans
description: MADISON  At Madison's Museum of Early Trades and Crafts, the tools of America's colonial artisans receive star billing.

title: Instead of Cutting A Hole in the Ceiling...
SPOTLIGHT
description: How much can a rubber company with headquarters in Akron, Ohio, be influenced by a labor organization with headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland?

title: WAGE RISE STEEP IN MANY NATIONS
description: GENEVA, Feb. 17Industrial workers of most countries are coming out ahead in the race between wage and price increases, according to the International Labor Organization.

title: Rockaway Resort Urged
description: A report on the development of the Rockaways said the area should be redeveloped as a recreational area, some 5,200 of 10,600 proposed units of housing eliminated, a sanitary sewer system given high priority and mass transportation expanded and made less expensive.

title: The Movement, With the War Ebbing, Ponders Its Role in a Nation at Peace
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17With the war officially over in South Vietnam, many of the leaders of a decade of protest in the United States are trying to define a place for themselves and their followers in a nation at peace.

title: Three Picture Books
description: BEFORE this year is too far gone, there are three picture books, worthy holdovers from last season, that deserve comment.

title: Developer Caught in Middle of Meadowlands Rift
description: LYNDHURST  The largest industrial and commercial developer in the 21,000acre Hackensack Meadowlands tract plays a constantly shifting role in the continuing dispute over the future of the marsh.

title: Strict Ethics Code Is Adopted
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I.  A stringent code of ethics to govern conduct of officers and employes of the Town of Oyster Bay was adopted unanimously last week.

title: Music Hath Charms, but Not Necessarily on TV
description: WHAT can a TV picture do for classical cal music? This question has not often been answered positively by American television, but efforts continue, and this week WNET/ 13 is showing two of the latest: tonight at 8:30, an installment in the Joan Sutherland series, Who's Afraid of Opera?, devotd to Offenbach's La Perichole (Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor led off the series last week); tomorrow evening at 9, a film of Ravel's Bolero, played by the Los Angeles Philharmonic conducted by Zubin Mehta.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The World
description: LONDON The tangled politics of Northern Ireland took an interesting turn last week when Protestant extremists and moderate Roman Catholics started talking about talking to each other.

title: 9 Held for Taking Betsat OTB Offices
description: Nine alleged members of A bookmaking syndicate were arrested yesterday and charged with taking illegal bets On horse races and other sports from OTB customers at Offtrack Betting Corporation offices.

title: Trenton Museum Caters to Layman
description: TRENTONThere was a time when museums were devoted primarily to research, restoration and pres, ervation. But today's museum emphasizes, in addition to its more scholarly pursuits, attractive and educational exhibits carefully designed with the layman in mind.

title: CRAMPTON LEADSSAN DIEGO OPEN
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 17Bruce Crampton of Australia fought off challenges from three former Oklahoma State starsGrier Jones, Bob Dickson and Dave Eichelberger  today, shooting a fourunderpar 68 to grab the thirdround lead by a stroke in the $170,000 Andy WilliamsSan Diego open.

title: Middlebury Captures Skiing at Williams
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Feb. 17Middlebury College won the Williams College winter carnival today for the first time since 1965. It took the two Alpine events and finished second in both Nordic competitions.

title: Rotz Is Even a Winner Between Coast Races
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 12 (UPI)John L. Rotz received the 1973 George Woolf memorial award today at Santa Anita as the jockey bringing credit to the riding profession.

title: Marshburn Paces Middies
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Feb. 17Bob Marshburn scored a careerhigh of 20 points today in leading Navy to a 7675 upset victory over Manhattan.

title: F. X. McCLANAGHAN
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Feb. 17 (UPI)Judge Francis X. McClanaghan, of the trial division of the Common Pleas Court in Philadelphia died in Atlantic City Hospital today. He was 66 years old.

title: Nixon Signs Highway Bill
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 17 (UPI)President Nixon signed into law today a bill extending the life of the Commission on Highway Beautification until Dec. 31. The legislation provides an authorization for $250,000 to continue the study of Implementation of the Highway Beautification Act of 1965.

title: Regina Heidrich Engaged to John Stem
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J., Feb. 17The engagement of Miss Regina Lois Heidrich to John David Stem, son of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Stem of Milford, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John J. Heidrich of Highland Park.

title: Man Freed in Slaying Wins Damages
description: It began with a scream at 2 A.M. April 20, 1947, when 15yearold Selma Graff was fatally bludgeoned by an intruder in the bedroom of her home in the East Flatbush secthin of Brooklyn.

title: Charles Stewart Mott, 97, An Early Leader of G.M.
description: FLINT, Mich., Sunday, Feb. 18 (AP)Charles Stewart Mott, a onetime soda pop bottler who went on to help guide General Motors to its place as the world's largest industrial corporation, died early today at St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 97.

title: State Adds Inspectors To Patrol Highways
description: TRENTON  State motorvehicle inspectors, whose powers on the highway equal those of state troopers, are beefing up their road patrols to catch wayward drivers, particularly truckers.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: SHOP TALK
description: PASSAICYou can hardly expect the glitter to be gold if the earrings cost only 49 cents a pair, but that's how low the prices for such accessories are at Jeanette's Costume Jewelry.

title: After an Amusing Premise, What?
description: GOT the shock of my, life. At Shelter, an intimate musical surrounded by stereopticon slides, I found myself becoming quite accustomed to the notion that all of the orchestration for the tunes was being provided by a companionable computer named Arthur, whose lights blinked in rhythm to the notes being churned out. As one does at musicals, I found myself turning my head in Arthur's direction each time an intro began, accepting him (it?) as the source of all melody. Once, though, I saw something other than Arthur. I saw two ghostly hands, white, disembodied, waving frantically, like those of a drowning man making one last effort.

title: Fatah Says Jordan Seized Its Men Going to West Bank
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 17Al Fatah the major Palestinian commando group, has reported the arrest in Jordan of some of its guerrilla fighters, who the organization said were on their way to Israelioccupied territory.

title: N. C. A. A. to Stiffen Its Penalties For Irregularities in Recruiting
description: Despite an increasing number of legal actions aimed at limiting the punitive powers of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, the N.C.A.A. intends to impose more severe penalties on colleges and athletes for recruiting irregularities and other unethical practices.

description: MAPLEWOOD The preservation of open space, an environmental policy embraced in the master plan of this Essex County town, is the main issue rin a continuing dispute here.

description: Half the members of the tiny Jewish community in Baghdad have applied for passports to leave Iraq in recent weeks in the face of a crackdown by Iraqi authorities, according to a firsthand account.

description: PHOTOGRAPHERS who are interested in having their work exhibited, or who would like to take an active part in the operation of a local gallery, should be interested in two recent announcements by local organizations:

title: Speedwell Acts to Restore Telegraph's Birthplace
description: MORRISTOWN  Drivers zipping along Speedwell Avenue between Morristown and Morris Plains might be more inclined to stop if they knew about the major surgery being performed at Speedwell Village, a few hundred Yards east of the road.

description: In an exciting windup to an exciting meet, Bryant High School of Queens won its first citywide Public Schools Athletic League track and field title yesterday at the 102d Engineers Armory.

description: ENGLEWOODThis town is proceeding with its Forest Avenue slumclearance program, which calls for the demolition of 64 dilapidated bulldins and the relocation of their residents.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Any Agriculture Department employee who uses the authority of a new presidential directive to inspect a farmer's tax return will be dismissed, a top department official said today.

title: From a Novel Idea Comes  Trouble
description: LOS ANGELESIn the depths of the 1970 recession, Lawrence August, a Los Angeles publicrelations man, had an idea that he thought world help builders sell houses, protect consumers from the loss of their homes as a result of unemployment and save the Government money.

title: Marilyn Dow Jersey Bride
description: MADISON, N. J., Feb. 17 Miss Marilyn Grace Dow, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Eugene Dow of Harding Township, was married here this afternoon to John James Moriarty 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Francis Moriarty of Andover, Mass. The Rev. Donald Bachtell performed the ceremony in the Presbyterian Church.

title: Calley
description: Under guard in an apartment at Fort Benning, Ga., First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. has waited for nearly two years as the Army pondered his role in the killing of perhaps 400 Vietnamese civilians in the hamlet of My Lai in March 5, 1968.

title: Uganda
description: In Uganda last weekend, 12 men were killed in exemplary public executions by firing squads. Some died without blindfolds, watching their executioners load and take aim. Most of them were in their 20's; the youngest was a schoolboy, 17 years old. All were tried in secret by a military tribunal and convicted of engaging in guerrilla activities.

title: THEATER PREVIEW WILL AID LINDSAY
description: Mayor Lindsay is expected to pay off most and possibly all of the $200,000 debt remaining from his Presidential campaign with the proceeds from a special preview of a Broadway musical tonight.

description: BOSTON, Feb. 17Dr. Donald G. Marquis, a professor in the Alfred P. Sloan School of Management at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, died today apparently of heart attack. He was 64 years old.

I., have announced the engagement of their daughter to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome J. Vianna of North Bellmore, L. I.

title: HARRY ADLER
description: Harry Adler, an actors' manager who was the agent for Alan King, the comedian, died Friday at his winter home in Miami Beach. He was 66 years old and also lived at 15 West 55th Street.

title: British Unit Trains in U.S.; Link to Ulster Duty Denied
description: LONDON, Feb. 17 (AP)The Defense Ministry said today that British marines have been training at a United States Marine Corps base in North Carolina, but it stressed that the program was in no way connected with British operations in Northern Ireland.

title: Law
description: ALBANY  Vindictive, said the Mayor. Unworkable. That was John Lindsay's reaction to the hardline plan proposed six weeks ago by Nelson Rockefeller for dealing with drug offendert.

title: Water Studies Roil East End Officials
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I. Eight months before Suffolk County proposed a comprehensive study of the water resources of the South Fork that would cost close to $1million, the United States Geological Survey offered to do a comparable job for $300,000.

title: Miss Hibbs Fiancee Of W.A. Lydgate Jr.
description: CONRAD, Iowa, Feb. 17The engagement of Miss Diane Joyce Hibbs to William Anthony Lydgate Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Lydgate of Pelham Manor, N. Y., has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Richard L. Hibbs, parents of the future bride.

title: Two Fixtures Scrap Old Sites
KERNER JURY GET SEVENWEEK GAS
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 17The ca against Judge Otto Kerner we to a Federal District Court ju?? today as the sevenweek trial the former Illinois Govern neared its end.

title: Paper Recycling Urged
description: What will happen to this newspaper after you're through reading it? If you stack it with others and take them to a recycling collection from the streets, you save the city sanitationmen some work and you even help to give the newspaper a new form.

title: No. Carolina, Duquesne Triumph at the Garden
description: North Carolina, continuing to enjoy life outside the Atlantic Coast Conference, defeated Florida State, 9179, in the secand game of a college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden yesterday. It was the 20th victory for the Tar Heels, their 14th straight outside the A.C.C. They have lost four games, all the A.C.C.

title: To tame the monster: A most Galbraithian economist
description: His body dangles tall and floppy like a giant scarecrow. Where his legbones stick out over his stockings his skin is bluewhite like a plucked goose. His hands hang at loose ends off his long arms. He is dressed up in a rumpled tuxedo jacket with a limp white shirt and a bow tie that looks like little black ribbon fastened under his Adam's apple. His head is chiseled out of stone the color of granite from an old, smalltown bank. His nose is the beak of a statuesque buzzard, and his jawbone is long and dangerouslooking. But his mouth is deceptively delicate and kind. On top of his head his hair bends over like Moslems praying, and out from underneath his threatening eyebrows peer two curious, appraising, funny eyes.

title: Ecologists Ask Binding Pledge
description: TRENTON, Feb. 17In his third annual legislative message last month, Governor Cahill outlined a number of significant environmental protection proposals that he planned to ask the Legislature to approve this year. The list included recommendations dealing with recycling, preservation of New Jersey's coastal areas, solidwaste control, tax abatement and corresponding penalties for polluters, and new propertytax exemptions for land conserved for open space in what is now the most densely populated state in the nation.

title: Sports Week
description: PRO BASKETBALL

title: Thomas C. Gibney, 71, Is Dead; Immigration Official for 45 Years
description: Thomas C. Gibney, former deputy district director in New York of the Immigration and Naturalization Service, died yesterday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital here. He was 71 years old and lived at 2277 Andrews Avenue in the Bronx.

title: Hanoi Freeing 20 More
description: An Air Force jet arrived in Hanoi, North Vietnam, today to pick up 20 more American prisoners of war. The return of the 20 will bring the number of freed Anserican prisoners to 163, eight civilians and 155 servicemen. The remaining captives are to be released by March 29. Details on Page 5.

title: Cuban Art Festival, After Delay, Offers Classical Program
description: The Festival of Cuban Art held last week at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine got around to classical music Friday night, and for a while the concert threatened to reaffirm every Latin stereotype in the book.

title: Saigon Tells Newsmen M.P.'s Shoot Intruders
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 17  The South Vietnamese authorities warned newsmen here today that they could be shot for seeking to interview Communist representatives on the Joint Military Commission at their base at Tan Son Nhut Airport.

title: A soft confusion, a hard clarity
description: EONARD Cohen, the Canadian poet, novelist and songwriter, was once a romantic of the agreeably restless and seedy kind. This worked out best in his songs, where the right musicand Cohen displayed a gift for moaning melodydeepened the sentiment, lending it emotional plausibility. For the rest his poems were about nothing in particularthey gave the impression of wanting to strike a nerve but of not knowing where it lay. Hitler, the Dachau generation, the hydrogen bombsuch facts were defused and deactualized simply by being incorporated into Cohen's prevailing medium, a kind of complaining verbal dream. He was reduced to asking a junkie to pray for us: at least a junkie knows what he wants, is singleminded. Cohen was not wrong in assuming that his own distraction and confusion were widespread. But his poetry was not the better for that; it was only part of the trouble.

title: Notes: Tourist Pollution
description: TOURISM has traditionally been referred to as the clean industry or the industry without smokestacks, but in recent years, particnlarly since the advent of jumbo jets, it has come under Increasing criticism for its unfavorable effects on the world's environment. With this in mind, 1,500 leaders of the travels industry, meeting in Kyoto, Japan, next week, will hold a threeday workshop on the subject of how to protect asyetundeveloped areas of the Pacific from the wholesale people pollution and what some people regard as ugly rows of highrise hotels that accompanied modernage mass tourism to such places. as Honolulu and faraway Guam.

title: Miss Perrini Affianced
description: RIDGEWOOD, N.Y., Feb. 17 Mr. and Mrs. Angelo J. Perrini have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Perrini, to Denis David Canavan, son of Mr. and Mrs. M. Vincent Canavan of Rumson, N.J. The wedding is planned for July. The prospective bridegroom a resident of BelAir, Md., is a planner with the Hartford County Planning Department.

title: Bill Seeks to Ease Impact of Raybestos Closing on Passaic
description: PASSAICSpecial legislation is pending in Trenton to help lessen the impact of the closing of the huge RaybestorManhattan rubber products plant, one of Passaic's largest employers for the last 80 years.

title: At 14, He's Butterfly Expert
description: PARSIPPANY  Calvin Myers Jr. lectures to entomology students, supplies lepidopteran specimens to universities and is a learned advocate of biological insect control.

title: 100Meter Record Falls
description: MOSCOW, Feb, 17 (AP) Alexandr Kornelyuk set a world indoor record of 10.3 seconds for the men's 100meter dash today, Toss, the Soviet new agency, reported. Nadezhda Bosfamilnaya also broke the mark for women with a 11.4 clocking in a track meet here. The 100meter event is rarely run indoors.

title: Jean Brush Day And Milan Kofol To Be Married
description: Dr. and Mrs. Robert M. Day of New York and Buck Hill Falls, P,a., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jean Brush Day, to Milan Kofol, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cyril Kofol of Wantagh, L.I., formerly of Cheb, Czechoslovakia.

title: David Dick to Wed Karen Sowpel
description: SIMSBURY, Conn., Feb. 17 Lieut. Col. Nicola Sowpel, U.S.A.F.R., and Mrs. Sowpel of Simsbury have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Karen Marie Sowpel, to David Hillas Dick, son of Mr, and Mrs. Malcolm Dick of Convent Station, N. J. The couple plan to marry Nov. 24.

title: NOFAULT SPONSOR HAILS STATE FLAN
description: The state nofault automobile insurance bill that was signed into law last week is similar to measures that became effective in Connecticut and New Jersey last month, but a major sponsor describes the New York law as one of the best overall plans in the country.

title: P.O.W. Families Continue Fight
description: GARDEN CITY, L. LDespite the ceasefire in Vietnam and the scheduled release of prisoners that has already begun, members of the Long Island League of Families of Prisoners and Men Missing in Southeast Asia are expressing a fierce determination to stick together until the last man is either home or accounted for.

title: 2 RECORDS BROKEN IN JERSEY RELAYS
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 17A 4:17.6 mile by Chris Inman enabled Essex Catholic to win the Parochial school's distance medley today at the eighth annual New Jersey Interionships at the Armory.

title: Timely Reminder For Brooklynites
description: For 43 years, the city's largest fourface clock, from its perch on the 42story Williamsburgh Savings Bank building in Brooklyn, has kept Brooklynites up to the minute, day and night.

title: Patricia Harrigan Has Nuptials
description: In the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday afternoon Miss Patricia Harrigan was married to Peter Andras Nadosy. The Rev. Joseph P. Fitzpatrick, a professor of sociology at Fordham University, performed the ceremony.

title: Body of Driver. Lies 3 Days Near Freeway
description: SAN LEANDRO, Calif., Feb. 17 (UPI)The body of a victim of a hitandrun accident lay three days just a few feet from his damaged car beside a busy freeway here.

title: Kekich, 4 Other Players Sign Yankee Contracts
description: The Yankees raised their total of players signed to 12 yesterday when they announced that Mike Kekich, a lefthanded starting pitcher, and four other players had come to terms.

title: YUKON CHIEFS WIN RULING ON CIAIMS
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 17Indians of the Yukon Territory have won Prime. Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeatr's consent to negotiate their claims for cash, a land settlement and perpetual royalties on natural resources.

title: LAST 8 INDICTED IN BOGUSBILL RING
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 17The arrest this week of a printing plant owner in southeast Baltimore has apparently brought to a close a 10month investigation by United States Secret Service agents into a complex, and sometimes bizarre, $1million counterfeiting operation here.

title: Will Destiny Give Steber Another Chance?
description: STEBER'S back and New York's got her! Eleanor Steber, at 56, is staging a marathon comeback with three solo recitals at Alice Tully Hall: lieder by Schubert, Schumann, and Richard Strauss, on February 26; American songs by Hopkinson, Stephen Foster, Victor Herbert, Ned Rorem and other contemporaries, on March 26; operatic arias by Mozart, Strauss, Verdi and Puccini, accompanied by the New England Conservatory Orchestra conducted by Gunther Schuller, on May 7. A fullblown, gutsy comeback at 56 by an artist who has not only worked hard, but, by her own admission, has lived hard.

title: Dance
description: TWYLA THARP makes a piece for the Spring season of the City Center Joffrey Ballet, and the dance world is astonished. The idea of one of the most important and obstreperously radical young. dancerchoreographers hooking up with a ballet company is unusual, but then, both Tharp and the Joffrey like to be first at things.

title: Piedmont's Losers Never Quit
description: DEMOREST, Ga.  There were four minutes left on the clock and the home crowd was going wild. They were up on their feet, whistling and clapping, and the cheers split the air inside the old brick gymnasium. The visiting coach was beetred in the face and he gave a metal chair a furious kick.

title: KILLY BEATS SABICH, TAKES GIANT SLALOM
description: BOYNE MOUNTAIN, Mich., Feb. 17 (UPI)  Jean Claude Killy, the former Olympic champion, took top honors today in the professional Grand Prix Giant slalom competition, beating Spider Sabich of Snowmass, Colo?

title: $7.5MILLION GRANT IS MADE TO CALTECH
description: The California Institute of Technology has been awarded $7.5million by the Fairchild Foundation to attract eminent scientists and leaders to the institute's Pasadena campus as visiting scholars.

title: Prisoners Thoughts on Reentering The World
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif.Capt. James Bond Stockdale returned to American soil last Week after more than seven years as a prisoner in North Vietnam. His hair was grayer than when he left, and a stiff leg dragged a bit as he stepped off an airplane here and thanked the waiting crowds for their loyalty.

title: 3 SHARE GOLF LEAD AT 143 IN FLORIDA
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., Feb. 17 (AP)Mrs. Joe Anne Owner of Lake Worth, Fla., rallied from five strokes off the lead today to move into a tie for first place with Barbara Romack and Jane Blalock after the second round of the $35,000 Pompano Beach Country Club L.P.G.A. Classic.

title: Mailbox
description: To the Editor:The Wood, Field and Stream columnist, Nelson Bryant, wrote Feb. 1 that The Eastern coyote is protected in Massachusetts and should be protected in all of the other New England states.

title: Indian Air Force Receives First Locally Made MIG
description: BOMBAY, India, Feb. 17 (AP) The Indian air force has accepted the &rst MIG fighter plane produced in India. Almost all the jet's components were locally manufactured.

title: R. E. Lussen Fiance Of Mrs. Richards
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Feb. 17The engagement of Mrs. Laura B. Richards to Richard Earl Lussen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas A. Lussen of Ravenna, Ohio, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Chester Billings Jr. of New Canaan and Quogue, L. I. A wedding in June is planned.

title: Dover: Where Pessimism Prevails
description: DOVERThe two elderly women on Mount Hope Street spoke frankly about the problems that confront Dover. This town is in trouble, one said. Merchants are quitting, the stores are vacant and there's no feeling for one another. Her companion nodded in accord. Not so long ago, we walked around town at any hourand without fear, she observed. It's different now. Who wants to go out alone? Who wants to walk on the streets when it's dark? This is not the town I came to 38 years ago. In fact, it's not what it was just a few years ago. We are in trouble; inare.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: As one American reader, may I suggest that you use native critics to review the books of such evident native poets as Robert Creeley?

title: Guarding Right Flank
description: MEDFORD, L. LIt all started modestly with the Conservatives, one of Suffolk's leading Republican officials said candidly last week. There was the attraction of being closer to them ideologically than to the Democrats, but as things went along, they wanted more and more.

title: The P.O.W.'s Show Pride and Gratitude
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Feb. 17As the first group of returning prisoners arrived on the American mainland here this week, a sketchy picture began to emerge of their years in captivity and their plans.

title: Dennis Wins AccidentFilled Daytona Race
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. 17Bill Dennis won today  or, rather, survived seven caution periods to win the Permatex 300, an accidentriddled race for oldmodel stock cars.

title: Boat Show Is On At Asbury Park
description: ASBURY PARK  Sailing enthusiasts, power boatmen and rowing advocates can enjoy an array of delights at the 20th annual Jersey Coast Boat Show, now under way in Convention Hall. The show will continue through next Sunday.

title: Man Slain in Argument Over Piece of Chicken
description: An argument over who was to get the last piece of chicken to eat ended when one man stabbed another to death early yesterday in a Bronx apartment, the police reported.

title: Criminals At Large
description: The author of THE TOOTH MERCHANT (Quadrangle, $7.95) is a chap named C. L. Sulzberger. Yes, it is the C. L. Sulzberger, the distinguished foreign correspondent of The New York Times, he who hobnobs with heads of state, the great pundit, the Rhadamanthus of journalists. But even these mighty ones must relax, and Sulzberger has now delivered himself of a sort of espionage novel, complete with dirty words and everything.

title: Reminder
description: Last night's full moon was a reminder that April isn't too far ahead. The next full moon comes only two days before the vernal equinox on March 20, and by then the days will be a trace longer than the nights. Maple sap will be flowing. Life will be stirring at the root of things.

title: Wishbone Offense May Go Pro
description: Zone defenses having cut severely into point scoring, pro football last year changed the markings on the fieldthe hashmarks  where the ball is placed after each down to give the pass, offenses a break. Scoring picked up but the rushing game had a rebirth rather than passing, to everyone's surprise, The measure of success in the game now is how you run, not how you pass, and how you defend against the run.

title: N.A.I.A. Football Hall Adds 2 Coaches and ExTackle
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 17 (AP) Two coaches and a former star tackle will be inducted into the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics Football Hall of Fame, A. O. Duer, N.A.I.A. executive secretary said yesterday.

title: Associates of Scott Gained U.S. Contract on High Bid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17. Rising 18 stories above a barren urban renewal tract in West Philadelphia is a nearly finished $14million office building that will soon house several hundred employes of the Federal Government.

title: Catholic Laymen Give Communion
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I.  A joyful responsibility and a very special privilege is the way Mrs. Charles Bingham views her role as a Roman Catholic extraordinary minister and thus permitted to distribute Communion.

title: VICTOR TALLEY, 78, OF TIMES, IS DEAD
description: Victor W. Talley, a pioneer in pictorial journalism who retired as Sunday picture editor of The New York Times in 1960, died Friday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 100 Central Park South.

title: We Must Face A Stark Fact
description: WASHINGTON  America is well on the way to winning the war against environmental degradation; well on the way to making our peace with nature.

title: Britain Ends the $12Million Hovertrain Project
description: LONDON, Feb. 17Britain opted out of the hovertrain stakes this week, writing off four and a half years of research and about $12million in development costs.

title: Indochina
description: WASHINGTON  Henry A. Kissinger last week opened a new dialogue with the Hanoi Government designed as the beginning of new bilateral relations between the United States and North Vietnam.

title: Women Barred by Jaycees
description: TULSA, Okla., Feb. 17 (AP) Directors of the United States Jaycees overwhelmingly rejected yesterday a proposal to admit women to membership.

title: 3 State Police Units Shift Headquarters to Edison
description: EDISONThe Troop C Tactical Traffic Patrol Unit, the Central Jersey Organized Crime Task Force and the Regional Communications Center, three specialized, highly trained groups of state troopers, have moved into a new station on Woodbridge Avenue.

title: Victory Is Still a Thrill to Petty
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 17 The Fu Manchu mustache that Richard Petty sports these days may suggest he is jazzing up his image, but actually it reflects the fact that Petty is so sure of himself that he can do anything he wants to. After all he is the biggest winner in Grand National stockcar racing  more than 150 victories and $1million  and he has had every honor there is in racing. Petty is the only man ever to win four Grand National championship (to do that he had to beat the record jointly held by his father, Lee Petty).

title: ERVING GETS 44, BUT SQUIRES BOW
description: HAMPTON, Va, Feb. 17 (AP) Lou Dampier's layup with 71 seconds left broke a tie and sparked the Kentucky Colonels to a 112105 American basketball Association victory over the Virginia Squires tonight.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION

title: Guaranteed Pay in Belgium
description: BRUSSELS, Belgium, Feb. 17 (AP)  Belgian employers reached agreement with major trade unions today on giving most workers a guaranteed monthly wage amounting to $312, a 40hour work week and fourweek vacations by 1975. At present there is no guaranteed wage. Workers work a minimum of 42 hours and have threeweek vacations.

title: Women's Caucus Planning L.I. Role
description: WOODMERE, L.I.  Ramifications from the National Women's Political Caucus held recently in Houston soon could be reaching local levels, including Nassau County, and affecting men as well as women.

title: THE GOLDEST DAY OF WINTER CHILLS CITY TO DEGREES
description: The coldest weather of the winter.  a nosereddening, cheeknumbing 7 degrees at midmorning  clasped the metropolitan area in an Arctic embrace yesterday.

title: Anglers Get Night Camping Permits
description: SEASIDE PARK  when the stripedbass season opens on March 1, beachbuggy enthusiasts, who pay $75 a year for the privilege of riding on the sand while surf fishing at Island Beach State Park, will find themselves getting a little more for their money.

title: Identification of Aspirin In Medicines Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI) The American Academy of Allergy has unanimously approved a resolution recommending that non prescription medicines identify, whether as pirin is an ingredient.

title: City Finance Hearings Scheduled This Week
description: Following are public hearings scheduled this week by City Council committees in the Board of Estimate Chamber in City Hall:

title: Jane Wasley Fiancee of Denis S. Neuhut
description: GREAT NECK, L. L., Feb. 17Miss Jane Lois Wesley, a senior elected to Phi Beta Kappa at Barnard College, will be married in May to Denis Scott Neuhut, a graduate of Columbia College and a thirdyear student at the College of Physicians and Surgeons.

title: Shane Gould Shatters U.S. 200 Swim Record
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 17 (UPI)Shane Gould of Australia set an American record in the 200yard freestyle and won two other races in the first women's world invitation swimming meet today.

title: Shipping/Mails
Steelworkers Seek to Buy New National Headquarters
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 17  The United Steelworkers of America is negotiating to buy a 13story building in downtown Pittsburgh that would serve as future headquarters of the 1.4 million member union,

title: U.S. Judge Voids Ouster Of Boyle Aide by U.M.W.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17A Federal judge has ruled that the new United Mine Workers administration cannot dismiss a trustee of the union's pension fund simply because the man is an associate of the ousted U.M.W. president, W. A. Boyle.

title: 2,000 Tanks Reported Sent By Soviet to East Germany
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Feb. 17 (AP)A Frankfurt newspaper said today that the Soviet Union had sent 2,000 new tanks into East Germany during the last few months to strengthen the Russian garrison of 20 divisions.

title: You See Yourself in Heartbreak
description: THE REVIEWS touting The Heartbreak Kid as a human comedy do not give audiences a fair idea of what they're in for, and when I recently saw the film for a second time, part of the audience was noticeably puzzled and disappointed. It Is indeed a human comedy, but not In the sense the word is ordinarily used by reviewers; it's not warm or tender or affectionate, though it is an unflinching, mercilessly accurate portrait of human awkwardness and cruelty. Audiences see themselves on the screen, and they don't like what they see.

title: New Novel
description: Apostles Of Light By Ellen Douglas. 307 pp. Boston: Houghton Mifflin Co. $6.95.

title: Soviet Union The State Versus God's Fool
description: As one of the creators of the Soviet hydrogen bomb and it member of the Soviet Academy of Sciences, Andrei Sakharov belongs to that scientific elite on which the Russian Government depends in its technological competition with the United States. But as a member of Russia's small coterie of political dissidentshe has long been championing the causes of individual Russians whose civil rights have been violatedMr. Sakharov is thorn in the Government's side.

title: Austrian Sled Leads in 4Man Title Event
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Feb. 17 In zero weather that caused one contestant from Sweden to say that it's making my teeth chatter, Werner DelleKarth of Austria gained the jump over 19 rivals today as the world fourman bobsled championships started on milelong Mount Van Hoevenberg.

title: Blair Academy Is Revitalized by the Admission of Coeds
description: BLAIRSTOWN  A threeyearold coeducational experiment at Blair Academy not only has revitalized the school's character, but also has been Its economic and academic salvation.

title: Secret Service Flap Over Guarding Nixon
description: WASHINGTONIt's called the Secret Service, but in recent years some of its doings have received the kind of public scrutiny normally reserved for the center ring of a threering circus.

title: KISSINGER MEETS MAO FOR 2 HOURS
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 17 (AP)Henry A. Kissinger and MSo Tsetung met for nearly two hours tonight in what were described as frank and wideranging conversations in an unrestrained atmosphere, the Florida White House announced.

title: Memphis Taxpayers Win Ruling on Taxes Not Paid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI) The Internal Revenue Service has agreed to let some 50,000 Memphis residents claim county taxes as deductions on 1972 income tax returns even though the taxes were not paid that year.

title: U.S. Plane Arrives In Hanoi to Pick Up 20 More Prisoners
description: CLARK AIR BASE, Philippines, Sunday, Feb. 18 (AP)A United States Air Force C141 medical evacuation aircraft, which left here at noon today (11 P.M. Saturday New York time), has landed in Hanoi, North Vietnam, to pick up 20 more prisoners of war.

title: Ocean Pollution
description: WASHINGTONIf Columbus, Magellan, Cabot and the other great explorers were to reenact their journeys today, they would marvel at yet another wonder of the new worldvast currents and eddies of pollution and debris slicking the surface of hundreds of thousands of square miles of the Atlantic and Caribbean.

title: Dance
description: BOSTON DO you remember Alice Ghostley, in a New Faces of the midnineteenfifties, singing with such passion: It happened in Boston? (Don't write and tell me the song was actually called The Boston Beguine because I know it was.) So what has been happening in Boston lately? Well, Al Pacino is playing Richard III, which I haven't yet seen, Henry Kissinger has finally defected, and the Boston Ballet has given a pretty successful season at the vast Music Hall Theater. This house is part cinema (it is Boston's answer to Radio City Music Hall) and yet does occasionally present theater pieces. It is the theater where the major touring dance companies, such as Britain's Royal Ballet or Moscow's Bolshoi, play. But this was the first time the Boston Ballet had ventured in there. It did marvelous business, I am told.

title: Sandman to Oppose Cahill in G.O.D. Primary in June
description: TRENTON, Feb. 17Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr. announced today that he would challenge Governor Cahill in the Republican gubernatorial primary election in June.

title: The power to make war and peace Foreign Affairs and The Constitution
description: Lawyers and laymen alike think of Constitutional issues in terms of what the Supreme Court says and  for a generation at least  almost exclusively in terms of the Court's treatment of individual liberties and civil rights. Only rarely are we conscious that in largest part the Constitution is not a charter of liberties but a blueprint for a federal system of government. And when we are, it its a crisis  the Treaty of Versailles, F.D.R.'s court packing Or the Vietnam warwhich has served to dramatize that fact.

title: Carl Gram Jr., Chairman Of ElectricControl Concern
description: Carl W. Gram Jr., board chairman of Actronics, Inc., manufacturers of electric controls, and a director of the United States Olympic Committee, died Friday at the Racquet and Tennis Club of a heart attack. He was 57 years old and lived at 1192 Park Avenue and in East Hampton, L. I.

title: SECRET SERVICE AIDE EXPLAINS TRANSFER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The director of the Secret Service, James J. Rowley, issued a statement yesterday denying reports that the head of the detail assigned to guard President Nixon had been removed because of a rift with the White House chief of staff, H. R. Haldeman.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
Buffet Dinners Slated For Knick Followers
description: A series of weekly pro basketball buffet dinners, highlighted by films of New York Knickerbocker games, will begin at 5:30 P.M. Tuesday at the Jak Nicholas Restaurant, 500 Eighth Avenue near 35th Street.

title: E. G. Eisert Fiance Of Cynthia Klieger
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Feb. 17Dr. and Mrs. Israel Stanley Klieger have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cynthia Gail Klieger, to Edward Gayer Eisert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Israel J. Bisert of New York.

title: Technology Put in Its Place
description: FREEPORT, L.T.A ninthgrader at Freeport High School fumbled with the wires as she attempted to hook together an electric circuit in the classroom laboratory. Eventually, the girl, who spoke no English, got the knack, and a small bulb glowed. The smile that crossed her face glowed as brightly as the bulb.

title: S. J. Poppoon to Wed Miss Archer
description: ROSEMONT, Pa., Feb. 17Mr. and Mrs. Richard Paul Archer of Rosemont, Pa., formerly of New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Fowler Archer, to Stephen J. Poppoon; son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis C. Poppoon of Penfield, N. Y. The couple plan to be married in June.

title: Despite Its Reorganization, Attacks on the State P.S.C. Come From Many Sides
description: Just three years ago the New York State Public Service Commission, whose activities in regulating the operations of electric, telephone, telegraph, steam and watersupply systems touch everyone in the state, went through the most extensive shakeup since it was formed in 1907 to protect the consumer.

title: Scotch Plains Is Taking Shift in Stride
description: SCOTCH PLAINS This quiet town in western Union County appears to be taking in stride a conversion from what has been described as a horse  and  buggy days fermi of government, into what it confidently believes will be an efficient modern way to run a municipality.

title: Laver Vanquishes Smith; First Meeting in 2 Years
description: TORONTO, Feb. 17In their first meeting in more than two years Rod Laver fought back to defeat Stan Smith, 46, 63, 76, in the semifinals of the $50,000 Toronto international tennis tournament today.

title: JAZZ GREATS JAM TO LAUD HAMPTON
description: The golden age of jazz was brought back for one fleeting evening at the 33d annua Beaux Arts Ball Friday night when Lionel Hampton, Benny Goodman, Teddy Wilson, Gene Krupa, Illinois Jacque and Tyree Glenn got together for an unscheduled jam session in the sedate WaldorfAstoria Hotel. They brought down the house.

title: Legislative Notes: Switching Parties
description: TRENTON  When a Federal Court ruled last year that voters in New Jersey could switch party affiliations in primary elections without restrictions, it was hailed by some as a notable reform.

title: Czechoslovak Skiers Capture Two Events
description: VIENNA, Feb. 17 (AP) Tomas Kucera of Czechoslovakia won the men's 15kilom eter crosscountry race and a countryman, Rudolf Hoehnl, won the ski jump on the 90meter hill today at the Tatran Cup Nordic competition in Czechoslovakia's Tatro Mountains.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: About nine months ago the J. M. Smucker Company of Orrville, Ohio, decided to give the consumer a little more information about what was in the jams, jellies, ice cream toppings and syrups it makes.

title: Pollution Stalls Automobile Stocks
description: One of the great mysteries of Wall Street these days is why the automobile stocks have been stuck in a rut, steadfastly ignoring every indication of boom conditions in the car business.

title: Vodika's Late Run Takes LeComte at Fair Grounds
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 17 (AP)  Vodika rallied in the stretch to win the $20,000added LeComte Handicap at the Fair Grounds today.

title: U.S. Agency Prepares to Aid Students
description: The Federal, Office of Education has taken the first procedural steps to start a major program for aid to college and other postsecondary students.

title: BOSTWICK ADVANCES IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: PRINCETON, NJ., Feb. 17Pete Bostwick, former world's open court tennis titleholder from New York, scored two upsets today to reach the quarterfinals of the United States squash racquets championships at Jadwin gymnasium.

title: S. H. Cohen to Marry Miss Myra Kremenko
description: Mr. and Mrs. Barney Kremenko of Riverdale, the Bronx, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Myra Kremenko, to Steven Howard Cohen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Cohen of Flushing, Queens.

title: RITGER TAKES FINAL IN $60,000 BOWLING
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 7 (AP)Dick Ritger of Hartford, Wis., began his final game with a string of four strikes, picked up a difficult split later and hung on for a 225222 victory in the $60,000 Fair Lanes open bowling tournament today.

title: MALTESE IS CHOSE BEST AT HARTFORD
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 17  The smallest dog in the ring, a fivepound Maltese, Ch. Aennchen's Paris Dancer, scored the biggest victory of his career, when he was named best in a field of 1,318 at the 44th show of the First Company Governor's Foot Guard Athletic Association in the State Armory tonight.

title: Heidi Virginia Porter, Teacher, Married
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Feb. 17Miss Heidi Virginia Porter, daughter of Mrs. Warren J. Garoni of Montclair, formerly of Smoke Rise, and Oscar S. Porter of Stockton, was married here this afternoon to David Graham Webster, son of Dr. and Mrs. Graham T. Webster of Chardon, Ohio. The Rev. Herbert Donovan performed the candlelight ceremony at St. Luke's Episcopal Church.

title: David Petro Is Fiance Of Christina C. Casey
description: RYE, N. Y., Feb. 17The engagement of Miss Christina Catherine Casey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles F. Casey of Rye, to David Joseph Petro of Hartford, son of Mr. and Mrs. David G. Petro of Perth Amboy, N. J., has been announced by the future bride's father.

title: New School District Is Announced for Bushwick Section
description: Acting quickly on the heels Of the State Legislature's approval of a bill that reduces the required size of community school districts in the city, the Board of Education announced last week the creation of a new district for Brooklyn, encompassing the Bushwick section of the borciugh.

title: Milan's Student Unrest Generates Fear and Tension
description: MILAN, Feb. 11  A surge Of student turbulence has created a climate of tension and fear in this center of big business in Italy's wealthiest area.

title: Rules Deadline Extended For Meat Packers in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP) The Agriculture Department announced that meat packers will have another six months to abide by new Federal regulations that require windows in bacon packages and full beling of ingredients in hams.

title: Too strong a taste for battle
description: HIS is Anthony Herbert's own story of his long love affair with the United States Army, a love affair that ended sadly in Vietnam in 1969 and turned to bitter anger and recrimination. Beginning with his boyhood in a western Pennsylvania coal town, the long autobiography details his exploits of slaughter of enemy soldiers in Korea and Vietnam, his rise in the Army from an illeducated private to a lieutenant colonel in charge of an infantry battalion with a master's degree in psychology, and ends with blowbyblow account of his public feud with the Army he loved and claims to love still. If hell bath no fury like a woman scorned, it is no less true of this professional soldier.

title: Common Market Gives U.N. Aid for Palestinian Refugees
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 17The European Economic Community has come to the aid of the United Nations agency in charge of Palestinian refugees with a donation of food and cash valued at $4.3million.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The role of banks and other multinational corporations in the tumultuous currency speculation that led to last week's devaluation of the dollar has been outlined in a general way in a Tariff Commission study just published.

title: AN ITALIAN DAILY USES FACSIMILE
description: ROME, Feb. 17La Stampa of Turin, a national newspaper with a daily circulation of more than 500,000, has started a facsimile edition in Rome that has made Italian press history.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Feb. 18 (AP)  Graham McRae of New Zealand, his car packed in dry ice combat temperatures of more than 100 degrees, clinched his third Tasman Cup championship today by winning the nexttolast race of the eightrace series. McRae, in a fiveliter STP McRae, won the 52lap, 111.36mile race in 55 minutes 32.3 seconds, an average speed of 108.45 miles an hour.

title: Tugmen and Employers Start Talks as Contract Date Nears
description: The 2,800 men who man the 300 tugs and barges that dock the ships in the harbor and keep the metropolitan area supplied with fuel and building materials have started contract talks with their employers.

title: Elaine Shaffer, Flutist, 47, Dies
description: Elaine Shaffer, an internationally known concert flutist, died early today of cancer at a London hospital. She was 47 years old and lived, between concert tours, in Gstaad, Switzerland with her husband, the conductor Efrem Kurtz.

title: Newsman, a Critic of Police Is Arrested in Newark
description: NEWARK, Feb. 18 (UPI) A television newsman who has written a book critical of the Newark police was arrested today for allegedly creating a disturbance outside a South Ward tavern.

title: Students Educate Panel Studying Unrest in Schools
description: After the state commission that has been studying unrest among students releases its fourth and final report next month, one of any lasting effects its work may have will apparently be in the education of its own members.

title: VIETNAM FIGHTING GOES ON UNABATED DESPITE APPEAL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Feb. 19.  The recent upsurge in fighting showed no signs of abating yesterday despite an urgent appeal by the FourParty Joint Military Commission for an immediate end to hostilities.

title: Amer. Basketball Assn
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Yale Downs Princeton Six
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 18Yale scored three goals in the third period last night and defeated Princeon, 5.2, in hockey, avenging a 42 loss to the Tigers 10 days earlier.

title: Parade Today
description: A parade by the Knights of Columbus marking George Washington's birthday is to begin today at 9:45 A.M. at 35th Street and Fifth Avenue and go up the avenue to St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: STATUARY If you would like to recall Washington en passant, there are several places in town where you can see him portrayed in stone. At the Williamsburg Bridge Plaza, in Brooklyn, Washington at Valley Forge (horseborne), is a statue done in 1906 by Henry M. Shrady. In Manhattan, he shows up in statuary in front of Federal Hall; in Union Square Park; at Washington Arch, at the beginning of Fifth Avenue; with Lafayette, on a pedestal, at Manhattan Avenue and 114th Street, a work done by Frederic A. Bartholdi (the Statue of Liberty man in 1876, which was the nation's 100th birthday. The roster is probably not complete, but it will do for a cold day.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Now that the 1950's favoritethe shirtwaist dressis back in fashion, could the spectator shoe be far behind? After all, it was the saddle shoe grown up, and the generation that spent its girlhood under petticoated shirtwaists remembers it with affection.

title: Europeans Act to Curb the Sex Market
description: LONDON, Feb. 18  To the taped strains of Stranger in Paradise, Eric and Marie went on stage for their twicenightly sex performance in the dim nightclub in downtown Stockholm.

title: Bridge: A Rare Triple Tie Occurs In Men's Pair Contest Here
description: Pair championships not infrequently end in a tie, but a triple tie is virtually unknown. One occurred Friday in the men's pair championship in the Greater New York sectional tournament at the New York Hilton. The winners, were Bernard Gench of New York and Dov Happaz of Great Neck, L. I., tied with Joe Pastemack and Joseph Cirignano, both of New York, and with Max Shapiro and Theodore Freudenheim, both of New York.

title: Daniels Quits Boxing
description: bouts, including one to Joe Terry Daniels, a heavyweight boxer who has lost six straight bounts, including one to Joe Frazier, has decided to retire from boxing. He was stopped by John Conteh of Britain in the seventh round last Wednesday.

title: Owners, Players Are Still Talking
description: If there's any encouraging sign in the baseball negotiations, it's that representatives of the owners and players are meeting more frequently than at any time since talks began last September.

title: Troy Wants New System To Announce City Projects
description: Matthew J. Troy Jr., new chairman of the City Council's Finance Committee, demanded yesterday that all agencies announce local projects through Councilmen instead of through mayoral task forces or neighborhood offices.

title: Leave It to Beaver Takes Hunter Title At Show in Weston
description: WESTON, Conn., Feb. 18Jessica Fleischmann's Leave It to Beaver made his first start and won the regular working hunter championship today at the Nimrod Farms horse show.

title: 4Week Soviet Trip By Limon Dancers To Begin on Friday
description: The Jose Limn Dance Company will leave here Friday for a fourweek tour of the Soviet Union that will take it to Leningrad, Riga, Kiev and Moscow. Only one other moderndance company  the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theaterhas toured the Soviet Union.

title: Books of The Times
description: BUCK?. A Guided Tour of Buckminster Fuller. By Hugh Kenner. 338 pages. Illustrated. Morrow. $7.95.

title: School Reform Autopsy
description: Usually intent on publicity for their grandiose plans, institutionswhether public or privateare not often quite as anxious to invite public scrutiny later on, when some of the earlier promise may have gone sour. The Ford Foundation therefore deserves special commendation for publishing A Foundation Goes to School, a detailed appraisal of its school improvement projects which spanned the decade of the sixties at a cost of $30 million.

title: Women's Group Reelects Its President
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18The National Organization for Women reelected Wilma Scott Heide today as its president and elected Judith Lightfoot, a native of the Bronx who now lives in. Decatur, Ga., to what it calls its chairone of the board.

title: CUNNINGHAM STARS IN COUGAR VICTORY
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb. 18 (AP)  The Carolina Cougars rolled to a 138114 American Basketball Association victory over the Memphis Tams today. Mark Calvin played most of the game and totaled 27 points, scoring in only the second and third quarters. Billy Cunningham had 20 points, 17 rebounds and 17 assists for the winners.

title: Salzman's QUOG Is Not All It's Supposed to Be
description: Lots of composers have been good critics, and even vice versa, so Eric Salzman's eloquent writingon behalf of himself and othershas naturally aroused attention.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I note that the Vietnam, ceasefire agreement contains the following language: In pursuance of its traditional policy, the United States will contribute to healing the wounds of war arid to postwar reconstruction of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam and throughout Indochina. Since the President's announcement of the agreement there has appeared in the press discussion, and in your newspaper endorsement, Of the future extension by the United States to North Vietnam of economic assistance of some $2.5 billion.

description: Man in the News

title: Europeans Act to Curb the Sex Market
description: LONDON, Feb. 18  To the taped strains of Stranger in Paradise, Eric and Marie went on stage for their twicenightly sex performance in the dim nightclub in downtown Stockholm.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Red Smith
description: Driving home from the Polo Grounds, where he was a broadcaster covering the New York Giants, Frank Frisch was weaving through the East Bronx on what he hoped was a shortcut to New Rochelle. He got too close to the curb and the car brushed a fat lady. She was Puerto Rican, and excitable, with the pitch of a steam calliope, and her drowned out the screech of brakes. She was hitting C over high C and drawing a crowd when she broke off abruptly, peering at the face behind the wheel.

title: A Perennial Leads Way into N.C.A.A. Field
description: U.C.L.A. has won 66 straight basketball games, Long Beach State has lost once In 23 games and Marquette has won 20 of 22, but they have not qualified yet for the National Collegiate championship tournament. Weber State has, as usual.

title: BONN CUTS BUDGET AND RAISES TAXES
description: BONN, Feb. 18  The West German Government announced today a series of tax increases and a sharply trimmed budget, and said that both measures were aimed at curbing inflationary price rises.

title: The Theater Donald Driver's Status Quo Vadis
description: Donald Driver, the author and director of Status Quo Vadis, which opened at the Brooks Atkinson Theater last night, is much obsessed with class in American society. In This way he may be making valid sociological point, but it does not necessarily leave him with a valid play.

title: State's Ski Areas Suffer With Few Frozen Assets
description: VERNON VALLEY, Feb. 18 (UPI)New Jersey's largest ski area has installed $1million in snowmaking equipment this year, but management acknowledges that there is still nothing like natural snow to lure the skier to the hills.

title: Book Recalls Life in Shops
description: Garment work in factories here 60 years ago was described in the following excerpt from The Triangle Fire, by Leon Stein an account of the tragic Triangle Shirtwaist Company fire of 1911.

title: Quiet Battle Is Under Way in Vietnam For Areas That Neither Side Controls
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 18A silent battle is under way in South Vietnam for the control of areas in which neither the Government nor the Communists can claim to exercise full authority. The weapons are people.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, FEBRUARY 19, 1973

title: 8th Oklahoma Convict Seized
description: McALESTER, Okla, Feb. 18 (AP)Only one of the nine convicts who burowed out of the Oklahoma State Prison remained free today after the eighth was captured late last night. The capture of John O. Engberg, serving 50 years for armed robbery, left Jack O. Stewart the only free convict.

title: Sadat Aide to Visit China; Another Will Meet Nixon
description: CAIRO, Feb. 18  Foreign Minister Mohammed H. elZayyat will fly to Peking later this month as part of a worldwide diplomatic campaign that is taking Hafez Ismail, President Anwar elSadat's adviser on national security, to Washington.

title: LAYER IS WINNER AT TORONTO AGAIN
description: TORONTO, Feb. 18 (AP)Australia's Rod Laver won the men's singles title for the second straight year in the $50,000 Rothmans indoor tennis tournament, trouncing a countryman, Roy Emerson, 63, 64, today.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Oyster Creek Fish Kills Laid to Nuclear Plant
description: WARETOWN, Feb. 18 (UPI) Officials in Ocean Township reported today the second fishkill in three days in Oyster Creek and said they would bring complaints against a nearby nuclear generating plant to the State Legislature.

title: Humphrey Sees New Chance for Peace in Mideast
description: Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said here last night that the end of the war in Vietnam and the withdrawal of American forces from Indochina could lead to peace in the Middle East.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 25

title: A SkiLift Failure Kills Brooklyn Man And Hurts 2 Others
description: WARWICK, N. Y., Feb. 18One New York City man was killed and another was injured at the Mt. Peter Skiing Center near here this afternoon when the skilift chair they were in broke loose from the lift cable and dropped with them 45 feet to the ground.

title: Lindsay Appointees Insecure on Job Future
description: Mayor Lindsay's bimonthly cabinet meetings, perhaps because they are usually closed to the news media, are enlivened by barbed inside humor about situations that the officials prefer not to discuss publicly.

title: Shultz Calls Money Talks Slow And Opposes an Import Surtax
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (Reuters)  Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz complained today that international negotiations on a more flexible monetary system had been moving too slowly.

description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: COLONELS SCORE OVER NETS, 9485
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 18The Kentucky Colonels put on a 9point rally midway in the fourth quarter to break open a tight game and defeat the New York Nets, 9485, tonight.

title: Deceiver
description: In Mao's China there is a maxim: Those who seek power for personal ends eventually run afoul of popular opinion,

title: Hanoi Aide Leaves for Paris
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Feb. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)Deputy Foreign Minister Nguyen Co Thach left today for Peking and Paris at the head of a mission of experts to take part in the international conference on Vietnam, scheduled to begin Feb. 26 in Paris.

title: 11498 Triumph Philadelphia's 3d in 4 Gaines
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 18 Completing their most glorious week of the basketball season, the Philadelphia 76ers defeated the New York Knicks, 11498 today, for their third straight home victory and a .750 pacethree out of four since snapping their record 20game losing streak Wednesday night.

title: Sadat Aide to Visit China; Another Will Meet Nixon
description: CAIRO, Feb. 18  Foreign Minister Mohammed H. elZayyat will fly to Peking later this month as part of a worldwide diplomatic campaign that is taking Hafez Ismail, President Anwar elSadat's adviser on national security, to Washington.

title: Police Kill One Man And Wound Another In 2 Incidents Here
description: Policemen in Manhattan and Brooklyn shot one man to death and wounded another yesterday when the men allegedly threatened the patrolmen with weapons.

title: Smallpox in Bangladesh
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Feb. 18 (Reuters)  A smallpox epidemic has erupted in Bangladesh and more than 1,000 people have died,. Dr. N. A. Ward, the World Health Organization adviser here, has announced. Dr. Ward said 200 cases a week were being reported from contested areas in Dacca, the capital, where he called the situation extremely serious.

title: MARY TRAVERS SINGS ON CURRENT TOPICS
description: Good political songs are hard to find, said the singer Mary Travers during her Carnegie Hall concert Saturday, and that comment underlines her attitude to her work. She sings to inform and illuminate, perhaps to educate.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Classified pages distributed in meropolHan New York and adjacent territory.

title: MAN SHOT TO DEATH AT A WEDDING PARTY
description: One man was killed and three others were wounded early yesterday during a shooting spree at a wedding reception in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn.

description: A band of bluecoats fired musket volley over the heads of a crowd and then advanced with fired bayonets toward 250 men, women and children armed with cameras.

title: L.I. CATHOLIC TRACK WON BY CHAMINADE
description: Chaminade High School captured its third straight Long Island Catholic schools indoor track championship yesterday at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Kissinger and Chou Talk for Five Hours
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 18Henry A. Kissinger met for five hours today with Premier Chou Enlai on the fourth day of his visit to Peking, the White House announced here.

title: $100,000 in Pelts Stolen
description: Three armed men handcuffed a guard at the MeiselPeskin furfinishing plant in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn and escaped with $100,000 worth of unfinished pelts early yesterday morning, the police said. The robbers entered the plant at 349 Scholes Street by forcing a secondfloor window.

title: The Stained Glass Proved to Be One of Tiffany's Earliest Works
description: SOUTH NORWALK, Conn. The unexpected discovery of that stained glass window made Robert Koch's Thanksgiving not only the most memorable of his life, but also provided a footnote to the author's work in documenting the stunning glass achievements of Louis Comfort Tiffany.

title: Bullets Triumph, 96 to 93, As Bucks' Comeback Fails
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Feb. 18 (AP)Archie Clark sank two free throws with five seconds left and preserved a 9693 victory for the Baltimore Bullets over the Milwaukee Bucks today in a National Basketball Association game.

title: A SemiDocumentary Shown on N.B.C.
description: Street of the Flower Boxes was presented at noon Saturday over the network of the National Broadcasting Company. Billed as a semidocumentary, the onehour program was a special production for N.B.C. Children's Theater.

title: Petty's Steady Pace Wins Daytona 500
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 18  Richard Petty, the overall leader in stockcar victories, won the Daytona 500 today after two faster cars, flogged to their limit, broke down in the final stages. The stronger opponent, Buddy Baker, retired with less than 15 miles to go and dropped down to sixth place.

title: Copernicus
description: Nicolaus Copernicus was born 500 years ago today, and much of the civilized world is properly marking the occasion. Technically, Copernicus' immortal contribution was to challenge the ancient fallacyformalized in the intricate Ptolemaic astronomical schemethat the earth was the center of the universe, the point around which the sun, the planets and the stars revolved. Not so, Poland's greateit scientist argued; it is the earth that moves around the sun. Half a millenium of scientific progress has vindicated the Copernican thesis.

title: Bluecoats Corning, by George!
description: CROTON  ON  HU??SON, N. Y., Feb. 18A ban?? of bluecoats fired a musket volley over the heads of a crowd here today and then advanced with fixed bayonets toward 200 men, women and children armed only with cameras.

title: Delighted Parents of ExP.O.W Plan Joyful Reunion at L.I. Home
description: I saw him get off that plane and walk along that chow line, and he was smiling every moment of the way, boomed Joseph McManus of Babylon, L.I., yesterday as he broke away from a champagne party toasting the return of his son from North Vietnamese captivity. He looked like he could do five more years and eight months standing on his head.

title: Star Trek Sparks Future Nostalgia
description: Several thousand youthful escapists packed the meeting rooms of the Commodore Hotel yesterday to celebrate their devotion to the defunct science  fiction television show Star Trek.

title: Carolina Gamecock Scores
description: BOSTON, Feb. 18 (AP)Carolina Gamecock broke on top and led all the way in winning the $6,500 Mr. Harrison Handicap before a crowd of 9,353 today at Suffolk Downs. The winner, ridden by Joe McKenna, scored by one length over Towmotor Tony.

title: F.D.A. Is Recalling More Mushrooms For Botulism Check
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration said today that botulism toxin had been found in second lot of canned mushrooms, but added that there was not evidence that the contaminated food had reached the public.

title: Export Demand Causing GrainElevator Squeeze
description: GRAND FORKS, N.D.Tremendous export demand for wheat has clogged the railroad pipeline to the nation's ports and left farmers and country grainelevator operators in a squeeze.

title: Nixon to Seek Unions' Backing Today
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 18Fifty leaders of organized labor were assembling today for a meeting tomorrow with President Nixon at which the President will seek their backing for his economic policies.

title: 20 More Freed P.O. W,'s Greeted at Clark Air Base
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Philippines, Monday, Feb. 19 Twenty American prisoners of, war arrived here last night from Hanoi, looking healthy, saluting the flag, and waving and smiling at a crowd of more than a thousand wellwishers.

title: Exchanges Closed Today
description: All securities exchange and major commodities markets in the United States will be closed today in observance of Washington's Birthday. Banks also will be closed in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

description: SACTONS RIVER, Vt., Feb. 18  Eaglebrook School of Deerfield, Mass., defeated five other schools today in an invitation junior prep school slalom and giant slalom competition at Vermont Academy. Eaglebrook scored 189.32 points to 175.87 for Berkshire. Matt Bell of Cardigan Mountain School was individual winner in both races.

title: Frank Costello Dies Of Coronary at 82; Underworld Leader,

description: CHICAGO, Feb. 18The jury in the trial of former Gov. Otto Kerner and Theodore J. Isaacs completed its second day of deliberations tonight without reaching a verdict.

title: White House Plans Law to Ease Tax Problems of War Widows
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 Legislation that would solve some difficult incometax problems for the families of servicemen who had been listed as missing in Vietnam, but who are now found to be dead, will be proposed shortly by the Nixon Administration.

title: AUSTRALIANS CITE CURRENCY LOSSES
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Feb. 18Prime Minister Gough Whitlam's Government has come under heavy pressure to devalue the Australian dollar because of the latest American devaluation.

title: CANADIENS DOWN MAPLE LEAFS, 21
description: TORONTO, Feb. 18 (AP) Jim Roberts and Steve Shutt scored 26 seconds apart early in the second period today and the Montreal Canadiens edged the Toronto Maple Leafs, 21, in a National Hockey League game.

title: TERROR CHARGED AT ATHENS TRIAL
description: ATHENS, Feb. 18Lawyers defending 11 university students charged with insulting the police during a campus meeting said in court today that the trial was being held under conditions of terror.

title: Sharks Beat Blazers, 41, in W.H.A.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 18 (UPI) George Gardner stopped 25 shots on goal as the Los Angeles, Sharks topped the Philadelphia Blazers, 41, in a World Hockey Association game tonight.

description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Feb. 18A proposal to float huge trains of icebergs froth Antarctica to the Southern California coast to provide an abundance of fresh water for this and region is being seriously studied by the National Science Foundation.

title: ITURBI IS EXCELLENT AT HIS RARE RECITAL
description: Jos Iturbi, the Spanish pianist, has played before American audiences for 44 years and now liyes in Beverly Hills, Calif. But he had not given a solo re cital in New York since 1967, and his admirers welcomed him warmly yesterday afternoon in Philharmonic Hall.

title: Martin and Waltke Reach P. Washington Tennis Final
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Feb. 18Billy Martin of Palos Verdes, Calif., seeded first and Trey Waltke of Los Angeles, seeded fourth, reached the 18's final of the junior indoor tournament at the Port Washington Tennis Academy tonight.

description: MOSCOW, Feb. 18. (AP) President Nikolai V. Podgorny has been awarded the Order of Lenin, the Soviet Union's highest civilian honor, on his 70th birthday, the press agency Tass announced today.

title: BONN CUTS BUDGET AND RAISES TAXES
description: BONN, Feb. 18  The West German Government announced today a series of tax increases and a sharply trimmed budget, and said that both measures were aimed at curbing inflationary price rises.

title: COLONELS SCORE OVER NETS, 9485
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 18The Kentucky Colonels put on a 9point rally midway in the fourth quarter to break open a tight game and defeat the New York Nets, 9485, tonight.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: THIEU SAYS SAIGON WILL NEED MORE AID
description: President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam said in an interview broadcast yesterday that his country would need more economic aid from the United States in peace than in war. He said also that diplomatic relations with Hanoi could be established in the future.

title: JUDAISM SEMINAR WILL BEGIN TODAY
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 18Protestant, Roman Catholic and Jewish scholars started gathering tonight for a fourday JewishChristian dialogue on Judaic studies at the Princeton Theological Seminary that begins tomorrow.

title: Threat to Pope Brings Strict Vatican Security
description: ROME; Feb. 18An anonymous warning that an attempt would be made on the life of Pope Paul VI caused strict security measures to be taken in and around, the Vatican today.,

title: The Politics Of Purity
description: The weeks since Nov. 7 appear to have hardened the view of Senator George S. McGovern that what the Democratic party needs most of all is an ideology. Not for him the classic view of the party as a large political umbrellaa party with no principles, no programs, living only from day to day, as he described the Democrats to an audience at Oxford University last month. In that faroff city his view may well have made a great deal of sense, as it would almost anywhere else in theory. But not in the United States, where large visions blueprinted in detail can do a party more damage than all the bugging operations its opponents can finance.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 25

title: Guggenheim Museum to Alter Facade
description: The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum plans to alter part of its Fifth Avenue facade by enclosing with glass an area now used as a driveway.

title: BEARD TAKES SPRINT ON COAST
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 18 (UPI)Willie Deckard of the University of Southern California defeated Valery Borzov of the Soviet Union, last night in the 60yard dash. Borzov's loss, his second indoors in two weeks, was decided by a photo in which he was placed third with Jim Kemp second.

description: Whatever its ultimate artistic and technological merits may be, quadraphonic sound understandably has the classicalrecord business rubbing its collective hands together with glee.
