description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)Spokesmen for the life insurance and banking industries today endorsed a bill to create price competition among brokers bidding for the orders of institutional investors.

title: Nixon's Vote Breaks Tie; Gives Shoe Concern Help
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)Breaking a tie vote on the Tariff Commission, President Nixon today declared the Bernie Shoe Company of Haverhill, Mass., and its workers eligible for adjustment assistance under the Trade Expansion Act of 1962.

title: ISRAELIS DOWN A LIBYAN AIRLINER IN THE SINAI, KILLING AT LEAST 74; SAY IT IGNORED WARNINGS TO LAND
description: JERUSALEM, Thursday, Feb. 22Israeli fighter planes shot down a civilian Libyan jetliner in the Sinai desert yesterday, killing at least 74 persons. Jerusalem officials said the plane had penetrated the airspace of the Israelioccupied Egyptian territory and had ignored instructions to land.

title: Dollar Crisis Leaves Bonn Confident
description: BONN, Feb. 21In contrast to the gloom evident in several European capitals affected by the latest international monetary crisis, Bonn appears to be brimming with confidence a week after the currency realignment. It is not that the West Germans rule out a new currency crisis. But they feel they emerged this time from what could have been a bitter situation with the country's major interests virtually unscathed. These interests include continuing close relations with the United States and neighboring France, keeping the European Economic Community intact and protecting the competitiveness of West Germany's vital exportbunsiness.

title: Dow Index Tumbles 925 As Glamour Issues Slump
description: An assorted bag of worries and a lack of buying interest combined to drive stock prices lower yesterday in a dispirited session.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 President Nixon promised relief to the American housewife today in the form of more reasonable food prices during the second half of 1973.

title: Uruguay Devalues Peso
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 21 (UPI)The central bank announced a devaluation of the Uruguayan peso today, raising the dollar to 815 pesos when bought and 823 pesos when sold. The change represents a 2.83 per cent devaluation from the former rate, set on Feb. 2.

title: FUTURES IN MEAT CLIMB TO RECORD
description: Meat and potatoes set new highs in terms of futures trading yesterday, offering the housewife no relief yet from rising prices.

description: BOISE, Idaho, Feb. 21 (UPI) The Idaho House of Repre sentatives yesterday approved a bill making aircraft hijacking a capital crime.

title: Kretchmer Can't
description: Jerome Kretchmer, Mayor Lindsay's former Environmental Protection Administrator, is running for Mayor with a campaign button that resembles the lid of a garbage receptacle and carries the slogan, Kretchmer Can. The question is, however, can he? Can he hope to succeed in his quest for higher office by slinging political mud?

title: Action on Nominee delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Acting on a request from former Senator Fred R. Harris, Democrat of Oklahoma for a public hearing, the Senaet Agriculture committee has delayed approval of President Nixon's nomination of Robert W. Long, a California bank executive, as an Assistant Secretary of Agriculture. Mr. Harris requested the hearing in a letter stating that he feared Mr. Long would be prejudiced in favor of big agribusiness corporations. The hearing will be held March 6.

title: Princes Who Lead Laos Along. Separate Paths
description: Odd and distinctly unLaotian noises sounded in the Vientiane villa of Prince Souvanna Phouma yesterday: the popping of champagne corks. Yet it was both appropriate and predictable that the Laotian Premier, who is of the most august Indochinese lineage, should break out French wine to usher in Men the peace. After all, the prince is very much of a Frenchman in many of his tastes and habits; he is nothing if not debonair. And after heading his Government during a decade of intermittent crisis, he has a lot to celebrate.

title: ALL MUSHROOM CANS REPORTED RECALLED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)  The Stouffer's Food Company said today that it had recovered all 14,000 cases of frozen food that may have contained poisoned mushrooms, but the Food and Drug Administration said it would make its own check before declaring an end to the emergency.

title: Mt. Atha's Menastery Fire
description: SALONIKA, Greece, Feb. 21 (AP)A fire swept through the Monastery of Xeropotamou on Mount Athos early today, destroying scores of ancient icons and sacred scrolls.

description: With players and owners both growing more impatient to romp in the sun that lights up their spring training camps, a little sunlight might have seeped into the baseball negotiations yesterday.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Secretary of State William P. Rogers hailed the Laotian ceasefire agreement today, but he expressed concern about the absence of a settlement in Cambodia so far.

title: Never Saw Vase Intact, Beirut Dealer Says
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 21 Dikran A. Sarrafian, the Lebanese art dealer who was named by the Metropolitan Museum of Art as the person who sold it an ancient Greek vase for about $1million last September, said today that he had never seen the vase as a whole until he looked at a picture of it in a newspaper this morning.

title: DEMOCRATS CURB SECRECY IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Reform forces in the House won a decisive victory today as Democratic members endorsed a sharp limitation on secrecy in committees.

title: The Spirit of '76 (Conservative Division)
description: The field of punditry is white with the bones of political writers who tried to predict the actions of Richard Nixon, and I decline to add mine to their number. In his second term Mr. Nixon may, for all I know, swing hard to the right, or elope with Angela Davis, or both. But there are those whose political orientation is more consistent  among them America's conservatives; and of these latter it is possible to speak with more confidence. They are alive and well; they will very definitely be around in 1976; and they may even, just possibly, elect one of their number to the Presidency that year.

title: Shooting of 2 Stirs London Controversy
description: LONDON, Feb. 21The police slaying of two youths who terrorized the Indian High Cornmissioner's office in Londonl yesterday has touched a raw nerve in British sensibilities about violence and is causing new concern over the use of firearms by policemen.

title: Books of The Times
description: I remember a friend of mine, an older writer, commenting on one of the first book reviews I ever wrote. It's a nice piece, he said, but you don't have to include the cosmos. He was telling me, in a kindly way, that I was young and inexperienced and straining too hard. I mention this here because, in reading Pauline Kael's Deeper Into Movies, I realized that she includes the cosmos, but with no strain at all. I don't think she could keep it out, and I hope she never tries.

title: A Transit Worker Is Indicted For Falsifying Job Application
description: The indictment of a Transit Authority car cleaner by a Brooklyn grand jury on charges of making a false statement about his scholastic record in and employment application was announced yesterday by District Attorney Eugene Gold.

title: Arthur Daley
description: During spring training of 1939, Lou Gehrig couldn't hit and he couldn't field. If he was reluctant to admit that his reflexes were shot, he could not avoid realization after the season began. On May 2, a historic day, a de cision was reached by the seemingly indestructible Iron Horse, the man whose record of playing in 2,130 consecutive games is hardly likely surpassed. He broke the news to Joe McCarthy, the Yankees' manager.

title: JAWS ARE SKETCHY ON AIR INTRUSION
description: Specialists in intemational aviation law agreed yesterday that a nation has a right to order a foreign airliner that strays into its airspace to land promptly within its territory.

title: Notes on People
description: Looking up seemed to be the best way to describe the state of United StatesIndian relations in New Delhi yesterday. To mark the arrival of Daniel Patrick Moynihan, the new American Ambassador, Air India placed a large billboard atop its downtown New Delhi office. The sign depicts Mr. Moynihan being kissed by the cartoon maharajah who serves, as the airline's symbol. And passersby raising their eyes read the inscription, Oh Danny Boy You're Irish, Puckish, Controversial, Orthodox. Oh Danny Boy we're going to love you so.

title: STUDENTS ON COAST HONOR SLAIN COEDS
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., Feb, 21 (AP)About 1,000 University of California students listened in silence today at the school's openair amphitheater as two slain coeds were eulogized. Classes were canceled from 10:30 A.M. to noon for the memorial convocation.

description: TRENTON, Feb. 21Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr. opened an attack on Governor Cahill today, charging that the Governor's Administration had been weak on corruption, states, and school busing.

Levywas arranged through the office of Abraham M. Lindenbaum, a leading realestate lawyer and former city planner now actively practicing before city agencies.

title: Valentines for Legislators
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 21 (UPI)Members of the National Organization for Women distributed red carnations and valentines last week to members of a legislative committee that opened hearings on the equal rights amendment for women, Last night at the second hearing, members of American Women Already Richly Endowed showed up with loaves of homemade bread for the lawmakers.

description: WEDNESDAY, FEB. 21, 1973

title: AMEX STOCKS OFF IN LIGHT TRADING
description: In relatively light trading, stocks opened mixed, dropped sharply and closed broadly lower on the American Stoek Exchange yesterday. The Amex index closed 0.13 lower to 25.24, after being unchanged at 10:30 A.M. It was the fifth straight session in which the index had decreased.

title: Peace Pact Approved By Hanoi's Assembly
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, Feb. 22 (Reuters)  North Vietnam's National Assembly has unanimously approved the Vietnam peace agreement signed by Hanoi and Washington officials last month, the North Vietnamese news agency reported today.

title: CANADIENS DOWN BLACK HAWKS, 42
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 21 (UN) Guy Lafleur feinted the Chicago Black Hawk goalie, Tony Esposito, out of position and scored the winning goal from Short range with 7:22 to play tonight to give the Montreal Canadiens a 42 victory in a National Hockey League game.

title: Former Fort Lee Tax Collector Guilty in U.S. Income Tax Case
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21A former tax collector of Fort Lee, Edward . McDermott, pleaded guilty today to not having filed Federal tax returns from 1969 to 1971.McDermott, the son of a former Fort Lee police chief, took a leave of absence from his tax post just after the indictment was announced. He did not seek reelection.

title: Blumenthal in Race
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal joined the ranks of Democratic mayoral candidates yesterday and announced his candidacy, declaring that he was the only liberal alternative to Mario Biaggi and John Lindsay who can be elected. Page 33.

title: Five in Soviet Leaflets Case Are Said to Face Early Trial
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21 (AP)Five men will go on trial soon for distributing leaflets accusing Soviet leaders of living better than many Czarist lords, dissident sources reported today.

title: Energy Shown By Washington In Jazz Playing
description: The fact that the first two record albums made by Grover Washington Jr., jazz saxophonist, have both been on the bestseller charts in the last year might suggest that he is a newcomer with a readily distinctive style. Actually, he has been around for more than 13 years, working as a sideman in various groups, and, in his New York debut this week at the Half Note, it is the results of those years of experience rather than any personal idiosyncracies that color his playing.

title: Official Backs U.S. Claim To Trade Aid in Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The United States supplied new evidence today to support its claim for substantial trade compensation from Europe for exports probably to be lost las a result of the recent enargement of the European Economic Community.

title: 'Lolly-Madonna' Appears on Screen
description: "Lolly-Madonna XXX" is a disaster, but I can't tell whether it's because hillbillies make rotten metaphors or because Richard C. Sarafian has made a rotten movie. The film was photographed in the Tennessee hills, and its cast includes Rod Steiger, Robert Ryan, Jeff Bridges, Season Hubley and a lot of other people who play characters with names like Laban and Pap and Ludie and Seb and Lolly-Madonna.Its high-minded intention: to demonstrate the futility of war in terms of a feud between the Feather family and the Gutshalls, which begins with some fussing over a piece of land and climaxes in the sort of fighting in which people really get their heads blown off. I assume Mr. Sarafian and his screenwriters thought they were making a film about Vietnam without making a film about Vietnam, which is the weasel way of dealing with Great Issues.Had the story about the Feathers and the Gutshalls any dramatic or emotional intensity of its own, it wouldn't be necessary to mention Vietnam. But "Lolly-Madonna" is so absolutely spineless, it can't even be consistent about its characters, some of whom come straight out of old Esquire cartoons and some of whom are apparently sophisticated enough to argue scruples vs. jrinciples. The result is what W. C. Fields, describing a particularly ghastly mixture of free lunch ingredients, once called a moulage.Mr. Sarafian, the director of "The Vanishing Point" and "Man in the Wilderness," has done better things, as has the co-author, of the screenplay, Rodney Carr-Smith, who worked on "Bartleby." Perhaps the blame should be put on the editorI don't know. I am sure, however, that "Lolly-Madonna" (which is a signature, not a film rating) opened yesterday at the 59th Street Twin East I Theater and it's indefensible on any level.

title: Gateway Plan Opposed on S.I. For Alleged Link to Jetport
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21State Senator John J. Marchi charged today that the new Gateway National Recreation Area project had been written to permit construction of a jetport off Staten Island. He said that because of this he would oppose the transfer of city lands to it.

title: U.S. Queries Laos Reds About Captives
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Thursday, Feb. 22  With the agreement signed to end the war in Laos, United States officials quickly made contact with the Communist Pathet Lao yesterday, apparently to find out whom it is holding as prisoners of war.

title: Jersey Law on Waste Affects Other States
description: TRENTON Feh. 21 (UPI)Governor Cahill signed a wastecontrol law today that gives, New Jersey authority over the disposal of trash and garbage from other states, principally New York.

title: MRS. PRESTON DELANO
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Mrs. Ruth Small Delano, widow of Preston Delano, Controller of the Currency from his appointment in 1938 by President Franklin D. Roosevelt, a distant cousin, to 1953, died Monday in the Washington Hospital Center. She was 82 years old.

title: Vermont 28th to Ratify
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Feb. 21 (AP)Vermont today became the 28th state to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment to the Constitution. Thirtyeight states must give their approval before it becomes law.

description: Housing Proposal Includes a School

title: InnerCity Protest
description: Embattled municipal officials and veterans of antipoverty crusades gathered in Washington this week to protest the Administration's spending freezes and proposed cuts in social services. While the municipal officials, members of the legislative action committee of the United States Conference of Mayors, and representatives of the poor met separately with various Congressional leaders, the thrust of their message was the same: there is need to reorder the Nixon Administration's priorities.

title: PrimaryRunoff Dates Get Final Legislative Approval
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21The Senate passed and sent to Governor Rockefeller today a bill providing for a statewide primary on June 4 and a runoff in New York City June 26 if it is needed in the contests for Mayor, City Council President and Controller.

description: An offduty police lieutenants was shot and seriously wounded when he tried to thwart a holdup by three men in a Washington Heights bar last night.

title: Pesticide Inquiry Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Senator Alan Cranston, Democrat of California, called today for a Government investigation of the agricultural use of a new pesticide said to be more powerful than DDT. The new pesticide, called Ortho Monitor, is produced by the Chevron Chem. icel Company. Mr. Cranston said the company had withdrawn use of the pesticide on lettuce but it was still being used on other crops around the country.

description: Looking up seemed to be the best way to describe the state of United StatesIndian relations in New Delhi yesterday. To mark the arrival of Daniel Patrick Moynihan, the new American Ambassador, Air India placed a large billboard atop its downtown New Delhi office. The sign depicts Mr. Moynihan being kissed by the cartoon maharajah who serves as the airline's symbol. And passersby raising their eyes read the inscription, Oh Danny Boy You're Irish, Puckish, Controversial, Orthodox. Oh Danny Boy we're going to love you so.

title: 1 Dead, 2 Injured in Bronx WaterTunnel Explosion
description: An explosion more than 565 feet underground at a watertunnel construction site near the city line in the Woodlawn section of the Bronx killed one worker and injured two others last night.

title: Okla. State Coach Quits
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Feb. 21 (AP)Sam Aubrey submitted his resignation today as head basketball coach at Oklahoma State University, Floyd Gass, athletic director, announced.

title: Democrats Say Governor Hid $764Million in State Budgets
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21  Democratic legislators charged today that Governor Rockefeller had hidden almost $764million in his 1972 and 1973 budgets by underestimating income and overestimating expenditures. They called for repeal of the 2.5 per cent incometax surcharge and elimination of the socalled hotdog tax.

title: New School District Approved For Bushwick, the 32d in City
description: The Board of Education last night established a new community school districtthe first since the start of school decentralization in 1970  for the Bushwick section of Brooklyn.

title: Personal Finance
description: Leaving money to loved ones is a tricky matter these days. Take the case of the man who thinks he wants his children to have his money if his wife remarries. To save Federal estate taxes he needs to get expert legal advice and to do some rethinking. Take also the case in which a father, with two financially successful sons, wants to leave his money to his grandchildren and yet does not want to cut out his sons completely in case they suddenly need help. He, too, can save Federal estate taxes if he proceeds carefully.

title: Ampex in TV Accord
description: The Ampex Corporation and Cartridge Television, Inc., announced yesterday that they have reached an agreement by which Cartridge Television will acquire a nonexclusive license under certain Ampex video recording patents. As a result of this, all related litigation pend ing in the United States District Courts in San lrancisco and Chicago will be dismissed. Cartridge Television is about 32 per centowned by the Avco Corporation.

title: TWO AIRLINES BUYING 3 747'S AND 13 DC9'S
description: Two airlines announced yesterday plans to buy 16 jet planes. Seaboard World Airlines said it had agreed to purchase three 747 longrange freighters from the Boeing Company and Southern AirWays, Inc., said it was buying 13 DC9 jets.

title: Broker Firm Sets Acquisition
description: DuPont Glore Forgan, Inc., the large nationwide brokerage firm, expects to announce its acquisition of Robert Moore & Co. on March 1. The Moore firm ranks as one of the nation's oldest active cotton commission merchants.

title: People in Sports: Koosman Is Agreeable
description: Major league baseball play, ers may be locked out of the training camps, but apparently there are no bars on the bargaining table. Witness Jerry Koosman the New York. Mets lefthander, who signed a contract reputed to be worth $65,000.

title: Draft Evasion Denied
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 21 (UPI)  Kenneth Rutledge, 26years old, who returned recent17 from Swede so he could lead a normal life like most Americans, pleaded not guilty yesterday to charges of evading the draft. United States Magistrate Nordin Blacker set March 13 for a hearing in United States District Court.

title: Wood Field and Stream Learning to Cook by Ear
description: Flamb quail was one of the delicacies prepared in the stone fireplace of the log cabin hideaway on the 12th floor of Abercrombie and Fitch yesterday afternoon in celebration of the publication of what has been described as the world's first talking cookbook for hunters and fishermen and their wives.

title: U.S. Queries Laos Reds About Captives
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Thursday, Feb. 22  With the agreement signed to end the war in Laos, United States officials quickly made contact with the Communist Pathet Lao yesterday, apparently to find out whom it is holding as prisoners of war.

title: STALLING CHARGED IN TRUCE INQUIRIES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 22American sources on the Joint Military Commission accused the North Vietnamese and Vietcong sides yesterday of stalling the first two field investigations of alleged ceasefire violations that the fourparty group has undertaken.

title: 14 Mayors Denounce Budget Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Mayors of 14 large and middlesized cities denounced President Nixon's planned budget reductions today, using such terms as a gigantic double cross of the poor and of city officials who had been promised by the Administration that there would be no such cuts.

title: Quake Jars Southern California Coast; One City Reports $1Million Damage
description: OXNARD, Calif., Feb. 21A rolling earthquake shook the Southern California coast this morning, but there were few serious injuries and no reported deaths.

title: Nixon Sends His Condolences to Libya and Egypt
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  President Nixon has sent messages of condolences to the Libyan leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, and to President Anwar elSadat of Egypt in connection with the downing of a Libyan airliner, the State Department said today.

title: HIGH COURT EASES DISTRICTING RULE FOR LEGISLATURE',
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Supreme Court said today that its oneman onevote man date need not be applied sc strictly to state legislative dis tricts as to Congressional re. apportionment.

title: Ballet: Eliot Feld's Jive and the Strauss Family
description: The City Center Joffrey Ballet returned to the City Center .55 Street Theater last night with a mixture of assorted Strausses and Eliot Feld. It was the Strauss family (the program note for Joffrey is far too ingenuous in its allocations) that provided the music for Gerald Arpino's Kettenanz and Leonide Massine's Le Beau Danube. It was Mr. Feld who offered a world premiere, Jive.

title: Now It's a Ski Lesson After the Piano Lesson
description: KILLINGTON, Vt., Feb. 21 Leo Dennis, the manager of skiing at Killington, is enthusiastic over the resort's success with young skiers. Skiing continues to make a tremendous family impact, he said today. Parents realize that providing their children only with music lessons or perhaps dancing lessons is shortchanging them. Skiing is now also very much in the social picture. The Killington teaching program is impressing Dennis the most.

title: Two Essex LegalAid Agencies Stymied by Lack of U.S. Funds
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21  While legislators and politicians argue the probable results of recent cuts in the Federal budget, two Essex County legal services financed primarily by the Office of Economic Opportunity have already been forced to refuse new cases because of a lack of funds.

title: COLLEGES IN STATE AT TO COOPERATE
description: A set of goals aimed at achieving an open era of mutual support and cooperation has been agreed upon by a group representing most of New York State's public and private degree  granting colleges and universities.

title: BLUMENTHAL JOINS MAYORAL PARADE
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal joined the parade of Democratic mayoral candidates yesterday and formally announced his candidacy, declaring that he was the only liberal alternative to Mario Biaggi and John Lindsay who can be elected.

title: EAGLETON BACKS PRESS IMMUNITY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Senator Thomas F. Eagleton, who was the victim last summer of a columnist's erroneous report that the Senator had a record of arrests for drunken driving, told a Senate subcommittee today that newsmen should have a right to keep their sources confidential, even in cases of libel.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $2.500. Tickets, with the five numbers In reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last four numbers In order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers in sequence win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win $25. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second and third, the third and fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2.50.

title: Advertising: A Winner in Paper
description: The William Esty Company has won the roller derby and will soon be doing advertising for the Consumer Towel and Tissue division of American Can.

title: First of the Mohegans Starts Line of Winners
description: Long before Mrs. Ronald Thibault was winning fame with her Newfoundlands at dog shows, she was taking home ribbons and championships with her Pompey Hollow Stable saddle horses.

title: MAJOR FINANCING BEGUN BY A.T.&T.
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company announced plans yesterday to issue $500million of cumulative, nonconvertible preferred stock. This is the first step in the raising of more than $4billion for this year's corporate needs.

title: Police Compiling a List of 100 Major Narcotics Violators
description: In December, 1971, shortly after being appointed deputy police commissioner, William P. McCarthy ordered the intelligence section of the department's narcotics division to compile a list of the 100 Major narcotics violators in New York City.

title: Pennsylvania Paper Sold
description: YORK, Pa., Feb. 21 (UPI)The York Daily and Sunday Record has been purchased by the Scoggins Publishing Company, Inc., for an undisclosed sum. J. D. Scoggins, formerly publisher of the Lewistown (Pa.) Sentinel, is the new publisher, succeeding Harold N. Fitzkee. Mr. Fitzkee is a member of a local group that purchased the morning newspaper, then known as The Gazette and Daily two and onehalf years ago from J. W. Gitt.

title: Blacks See Work Resume At Kawaida Towers Site
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21Blacks and Whites faced each other over a line of policemen today as skilled workers returned to the Kawaida Towers housing project for the first time in three months.

title: News Summary and Index
description: A civilian. Libyan jetliner was shot down by Israeli fighter planes yesterday when the plane reportedly flew over the Israelioccupied Sinai Peninsula and the pilot ignored instructions to land. Some 74 persons were reportedly killed and 13 more injured in the fiery crashlanding about 12 miles from the Suez Canal. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A newly found fragment of the equestrian sculpture of George III that was toppled by patriots here in 1776 went on display yesterday at the Museum of the City of New York, Fifth Avenue and 104th Street. The twoton gilded lead figure, which had stood in the Bowling Green, was broken up and taken to Litchfield, Conn., to be made into bullets so that, as a letterwriter put it at the time, the. King's soldiers could have melted majesty fired at them.

title: Encyclopaedia Britannica Denies Deceptive Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)  Encyclopaedia Britannica, Inc., of Chicago, denied today Federal Trade Commission charges that it had used deceptive practices in recruiting salesmen and in selling books.

title: Another Quint Goes Home
description: NORTHBROOK, Ill., Feb. 21 (AP)  The firstborn of the quintuplets delivered six weeks ago to Mrs. James Baer went home from Evanston Hospital today. Only one of the quints, Elizabeth, remains in the hospital.

title: FROEHLING UPSETS GRAEBNER, 76, 64
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 21 (AP)Frank Frank Froehling upset the 1971 winner Clark Graebner, and Ilie Nastase, the 1970 victor from Rumania, was carried to three sets before advancing to the quarterfinals tonight in the United States national indoor open tennis championships.

title: Never Saw Vase Intact, Beirut Dealer Says
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 21 Dikran A. Sarrafian, the Lebanese art dealer who was named by the Metropolitan Museum of Art as the person who sold it an ancient Greek vase for about $1million last September, said today that he had never seen the vase as a whole until he looked at a picture of it in a newspaper this morning.

title: Miss Proell Endfingers Cup Eligibility
description: LIENZ, Austria, Feb. 21 (AP) Annemarie Proell easily won the giant slalom at the Austrian national Alpine skiing championships today.

title: 2,000 STAGE SITIN AT ATHENS SCHOOL
description: ATHENS, Feb. 21University unrest spread here today as more than 2,000 students barricaded themselves into the law school of Athens University.

title: Cricket Test Ends in Draw
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Feb. 21 (Reuters)The first test cricket match between Australia and the West Indies ended in a draw today. Australia had 428 runs for seven wickets declared and 260 for two declared, the West Indies 428 and 67 for three.

title: Mellon Relative Is Indicted For $543,800 Tax Evasion
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 21 (UPI) William Mellon Hitchcock, 33 years old, of Tucson, Ariz., a member of Pittsburgh's wealthy Mellon family and onetime associate of Dr. Timothy Leary, the drug cultist, was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges of evading $543,800 in Federal income taxes.

title: Instant Sweepstakes Plan
description: CONCORD, N.H., Feb. 21 (AP)  The New Hampshire Sweepstakes Commission approved today a proposal for an instant sweepstakes directed at tourists in which a buyer would find out immediately if he is a winner. The proposal will need approval of the Executive Council before it can be implemented. Under the plan, a person would buy a 50cent ticket, remove a seal and know instantly whether he had won $100, $10, $5 or a chance in a later drawing for $3,000.

title: Shipping/Mails All HoursGiven in Eastern Standard Time
description: Today, Feb. 22

title: British Football
description: ANGLOITALIAN TOURNAMENT

title: Senate Banking Unit Backs Cook as S.E.C. Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) The Senate Banking Committee today approved the nomination of G. Bradford Cook, general counsel of the Securities and Exchange Commission, to succeed William J. Casey as S.E.C. chairman.

title: Corporate. Profile
description: The Mitsubishi Group, a conglomerate of 26 Japanese companies, has been one of the main contributors to Japan's huge export success of recent years.

title: U. S. and Soviet Sign Accords Controlling Fishing Off West Coast
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21The United States and the Soviet Union signed a series of agreements today regulating fisheries off the American Pacific coast, where Soviet trawler operations have long been a source of friction. However, the two sides failed in an attempt at a similar pact for the middle Atlantic coast.

title: Bridge:
description: A type of event that has gone out of fashion, perhaps undeservedly, is the individual. In former years the players competed by invitation. But it was a victim of the masterpoint scheme, which sacrifices aristocratic goals in the interests of democracy.

title: Train Wreck Kills 3
description: KILLONA, La., Feb. 21 (UPI) A Texas and Pacific freight train sideswiped another train today, killing three railroad workers, derailing 12 cars and causing a fire.

title: 4 Small Phone Concerns Seek Jersey Rate Rises
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21 (AP) Four small telephone companies serving rural areas have asked the State Public Utilities Commission to grant them unspecified increases.

title: Text of CeaseFire Agreement Signed by Laotian Government and the Pathet Lao
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Following, as made public today by the State Department in unofficial translation from the Lao language, is the text of the ceasefire agreement reached by the Laotian Government and the Communist Pathet Lao:

title: Special Charges Cited
description: The National Cash Register Company last year lost $59.6million, equal to $2.68 a share, compared with a 1971 net income of $2.1million, or 8 cents a share, the maker of cash registers, and accounting machines, reported yesterday.

title: Antitrust Suit Challenges Mutual Fund Sales Setup
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Justice Department filed an antitrust suit today charging conspiracy and challenging the legal right of the mutual fund industry to sell its shares solely in the way that it traditionally has done.

title: Serkin and Guarneri Quartet Sparkle
COALITION ASSESSES HOUSING CUTBACKS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 President Nixon's impoundment of housing funds will have a total economic Impact of $19billion and will result in a loss of the equivalent of 220,020 construction jobs for 10 years, spokesmen for a national coalition of housing interests asserted today.

title: A Human Hormone Is Made Artificially In Automated Test
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) The first automated production of a pure synthetic human hormone was reported today by two University of California researchers.

title: Bruce on a Countdown to 4:00
description: Like most black American track and field athletes, Cliff Bruce grew up believing the cultural party lines: Blacks owned the sprints and the distance races belonged to white runners.

title: OPENING OF RECORD ON MERGER ASKED
description: American Export Lines, Inc., yesterday asked the Federal Maritime Commission to reopen the record in the $65million merger agreement between R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., and U. S. Line, Inc., which is owned by Walter Kidde & Co., a conglomerate.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Army spokesmen said yesterday that their safety precautions at Fort Dix were adequate even though one teenaged civilian was killed and three injured in a grenade accident on a target area.

title: Haw the City Assesses Real Estate
description: Every Feb. 1 more than 700 large ledgers go on view on open racks in the city's five taxassessment offices.

title: Szigeti Cremation Today
description: GENEVA, Feb. 21The body of Joseph Szigeti, the violin virtuoso, will be cremated tomorrow at a private ceremony in Lucerine. Mr. Szigeti, who died there early yesterday at the age of 80, is survived by a daughter, the wife of the pianist Nikita Magaloff, and by a granddaughter. The violinist's ashes will be transferred later to Montreux on Lake Geneva, where Mr. Szigeti Eved in retirement.

title: G.W. to R.M.N.FYI
description: Quoting Scripture selectively to serve one's purpose is a venerable practice, though it generally confirms the practitioner in his view more than it persuades his antagonist. In much the same way American politicians invoke the words of the Founding Fathers and with as little effect.

title: New York Wines Under Attack in Ohio
description: Five major wine producers In New York State, who account for nearly one out of every 10 bottles of wine produced in the United States, declined comment yesterday on a suit in Ohio that accused them of violating state labeling laws.

title: Draftsman, 28, Wins $1Million in Lottery
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21 (AP)Edwin R. Mathesius, a 28yearold draftsman from Jersey City, became the 25th winner of the $1million prize in the state lottery.

title: Blumenthal in Race
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal joined the ranks of Democratic mayoral candidates yesterday and announced his candidacy, declaring that he was the only liberal alternative to Mario Biaggi and John Lindsay who can be elected. Page 33.

title: Gray Backed by Ribicoff
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, said today that he would fight for Senate confirmation of L. Patric Gray 3d as permanent director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Mr. Gray, of Stonington, Conn., was nominated last weekend for the job by President Nixon.

title: GAS PUFFS FOUND IN MOON CRATER
description: While it has been shown by the Apollo landings that the moon is not a living celestial body, it now appears that it is, at least, a breathing one.

title: A PHONERATE RISE OPPOSED BY STATE
description: The rate increase sought by the New York Telephone Company was opposed yesterday by the State. Attorney General's office at a Public Service Commission hearing.

title: John J. Kenny Trial For Extortion Opens In Mercer County;
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21  John J. Kenny, former Hudson Cdunty Freeholder and Democratic party chief, went on trial in Mercer County Court here today on charges of extortion and misconduct in office.

title: British Club Loses $120,000 On Sale of a Soccer Star
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (AP) The Manchester United soccer club sold Ted MacDougall to West Ham United today for approximately $360,000.

title: MAGAZINE FIGHTS RAP BROWN IT
description: New York magazine reversed itself and moved yesterday to quash a subpoena calling for any records it has relating to a controversial article it ran last Oct. 23 titled The Man Who Shot Rap Brown.

title: Snowmobile Kills Boy, 6
description: PLATTSBURGH, N. Y., Feb. 21 (AP)  A 6yearold boy, John A. Brassard of Ellenberg Depot, was killed today after the snowmobile he was driving alone tipped over and struck him in the head as he came off a snowbank. The accident occurred near his grandfather's house in the town of Dannemora, the state police here said.

title: ST. JOSEPH'S TOPS ST. JOHN'S, 7665
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 21 Suddenly, St. John's chances for an atlarge berth to the National Collegiate basketball tournament are down to 5050.

title: McGovern Shifts, Opposes Hanoi Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Senator George McGovern dedared today that he cannot be at all sympathetic now to proposals that the United States provide direct reconstruction aid to North Vietnam.

title: Federal Aide Defends Legality Of Philadelphia Office Contract
description: Arthur F. Sampson, acting head of the General Services Administration, said yesterday that the selection of a new building in Philadelphia to house the regional headquarters of Federal socioeconomic agencies was legal and ethical.

title: ALBANY STUDYING GAMBLING PLAN
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21Final legislative approval of an amendment to the State Constitution that would permit the Legislature to legalize a whole array of gambling in the statean amendment that easily won initial approval last year  appeared uncertain today.

title: Guide
description: JAZZ So atmospheric that it looks as though it comes from an imaginative stage designer's set, Hilly's on the Bowery, 315 Bowery, near Bleecker Street (7778500), is one of those places to take someone who wants to try something different. In a dowdy, depressing block, which you may feel more secure in approaching by car or cab, this bar at first blush looks as though it is an unimproved quarters; at second blush you can see that it is quite painstakingly laid out. The illumination comes mostly from neon beer  signs strung overhead above the endless 75foot bar.

title: Raiders Beat Oilers on 2 Late Goals
description: The New York Raiders scored two goals in the final 2 minutes 58 seconds to beat the latearriving Alberta Oilers, 54, before 5,722 patient fans at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Two Testify on Rockland Bus Crash
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Feb. 21Two girls who were on the school bus that was hit by a freight train near here last March testified today at the driver's trial that they saw and heard the train hundreds of feet before the impact point and that students began yelling about the train before the bus reached the tracks, but that the driver never stopped.

title: Petain Body Recovered by French Police
description: PARIS, Thusday, Feb. 22, (Reuters)The body of Philippe Main, a World War I hero who headed the collaborationist Vichy regime in World War II, was found late last night, the police said early today.

title: RAIL INSPECTION CITED IN WRECK
description: YONKERS, Feb. 21Mayor Alfred. B. DelBello said today that a weeklong investigation by his staff into last Monday's freight train derailment here had shown that train wheels rarely received more than visual inspection, even though wheel failures were responsible for nearly 10 per cent of all train accidents in the Country.

title: Amer. Hockey League
description: TUESDAY MIGHT'S GAMES

title: Leaning On A Weak Reed
description: Senator Sam Ervin of North Carolina has made clear the fact that those who are relying on Congress to restore a reporter's ability to protect confidential sources are leaning on a weak reed. This is not because Senator Ervin doesn't want to help; he and numerous other Senators, in fact, are anxious to pass some measure that would undo the Supreme Court's 54 decision in the Caldwell case.

title: N. C. STATE ROUTS DUKE
description: DURHAM, N. C., Feb. 21 (AP) David Thompson scored 31 points tonight to lead undefeated North Carolina State to a 74.50 victory over Duke, clinching the Atlantic Coast Conference regular  season basketball title for the Wolfpack.

title: A Northeast Rail Parley Sought by Cahill in Crisis
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21Spurred by mounting problems in maintaining commuter railroad service in New Jersey, Governor Cahill disclosed here this evening that he was attempting to convene a meeting of Northeast Governors next week to try to resolve the region's railroad crisis.

title: Brezhnev Letter to Nixon Says Peace Pact Opens Opportunities
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, has told President Nixon by letter that the Vietnam peace agreement creates new possibilities for improving SovietAmerican relations and the world situation.

title: FIOUSING PROPOSAL INCLUDES A SCHOOL
description: A new plan to build a joint housing and publicschool complea on the Upper East Side was proposed by a city agency yesterday to replace a plan killed last November after opposition by community elements.

title: People and Business
description: George W. Romney, who resigned at the end of last month as Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, plans to take on a corporate directorship as part of his return to the private sector. Mr. Romney will be nominated for a seat on the board of the JohnsManville Corporation at its annual meeting on March 28.

title: Pakistanis Charge Indians With Torture of P.O.W.'s
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Feb. 21 Pakistan accused India today of torturing prisoners of war to obtain military information.

title: Five Killed in Gas Explosion in Coopersburg, Pa.
description: COOPERSBURG, Pa., Feb. 21 (AP)  Five persons were killed tonight after an explosion leveled a threestory apartment building in this eastern Pennsylvania community.

title: Victor H. Czegka, Byrd Aide On 2 Antarctic Expeditions
description: IPSWICH, Mass., Feb. 21 (AP)Victor H. Czegka, who served in both of Adm. Richard E. Byrd's Antarctic expeditions, died here Sunday at his home. He was 92 years old.

title: ExCity Planner Is Linked To RealtyTax Reduction
description: A $1million reduction in the tax assessment on a new office building in lower Manhattana reduction that the State Commission of Investigation has charged was improperly granted by the city's tax commissioner, Norman A. Levywas arranged through the office of Abraham M. Lindenbaum, a leading realestate lawyer and former city planner now actively practicing before city agencies.

title: Iran Will Buy $2Billion in U.S. Arms Over the Next Several Years
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Iran has contracted in recent months to buy more than $billion in military equipment from the United States in what Defense Department officials describe as the biggest single arms deal ever arranged by the Pentagon.

title: DEMOCRATS CURB SECRECY IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Reform forces in the House won a decisive victory today as Democratic members endorsed a sharp limitation on secrecy in committees.

title: Ponce, Veteran Pianist, in Belated Debut
description: Each music season brings its quota of surprises, and Walter Ponce's New York debut recital at the Metropolitan Museum on Tuesday night might qualify as one of the current winter crop.

title: Last Body Is Recovered From Staten Island Tank
description: The body of the last of 40 workmen known to have died Feb. 10 when they were trapped in an explosion and fire in a gas storage, tank on Staten Island was recovered early yesterday.

title: Chess: FischerSpassky Title Match Still Making Giant Waves
description: The repercussions for opening theory of the Bobby FischerBoris Spassky world championship match in Iceland are still being felt throughout the chess world. Surely no match or tournament in the history of the game ever equaled last summer's 21game title contest in its influence on subsequent play.

title: David J. Mendelsohn Dies; Led Advertising Agency
description: David J. Mendelsohn, president of the advertising agency of that name, died Tuesday in Park West Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 41 Park Avenue.

title: CeaseFire in Laos
description: The peace agreement between the Laotian Government and the Communistled Pathet Lao offers hope that an end to the bloodletting in all of Indochina may at last be really in sight. The speedy call for a ceasefire along with the termination of American bombingboth presumably in effect as of nowis an encouraging indication that ail sides to the agreement seem anxious to put an end to the killing.

title: SLOW RISE NOTED IN MARIJUANA USE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21A slowly increasing minority of American adults have tried marijuana and a slowly decreasing majority oppose the legalization of its use, according to a recent Gallup Poll.

title: Wallace Is Out of Hospital; Surgery Called a Success
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Feb. 21Gov. George C. Wallace returned here today after spending almost a month in a Birmingham hospital recuperating from prostate surgery. He said that he was feeling fine, and that he had been told the surgery was a complete success.

title: David Roth, 31, Taking a New Post
description: David J. Roth, the 31yearold vice president and finance committee chairman of KayserRoth Corporatiod, has been elected to the new post of vice chairman in a plan to provide top management succession for the leading apparel manufacturer.

title: Miss Schroder Sings Salome at the Met
description: Salome, is as Salome does, or, to put it less succinctly, the effectiveness of Richard Strauss's opera depends in the last analysis on the performer in the title role. The Metropolitan Opera has a new Salome this season, Ursula Schrder. She sang the part for the first time here last Thursday night and was in Tuesday night's repetition of the work.

title: Hockey Transactions WORLD ASSOCIATION
description: CHICAGOSigned Dave Waller, renter, from Rhode Island of the Eastern League.

title: Records
description: Outstanding jazz violinists are so rare that those who have made reputations as hot fiddlers in the last 50 years can almost be counted on one hand. The nineteentwenties produced Eddie South, Missouriborn and classically trained, who spent most of Iris career in Europe, and Joe Venuti, who played duets with his fellow Philadelphian, Eddie Lang, the guitarist. In the thirties came Stuff Smith, whose fiddle playing was an adjunct to his raucous comedy, and Stephane Grappelli, known primarily because of his association with Django Reinhardt in the Quintet of the Hot Club of France. In the forties, Ray Nance's fiddle was featured occasionally in Duke Ellington's orchestra but Nance was primarily a member of the band's trumpet section. Since then, the only notable new jazz violinist to come along has been JeanLuc Panty, the young Frenchman who appeared in the sixties.

title: Putnam to Return Money To Funds to Settle Suits
description: The Putnam Management Company disclosed yesterday that it would return $3.29million to the mutual funds it controls in settlement of 19 lawsuits against 17 officials and former officials of the company.

title: City Opera Starts Its Season With Der Rosenkavalier
description: DER ROSENKAVALIER. Opera In three acts by Richard Strauss. Libretto by Hugo von Hofmannsthal. Directed by Dino Yannopoulos. Sets by Donald Oensiager. Costumes by Jose Varona. Lighting by Hans Sondhelmer. Conducted by Mario Bernardi. Presented by the New York City Opera at the State Theater.

title: SHOCKED MAYOR IS HAILED ON TOUR
description: Mayor Lindsay made an excursion into the city's hinterlands yesterday, using both helicopter and a limousine to leapfrog around Brooklyn and Queens for a series of ceremonies and celebrations.

title: The Birth Pill Dispute
description: The decision by the Food and Drug Administration to give official approval to the use of diethylstilbestrol (DES) as a morningafter contracentive has formally settled a longstanding debate, but it is unlikely to resolve the complex Issues that gave rise to the con troversy. These issues Include a number of problems that typically complicate the use and testing of drugs in this country. One is the difficulty of weighing benefits versus risks when the benefits are immediate and the risks may be decades off, and when the patients are essentially healthy.

title: SHOCKED MAYOR IS HAILED ON TOUR
description: Mayor Lindsay, made an excursion into the city's hinter lands yesterday, using both helicopter and, a limousine to leapfrog around Brooklyn and Queens for a series of cere monies and celebrations.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Robert Leidy Weds Nicole Redfield
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Feb. 22Miss Nicole von Gerloff Redfield, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Story Close Redfield, was married here this afternoon to Robert Polk Leidy, son of Mrs. Carter Randolph Leidy and the late Mr. Leidy. Both families reside here.

title: Transcript of Kissinger's News Conference in Washington on His Asian Tour
description: Following is a transcript of Henry A. Kissinger's press briefing In Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: C.A.B. Official Is Appointed To Post at United. Air Lines
description: Monte Lazarus, administrative assistant to Secor Browne, the chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, was appointed vice presidentpublic affairs, for United Air Lines yesterday.

title: Glen Campbell Adds To His Star Status In Carnegie Recital
description: The axis around which all this turned was a 1967 hit recording, Gentle on My Mind, rightly accorded a place of honor in the evening's proceedings.

title: JERSEY BOLDS UP DISTRICTING PUN
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22React ing swiftly to the United States Supreme Court's easing of it one man, one vote edict, the New Jersey Legislative Appor tibnment Commission has tem.porarily abandoned an agree ment that it had been set to announce tomorrow to make legislative districts virtually identical mathematically.

title: Meany Says Pay Restraint Hinges on Control of Food
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 22George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organilations, called today for direct Government controls on food and agricultural products. He amazed that workers would require substantial wage increases this year if food price increases were not halted.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Feb. 22Doug Gaffney, assistant to Rich Adubato at Upsala, didn't say it, but the Vikings are currently the hottest college basketball team, in New Jersey.

title: U.S. AND CHINA WILL SOON SET UP OFFICES IN CAPITALS FOR LIAISON; PEKING TO FREE TWO AMERICANS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The United States and China, almost totally isolated from each other for two decades, moved close to formal diplomatic relations today with the announcement that each would soon establish a liaison office in the other's capital.

title: India's Economy Is Ailing; Prices Rise, Income Lags
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 22  The Indian Government painted a somber picture of the nation's economy today, pointing to a decline in food production, a rise in prices and an unsatisfactory growth of national income.

title: BEAME WILL RUN, PARTY AIDES SAY
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame has decided to run for the Democratic mayoral nomination, sources in the Democratic party reported yesterday.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22The State Tax Commission today authorized the New York Racing Association to defer payment of parimutuel betting taxes for one month, beginning next Thursday. The commission's action is intended to assure the opening of Aqueduct race track next Thursday and was taken on the recommendation of the Governor's Commission on the Future of Horse Racingthe socalled Delafield Commission.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: House Democrats Set Up Unit to Map Party Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22House Democrats continued their efforts to carve a new image today by creating a 23member steering committee to set party policy and legislative strategy.

title: Film: Payday Traces Country Singer on the Road
description: The pursuit of that ultimate allAmerican popculture artifact, the road movie, continues. And it is not likely to be delayed for long by the emergence of Payday, an account of two nights and a day in the life of one Maury Dann, a countryandWestern singer journeying not too successfully up from Alabama to Nashville.

title: Miss Alexis Turpan's Wedding To John C. Revson Held Here
description: Miss Alexis Turpan was married here yesterday afternoon to John Charles Revson, vice president and general manager of the Etherea Fine Fragrance Division of Revlon, Inc., the cosmetics organization of which his father, Charles Revson, is founder and board chairman.

title: GROWTH IN MONEY SLONED IN WEEK
description: The rate of growth in the money supply, which showed an upward blip last week, was cut back, figures released yesterday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York showed.

title: Wall Street Bombshell
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, dropped a bombshell yesterday in announcing his support for completely eliminating the fixedrate structure of stockbrokers' commissions. At preseht, commissions charged by Exchange members can be negotiated only on that portion of trades in excess 300,000.

title: KODAK ET UP 36% IN FINAL QUARTER
GOLD TOUCHES $90 AS DOLLAR ERODES IN TRADE AROAD
description: PARIS, Feb. 22The price of gold touched $90 an ounce today as new speculation against the dollar broke out in Europe only 10 days after its devaluation.

title: GOLD TOUCHES $90 AS DOLLAR ERODESIN TRADE ABROAD
description: PARIS, Feb. 22The price of gold touched $90 an ounce today as new speculation against the dollar broke out in Europe only. 10 days after its devaluation.

title: An American Education
description: At the beginning of 1961 I was an eighth grader in an all  black high school in Charlotte, N., C. My father was living and my youngest brother was not yet born. None of my sisters had yet had any babies and none had dropped out of school. I had lost no friends to death in Vietnam and none had become addicts. We had a new Prsident, born of this generation and promising us  me that a new day had come. We were all happy then. Perhaps prematurely, so our friends told us, but we weft, happy.

title: Negotiations Divide Mets Into 2 Camps
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 22Baseball players continued to stream into Florida today in the expectation of a labor settlement that would finally open the spring training camps.

title: Melee Erupts at Kawaida Site; 2 Police Hurt
description: NEWARK, Feb. 22  Longsimmering racial tensions caused by the Kawaida Towers housing controversy erupted into violence today as a handful of black supporters of the project and dozens of white demonstrators clashed in brief, freeswinging melee.

title: KATINA PAXINOU, WON OSCAR IN '43
description: ATHENS, Feb. 22  Katina Paxinou, who won an Academy Award for her portrayal of Pilar in the 1943 film of Ernest Hemingway's For Whom the Bell Tolls, died of cancer here today. She was 72 years old.

title: Violence Erupts at Kawaida Site
description: NEWARK, Feb. 22 Longsimmering racial tensidns caused by the Kawaida Towers housing controversyy erupted into violence today as a handful of black supporters of the project and dozens of white demonstrators clashed in brief, freeswinging melee.

title: MANHATTAN POSTS 97TO87 TRIUNIPT
description: Seton Hall, struggling to finish a dismal season with a bright flash of hope, gained a 6155 upset victory over St. Bonaventure last night before a crowd of 4,115 in the second game of a doubleheader at Madison Square Garden.

title: ROCKEFELLER BACKS NEWS SOURCE LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Governor Rockefeller told a Senate subcommittee today that the prosecution of criminals had been aided, not hindered, by laws giving newsmen the right to keep their sources confidential.

title: Survivor Tells of Killings Of 7 Moslems in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Almina Khaalis, one of two survivors of a mass killing here last month, said that the killers shot her once in the head and, returning to find her still alive, attempted to shoot tier again.

title: The Increase in Wholesale Food Prices: a Burning Fuse
description: I always looked to chicken to balance off the higher prices of steaks and chops, Lucy Orenstein of Greenwich Village said with a sigh the other day as she bent over the poultry counter at D'Agostino's supermarket and noticed that the price of chicken had just jumped by 12 per cent.

title: Man Found Dead After Fire In a Waterfront Hotel
description: Policemen and firemen called to the scene of a smokey fire at, a Greenwich Village waterfront hotel last night found the body of a 65yearold man.

title: Cairo's Tape of Pilot Heard
description: CAIRO, Feb. 22The French pilot of the Libyan airliner that was shot down by Israeli fighters yesterday over Sinai had lost his way as a result of instrument failure and thought he was over Egyptian territory and was being followed, by Egyptian MIG's, according to a tape recording of his exchanges with the Cairo control tower.

title: HEAD OF EXCHANGE ASKS NEGOTIATION FOR BROKER FEES
description: In a reversal of position, James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, yesterday advocated fully negotiated commissions for brokers in stock trading to replace the present system of fixed commissions.

title: Israeli Deplores Tragedy
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 22Defense Minister Moshe Dayan today described the loss of life in the downing yesterday of a Libyan airliner over the Sinai desert as a tragedy, but he said that the blame lay with the pilot because he ignored repeated instructions to land.

title: BONN TO RESUME AID ON BERLINERS' VISAS
description: BONN, Feb. 22The Government of Chancellor Willy Brandt reversed a weekend decision today and decided to resume compensating West Berliners for fees that they were required to pay to visit relatives in East Germanythereby ending five days of mounting friction between Bonn and West Berlin.

title: It's Gilbert the Playmaker Now
description: OAKLAND, Feb. 22  Rod Gilbert won $5,250 in prize money as a competitor in Monday's Superstars Carnival. He rejoined the Rangers but was bedridden with the flu in his hotel room while they were beating the Los Angeles Kings, 43, last night.

title: Italian Inquiry on Vase Said to Identify a Thief
description: ROME, Feb. 22The Italian police reported today they had identified a grave robber, who, they said, had delivered to Robert E. Hecht Jr. the milliondollar Greek vase now in the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: P. S. 41 Critics Assay Modern Dance
description: Merce Cunningham, whose tours as the high priest of the dance avantgarde have taken him to Persepolis and Warsaw recently, dropped in, with his company to Public School 41 on West 11th Street yesterday afternoon.

title: Tragic Blunder
description: The shooting down of a Libyan passenger plane by Israeli jet fighters over the Sinai peninsula Was at best horrifying blunder that killed more than a hundred innocent then, women and children. At Worst, it was an act of callousness that not even the savagery of previous Arab actions can excuse.

title: BEAME IS CRITICIZED FOR BONDS COMMENT
description: John K. Pfeiffer, vice president of Standard & Poor's Corpdration, yesterday criticized City Controller Abraham D. Beagle for onesided and inaccurate comments in connection with the bond rating company's actions involving the Development Corporation of Evergreen Valley, Me.

title: P.O.W.'s Maintained Discipline but Had Some Quarrels
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The American prisoners of war in North Vietnam maintained strong overall discipline and rapport, sources close to the prisoners report, but daytoday camp life also included many serious personality disputes and some bitter divisions over the Vietnam war.

title: New Jersey Whitewash
description: The New Jersey State Commission of Investigation was initially reluctant to investigate charges that one high state official, Attorney General George F. Kugler Jr., wrongly declined to act on evidence of corruption on the part of another high state official, Secretary State Paul J. Sherwin. Forced to make an inquiry, the commission has now handed down a report that seerhs to distort testimony, to ignore established fact and display flagrant bias. It appears, in sum, a whitewash.

title: HIGH COURT LIMITS RACKETEERING ACT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 Striking workers, even when they resort to violence, cannot be prosecuted for extortion under a 1951 Federal law aimed at labor racketeering, the Supreme Court held today.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Nicklaus and Agnew to Tee Off for Drive to Aid Fish
description: Fish and fishermen will benefit from the Jack Nicklaus golf clinic and exhibition at the Marco Island (Fla.) Country Club on Monday, March 19.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am a resident of Rye. I have watched my fellow citizens of Rye behave in not untypical fashion, reacting toward the bridge much as a virgin about to be raped. Words like pollution, sullying, raping, and obscenity are used with rather indecent frequency in discussing the issue of the Rye bridge.

title: Gold Rush...
description: Frantic selling of paper currencies and buying of gold yesterday sent the freemarket gold price up to $90 an ouncemore than double its new official price of $42.22.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Daily index numbers and spot primary market commodity peaces Feb. 6, 1973 to Feb. 13, 1973.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: 3 BRONX MEN HELD IN HOLDUP AT BAR
description: Three Bronx men were arrested yesterday in the attempted robbery of a bar in Washington Heights Wednesday evening in which an offduty police lieutenant and a bus driver, both patrons in the bar, were wounded.

title: WINGS, CANADIENS SKATE TO 33 TIE
description: DETROIT, Feb. 22 (AP)Marcel Dionne scored the three Detroit goals tonight, two on power plays and the other unassisted, as the Red Wings, and the National Hockey League's East Divisionleading. Montreal Canadiens played a 33 tie.

title: Islanders' Scoring
description: FIRST PFRIOD1, Islanders, Cameron (15) (Spencer, westfall) 13:11, 2, Pittsburgh, Burrows (2) (Apes, McDonough) 17:11. PenaltiesMiller, Islanders, (8:26); Hextall, Pittsburgh, (10:17); Hart, Islanders, (10:17).

title: Princeton High Appeals Its Ban From State Basketball Tourney
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22 Princeton High School went to the Appellate Division of the State Superior Court today in a lastditch effort to restore the eligibility of its outstanding basketball team for the state tournament, beginning Monday.

title: A CAMPAIGN BILL PASSES ASSEMBLY
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22A drastically amended political campaign financial disclosure bill was was approved 61 to 7 in the Assembly this evening after nearly a day of bitter, partisan wrangling that left both sides exhausted.

title: Coyote Poisoning Goes On
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI) A Federal ban on the poisoning of coyotes is being violated ep masse by Arizona sheepmen and cattlemen, Representative Sam Steiger, Republican of Arizona, said today, He criticized officials for imposing the ban before other methods for controlling predators were ??vailable.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Tickets matching the number above win $50,000, Tickets matching the last five numbers win $5,000. Those matching the last four numbers win $500 and those matching the last three, $50.

title: LINDSAY ASSAILS S.I.C. OVER JUDGES
description: Mayor Lindsay assailed the State Investigation Commission last night for what he called its failure to look into the political deals and sources of campaign funds, which he said had made the state court system the protected haven of politicians.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 650,000 shares of beneficial interest of First Wisconsin Mortgage Investors, real estate investment trust, at $41.25 a share was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Goldman Sachs and Robert W. Baird. The trust's shares close on 41, down  on the American Stock Exchange.

title: East Siders Rekindle Fight On PlantSite Development
description: An Upper East Side neighborhood group and a city agency squared off yesterday for Round 2 of a fight involving a fiveacre plot of land near Mayor Lindsay's official residence.

title: Needham UnfixedRate Plan Backed
description: The proposal of James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, to eliminate fixed commission rates for securities traded on the Big Board met a generally favorable response yeterday from institutional investors and Wall Street brokers.

title: $50,000 Payoff Related at Kenny Trial
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22  The heads of two businesses involved in a 1966 Hudson County land transaction testified today at the trial of John J. Kenny about how they rounded up $50,000 in cash to pave the way for a change, in a county deed restriction.

title: John Nuveen & Co. Expects An Excellent Year in 1973
description: John Nuveen & Cp., Inc., had the second most profitable year in its 74year history in 1972 and expects another excellent one in 1973, according to Frank P. Wendt, president. The company, a leading underwriter and distributor of municipal, corporate and Federal securities, of Investors Diversified Services, Inc.

title: Burch Cautions on a Bill for Program Responsibility
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 Dean Burch, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, said today that the question of whether legislation was needed to spell out the responsibility of broadcasters to present all aspects of controversial issues was terribly difficult and terribly delicate and must be carefully thought out.

title: Clark Opposes Cray
description: STANFORD, Calif., Feb. 22 (UPI)  RamseyClark, former Attorney General of the United States criticized President Nixon's nomination of L. Patrick Gray 3d to head the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Mr. Clark said yesterday Mr. Gray was not qualified for the Job.

title: PICTURE IS BRICHT AT HIALEAH MEET
description: MIAMI, Feb. 22John W. Galbreath has, in the parlance of the race track, a lot of things going for him. He's the owner of the Pittsburgh Pirates, he's building a huge residential and business complex in Hong Kong, he has a real estate empire based in his hometown of Columbus, Ohio, and, since Dec. 23, he has been president of Hialeah Park.

title: ELIZABETH BOWEN NOVELIST DEAD
description: LONDON, Feb. 22Elizabeth Bowen, the novelist, died today in a London hospital. She was 73 years old.

title: Old Ironsides in Drydock
description: BOSTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)The Navy announced yesterday that the U.S.S. Constitution, visited by an average of 600,000 persons annually, will be closed to the public for two years for a $4.2million overhaul at the Boston Naval Shipyard.

title: U.S. AND CHINA WILL SOON SET UP OFFICES IN CAPITALS FOR LIAISON; PEKING TO FREE TWO AMERICANS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The United States and China, almost totally isolated from each other for two decades, moved close to formal diplomatic relations today with the announcement that each would soon establish a liaison office in the other's capital.

title: TALLAHTO CAPTURES SANTA ANITA STAKES
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 22 (AP)  Tallahto captured the $43,800 Santa Ynez Stakes today by 4 lengths over Waltz Fan at Santa Anita Park.

title: SCHOOL BOARD 16 TO RESTRICT NEWS
description: Teachers in Brooklyn's District 16 will be liable to punishment by the district superintendent for statements made to the news media about school matters under new rules announced by the Community School Board yesterday.

title: Drug Dealer on Top 100 List Is Sentenced to Seven Years'
description: A 64yearold Bronx restaurant proprietor who has been listed by the Police Department as among the 100 major cotics violators in New York City was sentenced to seven years yesterday in State Supreme Court in the Bronx.

title: Mrs. Samuel E. Morison, Wife of the Naval Historian
description: BOSTON, Feb. 22 (AP)Priscilla Morison, wife of Adm. Samuel Eliot Morison, the historian, died today at the Massachusetts General Hospital. She was 66 years old.

title: AUSTIN, MILER TRIUMPH AT NET
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 22 (AP)Jeff Austin, the last player invited, to the United States National indoor open tennis championships, and Karl Meiler of West Germany, the No. 4foreign seeded player, advanced to the  quarterfinal round tonight with threeset Ivictories.

title: Food, Fuel, Utilities Up Here, Apparel Down
description: The cost of food rose 1.9 per cent, and fuel and utility prices rose 2.4 per cent in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area last month, the Bureau, of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: BEANIE WILL RUN, PARTY AIDES SAY
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beanie has decided to run for the Democratic mayoral nomination, Democratic party sources reported yesterday.

title: Mr. Nixon's Remarkable China Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The KissingerChou conversations in Peking have made progress mainly because the two men have been faithful to the agreement they made at the very beginning of their talks last year: Get the principles straight first, and the practical problems can then be sorted out at leisure.

title: Sound of Hoofbeats Gets Louder in Queens
description: If I was the cop, the man at the rail was saying, I would've torn up the ticket and told Holly, This one's on me, dad.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: 4 Deep Sleep Principals Indicted

title: JERSEY HOLDS UP DISTRICTING PLAN
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22Reacting swiftly to the United States Supreme Court's easing of its oneman, onevote edict, the New Jersey Legislative Apportionment Commission has temporarily abandoned an agreement that it had been set to announce tomorrow to make legislative districts virtually identical mathematically.

title: Senate Confirms Nomination Of Cook as S.E.C. Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (Reuters)  The Senate today confirmed the nomination of G. Bradford Cook to be the new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission by voice vote without opposition.

title: Italian Inquiry on Vase Said to Identify a Thief
description: ROME, Feb. 22The Italian police reported today they had identified a grave robber, who, they said, had delivered to Robert E. Hecht Jr. the milliondollar Greek vase now in the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Regulation of Press Is Set by Sri Lanka In a Boycotted Vote
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Feb. 22  Parliament today approved a bill that allows the Government to regulate the press. The controversial bill was approved in principle by 112 votes in favor. All the opposition members refused to take part.

title: HEAD OF EXCHANGE ASKS NEGOTIATION FOR BROKER FEES
description: In a reversal of position, James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, yesterday advocated fully negotiated commissions for brokers in stock trading to replace the present system of fixed commissions.

title: Old tronsides in Drydock
description: BOSTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)The Nhvy announced yesterday that the U.S.S. Constitution, visited by an average of 600,000 persons annually, will be closed to the public for two years for a $4.2million overhaul at the Boston Naval Shipyard.

title: People and Business
description: The chief executive officer of the nation's most profitable bank discussed the bank's earnings prospects at a meeting of the New York Society of Security Analysts yesterday.

title: CSRCHBCK SYSTEM PLANNED BY STATE
description: ALBANY, Feb 22 State officials are aplanning a network of autoinspection stations to do the safety checks flow performed by gasoline, stations and to enforce exhaustpollution standards flue to take effect in 1975.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: District Attorney Thomas V. Mackall of Queens has been subpoenaed to testify before a special grand jury investigating the way his office handled a case in which some of his staff members were involved.

title: LAOTIAN REPORTS COMMUNIST DRIVE
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Friday, Feb. 23  Prince Souvanna Phouma, the Premier of Laos, charged this morning that Communist forces had launched a general offensive throughout his country following yesterday's ceasefire, and that if the Communist attacks continued he would ask for renewed American bombing.

title: Nixon, at Show, Sees ExDancing Partner
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)President Nixon took his wife and daughter to the theater tonight and met a Massachusetts woman who had danced with him at his inaugural ball a month ago.

title: JeanJacques Bertrand Dies; Former Premier of Quebec, 56
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 22 (Canadian Press)JeanJacques Bertrand, former National Union Premier of Quebec, died, after heart surgery this evening in a hospital here. He was 56 years old.

title: GEN. W.N. PORTER, LED CHEMICAL WARFARE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 Maj. Gen. William N. Porter, who sereved as chief of the Army Chemical, Warfare Service during World War II, died Feb. 5 of a heart attack in his Key, West, Fla., home. He was 86 years old.

title: Truck Tonnage Advances
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The American Trucking Associations, Inc., today reported that intercity truck tonnage last week was 8 per cent above the corresponding week last year while tonnage was 0.9 per cent below the preceding week.

title: Nixon's Aides Urge More Sales of Arms Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 The Nixon Administration began developing the argument in Congress today for expanded sales of weapons to foreign countries, particularly in Latin America.

title: Miss Johns Back in Show
description: Glynis Johns, star of A Little Night Music, returned to the cast last night following a brief illness. After a series of tests, no serious disorder was found. The show, whose postponement had been announced will have its local premiere at th Shubert on Sunday at 6:30 P.M. as originally scheduled.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: Absence of U.S. Squad Annoys 2 East Resorts
description: Officials of two of the East's largest resortsStowe (Vt.) and Waterville Valley (N. H.) feel they were snubbed when the United States Ski Association failed to produce national team members at their Alpine races fast week. The United States, performers, immediately on their return from an un productive European campaign, were scheduled to compete at the two New England areasmen at Stowe and women at Waterville. The contests had been schduled and sanctioned. by the U.S.S.A. six months, ago.

title: Text of the Communique
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)Following is the text of a joint communiqu issued today by the Governments of the United States and China reporting on the visit of Henry A. Kissinger to Peking last Thursday through Monday:

title: Basketball Transactions
description: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION

title: SADAT AIDE IN U.S.; SEES NIXON TODAY
description: CAIRO, Feb. 22  President Anwar elSadat's adviser, Hafez Ismail, is expected by diplomatic sources here to tell President Nixon that Egypt is prepared to enter into a peace ogreement with Israel, but not if the price is the loss of national territory.

title: Soprano, Clarinetist And Violist Present Modern Program
description: The Composers Theater offered a program of modern music Wednesday at the Greenwich Mews Theater for an unusual asortment of performers soprano, clarinetist and violist, singly and in various combinations. The concert had its Alps and downs, but unfortunately more of the latter. This was an evening of dutiful, wellcrafted and rather too overtly academic music, pierced only occasionally by flashes of inspiration and wit.

title: Books of The Times
description: COMMUNICATION IS POWER. Unchanging Values in a Changing Journalism. By Herbert Brucker. 385 pages. Okford $9.50.

title: Platinum Prices Rise by Limit To Close Session at $176
description: The flight of speculators and Investors out of paper currency and into gold and other commodities continued yesterday.

title: Fliers Held by China Were Seized in Vietnam War
description: The two fliers who are soon to be released from imprisonment in. China were both captured when their planes were shot down after straying over the North Vietnamese border.

title: Islanders Help Penguins to 2.1 Victory
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 22  The Pittsburgh Penguins, hoping for a playoff berth, and the New York Islanders, destined to set all sorts of National Hockey League records for losing, made progress in both their designated directions tonight as the Penguins scored a 21 victory before 9,200 spectators in the Civic Arena.
