description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: 5.5% Pay Ceiling to Be Kept in Phase 3, But Stabilization Policy Seems Flexible
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 The Administration said today that it would retain 5.5 per cent as a standard for annual wage increases during Phase 3 of President Nixon's economic stabilization program. But there were indications that it was moving away from a specific standard toward a more flexible approach to wage regulation.

title: TENNESSEE UPSET BY L.S.U., 78 TO 74
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Feb. 26 (UPI)Eddie Palubinskas led the Louisiana State Tigers on a giantkilling 7874 Southeastern Conference victory over firstplace Tennessee tonight to complicate the league's basketball championship race.

title: Mardi Gras Begins
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 26 (AP)  Thousands of persons jammed city streets today as succession of parades officially opened the Mardi Gras season. The parades and festivities will continue daily until Mardi Gras Day, March 6.

title: Interest Rates Shoot Up In Bill and Bond Markets
description: Interest rates climbed sharply yesterday in response to official weekend moves designed to use higher money costs as a major weapon in fighting inflation.

title: Hanoi Is Accused in Paris Of Sending Troops South
description: PARIS, Feb. 27  Secretary of State William P. Rogers was ordered by the White House tonight to give highest priority to seeking an early meeting with the North Vietnamese Foreign Minister, Nguyen Duy Trinh, to demand an explanation for the delay in Hanoi's release of further American prisoners of war.

title: JOSEPH A. SOLOVEI
description: Joseph A. Solovei, of 10 Plaza Street, Brooklyn, a lawyer, died yesterday at Brooklyn Jewish Hospital. He was 83 years old and had, his office at 16 Court Street, Brooklyn.

title: Genesca Family Dispute Quelled
description: Directors of Genesco,. Inc., yesterday quelled a dispute within the family at its top management and elected. Franklin M. Jarman, the 42yearold chairman, to the additional post of chief executive officer. His father, W. Maxey Jarman, gave up his post as chairman of a combined financeexecutive committas to remain as a director and possible committee member.

title: Knicks Rout Celtics, 12391, Cut Gap to 3 Games
description: The final score was New York Knicks 123, Boston Celtics 91 at Madison Square Garden last night, and Tom Heinsohn, coach of the leagueleading Celtics, summed it up neatly.

title: 3 NEWSPAPERS GET PRINTER DEMANDS
description: Negotiators for Typographical Union No. 6 explained their contract proposals yesterday to representatives of The Daily News, The New York Post and The New York Times as formal talks got under way in an effort to work out new agreements to replace those expiring March 30.

title: SOYBEANS ARE HIT BY PROFIT TAKING
description: When a commodity futures market moves like a steamroller up a oneway street, traders eventually become little nervous. In the five most recent sessions, through Monday, soybean futures prices in terms of the March delivery rose from $6.03 a bushel to $6.68. Each day they set a new historic high on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: As Gorillas Go, SixMonthOld Patty Cake Is a Charming Monkey
description: In a sundappled cage on the south side of the Lion House, the superstar of the Central Park Zoo is eating sliced bananas. Suddenly she cocks her wizened head. Her brown eyes begin to gleam. She tenses, andwith a burst of utter gleeshe pounces on a banana peel.

title: A P.O.W. CONCEDES HE ASSAILED WAR
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE Calif., Feb. 27 (AP)A former prisoner of war acknowledged today that he made statements over the Hanoi radio urging Congress to end the war.

title: Doc Hayes, G.M.U. Coach, Dies With Vile in Crash
description: TERRELL Tex Feb. 27 (AP)  E; O. (Doc) Hayes, former basketball' coach at Southern Methodist University and his wife, Kathleen, died in a onecar crash yesterday. He was 67 years old.

title: Squires Get Mueller
description: NORFOLK, Va., Feb. 27 (AP) The Virginia Squires of the American Basketball Association placed a rookie guard, Billy Shepherd, on waivers today and signed Erwin Mueller, a centerforward released last week by the Detroit Pistons of the National Basketball Association.

title: South Africa Bait Leaders of Students From All Activities
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Feb. 27Prime Minister John Vorster announced today that the president and other officials and members of the National Union of South African Students were prohibited from attending school or having anything further to do with student activities.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Tomorrow, March 1 Shio Passengers From Due Will Dock STATENDAM. Holland Amer. (641)..St. Thomas, Feb. 26 I P.M...W. Houston St.

title: 28 Held on DrugSale Charges In Early Morning Hofstra Raid
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. Feb. 27 Twentyeight Hofstra University students were arrested on drugsale charges during an earlymorning raid by 70 plainclothes men from the Nassau County Police Department.

title: Notes on People
description: Stating that I am functioning within the wrong party structure, Representative Donald W. Riegle Jr. became the second prominent Republican Congressman in. less than a year to switch to the Democrats. Last March, Representative Ogden R. Reid of New York becanie a Democrat Yesterday, at a news conference in his home district of Flint, Mich., Mr. Riegle said he was joining the Democratic party because it was much more the people's party and leaving the G.O.P. because increasingly its poiIcies have been imposed from the top down.

title: Publishers Hail Soviet Move Despite Problems
description: American publishing figures and experts on copyright law yesterday applauded the Soviet Union's decision to become a party to the Universal Copyright Convention, but they said it was not clear how much American authors stood to gain from the move.

title: City Council Unit Clears Way For Environment Control Panel
description: A 15week bottleneck that delayed enforcement of the city's air and noise pollution laws was broken yesterday when a City Council committee approved Mayor Lindsay's four civilian nominees for the Environmental Control Board after a candidate opposed by the Councilmen withdrew his name from consideration.

title: Lansky Says Health Barrett U.S. Trip To Testify Earlier
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27 (UPI) Meyer Lansky, testifying in a Weak voice, told a Federal court jury today, that the only reason he had not answered a grand jury summons to testify in a gambling inquiry, was that bis doctor had advised him Against traveling.

title: CITY HOUSING AIDE HELD FOR BRIBERY
description: An official of the city's Emergency. Repair Program fin slum housing was indicted yesterday on charges of having taken $4,000 in kickbacks from a contracting concern working under the program.

title: Jersey Court Upholds Security to
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Feb. 27A Superior Court judge here today upheld what is believed to be the first local law In the nation requiring landlords to post security deposits to assure emergency repairs in apartments.

title: Poverty Chief Scored at House Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27A Congressional subcommittee today accused Howard J. Phillips, acting director of the Office of Economic Opportunity, of arrogance, subverting national policy, encouraging summer turmoil in the streets and using a meat ax on the program.

title: Bill on Abortions Offered
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI)  Hospital employes could refuse as a matter of conscience to participate in abortions under a bill introduced today by Representative Margaret M. Heckler, Republican of Massachusetts. The legislation states that a hospital's eligibility for Federal aid is contingent upon certification that its employes are allowed to refuse participation in abortions.

title: TV: Bill Moyers' Journal Endangered
description: After months of quiet and subtle searching, Bill Moyers' Journal seems to have found itself. Mr. Moyers, whose credits include being President Lyndon B. Johnson's press secretary and publisher of Newsday, has evolved into one of the most solid and effective commentators on the television scene.

title: NETS NEED HELP FOR GUARD DUTY
description: UNIONDALE, LI., Feb. 27Help! That's what the New York Nets coach, Lou Carnesecca, is looking for before tomorrow night when his fourthplace team goes on the court in another headtohead battle with the fifthplace Memphis Tams at the Nassau Coliseum starting at 8 o'clock.

title: STARS TURN BACK COLONELS 10397
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Feb. 27 (AP)Ron Boone and Bobby Warren combined for 53 points tonight to lead the Utah Stars to a 10397 American Basketball Association victory over the Kentucky Colonels.

title: Figure in S.E.C. inquiry Gave $200,000 to Nixon
description: A $200,000 cash contribution was disclosed yesterday to have been made to President Nixon's reelection campaign last April 10 on behalf of a financier then under Securities been approached in Europe by a man he understood to be Daniel Hofgran, on behalf of the Finance Committee to Reelect the President, on the possibility of a contribution by Mr. Vesco to be made before April 7.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two fire engines responding to an alarm collided at an intersection in. Newark yesterday, killing a pedestrian and injuring eight firemen. Men, were tossed all over the street, Capt. Raymond Bishof of the Fire Department said. Most of them were found unconscious, and two were reported in serious condition last night.

title: CONVICTION OF BLACK OVERTURNED BY NAVY
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 27 (AP)The Navy said today that it was overturning the riot and assault conviction of a black crewman from the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk in whose case a civil suit was filed alleging perjury by a Navy witness.

title: SOVIET WILL HONOR LAW OF COPYRIGHT ON FOREIGN WORKS
description: PARIS, Feb. 27The Soviet Union has announced its intention of observing copyrights on books, music and movies by nonSoviet citizens.

title: Squires Get Mueller
description: NORFOLK, Va., Feb. 27 (AP) The Virginia Squires of the American Basketball Association placed a rookie guard, Billy Shepherd, on waivers today and signed Erwin Mueller, a centerforward released last week by the Detroit Pistons of the National Basketball Association.

title: SOVIET WILL HONOR LAW OF COPYRIGHT ON FOREIGN WORKS
description: PARIS, Feb. 27The Soviet Union has announced its intention of observing copyrights on books, music and movies by nonSoviet citizens.

title: G.O.P. Names Campaign Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) Ken Rietz, the 31yearold campaign aide who directed President Nixon's effort to attract young voters in the 1972 campaign, will head the Republican National Committee's New Majority Campaign for 1974, George Bush, the Republican National Chairman, announced today,: In that capacity, Mr. Matt will be in Charge of coordinating, campaign activities for, 1973774 with RePublican House and Senate campaign efforts, Mr. Bush said.

title: CHARLES A. BIGELOW
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Feb. 27 Charles A. Bigelow a retired vice president and director of Hercules, Inc., manufacturers of explosives, died at a retirement home here Friday. His age was 95 and he maintained homes here and in Essex, N. Y.

title: Hecht Backs Vase Sale; Will Avoid Italy for Now
description: Robert E. Hecht Jr., the American expatriate who sold a 2,500yearold Greek vase to the Metropolitan Museum of Art last year for approximately $1million, said yesterday he feared to return to Rome until he is certain the Italian police have no plans to give him free room and boarda prison cell.

title: Ratelle Now Flying High With New Pair of Wings
description: The most surprised person to discover that Jean Ratelle has scored at least one goal in five straight games is, predictably, Jean Ratelle.

title: SANDFORD BROWN
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Feb. 27Sandford Brown, who retired in 1953 as vice president of the Bakelite Division of the Union Carbide Corporation of New York, died yesterday at the. Overbrook Hospital in Summit. He was 84 years old and lived here.

title: 3d Attack Victim at Drew. Pities Violence Seekers
description: MADISON, Feb. 27  A nurse who was the victim of the third attack this month on Drew University personnel has written a letter to the student body saying that she pities the ones among us in this world to whom violence is a challenge, a thrill, a way of life.

title: STOCKS SLIP AGAIN AS RALLY FIZZLES
description: The stock market tried to rally yesterday morning but gave up the effort in the afternoon and closed with another substantial decline.

title: 3d Attack Victim at Drew Pities Violence Seekers
description: MADISON, N.J., Feb. 27A nurse who was the victim of the third attack this monthon Drew University personnel has written a letter to the student body saying that she pities the ones among us in this world to whom violence is a challenge, a thrill, a way of life.

title: METHODIST GROUP SUPPORTS GARELIK
description: Ministers of the African Methodist Episcopal Church endorsed City Council President Sanford D. Garelik for Mayor yesterday.

title: British Soccer
description: ENGLISH F.A. CUP

title: Secretariat Is a Blue Chip in the Race Horse Market
description: In the bullish world of horse breeding, buying Secretariat at. $190,000 a share makes as much sense as buying I.B.M. at $431.

title: Yankees Are Reporting in Good Shape
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27The number of New York Yankee players at spring training here today was 16, an increase of six from the previous day.

title: P.S.C. Suggests Con Ed Pay for Blackout Losses
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27  The Public Service Commission proposed today that Consolidated Edison be required to pay Customers for spoiled food and damaged appliances resulting from local failures in power. distribution.

title: Mrs. Skadden Wed To R. A. Atkinson
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Feb. 27Mrs. Valerie Nash Skadden of Port Washington, widow of Marshall K. Skadden, was married in Trinity Episcopal Church here at noon today to R. Alton Atkinson, a widower, of Delaware, Ohio. Only the children and grandchildren of the couple attended the ceremony, performed by the Rev. Nils Blatz, the rector.

title: Record Forest Use Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Recreational use of national forests is expected to reach record proportions this year, John R. McGuire, chief of the Forest Service, told. Congress today. Testifying before a House appropriations subcommittee, Mr. McGuire said recreational use of Governmentowned forests totaled a record 182.4 million visitordays last year. This year, he said, the Forest Service expects recreation use to increase by another 8 million visitordays.

title: RIGHTS BILL VOTED BY ARKANSAS HOUSE
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Feb. 27 The Arkansas House overwhelmingly approved today a bill that would create a State Civil Rights Commission as a symbol of what the sponsors said was the state's changing attitude on racial matters.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Administration reacted sharply yesterday and accused Hanoi of violating major provisions of the Vietnam ceasefire agreement by delaying the release of American prisoners of war. President Nixon ordered Secretary of State William P. Rogers at the Vietnam peace conference in Paris to demand clarification from the North Vietnamese delegation on the most urgent basis. [Page 1, Column 8.] Statements by the United States and North Vietnamese delegations, and the White House press secretary are on Page 10.

title: PISTONS CONQUER WARRIORS, 114100
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27 (AP)Bot Lanier scored 24 points, ant puled down 16 rebounds to night to lead the Detroit Pistons to a 114100 victory over the Colden State Warriors in a National Basketball Association game.

title: MRS. CLEMENT HOOPES
description: WEST GROVE, Pa., Feb. 27 Mrs. Marcia Meigs Hoopes, wife of Clement R. Hoopes, author and former development director for the American Shakespeare Festival Theater, died today in a hospital here after suffering a stroke. She was 63 years old and lived at Windfall Farm.

title: College Student Shot and Charged as a Mugger
description: A 21yearold college student was shot and wounded on East 83d Street yesterday afternoon according to the police, he tried to escape from what they said was his second robbery within 10 minutes.

title: HORNE VOCAL GIFTS SHOWN ABUNDANTLY
description: Like, the proverbial million airess who wears all her diamonds at once simply because she owns them, Marilyn Home is not one to stint when showing off her talents. She is an extraordinary vocal technician, and her Carnegie Hall recital Monday night reinforced the point.

title: 4 Democratic Governors Assail Nixon's RevenueSharing Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 Four Democratic Governors protested to the Senate today that President Nixon's idea of revenue sharing was costing foe states money and his New Fed?ralism was making chaos of their budgets.

title: ZONING RESTRAINT ON GROUPS VOIDED
description: A zoning law designed to bar groups from living together in a Long Island community of onefamily homes was rejected yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Feb. 27  The most accomplished allround professional bicycle racer in history, Alfred Timothy Goullet of Newark, is hale and hearty and 82 years old. And he still resides here, with Mrs. Gonna, in the home he bought at 17 Noll Place shortly after he got off the boat from Australia wearing a straw hat in the midst of a raging March snowstorm in 1910.

title: Books of The Times
description: GETTING THERE WITHOUT DRUGS: TECHNIQUES AND THEORIES FOR THE EXPANSION OF CONSCIOUSNESS. By Butyl Payne. 204 pages. An Esalen Book. Viking. $7.95.

title: Chile Cancels Concessions Granted to I.T.T. for Phones
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 27 (UPI)The leftist Government today canceled concessions granted to the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation 43 years ago to provide telephone service in Chile.

title: Airport Toilets Now Free
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 27 (Reuters) The 10 cent toilet charge was abolished today at Chicago airports. Mayor Richard J. Daley announced that he had ordered an immediate end to pay toilets at the city's three major airports.

title: ACTION ON P.O.W.'S.IS ASKED BY HANOI
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Feb. 28A North Vietnamese spokesman said toay that both sides must take ositive steps to end an imasse on the release of more united States prisoners of war. Col. Bui Tin, a spokesman for the North Vietnamese delegaion to the FourParty Joint Military Commission, said his delegation would discuss its feasons for delaying the further release of prisoners at a meetthis morning of the comliission's chief delegates.

title: A Policy Of Bridging Gaps
description: MEXICO CITYLuis Echeverria Ali varez, Mexico's 51yearold President, Considers himself more left than right on the political spectitim but has advice for young students of this and other countries which might, to say the least, surprise them. It is revolutionary to study and counterrevoldtionary not to study, he says, sweeping away with a large smile and small gesture one of the causes of today's global generation gap.

title: Music: Sieber Recital
description: Eleanor Steber's most recent appearances here in concert, opera and musical cornedy have been so variable vocally that there was a good deal of speculation about how she would be able to carry out an ambitious series of three recitals that she had planned for herself in Tully Hall.

title: Records Set for Year
Kawaida Compromise
description: The recent melee at the construction site for Kawaida Towers in Newark underscores the growing need need for firm municipal leadership to resolve this ugly dispute. The blacksponsored housing project will be located on the fringe of Newark's predominantly white North Ward. Blacks, who have complied with every legal requirement, demand that construction proceed. Neighborhood whites, resenting an influx of minoritygroup families, have been demonstrating at the site and pressuring craft union members to stay off the Job.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Two Wanderers in NoMan's Land
description: I was born 25 years ago. I haven't seen my family in three years, as I'm a fugitive living undergrounda deserter from the U.S. Army.

title: Everything Is DutyFree in British Customs Strike
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (Reuters) A strike of civil servants enabled travelers to stroll through customs today without stopping to declare any bargains they had picked up abroad.

title: Express Route to Learning Fashioned for Precocious
description: BALTIMORE  In the fall of 1969, Johns Hopkins University admitted a 13yearold prodigy to its freshman class.

title: CAHILL SIGNS BILL TO HELP 24 CITIES
description: TRENTON, Feb. 27  Governor Cahill signed his safer streets  and  clean  neigh, borhoods bill into law today and made $12million available to the state's 24 largest cities to pay for more foot patrolmen and improved trash collections.

title: Quid Pro Quo Bono?
description: In offering to support Congressional action to require negotiated commissions on all securities transactions, the chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, James J. Needham, has asked for a quid pro quo: Congressional legislation requiring all listed securities to be traded exclusively on the stock exchanges. Mr. Needham would thus have the Government do what his member brokerdealers have been unable to accomplishget rid of the competition of the third market, the overthecounter dealers who make markets in the stocks listed on the New York Stock Exchange and who have become an increasingly important part of the national securities system.

title: Baddillo Enters Contest for Democratic Mayoral Nomination
description: Representative Herman Badillo of the Bronx announced his candidacy for the Democratic mayoral nomination yesterday, declaring that the city's basic problem was not crime the divisions between the middle class and the poor.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Feb. 20.

title: Middleweight Champion Reported Shot by Wile
description: SANTA FE, Argentina, Feb. 27 (AP)Carlos Monzon, the world middleweight boxing champion, was reported today to have been shot twice but not seriously injured during an argument with his wife at their home.

title: Orphans Of The War
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  The American troops in Vietnam are now down to about 11,000 and the prisoners, despite some delays, are coming home; but nothing has yet been done about the orphans of the storm, and particularly about the children fathered and then abandoned in Vietnam by American servicemen.

title: Hanoi Is Accused in Parts Of Sending Troops South
description: PARIS, Feb. 27  Secretary of State William P. Rogers wasordered by the White House tonight to give highest priority to seeking an early meeting with the. North Vietnamese Foreign Minister, Nguyen Duy Trinh, to demand an explanation for the delay in Hanoi's release of further Amer ican prisoners of war.

title: CONFEREES IN ACCORD ON FOREIGN AID FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27A HouseSenate conference, committee agreed today to legislation that would allow the Government to continue spending at the current rate through the end of June for foreign aid and for programs of the Department of Labor and the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Miss Magnussen Leads In World Figure Skating
description: BRATISLAVA, Czechoslovakia, Feb. 27 (AP)Karen Magnussen of Vancouver, British Columbia, took the lead over Janet Lynn of Rockford, Ill., in the women's compulsory figures today and the Soviet Union appeared headed for another pairs title in the world figureskating championships.

title: TEACHER ACCORD IN PEADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27The Philadelphia Federation of Teachers reached tentative agreement on a new fouryear contract today, ending a dispute that has kept the teachers on strike for more than seven weeks.

title: STATE PANEL ASKS 5 WILLOWBROOKS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27  A special state committee has recommended that the Willowbrook State School for the Mentally Retarded as it now stands, be dissolved and be reorganized into five independently administered units in each of the boroughs.

title: PROFICIENT CONCERT BY PHILADELPHIANS
description: A program as conventional as that offered Monday night at Philharmonic Hall by the Philadelphia Orchestra needs a good deal of interpretive personality to succeed. The performances of Claudio Abbado and his piano soloist, Christoph Eschenbach, tended instead toward the slick and machinetooled. It was functionally proficient evening of musicmaking by a great orchestra, but it was neither a particularly polished effort on that orchestra's own terms nor a particularly probing exploration of the music.

title: BYERS MAKES DEBUT WITH THE CITY OPERA
description: Reginald Byers, a tenor from Sydney, Australia, made his debut with the City Opera Sunday afternoon as Pinkerton in Madama Butterfly. He gave a smoothly proficient account of the role, generously vocalized but somewhat cautiously acted  understandably so since Frank Corsaro's detailed production is not an easy one to step into.

title: Allen Signs a 3Year Pact for $675,000
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Feb. 27 (AP)  Dick Allen, the American League's most valuable player in 1972, signed a threeyear contract today with the Chicago White Sox that was estimated to be worth $675,000.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: As Gorillas Go, SixMonthOld Patty Cake Is a Charming Monkey
description: In a sun dappled cage on the south side of the Lion House, the superstar of the Central Park Zoo is eating sliced bananas. Suddenly she cocks her wizened head. Her brown eyes begin to gleam. She tenses, andwith a burst of utter gleeshe pounces on a banana peel.

title: 3 SEIZED IN THEFT OF BANK'S CHECKS
description: A suspected bank robber and two men described as associates of Brooklyn mobs were arrested early yesterday in an East Side restaurant and charged with the attempted sale of $8.4million worth of cashier's checks to a Federal undercover agent.

title: Ballato's Team Triumphs
description: Lou Ballato and Mel Sokolo of the City Athletic Club defeated Don Spina of the Downtown Athletic Club and Denis Eagle of the City A.C., 615, 1513, 1511, 1514, to win the proamateur squash rackets doubles championship at the City A.C. yestetday. Ballato and Spina are professionals.

title: COURT VOIDS CURB ON BLACKS IN CLUB
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that a suburban swimming club cannot refuse to accept blacks who live in the immediate neighborhood if the club gives a membership preference to residents of the neighborhood.

title: Equity Financing
description: Three more companies, continuing a recent trend, yesterday announced plans to repurchase their own shares. The Bethlehem Steel Corporation announced it would purchase from time to time up to one million of its common shares for general corporate purposes. The company's stock closed at 28, down  on the New York Stock Exchange Sperry & Hutchinson Company announced plans to buy up to 500,000 of its shares which closed at 24, down  on the Big Board. Hilton Hotels said it planned to bpy up to 100,000 of its shares which closed at 30, down .

title: BRONX MAN CHARGED IN A DOUBLE SLAYING
description: A 20yearold Bronx man was arrested yesterday and charged with shooting to death his brother and sisterinlaw as they lay sleeping in the apartment he shared with them near Fordham Road.

title: VASE UNAFFECTED BY UNESCO ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27A 1970 agreement of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization aimed at curbing the flow of stolen and smuggled art would not affect the case of the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Greek vase because the United States has not completed the ratification process, according to State Department sources.

title: Governor Endorses Breitel for Chief Judge and Calls for Appointive System for Judiciary
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27Governor Rockefeller today strongly endorsed Associate Judge Charles D. Breitel as the next chief judge of the Court of Appeals and lamented the prospect of an allout partisan contest for the post in the coming elections.

title: Veterans Day Nov. 11 Voted
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 27 (AP)The Senate passed and sent to Gov. Thomas J. Meskill today a bill to return the celebration of Veterans Day to Nov. 11, its traditional date. The Governor has said he will sign it. The unanimous vote in both houses repeals the General Assembly's 1969 action moving the holiday to the fourth Monday in October.

title: Business Briefs
description: The 30,000 miles of road and track of the Penn Central and of the five other bankrupt Northeastern railroads would be, nationalized under a bill introduced in the Senate yesterday by Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, and coauthored by Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut.

title: Grafitti Is Favored Today In Hialeah's Black Helen
description: MIAMI, Feb. 27 (AP)Two horses trained by Horatio Luro rank among the favorites for the 31st running tomorrow of the $50,000added Black Helen Handicap at Hialeah.

title: Fugitive in Detroit Killing Slain in Atlanta Gun Battle
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 27. (UPI)Mark C. Bethune, a 22yearold fugitive wanted for the slaying of a Detroit policeman, was shot to death today on the roof of a college dormitory in a gun battle with an Atlanta policeman.

title: A Leader of Camden Draft Raid Appeals To Jury to Ignore the Law and Acquit
description: CAMDEN, Feb. 27  John Peter Grady, a leader of the Camden 28, asked the jury today to ignore the law and acquit the antiwar activists of charges of destroying draft files.

title: Christian Brothers Track Won by Paramus Catholic
description: Paramus Catholic High School of New Jersey posted six victories, one a meet record, to capture team honors yesterday in the Christian Brothers indoor track championships at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: CARRIER TO SWITCH TO ALUMINUM TUBES
description: The Carrier Corporation is switching from copper to aluminum tubing in its airconditioning units, William J. Bailey, president, told about 150 stockholders at yesterday's annual meeting in the Essex House.

title: Pet Control Bill Introduced
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 A bill to combat the problem of a growing abandoned pet population was introduced today by Senator Birch Bayh, Democrat of Indiana. The bill would establish a loan program for city and county governmentss to set up clinics to sterilize animals.

title: 200,000 New Refugees Reported Since the Truce
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The senate subcommittee on refugees reported today that more than 200,000 South Vietnamese civilians were made homeless during the first three weeks of the Vietnam ceasefire, the highest refugee rate since the weeks following North Vietnam's offensive last April.

title: Gold Rises $4 an Ounce As U.S. Dollar Weakens
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (AP)The freemarket price of gold jumped $4 an ounce in Europe's free markets today and the dollar weakened in some foreign exchanges. But, despite the jump, the price of gold was still far below the alltime high of $95 an ounce reached last Friday morning.

title: Monetary Language
description: These are times that try men's vocabularies. For instance, how can one express what is wrong with the world monetary system?

title: City Opens Computer Center to Check On Eligibility of Welfare Recipients
description: Mayor Lindsay and Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman yesterday opened a computer center at 2 Broadway, designed to merge data on the city's welfare, Medicaid, foodstamp, employment and socialservice clients by stages over the next, year.

title: BOSTWICK AND SCOTT WIN IN COURT TENNIS
description: Pete Bostwick and Gene Scott won fiveset matches at the New York Racquet and Tennis Club yesterday to give the United States a 31 lead over England in the court tennis series for the Bathurst Cup. Bostwick defeated Howard Angus, the English champion, 16, 65, 65, 26, 97. Scott beat Anthony Tuifton, 62, 46, 65, 46, 61.

title: MAGEE ESCAPE BID ANALYZED IN TRIAL
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 27Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, a nationally known psychologist, testified today that Ruchell Magee was acting under diminished capacity when he took part in an attempted courtroom escape in 1970 that resulted in the killing of a judge and three other persons.

title: DOUGLAS S. DICKSON
description: Douglas S. Dickson, manager of the new ventures group at Colgate  Palmolive Company, died in Roosevelt, Hospital yesterday of a heart attack. He was 45 years old and lived at 132 West 69th Street and in Warwick, N. Y.

title: Greek Students, Long Passive, Now Challenge Regime
description: ATHENS, Feb. 27  Greek university students, for years the, most passive in the West, are now posing major problems for the armybacked regime with demonstrations and strikes in support of demands for academic freedom.

title: NATIONALS BEAT CRUSADERS, 2 TO 1
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 27 (AP) Guy Trottier's 22d goal of the season gave the Ottawa Nationals a 21 World HoCkey Association victory over the Cleveland Crusaders tonight.

title: Borden, Schering Gain
description: Record results for the fourth quarter and all of 1972 were reported yesterday by three domestic companies in diversified chemical, drug and other lines. They were the WarnerLambert Company, whose board also voted a 2for1 stock split; Borden, Inc., and the ScheringPlough Corporation.

title: It's the Year of 200M.P.H. Indy Cars
description: This is the Year of the 200mileanhour lap for the Indianapolis cars. And there are are so many drivers and makes of cars in the 200 range that it is certain this season will be one of the most competitive in the championship division of the United States Auto Club. Earlier predictions of 200mile laps are being confirmed these days by tire tests on the high banks of Texas World Speedway and the moderately banked Ontario Motor Speedway in California.

title: No. Carolina State Tops. No Carolina for No. 24
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Feb. 27 (AP)  Undefeated North Carolina. State, sparked by David Thompson Tommy Burleson and Tim Stoddard, beat North Carolina, 8278, tonight in an Atlantic Coast Conference game between: two of the highestranked teams in college basketball. The victory was the Wolfpack's 24th and its first ever in North Carolina's Carmichael Auditorium.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Says India Fights Famine
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 27Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said today that the Government had ordered wide relief measures and strict graintrade controls to combat the effects of the drought in India.

title: $375,000 Agreed On By City and Victim In '57 Accident Suit
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Brooklym approved a $375,000 settlement yesterday of a damage suit filed against the city more than 15 years agoreportedly the oldest civil action pending in the State Supreme Court.

title: Cox's Will is Probated
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27 (UPI) Wally Cox, tevelvision's Mr. Peepers in the early nineteenfifties, left a $180,000 estate to a daughterby his first wife and to his Widow, but left nothing to his 13yearold adopted daughter. His will, filed for probate, showed today that Mr. Cox had left $3,000 to his 16yearold daughter, Alice, and the remainder of, the estate to his widow Patricia, his third wife. Mr. Cox died Feb. 15 of a heart attack at age 48.

title: JOHN P. MURPHY
description: ALLENDALE, N.J., Feb. 27John P. Murphy, a dog handler and judge, died yesterday of a heart attack in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood. He was 67 years old and lived on Forest Road.

title: Volcker and Burns Assert Dollar Cut Should Aid U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Two of the nation's top economic officials told Congress today that the latest devaluation of the dollar had at last achieved a set of world exchange rates that should enable the United States to achieve equilibrium in its balance of international payments.

title: U. S. SAYS HANOI VIOLATES ACCORD BY DELAYING PRISONERS' RELEASE; BIDS ROGERS DEMAND EXPLANATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Nixon Administration accused Hanoi today of violating major provisions of the Vietnam accords by delaying the release of American prisoners of war.

title: U.S. Minesweeping Delay Tied to Alert for Fishermen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (Reuters)The Defense Department said today that it was ready to begin sweeping mines from North Vietnamese waters, but that Hanoi had requested a delay so that fishermen could be warned to stay clear.

title: British Soccer
description: ENGLISH F.A. CUP

title: Official of Atlantic City Denies Builders Gave Him Kickbacks
description: CAMDEN, Feb. 27 (AP)Public Works Commissioner Arthur Ponzio of Atlantic City testified in Federal Court here today that his office had given but contracts totaling $8milion since he took office in 1968, and that he had never received kickbacks.

title: Bridge: Defending Champions Beaten In Von Zedtwitz Trophy Play
description: The double knockout team championship for the Von Zedtwitz Trophy is certainly the most protracted and perhaps the toughest event in the New York calendar. The average standard of the teams is so high that some of favorecl teams invariably run into trouble in early rounds.

title: REBECCA, WRY MIME, OFFERS DANCE SOLO
description: Rebecca is a talented dance mime whose solo concert Monday evening at Mercer Arts Center contained an impressive range of character vignettes. Among other subjects, she skewered a compulsive eater in Greed and created a minisaga, The Peasant.

title: Legion Scores Budget Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The American Legion declared today that it was deeply disturbed by the Nixon Adminis.; tration's proposed budget for veterans benefits. The 2.7milIion  member organization, which is the largest national veterans group, said that it Was unalterably opposed to what it described as the AdMinistration's attempt to slash pension benefits.

title: ST. JOHN'S POSTS 108TO90 VICTORY
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Feb. 27 St. John's kept its National Collegiate tourney hopes alive tonight with a 10890 triumph over Holy Cross before 2,500 fans at the Municipal Anditorium.

title: MARSHALL GREEN NAMED AS ENVOI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27President Nixon today chose till State Department's leading ex pert on China and East Asia Marshall Green, as the nev Ambassador to Australia.

title: Monday's Fights
description: TokyoSteve Smith, United States, knocked out Cassius Naito, Japan, 7 rounds; Smith won Japanese middleweight championship.

title: Postel Leads Ballot At Riverside Club
description: Councilman Robert I. Postet, has won 2.4, of the five firstballot votes that the Riverside Democratic Club will cast for Mayor at the reform convention to be held Saturday, club officials said yesterday.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Dreamy, said Mrs. Chester Dale, widow of the art collector. Such pretty clothes, said Paulette Goddard, her spectacular heartshaped ruby in on the Chest of her white knitted Adolfo dress. I can use a whole new wardrobe.

title: Monday's Fights
description: TokyoSteve Smith, United States, knocked out Cassius Naito, Japan, 7 rounds; Smith won Japanese middleweight championship.

title: People and Business
description: Kenneth McAllister resigned suddenly yesterday as president of the cigarette and tobacco division of Liggett & Myers, Inc., and as executive vice president of the parent corporation. Mr. McAllister, who is 56 years old, was unavailable for comment, but the company issued an announcement quoting him as saying that his resignation after 3 years of service was for personal reasons.

title: Cigarette Deal Set
description: American Brands, Inc., announced yesterday that it planned to increase its present 67 per cent investment in Gallaher, Ltd., of London, a major cigarette producer, to just over 80 per cent.

title: More Minus Than Plus
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 27A month after the signing of the Vietnam peace agreement the balance sheet on it is heavily weighted with failure.

title: Rapist Slain in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Feb. 27 (UPI)The police today caught a man raping a woman in an apartment and shot him dead when he ran for a window and drew two guns. The dead man was also suspected of kidnapping a 25yearold salesman. He was not immediately identified.

title: CANADA OIL QUOTA FOR U.S. TRIMMED
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 27 (UPI)The National Energy Board announced today that oil exports in March would be authorized at a rate of 1.235 million barrels per day. This was 47,598 barrels per day fewer than American customers had requested. The cutback affects the Middle Western United States.

title: LICENSES URGED IN TAX BUSINESS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 Persons who make a business of preparing tax returns for others should be tested and licensed by the Government to make sure they are competent, a Senator and a law professor agreed today.

title: House Crime Panel to Die in 4 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The House Select Committee on Crime got the official word today that it had only four more months to live.

title: STATE PANEL ASKS 5 VILLOWBROOKS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27  A special state committee has, recommended that the Willowbrook State School for the Mentally Retarded as it now stands be dissolved and be reorganized into five independently administered units in each of the boroughs.

title: MRS. MEIR PREPARES FOR TALKS IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Premier GoIda Meir of Israel worked with her staff today on the eve of meetings at the White House, State Department, Pertagon and on Capitor Hill. Mrs. Meir, who arrived yesterday and is to meet with President Nixon on Thursday, will request renewal of a nearly expired contract for Phantom and Skyhawk warplanes and will ask far tanks, electronic and other equipment, Israeli officials said.

title: NASTASE, CONNORS VICTORS IN TENDS
description: HAMPTON, Va., Feb. 27 (AP) Illie Nastase of Rumania and Jimmy Connors of Miami, the topseeded players, posted firstround victories in the $35,000 Coliseum Mall invitation tennis tournament today.

title: 8 Accused of Preparing False Tax Forms Here
description: Eight persons were arreit ed yesterday in Manhattan and Brooklyn by Federal authorities on charges of preparing false incometax returns for clients. Several other tax preparers were arrested or indicted in New Jersey and other nearby states.

title: TWO PROSECUTORS CALL NEWS VITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 Two top officials of the National District Attorneys Association said today that law enforcement would be hurt if newsmen were unable to guarantee anonymity to certain sources.

title: EXTEAMSTER IS HELD GUILTY OF EXTORTION
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 27 (UPI)Edward Grady Partin, a former Louisiana official of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, was convicted today of extortion in trying to fashion a monopoly in the concrete business in Baton Rouge by using violence against a competitor.

title: Pedestrian Killed, 8 Are Injured As Newark Fire Engines Collide
description: NEWARK, Feb. 27  Two Eire engines responding to an alarm collided at an intersection here today, killing a pedestrian and injuring eight firemen.

title: Study of Pyramid Hints Shift on Earth
description: Highly accurate surveys of the Great Pyramid of Cheops at Giza have shown that the ancient Egyptians built it with extraordinary precision. But, while its sides are oriented almost exactly north, south, east and west, the entire structure is twisted slightly to the west.

title: Todd Gets Big Contract
description: The Todd Shipyards Corporation said yesterday it had received a $760million contract for the construction of eight very large crude carriers, tankers with a minimum capacity of 250,000 tons. The contract was placed with Todd by the Virginia Shipping Corporation, a company that provides shipping facilities for a group of utility companies.

title: McGovern Stand Scored
description: NEWTON, Mass., Feb. 27 (AP)The Massachusetts state board of Americans for Democratic Action approved a resolution last night protesting Senator George McGovern's oppoqition to economic aid for North Vietnam.

title: NIXON FARM PLAN DRAWS CRITICISM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The fight over a new farm program opened in Congress today with attacks by farmers, farm organizations and Senators on President Nixon's proposal to phase out subsidy payments.

title: Greek Students, Long Passive, Now Challenge Regime
description: ATHENS, Feb. 27  Greek university students, for years. the most passive in the West, are now posing major problems for the armybacked regime with demonstrations and strikes in support of demands for academic freedom.

title: Museums Get $1,972,624 For Aid in Exhibitions
description: Grants totaling $1,972,624 for museums and related institutions in 31 states and the District of Columbia were announced in Washington yesterday by Nancy Hanks, chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts. The sum constitutes the first round of grants in the Endowment's museum program for fiscal 1973.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 28, 1973

title: URGENCY IS CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Nixon Administration accused Hanoi today of violating major provisions of the Vietnam accords by delaying the release of American prisoners of war.

title: Amex Widens Membership
description: The American Stock Exchange's membership approved yesterday certain changes in the constitution that would allow financial institutions to become members for the first time.

title: TWO IN ULSTER KILLED IN GUNFIRE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Wednesday, Feb. 28 (AP)A 13yearold boy was killed early today in a gun battle beween British troops and guerrillas. Flours earlier, a police officer was shot dead in a guerrilla ambush.

title: Doubts on Mr. Gray
description: Among the major items on this week's Congressional calendar are the Senate Judiciary Committee's hearings on the nomination of L. Patrick Gray 3d as permanent director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. There is no reason to anticipate the coihmittee's eventual, recommendation or to form a prior judgment in advance of the accounting Mr. Gray may give of his service as acting director since last May. But there is every reason to urge on the committee the gravest consideration of some disturbing aspects of Mr. Gray's candidacy.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York City's Board of Education ordered yesterday that a special task force be established to examine the applications of all school personnel hired since September, 1970. It also ordered creation of another task orce to investigate the hiring of two school guards and school aide who were arrested during an attempted robbery Monday and who had police records when they were hired. The board, in a sharply worded statement, declared that there had been a gross administrative failure at both the district and central levels in connection pith the hiring of the three men.

title: Bergen G.O.P. Elects Carney As Chairman on 3d. Ballot
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Wednesday, Feb. 28Joseph T. Carney, the organization candidate, won the chairmanship of the Bergen County Republican Committee early today on the third ballot.

title: Comments by North Vietnam and U.S. on P.O.W.'s.
description: Following are excerpts from a North Vietnamese statement on the ceasefire and prisoner releases issued by Hanoi's delegation in Saigon yesterday and the text of a United States response there, both distributed by The Associated Press, and excerpts from a news briefing yesterday by Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary:

title: BLACKFIN FIRST ACROSS THE LINE
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Feb. 27 Like an excursion up the Hudson, remarked a sailor today after completing one of the smoothest and fastest MiamitoNassau races in Southern Ocean Racing Conference history. Blackfin was the first of 125 boats to complete the 176mile sail, taking 20 hours, 43 minutes 8 seconds.

title: Anxious Farmers Keep Eye on Washington
description: DES MOINES, Feb. 27 While the folks in Washington began talking about phasing out farm subsidies today, some weary farmers out here in the midlands watched with growing traces of anxiety and talked a bit themselves.

title: Transferred Vadsburg Disciplinarran Says Militant Blacks Sparked Dispute
description: TRENTON, Feb. 27James Mosselle, the black teacher whose transfer from predominantly white Vailsburg High School in Newark touched off a boycott by 2,400 students, today attributed his removal to philosophical differences with more militant black school officials.

title: FURTHER RIOTING IN SYRIA REPORTED
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 27A number of persons have been reported killed and scores wounded in new religious riots in Syria.

title: Japanese Business Group Asks Eased Import Bars
description: TOKYO, Feb. 27  Japan's powerful Federation of Economic Organizations submitted to the Government today strong recommendation to liberalize curbs on foreign investment in this country and on imports of industrial and processed agricultural products.

title: Sylvia Syms Sings Her Old Jazz Tunes And New Ones, Too
description: Sylvia Syms, who got her start singing in such jazz clubs of another era as Kelly's Stable, the Royal Roost, the Little Casino and the Onyx before she gained much wider fame playing Bloody Mary in South Pacific, is back in a jazz club this week for (she says) the first time in 20 years. She is making her return at the Half Note, just three blocks from the spot where she made her debut in 1939Kelly's Stable, then in West 51st Street.

title: Pepitone to Succeed Tarr As Selective Service Head
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 27 (AP) Byron V. Pepitone, now serving as acting director, will be aominated by President Nixon to head the Selective Service System, it was announced today.

title: PRICE PANEL CHECKS 25,000 CAR DEALERS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Cost of Living Council, in its widest wageprice controls compliance action so far, is checking all 25,000 General Motors and Ford dealers to see if they overcharged customers tor spare parts and accessories In December, 1971, and January, 1972.

title: Curfew Ordered in Madagascar As Tribal Protests Erupt in Port
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, Feb. 27 (Agence FrancePresse) Tribal protests against official efforts to give education a more national character, broke out today in the third port city in three months, and the Government imposed a curfew there tonight.

title: Colt Named Nose For Money Sizzles in Big A Workout
description: While horseplayers continued saddling up for tomorrow's opening of the New York thoroughbred racing season, a 4yearold colt named Nose For Money demonstrated yesterday he was ready for the openingday Paurnonok Handicap.

title: G. & W. BRIEF SCORES BAR TO A. & P. OFFER
description: A Federal judge's Feb. 13 order blocking consummation of Gulf Western Industries' purchase of a block of Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company stock was a clear abuse of discretion, G. & W. argued yesterday in legal briefs filed with the United States Court of Appeals.

title: Sneaky Chimes, Captwes Hopeful Pacing Semifinal
description: YONKERS, Feb. 27Favored Sneaky Chimes captured semifinal of the YonkersRoosevelt Hopeful Pacing Series by a neck before 14,708 fans at the Raceway tonight.

title: Stern to Replace Miss Du Pre At the Philharmonic Tonight
description: Jacqueline Du Pre, cellist, is suffering from paresthesia, nerve disorder, in her bowing arm and will be unable to play in tonight's special gala at Philharmonic Hall benefiting the New York Philharmonic's Pension Fund. Isaac Stern has agreed to perform the Mendelssohn Violin Coneerto, which will replace Bloch's Schelomo, Miss Du Pr's scheduled vehicle. It will be conducted by Daniel Barenboim.

title: Badillo Enters Mayoral Race; Calls Divisions Basic Problem
description: Representative Herman Badilib of the Bronx announced hirgcandidacy for the Democratic mayoral nomination yesterday, declaring that the city's basic problem was not crime but the divisions between the middle class andthe poor.

title: Key Issue in French Race: Social Welfare Vs. Growth
description: PARIS, Feb. 27Economic issues are central in the campaign for control of the French National Assembly in the general election next week.

title: JAMES E. MERRILL
description: James Edward Merrill, who was a partner of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, until he retired as vice president in 1964, died Monday at New York Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 1140 Fifth Avenue.

title: Rapist Slain in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Feb. 27 (UPI)The police today caught a man raping a woman in an apartment and shot him dead when he ran for a window and drew two guns. The dead man was also suspected of kidnapping a 25yearold salesman. He was not immediately identified.

title: Hearst Corporation Reassigns Several of Its Top Executives
description: Several changes in top management of the Hearst Corporation were announced yesterday.

title: It's the Year of 200M.P.H. Indy Cars
description: This is the year of the 200 mileanhour lap for the Indianapolis cars. And there are are so many drivers and makes of cars in the 200 range that it is certain this season will be one of the most competitive in the championship division of the. United States Auto Club. Earlier predictions of 200mile laps are being confirmed these days by tire tests on the high banks of Texas World Speedway and the moderately banked Ontario Motor Speedway in California.

title: Dearie Wins in SpecialVote For Bronx Assembly Seat
description: John Dearie, a 32  year  old Democrat and formerly an employe of the United Nations Secretariat, swept to an easy victory last night over a Republican Conservative opponent in a special election to fill a State Assembly vacancy in the Bronx.

title: FOREIGN AIRLINES BALKED BY C.A.B. ON CUTS IN FARES
description: In the first such use of powers that were granted by Congress last year, the Civil Aeronautics Board announced yesterday that it had rejected, as too low, the transAtlantic fare proposals of British, German, Italian and Greek airlines.

title: More Minus Than Plus
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 27A month after the signing of the Vietnam peace agreement the balance sheet on it is heavily weighted with failure.

title: People in Sports: Napoles an Old Favorite
description: At 32 years of age Jose Napoles, the world welterweight boxing champion, gets sensitive when people keep asking him how long he plans to continue fighting. He is the 21 favorite to defeat 27yearold Ernie [Indian Red] Lopez in their title clash scheduled for 15 rounds tonight at the Forum in Inglewood, Calif.

title: Red Smith
description: Marcel Philippe is a bushy blond senior at Fordham who claims dual citizenship and wears the French tricolor on his camisole even though France cocked a snoot at him last summer when, having failed to qualify as a halfmiler on the United States Olympic team, he offered to represent her at Munich. This frustrated internationalist ran the race of his lite and beat the breeches off a crack international field at 1,000 yards in the National Amateur Athletic Union championships last week, but he has elected to move up to the mile for next weekend's I.C.4A (Intercollegiate Association of Amateur Athletes of America) meet in Princeton's Jadwin Gym, This is partly because he is the defending champion, the only Fordham miler to have achieved this eminence since the I.C.4A was born 97 years ago, and partly because he deems it his sacred duty to prove himself the best miler now pounding the sidewalks of New York.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Memphis Tams, at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, L. I., 8:05 P.M.

title: Con Ed Tank Plan Protested
description: About 200 adults and schoolchildren, chanting Ban Con Ed Bomb, picketed the Consolidated Edison Company's plant in Astoria, Queens, yesterday morning to protest construction of a tank for liquefied natural gas near La Guardia Airport. Such a tank on Staten Island blew up Feb. 10, killing 40 men working inside.

title: SUFFOLK IS FACING ZONE CHALLENGE
description: CENTERPORT, L. I., Feb. 27 The Suburban Action Institute, a nonprofit urban planWag and civilrights organizetion said last night that it planned to build a mixedincome community in western Suffolk County and at the same time challenge restrictive zoning throughout Long Island.

title: Former Assemblyman Harwood TO Head Democrats in Nassau
description: FRANKLIN SQUARE, L. I., Feb. 27Former Assemblyman Stanley Harwood of Levittown was elected by acclamation tolight as the new chairman of he Nassau County Democratic Committee.

title: Music: Medieval Concert
description: There was a time when everyone who liked music was expected to dabble in its performance, by singing if possible or by accompanying on one or several instruments. The Trio Francesca Caccini recreated the mood of one such era at Carnegie Recital Hall on Monday night in the fourth of six programs of early music being presented there this season by the Elizabethan Enterprise.

title: Art Smith, Stage Actor, Dead; Won Acclaim in Play by Odets
description: Art Smith, a retired Broadway and Hollywood actor, and member of the now defunct Group Theater, died Saturday of a heart attack at a nursing home in West Babylon, L. I. He was 73 years old.

title: 3 FROM LIBYAN JET FLOWN TO FRANCE
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 27 (Reuters) The coffins of three French crew members of the Libyan Arab Airlines Boeing 727 jetliner forced down in the Sinai desert last week by Israeli jet fighters, with the loss of 106 lives, were flown to Paris today.

title: RATES UP BROADLY IN CREDIT MARKETS
description: Interest rates continued to rise broadly on subdued activity yesterday, reflecting recent Government moves to sanction higher rates as necessary to control inflation. Shortterm, or money, rates were most conspicuous in climbing but the taxexempt market was also weak and corporate bond rates rose by a small amount. Treasury bills and Federal funds, two closely linked money rates, were under heavy upward pressure. Bills rose about an average 10 basis points in rateonetenth of a percentage pointand funds traded all day at 7 per cent or above.

title: Boeing Gets U.S Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The Air Force awarded the Boeing Company a $59million contract today for two 747 jet transports for, use as airborne command posts.

title: Gay Activists Say Police Hamper Protest Plan
description: A spokesman for the Gay Activists Alliance said yesterday that the police had denied ermission for the organization to hold a demonstration directly outside the New York Hilton Hotel to protest the annual Inner Circle dinner there next Saturday night.

title: FOREIGN AIRLINES BALKED BY C.A.B. ON CUTS IN FARES
description: In the first such use of powers that were granted by Congress last year, the Civil Aeronautics Board announced yesterday that it had rejected, as too low, the transAtlantic fare proposals of British, German, Italian and Greek airlines.

title: HAMS TURN BACK ISLANDERS, 5 TO 3
description: UNIONDALE, LI., Feb. 27The Islanders were tough for half a game tonight but they bowed to the pressure of the Chicago Black Hawks, 53.

title: Figure in $.E.C. Inquiry Gave $200,000 to Nixon
description: A $200,000 cash contribution was disclosed yesterday to have been made to President Nixon's reelection campaign last April 10 on behalf of a financier then under Securities and Exchange Commission investigation, without the public disclosure required by a new Federal law.

title: U.S. TO REQUEST FINANCIAL SHIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Nixon Administration pledged today for the first time to sponsor legislation to overhaul the structure and regulation of the nation's financial system.

title: Testing the Truce
description: One month after the ink is dry the imprecisions of the Vietnam ceasefire agreements are starting to confound the signatories.

title: NEWS INDEX
Government Party Gets Big Majority In South Korea Vote
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Wednesday, Feb. 28Nearly complete returns from South Korea's National Assembly elections showed today that President Park, Chung Hee's Democratic Republican party was certain to obtain a twothirds majority in the legislature.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TREATER ON THE MOVE In 1968, Richard Scheduler, avantgarde drama director and writer, and some colleagues took over an old machine shop at 33 Wooster Street, a grimy, industrial building just north of Canal Street. They called it the Performing Garage, and their troupe, The Performing Group. They transformed the place into unusual theatrical premises and, in fact, have become one of the more permanent repertory companies in town.

title: PRICES END LOWER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday continued to drop sharply in comparatively slow trading.

title: San Francisco Cabbies Out
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 27 (AP)All 1,060 drivers for the Yellow Cab Company went on strike today, taking 503 of San Francisco's 800 cabs off the streets in a dispute over the company's sale of three taxicab permits.

title: GOVERNOR NAMES SPECIAL ASSISTANT
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27Governor Rockefeller's office today announced the appointment of Naniel Klepak, a veteran of state service, to develop detailed plans and procedures for implementing Mr. Rockefeller's proposal for an inspector general to oversee primary and secondary education in the state.

title: New Jersey Briefs if
description: A work stoppage at the. State Prison in Rahway went into a second day yesterday, with about 75 per cent of the inmates with prison work assignments refusing to perform.

title: Record Foodstuff Trade Drains Bank Credit
description: The record movement of foodstuffs caused by unprecedented Soviet purchases last summer has not only tied up much of the nation's rail system, but also is draining an extraordinary volume of banking credit throughout the Midwest.

title: Women of Vietnam: Some Grew Strong in the Face of War
description: SAIGON, South VietnamThe wives of prominent politicians, businessmen and academicians have always had a delicate role to play in both public and private life. Wives in South Vietnam are adept at this. But living through a quartercentury of war has taught them to be independent and resourceful, and they have become a powerful breed in their own right.

title: Hecht Backs Vase Sale; Will Avoid Italy for Now
description: Robert E. Hecht Jr., the American expatriate who sold a 2,500yearold Greek vase to the Metropolitan Museum of Art last year for approximately $1million, said yesterday he feared to return to Rome until he is certain the Italian police have no plans to give him free room and boarda prison cell.

title: Sociologist, Trustee, Envoy
description: That's one thing about being the boss's wife, you get to choose your own hours, explained Dr. Ruth Lewis Farkas, whose husband founded Alexander's Department Stores.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Leader of Camden Draft Raid Asks Jurors to Ignore the Law
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Feb. 27John Peter Grady, a leader of the Camden 28, asked the jury today to ignore the law and acquit the antiwar activists of charges of destroying draft files.

title: Court in Jersey Upholds Landlord Repair Security
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Feb. 27A Superior Court judge here today upheld what is believed to be the first local law in the nation requiring_ landlords to post security deposits to assure emergew repairs in apartments. The ruling by Judge Morris Pashman marked the first legal test of a law that both tenant groups and owners expect to become a prototype for other towns if it is sustained in appellate courts. The law, enacted last June in Ridgefield over concerted opposition by owners, requires all landlords with buildings of four or more apartments to make minimum deposits of $100 for each apartment, with a maximum of $5,000 for a building.

title: Express Route to Learning Fashioned for Precocious
description: BALTIMORE  In the fall of 1969, Johns Hopkins University admitted a 13yearold prodigy to its freshman class.

title: 2 Hiring Inquiries Are Ordered Following Arrest of School Aides
description: The Board of Education directed Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner yesterday to set up a special task force to examine the applications of all school personnel hired since September, 1970.

title: Dutch Coach Named
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., Feb. 27 (AP)Rene Korernans, a 27yearold Dutchman, was named today coach of the Connecticut Wildcats, the new entry in the American Soccer League. He formerly coached Fortuna, the Dutch team.

title: VATICAN AND CZECHS AGREE ON 4 BISHOPS
description: ROME, Feb. 27The Vatican announced today that it had agreed with Czechoslovakia's Government on the nomination of four new Roman Catholic bishcips in that country.

title: Mets' Advance Sale Will Start Tomorrow
description: The Mets announced yesterday that their locations for advance ticket sales would open tomorrow morning.

title: Served Carriage Trade,
description: Two brokerage houses once known by their carriagetrade clienteleLaidlaw & Co., Inc., and Coggeshall & Hicks, Inc.said yesterday they have agreed in principle to merge.

title: Visible Photographer Loses U.S. job
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27A former White House photogra pher for Presidents Kennedy and Johnson has apparently been dismissed froth his Gov ernment job because he was visible in pictures taken of President Nixon's second inauguration.

title: Defense Opens Its Case at the Pentagon Papers Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27The defense in the Pentagon papers trial opened its case today with a promise to the jury that it would present extensive and compelling testimony from highranking civilian and military, officials of the Kennedy and Johnson Administrations and from the leaders of Congress in 1969 and 1970.

title: Nome Run in Baseball
description: Majorleague baseball, until now a squalling infant in the ranks of unionized industries, has set an admirable example of creativity at the bargaining table in the new threeyear agreement between club owners and players.

title: Compromise on Drug Bill Is Considered by Duryea
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea rated today that he might be receptive to a compromise on Governor Rockefeller's antidrug proposals, which would mandate life in prison for adult sellers of illegal hard drugs.

title: Greek Stadents in U.S. Support the Protests
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 27Greek students in the United States are organizing in support of the student demonstrations in Greece.

title: U.S. Planes in Cambodian War Said to Use Capital for Refueling
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 27 (Agence FrancePresse) For the first time since the war began, United States Air Force planes carrying out missions over Cambodia have started using the Phnom Penh airport for refueling, it was reported today.

title: Boy, 10, Tells Court School Bus Int Rail Tragedy Never Stopped
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Feb. 27A 10yearold boy who said he knew that if he lied he would get in trouble with God testified today that he was certain the school bus that was struck by a freight train in Congers did not stop before the tracks.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n LAST NIGHT'S GAME
description: Utah 103, Kentucky 97. Dallas 120, San Diego 115.

title: George W. Harris Dies; Founder of Steel Company
description: George W. Harris, a founder in 1915 of the Harris Structural Steel Company, died yesterday in Lenox Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived at 975 Park Avenue.

title: KEY GAUGES RISE 1.2% FOR MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP) The Government reported today that its list of leading economic indicators rose 12 per cent in January, to an index level of 155.5, up from December's 153.3.

title: Mets' Staub Is Holdout Not for Usual Reason
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 27More players streamed into the baseball training camps today and, in checking the attendance, the New York Mets found they had gained four varsity men, two coaches and one authentic holdoutRusty Staub.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The top 20, with points figured on a 10987654321 basis for first through 10th places (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records through games of last Saturday.

title: Advertising: Motivational Woes
description: Motivational research was described as a threat to youth, and advertising as a danger to the nation yesterday by witnesses before a Senate subcommittee conducting hearings on a bill to establish a facility to research what marketing is doing to us all.

title: NASTASE, CONNORS VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: HAMPTON, Va., Feb. 27 (AP) Ilie Nastase of Rumania and Jimmy Connors of Miami, the topseeded players, posted firstround victories in the $35,000 Coliseum Mall invitation tennis tournament today.

title: 5 in Westchester G.O.P. Seek Michaelian's Post
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 27With its convention less than two weeks away, the traditionally staid Republican party in Westchester County faces a primary fight with five candidates seeking the nomination for County Executive.

title: Merckx is Outsprinted
description: LANUESI, Sardinia, Feb. 27 (AP)Henri Camille Van Linden of Belgium outsprinted his countryman, Eddie Merekx, to win the fourth leg of the Sardinia cycling race. Merckx, however, comfortably held his overall lead in the dace.

title: Vickers Triumphs in Peter Grimes
description: PETER GRIMES. Opera In three acts by Benjamin Britten. Text by Montagu Slater. Produced by Tyrone Guthrie. Sets and costumes by Tanya Moiselwitsch. Directed by Bodo Igen. Conducted by Sixten Ending. At the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Carney 79 Votes Short on First Ballot For Bergen G.O.P. County Chairman
description: HACKENSACK, Feb. 27Joseph T. Carney, the Republican organization candidate, came within 79 votes tonight of a firstballot victory in the fourway race for chairmanship of the Bergen County Republican Committee.

title: COURT VOIDS CURB ON BLACKS IN CLUB
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that a puburban swimming club cannot refuse to accept blacks who live in the immediate neighborhood if the club gives a membership preference to residents of the neighborhood.

title: Deportation Inquiry Reopened By MAX H. SEIGELIn L.I. Alien's WarCrime Case
description: The deportation investigation of a Latvian alien sentenced to death in absentia for World War II war crimes has been reopened here by the Immigration and Naturalization Service.
